review_body: Visited NYC for one night. The location is the only real asset. Rooms are very small, the thermostat could not be controlled. This property was somewhat rundown (although not horrific) and average service. It would be a fine budget hotel at under $100 a night, but not a Marriott, in the largest US city at $300+ a night.

I checked in at 2am and got to room. I noticed a partially unmade bed where fitted sheet barely covered any part of the mattress. Then worst was the dirty sheet. I’m exhausted and going to sleep on a towel but will not stay here again.

I’m sorry - but any hotel that doesn’t have room service shouldn’t qualify to call itself anything above a Courtyard. The description on Marriott’s site is deceptive, I believe intentionally, to hide that fact. If you would like a soda - and can cram yourself into a crowded closet they call a gift shop, have fun opening the cooler without knocking other “trinkets” they have for sale on the floor. Unlike most Marriotts, they don’t have many Pepsi products - no Mountain Dew. The M club is a bunch of rude employees walking around not being helpful. If you want a soda you’re out of luck - they don’t stock them. I won’t be back. I also wonder if Marriott knows how unappealing this property really is - because it shouldn’t carry the Franchise name.

We are titanium Elite members of Marriott and I would like to start my review with that sentence just to iteirate the such is the big number of nights we book with mariott and hence we now qualify as titanium Elite members.So that should explain our loyalty towards Marriott world wide.Now, let's come over to the breakfast at lounge. The breakfast is complimentarynly for elite members. This particular day, at the lounge where breakfast was served which was told upto 11am and I walk in at 10am to find the breads all empty. I go upto "Mr.Jesus" the incharge that day at the lounge and ask for bread and I get a very impolite rude reply.Mr.Jesus thinks he's smart but amateur at his smirk that he is, he came across as rude, sarcastic, shrewd which certainly is not appreciated way to conduct yourself with any guests and specifically with elite members Mr.Jesus. Looks like your crew and management need to send you to India to get you some skills on hospitality, you need to get your hand badly at that. Wish you good luck on that... However with reputation of the hotel entrusted on employee like you, guess your management needs the good luck more than you do!

The service was very disappointing. Starting at check in the front desk couldn’t seem to locate the reservation. Rooms seemed partially prepared. Soap was missing in one of adjoining rooms.  We had to call for toiletries on the second day. Training seems to be lacking.  Maybe the hotel is always busy so it doesn’t matter how customers are served.

I stayed here for one night. The whole place is in desperate need of some TLC, particularly the lobby, which is pretty grim.Room 1917 was clean, and there were power sockets by the bed. Free internet was only available to those with a Marriott Bonvoy membership (although you could sign up for that and then get free Wi-fi). I do find this a pain , though - I expect to have free Wi-fi anywhere I stay without having to jump through hoops. The best part of the room was the TV, which was huge - and of good quality with a decent viewing angle. Although it advertised having Netflix, you needed a Netflix account to access the service. The worst part was the ancient air conditioning, which sounded like opening an ancient wardrobe full of metal coat hangers each time it shuddered into action.The bed, for me, was a little too soft.

Very disappointed in this Marriott, usually pretty good but this one is old fashioned, very tired fixtures and fittings, very poor bathrooms, terrible breakfast and bar area. Reception is small, staff not friendly at all. Would not recommend ......

When traveling to NYC as a family, the biggest issue is trying to find a room big enough to fit 4 people. Our was a big enough that we weren't crawling over top of each other. The Wi-Fi was up and down the whole week we were there which was frustrating. The lobby wasn't much but otherwise it was a decent hotel.

We live about an hour from NYC. I thought I would treat my family to a "tourist" day/night and spend some time in the City. We had a wonderful dinner and went to the Philharmonic. Then we went to the hotel. I am a lifetime Titanium Marriott member, meaning that I've staying more than a thousand nights and accumulated more than 2 million points with Marriott. Any my numbers are much higher. I say this just so it's clear that, usually, when I register, I'm treated, well, like a lifetime Titanium member. Not this time. When I approached the Rewards Members desk, I was told to go to the regular desk, despite no other customer being at the Rewards desk. I was affirmatively taken to the other desk. She was not interested in whether I was a Marriott member. All she wanted was ID. My Marriott ID wasn't good, and she was quite rude about it. So when I gave her my license, she studied it for what my wife thought was a full minute. Satisfied I was who I said I was, she checked us in without speaking to me or even looking at us. After handing me the keys (and almost forgetting to return my credit card and license), we went to our room. There are more than 30 floors in this hotel. Our room was on 11, which is important only because my Marriott status always -- always -- upgrades us to the high floors. When we got to our room, it looked like it had last been cleaned in the late '70s. And it was the size of a large shoe box. I went downstairs and, this time, went to the Rewards desk. The man behind the desk informed me that my room was in fact an upgraded room. In disbelief, I asked what their regular rooms looked like and if those rooms actually had bathrooms, because anything smaller could not fit one. He repeated that I had been upgraded and was done speaking with me. When I asked a final time, he said to step aside, although there were no other customers on the line. Please keep in mind that Marriott classifies this hotel as a resort, so there is a $25 resort fee added to the bill. Anyway, the room was gloomy. The noise from outside was so bad that we were able to get to sleep only by passing out. There was no food in the concierge lounge. They were even out of water. The messages and wake up call buttons did not work (though the front desk finally handled the wake up call request). The room also smelled. Finally, the two beds are doubles, not queens (if that makes a difference). Anyway, the breakfast in the lounge was standard scrambled eggs and bacon and some yogurt and fruit. Fine. When we checked out, though, unfortunately we had to deal with the front staff. Apparently, as a "resort," you are entitled to a $25 food/beverage credit, $20 in dry cleaning and one Local NYC Experience. That "experience" is one of four things, including a bus ride, a ticket (per room) to Ripley's Believe It or Not or a ticket (per room) to Madame Tussaud's, We found this out by reading the back of our key. After returning the room key, I asked about the tickets to Madame Tussaud's and was told to pick them up at the Concierge desk. But when I went to pick them up, I was told that, despite being good for 30 days, their "protocols" prevented them from giving the ticket on the day of the checkout. But then, it was time to leave this tired, run down place. I couldn't leave fast enough. Since the mega merger a year ago, Marriott has plunged in my opinion and doesn't seem to honor its loyal customers. Ironically, after we left the hotel, we passed the DoubleTree a block away. Hilton is looking good now.
user_name:
Forfeitboy
New York City, New York

review_body: We checked in at 9:30am, knowing that they might not have a room available but Swapna at the front desk was happy to accommodate us! We got a room right away and she gave us free WiFi! So nice of her. Then we went to the Hilton Honors desk and Tany hooked us up with some discounts for the city. We have only been here for about 5 minutes and we have already had such a warm welcome! Plus the room is big (for Manhattan) and clean.

I stayed here recently and was pleasantly surprised! My room was very large! There was minimal noise from the street below, so sleeping was great! The room was nice, and as a elite member, I had access to the club which offered snacks, beverages, and a decent continental breakfast. I felt safe in this hotel and would happily stay here again.

Really nice people, perfect location - but very tired hotel. Towels are thin, bath amenities are scarce, beds are saggy, no H2O in the rooms (even for elite Bonvoy members), slow elevators and really cold, bland and unwelcoming lobby. All first world problems - I know, but it would seem $300+/night would buy more.

In need of its 10-year facelift. I did not like the room I got in the 10th floor. And I am Marriott Gold. Lots of noise from outside - no noise protection windows. Room quite rundown. Need to look for a new Marriott in town. This used to be my preferred hotel in NYC.

Arrived for a late checkin was told we were upgraded to a very nice room-which was not true. The woman was not pleasant and the room is tiny and the hotel in need of aesthetic upgrades.. not what I remember of this hotel and so far the most unimpressive for us as loyal Marriott customers. The hotel has plenty of available rooms too-so don’t like to be told an upgrade was given... think this hotel could use new staff and new facelift.

This hotel is in a great location at 49th and Lex. Great eating options nearby. The hotel itself is approach the time when it needs a re-fit. The building itself is historic (I believe Georgia O'Keefe once called the 32nd floor home)--but that doesn't mean that the hotel and its furnishings should be. My desk had seen better days, as had the furniture in the room generally. TV was large, but my window was quite small. In fact, I think the TV is larger than the window.Despite being a lifetime Titanium BonVoy guy, my "upgraded" room was just large enough for a king bed and a desk. My AC was efficient, pumping out a consistent 68 degrees F all night, but it made an extremely noisy clunking while doing so. The bathroom is tight. While you'd do so anyway, you need to close the bathroom door to use the toilet or bathtub/shower. The is very little counter space. The king bed had a very discernible ridge right down the middle between the two foundations. Lest this review sound too negative, my experience with the staff was excellent, as was my experience in the M Club with its ever-helpful hosts. Again, not intending to sound negative, but generally I'm not particularly fond of the M-Club movement among Marriott hotels such as this one, which essentially creates a Residence Inn-type dining hall experience--but exclusive to certain guests.The gym is on the 35th floor, and requires an elevator transfer on 32. If you're working out during the busy morning or evening hours, get your pre-workout workout on the stairs up to the 35th floor rather than wait 10 minutes or more for the next elevator car.
user_name:
offthewalls
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The location was convenient to subway and walking to other attractions. The hotel is undergoing renovations so there isn’t a lobby but the “front desk” attendants were efficient. The room was clean and comfortable. The housekeeping lady always greeted us and asked how we were. That was nice. The breakfast was normal hotel breakfast but we just looked before we purchased breakfast. We decided it wasn’t worth it. You can get a great breakfast bagel around the corner in the morning. The NYC experiences offered in the “resort” fee weren’t anything we happened to be interested in but it might be on the agenda for you. I would certainly stay here again and I would like to see it when all the renovations are done.

The room was a bit dated and tired, but decent enough. Quiet for sleeping, as we heard no other guest activity or noise from other rooms. There is a “white noise” option on the TV for sleep aid. Our check in was quick and easy. We signed up for a hotel promotion in order to take advantage of free WiFi. The only free WiFi is in the hotel lobby, and it’s not a welcoming lobby at all. Not a single couch or chair or seat. Nothing. It’s also very small. Just bare bones. The hotel staff were polite and competent. The elevators worked well and were quick, which is a huge plus as we’ve stayed in other hotels in NYC with extremely slow elevators. All in all it was fine, nothing grand by any stretch, but we didn’t have high expectations. It’s a great location for using the subway, for walking anywhere in midtown, for seeing shows/attractions, and it’s got quite a few food options nearby that aren’t crowded at all on weekends. There’s a liquor store nearby too, if you’re doing take out, so everything is really right there as far as convenience. I would recommend if you’re not looking for five/four star. No issues really, and great if your goal is to see the city and spend most of your time out and about. We felt safe, secure and had a completely uneventful stay.

Just stayed here for a night - rooms are extremely old, TV's are tiny and old (32"), no USB charging ports or even USB charger/plug adapters available at the front desk. Service is average - had asked to speak with a manager and never heard back. Overall - avoid.

My mom and I took a trip to see NYC at Christmas time! This hotel is perfectly located since it is close to multiple subways, the Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central Station. Our room was clean and the staff was friendly. Our welcome gift from the gift shop was a wonderful surprise!

I wouldn’t come back to this hotel again and possibly the Marriott chain, first time visiting NYC, after 6 hour night flight, took a 2 hr power nap and rushed out of the room to get a head start to enjoy viewing the amazing sites of NYC , during my first day staying at the Hotel $400 went missing from my room, felt as my privacy and security was violated. Definitely changed my experience staying in hotels. Make sure to keep all your valuables and expensive items in a safe or don’t bring on the trip with you. Just the thought of someone going through your items in your own room that you pay to be secure and private isn’t so private and secure after all. Hotel does not and will not take any responsibility for their employees so think twice, something I didn’t think I had to do at a hotel. I came to enjoy the city and left feeling robbed!

Hotel lobby and bar/restaurant are undergoing remodeling. Staff was exceptional from the bartender, to reception, and the concierge. Room was modern and larger than most that I’ve experienced in NYC. Location is good about four blocks east of 5th Ave. An easy walk from there to most midtown tourist locations.

Location: great, very convenient, walking distance to grand central and anywhere midtown east. Rooms: pretty tired and old. Dark and a little on the musty side. Fairly clean. Really old school decor.Facilities: gym has most of the basic essential dumb bells and a good number of tread mills and cardio machines, no squat rack. Quite big. Not a fan of the lift situation -you have to change at certain floors, and they’re very slow.Service: very standard, not particularly impressive. Overall: very average, could do better in the area.

The Marriott Eastside on Lexington Avenue is a fine hotel overall, with the typical Marriott quality one can depend upon. We choose Marriott almost exclusively, we find the properties and the people to be more than acceptable, dependable and while often priced a bit above competition, worth the difference. The hotel is well located, and has been remodeled - like many New York hotels, built many years ago to a high level of comfort for the times, but needing upgrading and remodeling to compete in the 21st century. Overall, this remodel/refurbish was accomplished quite nicely. Bear in mind these sorts of hotels have some inherited shortcomings that are difficult for a remodeling to "fix" - for example, if a smoker (in a non smoking room) on the 5th floor sneaks into his bath (with what must be a hotel wide communal vent system) we could smell it up in our room on the 20th floor). We had one such experience, the air quickly cleared and all was well. Our visit of several nights was fine - bedding very good, clean of course, quick elevator service (31 stories high) and the 2nd floor "elite member" breakfast and lounge area was a beautiful area, a decent breakfast. Strangely, the furniture in the main "lounge" room was pretty spartan. Overall, well located, Marriott level quality and service, and a clean, comfortable, safe lodging.

My wife and I traveled with Versus travel to New York for Christmas fests. The agency had booked a stay at the Marriott East Side Hotel and I considered as a good choice since it belongs to a well-known chain. But this one, even for American standards of a 4-star hotel, is an old-fashioned to decadent and needs general renovation. Before arriving we had requested through the agency a double king-size bed. Upon arrival we were told they had no availability but mostly surprised me the lack of any intention to try to find something. Well, the room (although with worn out carpet and wall-paper and patches on the ceiling) was relatively Ok, with comfort bed-mattresses and good coffee in the room. We stayed on the 8th floor and soundproof has been proved problematic as it is quite annoying to hear night and day the fire, patrol and ambulance sirens one of the very characteristic of this city.The hotel has the originality of not having a lobby!!! There is just a cafeteria on the ground floor that is managed by a private individual, so you are obliged to order if you wish to sit there. We tried it once for a light night dinner.. and we had some fun by being serviced by two slow “bored” waiters, food of low quality and prices of upper range.. Value for money “vice versa”...We didn't experienced breakfast due to the price ($ 35 per person).Eventually as a hotel has several small negatives that makes the big picture suffer substantially. The very positive is its location in midtown Manhattan, close to the metro, theaters, restaurants and bars, shopping streets and Times Square.If I were to stay again I would think of it twice, maybe going for something else in the surrounding area.

We had a very easy, pleasant checkin. Location is great. Room was clean and satisfactorily arranged. (Bed super comfy). It is not a super extraordinary luxury type hotel but we paid a reasonable price and received a very fine experience.Not sure why some people rate it poorly. I found it to be a fine old hotel. Other than the miserable seeming young lady in the gift shop, everyone seemed cheerful. And everyone was efficient-even with long holiday checkin line.

Good location helpful staffNice hotel about 15 minute walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Staff very friendly and helpful. They have a restaurant on property that opens at 5:00pm. The M lounge on the second floor has drinks, appetizers in the evening and breakfast in the morning, it was a very nice selection that was available.The elevators are a bit oddly shaped and very tiny, especially the door to get in. The rooms were comfortable, clean and very quiet, we were right next to the elevator and was surprised that we rarely heard the elevator or people in the hallway during our stay.The views were not great, perhaps better in other rooms?

We stayed here for three nights in December. It is not a nice hotel at all and very subpar for a Marriott. We stayed in a junior suite ( two double and a pull out sofa). It is very dirty, run down and dark and gloomy. It is in dire need of a refresh. We had to pay for it as we couldn’t use points for the junior “suite” and I feel like it was a colossal waste of money.

Really outdated hotel. Would make a good movie set for the sequel to The Shining. Initially given a 3rd floor room despite a request for a high floor. Room unfortunately faced a trash bin whose trash pick up time was around 2 am. Did not sleep at all with all the racket. Went back to the front desk the next day, and the staff was able to get a better room despite the hotel being fully booked.Pros:-Fantastic location.-Helpful staff.-Stately facadeCons:-Outdated rooms.-Cheesy furnishings

This place is as beat down as they come. As Marriott owners we were treated horribly. The people seem miserable and I don't really blame them because I am sure they hear a lot of negative feedback. No water in your room so visit the CVS a few blocks down. The ceiling is falling out of the lobby and the rooms are gross and smelly. Avoid this stain on the brand.

So disappointing. I’ve stayed here many time over the years for business but never again. The lobby is under construction due to a water line break, but when reserving they don’t inform you of that. As a Platinunm Elite member, I had the ability to check in and make special requests the day before. Requested early check in, and upgrade. Got neither. When checking in, they said they would text me when ready. Never got the text. Upon checkin, requested a fan, then requested again at the front desk. We got into the room at 9:00 pm, asked for a fan again. When we got into the room, it was horrible. Dirty, small, and needed renovation 20 years ago. Not what I remember and not up to my standards. I called to the front desk and spoke to the manager, explained that the room was not acceptable and that I would not be staying, and not to charge me as the room was not used. She said not a problem, I immediately turned in my keys and found another place to stay. Adding insult to injury, I received an email folio showing that my cc was charged for a night. Horrible! I will rethink ANY Marriott in the future. Shame on Marriott!!! Horrible customer service and treatment of a frequent business traveler. I was booking 50 rooms for 4 nights for my company training in another city with Marriott, but not now!!

Staff was friendly when we checked in, allowed us to check in early as arranged. Hotel was nice and rooms were clean. I was a little afraid in the middle of the night when I felt it shaking knowing how old it was but that's normal I suppose.

We traveled to NYC for the Christmas time festivities in and around NYC. Our stay at the New York Marriott East Side was just "ok". We arrived at 3:00 and our room was not ready yet. The front desk told us to leave our luggage with the staff and gave us a few suggestions of places to grab a bite to eat. We waited until 4:30 and then checked back in and they couldn't find our reservation. Luckily, we had the paperwork so we avoided a potential disaster. The rooms are in desperate need of an update. The rooms appear tired and worn. The bar was ok and there is no restaurant. The staff didn't always seem happy to be there. The location was nice; it is within walking distance of Rockefeller Center and Time Square.

My family and I completed an overnight stay at the Marriott East Side and had a pleasant experience. My Titanium Elite status was recognized at check-in, leading to an upgrade to a suite on the 31st floor. I would like to recognize the outstanding hospitality provided by Paulina at the front desk. Her friendliness left an impression! We were also granted access to the M Club Lounge on the 2nd floor which offered a generous breakfast spread (we missed the evening appetizers). The hotel is located in an ideal location, just steps from some of NYC’s iconic sites and public transportation options, such as Grand Central Station. Highly recommended!
user_name:
MikeJet88
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I don't know where to begin because there are so many issues... I am a Platinum member and stayed at this hotel 5 times. I guess I have been lucky enough to get rooms on the 16th Floor in the past, which are more modern. I used my Platinum Card anniversary certificate for a 50,000 point free stay over Thanksgiving weekend. Upon first impression, the lobby is not welcoming nor festive. There is not a single place to sit and a pathetic Christmas tree that is super small. They had a pipe burst a few weeks ago and they said this is the best they can do. My Christmas decorations at home are way better. It was a sad state in the lobby. It seemed like no one cared to put the effort into decor. Check-in was a circus of misinformed and unprofessional staff. No one ever explained the destination fee and what was included, nor was I offered my welcome points or gift/snack from the gift shop. Luckily, I knew about these benefits from previous stays.The elevators are slow and scary and in dire need of updates. We were given the worst room possible (Rm 2203). It was small, cramped and had a view of an airconditioning unit. The color scheme looked like Ronald McDonald threw up in our room. There were black marks on the pillowcases and the comforter had a big wad of dust and hair attached to the side. Beds were super small and soft. The room was not dusted thoroughly and the bathroom was old and moldy. The gross shower curtain didn't help matters. Tub only. No walk-in shower. Terrible water pressure. I felt like I was on an island. TV was on a weird angle and difficult to watch without straining your neck. Every single ice machine was broken during our stay. We tried all the floors. My husband called down to the desk twice and spoke to the front desk in person for the third try. The issue was never resolved during our stay.The bell staff did not pick up our luggage on a timely basis and we ended up taking it down ourselves. Getting our car took longer than usual and the laziness of the front desk to get our car ticket stamped was the icing on the cake. We paid and the front desk attendant told my husband he had to get in line at the bell stand to tell them that we needed our car. The bell stand is 2 feet away from the front desk. Why couldn't she tell him? He was standing right there!All in all, I would never stay at this hotel again. I travel to NYC frequently and will find a new hotel for my stay in January. I felt very undervalued as a Platinum Member (since 1997) and feel like I wasted my certificate on a dump. A very disappointing stay. I do not recommend this hotel at all. I stayed at the Marriott Downtown in October and they have a brand new hotel, excellent customer service, stunning views and we felt like valued Platinum Members. The GM left us a bottle of wine and note at check-in, which was a nice touch. The East Side Marriott should take a lesson from them.

Hotel lobby. 2 stars.  Small, but clean and bright.  No place to sit! Literally, not a single chair. This makes it an uncomfortable place to wait for friends. Service.  The front desk staff are remarkably uninformed. They could not direct my husband to where to get a cup of coffee, despite the fact that there is a restaurant selling coffee attached to the hotel. The check-in process was very unprofessional, with the woman checking me in telling me about her sore neck, and getting my name wrong more than once. I received a chat message via the Bonvoy app asking how my stay was. I responded with concerns, and never got a response. One star, at best.Rooms.  I don't know what rooms are pictured on the website. Certainly not mine. My room was very small and dark and cramped. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. On the minus side, there is only a small window with no view of anything. The carpets are shabby and the decor much in need of updating. A very depressing hotel room. As well, despite the fact that it is an old hotel, and those were usually well-built, one can hear everything from neighboring rooms and the hallway in one's room. TV also didn't work properly - we needed service multiple times. One star.Bathroom.  The bathroom gets bonus points for a shower with excellent pressure. There is, however, a shower curtain. Eww. The bath towels are kind of worn out, and the bathroom needs to be updated.the ceiling has blistering paint. 3 stars.Location.  Excellent location, close to 5th avenue, Rockefeller center, and about a 20-minute walk to Broadway theaters.Overall, 3 stars, but mostly for location.  The hotel itself gets only 2, at best.

I stayed one night for work. My room was quite large and clean. Although it did not impact me, my room was on the Lexington Avenue side of the building. As such, street noise was constant thru the night. The staff was pleasant. As I walk around I did find Ristorante Grifone at 244 E. 46th. Quaint little place. Excellent food.

I really enjoyed my stay at the East Side Marriott. It has a real historic charm to it, and the rooms have been nicely renovated. The M Club Lounge was also nicely appointed. And a very convenient location!

Four girls for memorial day week-end. The room was very small, cramped and "vintage" (lots of wear and tear), Breakfast was very ordinary (eggs too dry, fruits with no savor at all, horrible coffee) .The concierge was not very helpful. We asked how to reach The Cloister museum, and purchase our tickets. Directions were so messed up, it took us 2 hours to go there and the museum did not acknowledge our tickets at first. It took us another 30-45 minutes to finally get inside. Overall, location is good but next time, we will go elsewhere.

The New York Marriott East Side is located in a convenient location with eateries all around so getting food is not a problem. The subway is nearby. It is not right in the heart of the Broadway area so it is not jam-packed with crowds the whole day. Good for those who like hotels within walking distance from popular tourist spots but which offer a little more peace and quiet at the same time.Rooms look a little dated though and one of the elevators seemed to have a mind of its own, refusing to open at the lobby level several times during my stay there. Those of us in the elevator ended up returning to the room levels and then going down again.

Arrived for a business stay for a conference. They had a pipe burst and the lobby was a mess. There were high powered fans running. The front desk was unfriendly, and downright rude! There was a notice to run water for 20 minutes before showering...yuck! Went to the room and it was rundown and after thinking about it, decided to leave with other colleagues. Tried to leave and the elevator wouldn't go down, so I got out. A housekeeper was there and walked me to the service elevator saying the other elevators weren't working. Now that wasn't comforting if there was an emergency. Left and went to another hotel nearby.

Check-In/Check-OutChecking in and out was slow, the staff was not so friendly. They really want you to go away as soon as they checked you in. The RoomThe room was small but it was fine for us. The room we stayed was close to the elevators so we could hear noises people dragging their luggage and etc (this was the downside) if you plan to have a romantic getaway let me put it this way, definitely no baby-making in this room. There are small fridge and coffee maker in the room. There is a small window, but you don't want that open coz your neighbor can see you. The good thing was the room light was bright enough. The BathroomThere is a bathtub, the water pressure could be improved. There is hairdryer provided on-site. Restaurant/EntertainmentThere are a restaurant and bar on site.Hotel Service/AmenitiesWe came here with our car and we parked on the hotel loading zone, we just want to drop off our luggage to our room. There was a valet man on site and he gave us a ticket and grab our keys. Luckily, our room wasn't ready so we didn't park our car for too long. When we got our cars, the man thought we wanted a valet service but we told him we just want to check in and move our car somewhere else, hence we parked on the loading zone. He then gave us our keys but wasn't too happy and was saying some bad things probably to his other staff while we got to our cars (not professional especially a Marriot hotel). They do provide wifi, but I don't think is available in the room. They do baggage service as well. Overall Not sure if I would come back, the location is definitely a 10 but other than that it was just okay and sometimes unprofessional from their staff. I used to work in a hotel and even in my bad days I never treated any customer unprofessionally in any way.

This property is consistently unable to get my Bonvoy profile request fulfilled. I have a neck problem and need to sleep with a foam pillow. My request for foam pillows is in my Bonvoy profiles however, they consistently fail to fulfill my request at this property. I had to call down several times before they sent the pillows up despite a promise they would be here in ten minutes. I am a Marriott Ambassador level guest. I stay at Marriott properties over 200 nights a year. Sad to say this is not the only property that struggles to satisfy guest profile requests.

Great set. Great hospitality. Very clean. The best of is ms Carla Morales the concierge person at the entrance that knows everything in time. With her assistance, we were happy and lucky to be the first viewers of the new MoMA. Thank you so much Carla. Thank you Marriott hotel!

Over the years, I have stayed at this hotel many times. However, it has been a few years and I must say I’m disappointed in the hotel’s offerings. Why call us a full service hotel if there is no in room dining and the restaurant and bar are closed at 4 pm on a Friday. The rooms are very out of date. I’m a lifetime titanium member and was so disappointed in this hotel for a long weekend in NYC with my husband. The destination fee is a stupid way to charge more. You might want to call this a Courtyard in the future.

Hotel is nice and this was my second stay - first for business and second with family. I stayed a second time for the value that the M club provided. The destination fee is ridiculous - gives you free dry cleaning?? Give me a break - a one night and/or family traveler really needs that! Rooms are decent sized for NYC. This hold member will not stay again for family travel due to destination fee.

Friendly staff, rooms are of a decent size. Typical Marriott, nothing special worth of mentioning.While the M Club is kind of average compared to other Marriotts, I would like to compliment the staff of it. Very friendly, trying their best to make your stay enjoyable.

unremarkable but adequate Marriott. nothing special to point out other than rooms are not as small as most NYC hotels. Elevators are rather sluggish to the point of frustration for many guests. electrical outlets in my room were very unreliable. hallway noise annoying.

A nice looking classic middle/uptown Manhattan motel. A great location with easy walking distance to 30 Rock ... subway stations, etc. Literally the entire dynamic of the stay for a non-business guest changes when you see an extra $100 for your weekend stay tacked on against your will and the pressure to then use up your restaurant daily food credit and "local attraction" ticket otherwise you feel the daily fee is stolen money from your wallet. Hotels including the Marriott chain are doing this in NYC to make their regular advertised website rates appear more competitive.Anyway, if you got extra cash to burn, this is a clean and safe hotel with friendly staff.

The location for this hotel is perfect, we walked to great restaurants, comedy clubs and Broadway for a show. I will say the suite is a little outdated and could use some redecoration, new carpet and walls/furniture would make this the ideal spot.

Rosario at the front desk was extremely rude with me when I was checking in. It was the last thing I needed after a long flight in, and the entire experience ruined my arrival to New York. Other than the unpleasant front desk staff, the hotel is old, run down, and in major need of a face lift. At the same price there are many nicer places to stay in NYC.

The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of enough sights (Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center) and it's a decent enough hotel. I did find it very strange when we entered our room, the temperature outside was wather cold and yet the air conditioning was going full blast! We quickly shut it off before freezing to death but other than that the room size was ok and well kept. We did not bother having breakfast there, too expensive frankly, but there is a Starbucks very nearby. The room was also pricy but at least nearly everything was close at hand. By the way, how do you turn the TV on, way too complicated and pressing "power" doesn't do it!

My husband and I have been staying at this hotel for a couple of nights a year for several years. After our most recent trip, I think it's time to try something different. The rooms are good size, and as an elite rewards member the concierge lounge breakfast is a plus. However, the price difference between this hotel and others just didn't seem worth it on this trip. The breakfast offerings are minimal (bagels, toast, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes) and the food was about what you would expect of a free hotel breakfast. I will say that the lounge staff was amazing, very friendly and accommodating.The room size is decent, especially for NYC. We always stay in a King room, which I believe is around 350 sq. foot. The rooms are dated, but still in good condition. If you look closely, you can see the age in the bathrooms as they are continuously exposed to moisture, but our room across from the elevator on the 21st floor was quiet and comfortable. Accessing our Netflix subscription on the TV was a nice added benefit.One of the things that bothered me is as a rewards member, I put in my requests, foam pillows and extra towels. Those are never in the room when I check in, which is fine. I called down to the desk and housekeeping brought them right up. Here lies the problem. We showered, left the remaining extra clean towels on the shelf. The next day, housekeeping came in and cleaned, and they took our extra CLEAN towels. What gives?As an elite rewards member, we should be eligible for a free room upgrade as well as early check-in. We were notified through the app that our room was ready early (even though I asked for a phone call), however we have never received a room upgrade at this hotel.The location of this hotel is not bad. We've never had a problem walking around in the area. It's much quieter here than the Times Square area but still walkable to many sights or the subway. Close to Grand Central station, subways, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Central Park, and our favorite restaurant - Hillstone. We take the train into Penn Station so it's not as convenient to get to as it was when Amtrak was going into Grand Central.Not a terrible trip, but we'll probably try something closer to Penn Station on our next visit, maybe another brand.

I love Marriott properties. This was a disappointment! Never in a million years would I have guessed this is Marriott. Obnoxiously expensive with rooms the size of closet. Dated hotel with questionable elevators. Recommend passing on this hotel.

Paulina has the most incredible memory. We had not been to the Marriott East Side in over 1 year yet she remembered us and welcomed us back to the hotel. She is pleasant, outgoing, well informed and charming.After our afternoon travels, we returned to our room whereby there were a delicious charcuterie board and a bottle of red wine from Paulina. She is simply the best employee the Marriott Eastside has. Thank you very much,John and Janet McDonald
user_name:
Janet M
Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida

review_body: It’s hard to believe that in one of the most important cities (NY) in the world!! Marriott has such a bad hotel!!Rooms are extremely old, air conditioning system is louder that a train wreck, there is no Restaurant!! You can not have breakfast or room service!! Elevators, lobby, everything is at least 40yrs old!!Extremely expensive!! Do no stay at this location

As a Marriott elite, I obviously stay in them very often. But I was disappointed in this stay. The staff were nice enough but even with an upgrade, the room (and whole floor) felt like a motel. The upkeep was not what I would expect from a Marriott. I’ve stayed in Courtyards that were nicer. No room service either. At least the location was good.

The room was disgusting. We complained and they attempted to clean the room again and it was still embarrassingly bad. I understand the hotel is outdated and that is fine but the level of filth was unacceptable. Dust everywhere, food under furniture, hair and crumbs in bed, mold and water damage in bath. I wouldn’t have hesitated to switch hotels if we were staying more than one night

I am very disappointed with how the staff at Marriott East handles their customers. I recently had a stay at Marriott this past weekend (8/16 - 8/18) along with my other family members. In total, we had about 15 hotels rooms that were booked with Marriott for our family reunion. Our check in was horrendous as the front desk personals seemed very uninterested in checking us in in a timely manner. Next, when we got to our room, our sheets were dirty (I found hairs once I pulled out the comforter and there were these very obvious stains on the sheets and on the pillow cases. Does management not check their hotel rooms? My other family members had their own problems with their hotel room (My uncles toilet wasn't flushing, my cousins room had a really bad cigarette stench, etc) but I'll let them write their own reviews. HOWEVER, the biggest complaint and the reason why I am writing this review is because I just saw a separate charge on my credit card for a hundred and some dollars and like any normal person, I went ahead and called the hotels line directly. I dialed the (212) - 755 - 4000 and got connected to a person who I believe was working at the front desk. I then inquired about my additional charge and this human being was being rude. She kept on yelling at me, kept cutting me off, and wouldn't even let me explain what is going on. What kind of customer service is this? I would never expect this from a hotel where we generated them so much business that weekend. Any who, I then politely asked the agent to just let me finish spelling out my name because clearly she wasn't understanding. Thats when she hung up on me. I then called about 1 minute later and it was the same agent. I politely asked for her name and then she hung up (clearly knowing who I was). I called for the third time, and she then screened my calls. I had my friend call her and inquire about something else and when my friend asked for her name, she said her name was Paula. All in all, Paula (if that is even her name) really does not deserve to be in this industry if she can't handle customers. Her service was unacceptable, inexcusable, and just disgusting. I hope that their is a way that you can rectify this situation, my experience, and Paula's behavior as this is not acceptable. - Laila H.

Tried to upgrade room and was spoken to extremely rudely. I was trying to pay the up charge but they wouldn’t even try because I booked through third party. We have been Marriott reward members for years- extremely disappointed in the horrible customer service. Just trying to make the trip special for a big birthday and first trip to NY.

Third time staying in New York, and I’ve been to many Marriott hotels globally. The location is excellent, close to Times square (15 minute walk) and the subway (6 minutes). Staff were friendly and professional, and everything went smoothly with the stay. Easy check in and check out. Room was clean, bed and pillows were outstanding. Bill was correct. There’s even a $25 USD credit they give you when you leave (they explain it as giving back to the customer because the state charges a hotel tax). A lot of people are complaining about the rooms; they are small, especially the bathroom, and dated (carpets are older, rooms are a bit worn out). It’s NYC so be prepared for small rooms, but this Marriott is due for a Renovation soon I’m sure. One drawback is the lack of a pool, but most people probably don’t come to NYC to swim. Still though, reasonable value for money especially given the great location and excellent staff experience. To compare, I recently stayed at the Paris in Las Vegas for almost twice the price, and the Marriott east side staff were 100 times better, and so was our experience. Will likely return here.

Stayed at this place over the weekend, the family of Mariott hotels has always been my first choice when choosing a hotel. Never again. Worst experience ever, had a better experience at a one-star rinky dinky motel in Tucumcari New Mexico... Receptionist could not find my $400-plus reservation, his colleague finally found it after an argument that included the threat of having me unceremoniously escorted out by hotel security at 01:30 in the morning. Checked in the wrong room after 45 minutes. A great experience deserves an excellent review, an a bad experience begs to be exposed. Sorry, Mariott, you did not live up to your reputation this time...

Our last of many stays here over many years. The hotel is very tired and desperately needs renovation. Furniture, carpet, baths, all worn out. Great location and friendly staff are the draws here but the dirty, tattered furnishings overshadow. Getting stuck in the elevator on the 32nd floor ruined an afternoon (it is tired too)! Time for us to find a new hotel in New York City.

The reason for my visit on August 9-10, 2019 to NY Marriott East Side was a medical appointment at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. We arrived at the hotel at 12:30PM on August 9. The bell staff was wonderful throughout and held our bags as the room wasn’t ready. The front desk staff said that our room wasn’t ready (expected that as check in is 3pm.). She asked for my cell number and said she would text as soon as our Room was ready. We planned to return to hotel after my medical appointment to rest a bit and change before dinner. That did not happen. The “room ready” text came in the form of a voice mail at 5:27pm. We returned to the hotel after dinner. Joshua finalized our check in. I mentioned that I was disappointed that our room was not ready until 5:30pm. He apologized and said that he would grant us complimentary access to the concierge level lounge and complimentary breakfast. I acknowledged that in a big way, stating that kindness goes very far, and we need a lot more of that currently in our broken world. We presented at the Lounge at 9:25am. We were in the middle of a line of approximately 8 people. When it became our turn to enter the lounge, the female staff member was very loud and curt when denying us access because we were “not entitled and Joshua did not notate our account.” We immediately returned to the front desk and found Joshua, again alone. I explained our embarrassment and he couldn’t even muster an apology. We returned to our room, gathered our belongings and returned to the front desk to check out. Carmen checked us out without even asking how our stay was. While our situation left no long term damage and we have moved on, as Marriott reward members, I will make a point to go out of my way to avoid Marriott brand hotel, especially the one that employs Joshua and Carmen, and others like them. This was an epic fail In the service industry. Practice kindness, please. It isn’t difficult.

The location was great but thats about all I can say this hotel has going for them. The location is wonderful because it is walking distance to so many things. The staff initially was friendly but the rooms were small and our room looked like it was a cement box . it did not have a warm homey feeling to it at all. We were in town for less than 24 hrs for a business meeting and at 130 am. we heard loud talking and laughing. After a half hour we called downstairs and were told that it was Friday night so what do we expect!!! I was less than happy since we were payving over $300/night for this hotel. Upon leaving the next morning, we told that staff about our experience and no one seemed to care. Also, the restaurant/bar did not open until 5 so when we landed at 1 pm we then had to search for a place to eat. it would have been so convenient to relax at the restaurant at the hotel before our meeting. We picked this based on the location and Marriotts reputation but we will not be staying here again.

Very impressed with the entire staff and especially Pauline as she helped us most often at this Marriott. Our expectations were exceeded by their friendliness, knowledge, and ability to accommodate our needs. Hotel was clean and club lounge was very good. Fitness center was clean and nice too. Would highly recommend and will stay again in the future.

The location of this marriott is great and the staff is friendly. The rooms by NYC standards are actually quite big and very clean. The only downside was the noise. Not the normal city noise either. The sporadic toilet sounds and the very loud air conditioner noises all day and night were a tad annoying.

I learned of the $25 destination fee upon checking in. You had to use this money or you will be charged. The hotel had terrible amenities to use this on. The cafe opened at 6:30 am, but not really. Jerry the rude worker may appear at 6:40 and point for us to go to Starbucks for coffee as he “set up”. The hotel offered zero coffee in the lobby or zero snacks. The food for the $45 breakfast buffet was terrible. The potato’s were cold as was everything else on the hot bar. Not only disgusting but unsafe. The MGR on duty had an attitude when defending the misleading policy on the “destination fee”. If you had good products I doubt you would have to force people into eating there. This is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at in New York.

This was our second trip to NYC in 2019. We almost always choose a Marriott property when we travel and these two trips were not an exception. We chose this hotel Bc we didn’t want to stay in Times Square. However, I wished we would have dealt with the crowds in Times Square vs the apathetic staff at this hotel. From the check in where the staff seemed bothered by our presence to the none working ac to having to move rooms (and no apology or even kindness about the inconvenience they caused us), we did not encounter one kind staff member. This is not what we are used to when staying at other Marriott properties. The rooms were tiny as well and need some updating. We would not choose to stay here again.

Might be my last stay. This hotel is tired and overpriced, and the $25 destination fee was particularly painful as I arrived after 11pm and everything was closed. The lounge was locked, so no bottle water and no water in the rooms.
user_name:
tcc1056
New York City, New York

review_body: Incredibly shocked at how bad this room is. Door frames are being held up by tape and there’s a hole in the ceiling. And a great view of a brick wall!!! The only decent thing about this hotel is the location... otherwise avoid it. Marriott should be embarrassed.

I was feeling nostalgic when I booked this hotel. I travel to NYC a lot and have stayed in many Marriott Hotels. My meeting was just a block away from this location so I chose to stay here.This was my "go to" hotel for a few years. Its been some time (about 12 years) since stayed stayed at the Marriott East Side, but I remember my family having a wonderful stay there. The staff is great. they are friendly and engaging - from the time you check in until you say goodbye, the people were wonderful. But the building and rooms are showing some serious wear and tear. Everything is dark and outdated. the elevators are slow, and the bar/restaurant can use a serious upgrade. The room was nice, but the TV during the evening hours would glitch every few minutes. The remote didn't turn the channels. The bed was comfortable, but the lighting needs to be upgraded. On the positive side, the air conditioner was very quiet so it will not wake you in the middle of the evening. It was OK for one evening. The location was nice.

Manhattan has lot of hotels and apartments, stay somewhere else. Firstly, because of the elevators, one day I just waited for 20 f.... minutes until they arrive. No one care, the stuff couldn’t or wouldn’t try to fix or even try to apologize for the inconvenience. Second, because they don’t care. Third, due to the gym situation- old, dusty and out of order. All in all - old fashioned rooms, no service and basically nothing to write home about. Go somewhere else
user_name:
erka60763
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is nice located in the Lexington Ave. Near a lot of interesting touristique places. Room is pretty big. Service is good too. But it need a big refreshment for the room, bath and common part.

This hotel is in a desperate need of an upgrade - with the staff and with the hotel. I travel to NY often and have stayed at several Marriott properties and this by far is the most disappointing. Location is great, centrally located to so much, and easy to get around. The hotel is very dated and needs a renovation. The housekeeping team does a good job at keeping it clean. The staff was very disappointing compared to staff at other NY Marriott properties; very unfriendly. Once I told the bellman that I did not need help with my small suitcase he was very annoyed and would not assist in any way, even when I asked for directions. He just leaned up against the stair and looked at his phone. Like many other reviews, the elevators are small and do take forever, luckily I was on a lower floor so I was able to take advantage of the stairs. The bar is fine, nothing memorable. I wouldn't book another stay at this specific Marriott.

While this may not be the newest hotel it does have an excellent level of service and staff. The M Club lounge is fantastic for a quick bite in morning or water/soft drink. The seating is relaxed and comfortable also. Elevators are small since this older hotel feels very historical but has great room A/C, nice but small bathrooms, and a very helpful and friendly staff. I will be coming back to this property!

I have stayed here many times and you can find my 5-star reviews from previous visits however this time we lose a star. Did the management change? Feels like maybe it did with the change in the concierge lounge. The rooms are comfortable, and I slept well. The staff is very accommodating and friendly and maybe I hit them during a particularly busy week, but lounge was bad. Breakfast, which I previously raved about here, was not good. I'm in New York and they use frozen pastries and bagels... and if they weren't, they tasted like it. All the usual grandeur of the food for elites was gone. Dessert was tiny Petit Fours - not worth going for and breakfast lacked in all areas - just wasn't what I was used to getting at this property. The final insult is in NYC I don't expect FOX news and all the TV's - I lost my appetite before I sat down. So - speaking as an elite, they have unfortunately downgraded here.

The rooms here are standard NYC and the location is standard midtown. I stayed at the hotel years ago and had a nice stay. The room itself this time around was also just fine. But the only thing we will remember about our stay at this hotel is the incredibly rude and unprofessional check-in experience we had. Even though the desk manager apologized profusely for a rude clerk, and completed our check-in and tried to remedy the situation, it is hard to undo the memory of such rudeness with any gestures. Unbelievable and surreal that people in the 'hospitality' industry can behave in the manner of the desk person at this particular hotel- although not the first such experience in NYC hotels. This particular individual did three other things while checking us in - a phone to the ear- barking to another person on the side, and clicking away on the computer, never looking up, first refusing to answer queries- just too rushed to bother, and later, upon re-query about upgrades, first lying about available upgrades, proven by pulling up the booking abilities, to which he had no answer, and when queried on if he had made an error, responding in sheer aggression. Next, having been embarressed at being caught lying, deciding to punish us by stating we needed to wait till 4 pm for rooms because 'we booked late'- another lie reversed by the desk supervisor/manager who checked computers and had not one, but multiple room choices for us. Statements like "you booked this last minute today, so you don't have any upgrade options" - something that is utterly crazy, the time you book a room has nothing to do with your check-in options and a slew of other - lets call them what they are - lies, left us angry and dumbfounded at why we were so unwelcome. Shame on Marriott even allowing people like this to interact with guests at their hotels. At least there was an excellent manager who was there to cover and apologize for the fool.
user_name:
Matars_Z
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location! The hotel is very old and in dire need of renovation- our room was one of the ugliest rooms I have ever stayed in - sadly needs a huge makeover as does the rest of hotel! The elevators are painfully small and only hold 4-5 people max. They are also VERY slow. Several times we waited 20 minutes to get downstairs with the elevator making stops on every floor! Super annoying! Trying to get to the small fitness center took a while as well! It is located on top of building and from our room on 14th floor required 3 elevator rides/changes to get to!!! There is a bar in the hotel that opens at 5pm however there are no restaurants that serve Breakfast or lunch! They tell you to go to the restaurant next door!! Check in took forever and Alma at the front desk took two other people in front of me even though I was in the elite line! Stayed here 4 nights too many and won’t be back!

Best thing about this hotel: location. 58th & Lex. We walked everywhere. In town for a family wedding.Negatives:1. Service. No breakfast (unless you want a muffin or to pay $35 at the Marriott Club). No room service. When we asked the concierge to recommend a place for breakfast, she sent us with incorrect directions. When we returned from the breakfast hunt, her comment was "sorry you missed it". On a second try we asked for a recommendation for a pizza restaurant and a different concierge sent us to one that was permanently closed .The bride and groom had arranged for each guest to receive a welcome bag. Ours never arrived; when checking out the person at the desk said "we have a note here that there is a bag for you" which they were unable to find. Never got it. 2. Room & hotel. Tiny, tired, dated. Not like any Marriott we've ever stayed in. Our shower floor was unstable, as though standing on a waterbed. Seemed dangerous to anyone with balance trouble. One day we returned after the room had been cleaned and there was a pile of dirt in the bathtub (????)No place to sit in the lobby. The only restaurant/bar was not open much. We often stay in Marriotts but this one does not seem up to company standards. My husband did receive a reply from the hotel after he emailed his concerns, which was good. Apparently their concierge service is outsourced.

Our family only stays at Marriott International properties throughout the world. My wife and I do volunteer work in Bryant Park on a frequent basis. We thoroughly enjoy staying at the New York Marriot East Side for many different reasons which include : Location, Character, Service, M Club, Comfortable Beds, Nearby Restaurants and more. Often times people write General Managers to complain…that is not my style. If something needs to be taken care of, I speak up at the time. We just enjoyed spending a four day/three night weekend at your hotel which was fabulous and I wanted to call out some individuals that made our stay very special: Ron Rivera: We met Ron several years ago as we normally stayed at the Marriott Marquis. He always treated us like royalty and had his team take care of every detail of our needs for each visit. When he told us he was moving from W Downtown to the Marriott East Side, he invited us to stay and check out the property. We’ve been coming back regularly since that time. He is a consummate professional and makes clear that he appreciated our status/loyalty to Marriott properties. I’m sure that he will be a General Manager of a property in no time (I hope that it's also in Manhattan). Zach Donahue & Allan Hartwig: Both are two professional managers that care about details and reach out to us each time we are in residence. Zach and Allan were both extremely helpful during this visit. Jimmy & Michael Walsh: Both are outstanding doormen that are eager to please, do not try to “hustle” me and recall that we are frequent guests. Kenny & Michael Aromolo : These men are great. Hard workers, manage our suitcases and bags carefully/respectfully and are genuinely nice people. Yesterday we had a situation where we checked out at 11:30AM and asked the bell stand if they could bring things down and hold them in my wife’s name until we returned to the hotel with my car at 4:30pm. Everything worked flawlessly. Alexander: From Security. My family member was in the adjoining room and failed to pick up their items from the closet. The housekeeper put them in a bag and delivered them to security (which I understand is procedure). Alexander checked #1607 to make sure there was still nothing there, went down to security and brought up the bag of clothes to our room. Very kind. Joshua: At the front desk is always friendly and helpful. I had a problem with keys for M Club not working which he fixed at once. Also needed to light a candle and had no matches or lighter. He went out of his way to find some matches in the locker room, which was much appreciated. Joshua has in mind the history of the hotel and shared some very interesting details. Paulina Hernandez: At the front desk is extremely friendly and tons of fun. My family speaks Spanish and Portuguese so always enjoy an interesting exchange. She saw to it that all of our family members were checked in properly when they arrived on Saturday. Very informative, helpful and has delightful personality. Natascha: Housekeeping was an all-star. She was assigned to clean our suite up prior to guests arriving over the weekend and did a great job inside and outside. Everything was in perfect order and it was obvious that she put extra attention to preparing for us. I expressed our appreciation on Friday then told her that we were having friends/family over on Saturday. As always we would serve in disposable plates/cups so that they could be disposed of easily. She gave me some large garbage bags to use. Before everyone left on Saturday evening, we gathered together most of the trash and filled two bags which I gave to the houseman working the floor on Sunday morning. When we saw her on Sunday I explained and shared with her how she was truly appreciated. Please congratulate each of these individuals which are part of the New York Marriott East Side team and share with them how content and satisfied we’ve been with their excellent service.

We were booked here for 2 nights as part of an East Coast tour, so staying here wasn’t our decision. No problems with check in, even though we were part of a large group. We found the room to be comfortable, reasonably sized and very clean. The bathroom had a tub and shower, and the hotel is certainly well located. Only problem was a noisy air con unit.

The hotel is located in midtown and a short walk from Grand Central Station - so a great exploring base if you're a tourist. Also plenty of places to eat nearby to satisfy most budgets.The hotel itself is somewhat worn and tired like so many mid-range Manhattan hotels. The bedrooms are small by USA standards, but perfectly adequate if you are not planning on spending much time in it . The bathroom in particular is small [room 716] but has an excellent bath and a shower over that really works well. Good selection of toiletries provided that are replaced each day. The usual tea & coffee machine and decent sized flat screen TV provided. Dated decor, but comfortable bed and it's all clean throughout. Some traffic noise, but hey this is NYC with all the horns blaring and emergency sirens going 24/7.There is a very helpful and knowledgeable concierge service. The business centre has friendly staff and has an M Club for breakfast and snacks through the day.

Ignoring the building is old which I think is a plus as it creates charm, this place gave mixed feelings. The good is location as a big good. Also staff were amazing and access was fantastic for a busy spot. Downsides aren't that it needs a reno, but items sorted like poor air extraction, noisy hallways, improved air con and better food. Overall it was ok, and we didn't leave disappointed but let to think what other options exist for next time? Oh, and we don't care about the complaints of room service not available, it's Manhattan, go out the front door and walk 5 mins!

First of all, I’d like to say a massive thank you to Barbara for making our stay even better than it would have been for us prior to arrival! This hotel was absolutely perfect in every way for our trip. The room was spotless and comfortable. The breakfast was amazing as was the service we received from all staff members. The hotel is positioned brilliantly for tourists. Around a 10 minute walk from Times Square so you’re close to all the excitement of NYC but also away from all the noise as well as the hustle and bustle.Subway station literally 2 minutes walk away which is so simple to get to from JFK airport. Will definitely look to stay here again if we visit New York City anytime soon. We’ll also be recommending it to anyone who is considering a trip to NYC.

I stood here for 4 nights, the room was fine, but once we arrived for the checkin, we were notified that a “hotel fee” of $25.00 per night was going to be charged, I was not happy about that as I was not expecting to pay extra after the online booking was made. During my stay, a new dress that I had just bought and placed in it’s bag in my room was stolen from the room. It was not missing, it was stolen apparently by the housekeeping staff and the only response I got from the hotel administration is that they cannot do anything as the dress was never found. Not a refund or anything. Thanks, I will never use nor recommend this hotel ever.

It's very dated, which I could look past except they are overlooking the details around cleanliness. For example, hair on the bathroom towel (noticed it right when we walked in so obviously wasn't mine), a broken window blind (I would have had a nice view of the river if it worked), the rug was wet for some reason near the bed, not sure why. The bathroom door was filled with rust and some rotting. For a lower price you can find a much cleaner and updated hotel in that same location. Gave it the 2 circles since the staff was very friendly.

This is an old charm hotel that is in great location, walking distance to Grand Central and convenient to travel. We were upgraded to a very nice suite (thanks Sylvia) on a top floor that was very nice.The hotel has a Club M lounge that is opened 24 hrs where you can get coffee, soft drinks, water, fruit, snack bars etc.We found the staff very friendly, and the price is very reasonable by NY standard, great value for money.
user_name:
albertf940
New York City, New York

review_body: The receptionist was very nice and accommodating to us as Elite members. The layout of the hotel is strange where the rooms had the door entry at the extreme left side where the bed is. The closet is small, but understanding this is Manhattan, it did not bother us, since there was a floor-length mirror mounted on the closet door to use. The bathroom had a very low ceiling in the shower area. We’re glad that we had at least one window that does not face directly into another building. The bed was not very comfortable, but the layout of the room was sufficient for Manhattan to fit two Double size beds. Room was dark and designed as classic ornate. Keep in mind that the elevator does not accommodate many passengers during rush hour check out time or dining period that we had to take elevator going up in order to make it to the ground floor because it was always full.
user_name:
EY_GlobeTrekker
New York City, New York

review_body: The experience here was great. I really enjoyed it. The hotel has very good location and is very old New York with the right hints of modern. We checked in with Paulina Brito, a very nice Dominican lady. The service was excellent throughout the hotel and the room was clean, and comfy. Loved it.

I am a platinum elite member for Marriott. Obviously if I did not like Marriotts I would not reach this level. I don’t complain much about hotels but this one has to be my worst experience of all. The room was not dusted, the room was very small (feels like a broom closet) furniture missing and in bad shape, wall paper coming off the wall, sheets torn. See the torn sheets and dust bunny. I have better videos but don’t know how to post them.I feel that I get a much better room at the Fairfield in Cambridge, Ohio.Another interesting point is that this hotel has no room service. Not a big thing but I checked in late and it would be nice if I could order something for the room. This is not the standard I expect from a Marriott.

The location of this hotel is excellent but it is desperately in need of a refresh of people and rooms.Check in was unfriendly and I didn’t get an upgrade despite titanium status. It just seemed too hard for them to organize.Room was ok and internet worked ok. No water bottles in room is totally unacceptable. Bathroom was small but ok. Bed was old and lumpy.Common areas were horribly overheated.Elevators are very slow.Gym is 24 hours but small with limited equipment. 4 treadmills, 3 elliptical and 2 bikes if I recall correctly.Services needed follow up.Staff in the lobby bar were good and friendly.Hotel lies about the rates. They add $25 to the rate that they don’t tell you about when booking. This is not something I expect from Marriott and I complained about it. You can’t just add $25 charge for nothing! For this reason I’ll not use the hotel again unless they become honest about their rates.Their answer? “All marriotts do it!” That’s not true, I’ve been in 4 in the last 2 weeks and that’s the only one that lied about the rate.I would probably give 3 stars except for the rate issue.Avoid.

This applies to staff as well as service seemed alien to some, especially in the bar. Most pleasant we’re the cleaning staff who I suspect are the lowest paid.Good size room and a large bathroom which could have had a much bigger bath.Meeting room good size but really expensive especially for all additional items. Tough for the staff organising meeting as budget not limitless.Marriott- invest in fabric and training. Stop being greedy and provide better value

The hotel location is good. Rooms need updating and the common areas of our floor are really looking old. Ice machine was out on our floor. Sign said go to the next floor. Next floor was out of ice all three days. Other floors have been updated, but not all. Very strange. Small room, but not unusual for the area.

I traveled with a group, so I can't rate the value. I can say that the staff was wonderful, accommodating, friendly and quick to answer questions about the area. The property was clean and the room more spacious than I expected for NYC, but it is a bit outdated. Definitely in need of a remodel. It is in a very convenient location.

Beautiful old building with interesting history and architecture to match. Walkable to many tourist attractions. Check-in was chaotic. There were several large groups checking in around the same time, and the hotel staff was not prepared to handle a large volume. After waiting in a completely unorganized line, the staff person continued his phone call as I was standing there. When he got off, there was a "Welcome."Elevators are extremely small. The door opening is small and makes squeezing in with a lot of luggage difficult. Our room (#606 junior suite) was outdated and in need of modernization. Windows looked out to brick walls, with very little sunlight coming in. The toilet flushed very slowly, and the water ran constantly. I called maintenance to fix it - they didn't. A $2 rubber seal would have fixed it.The elevators were slow and crowded - if they worked. The elevator got stuck on two different occasions, and that's if you were lucky enough to get on one. We ended up walking down the six flights rather than waste our day waiting. At checkout, we waited and waited and ended up carrying our luggage and other shopping bags down the stairs. When I conveyed my annoyance with the front desk, their response was, "Sorry, we're completely booked." Isn't it your primary business goal to be able to book all your rooms?I'm a life-long Marriott/Starwood member (Platinum), and I've always enjoyed my stays at their properties. This however, is one that I would not go back to.
user_name:
David N
Newton, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Stayed for 1 night in transit. Really bad quality room, needs complete renovation, furniture and carpets really worn out. A previous post aircon is old and noisy. There was a problem finding my reservation and waited 10 mins at check in for them to resolve “ a computer problem”. For waiting I was “upgraded” to a room with a view. Pathetic view of rooftops of adjacent buuildings. To be fair the room rate was cheaper than other similar properties and originally I put this too it’s less central location a few blocks fro attractions. Room rate was still high and the resort charge ridiculous for a city hotel, but most nyc hotels add this charge, so just make sure you spend it,

I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member. Which means I stay in many Marriotts. This is a stone cold rip off. Start with the mandatory $25 a day food and beverage charge. Fine if you can actually use it. But the options are terrible. AND there is a $20 a day laundry charge not mentioned anywhere until you arrive. And then they try to charge 50% surcharge on laundry. Upgraded suite was worn out. No sign of the feather pillows on my Marriott profile. Etc. etc. Front desk has serious attitude problem. Elevators need to be replaced. Etc. etc. I will never stay there again. Marriott chain should be ashamed of itself.

This is one of my favorite hotels in Manhattan, but it is getting old. The air conditioning, too noisy and the rooms and carpeting are not in good state. Super friendly staff; Paulina and Denis at the front desk, the best!! I'll wait until remodeling to come back. Anyways location is the best.

Small room, but very nice... This is NYC!The hotel lobby is beautiful and very well kept.Checkin was quick and efficient.The room was very nice, clean and on the back of the building (no street noise).Even though I bumped into everything in the room, I would stay here again.I hope you enjoy your stay in my 2nd favorite city in the world.

Lack of service, check in was almost as if I was an inconvenience ... $25 resort fee of which you got a $25 voucher for the exceedingly poor restaurant and a feel of being a production line - not recommended

Traveled with daughter and 2 teenagers to NYC. It was an easy walk to the subway or to call an Uber. We did walk to many locations also. The food was good and quick to grab when in a hurry. Room was a little small but ok since we were only in there to sleep.

We stayed at this hotel for the weekend, the occasion was a bachelorette party getaway. The room size did accommodate the four of us. However you can tell this location does need some updating the elevator got stuck on 3 another guest was stuck in one, for as busy as this hotel seems to get they really need to fix the elevators, fixing may not be the answer for I'm sure they need a whole new elevator system. The beds we're too soft, if that is for you then it's perfect but I just stayed at the Renaissance and the bed had a good balance. The room was clean didn't have too many noise issue but you can smell whatever is cooking for Saturday morning we awoke to a strong garlic smell I'm sure this is do to the old building and it is still more than likely still using the old ventilation system. The room had two double beds and a sofa bed the sofabed was in a separate area, which is nice. I would have given 4 stars if there was a better bed and also some much needed upgrades. Overall the location is nice staff was great rooms not bad just needs the updates.

Returned here for a 2 night stay last week. Although the room was looking fairly worn, the bed was very comfortable and everything was clean. We paid for access to the M lounge and enjoyed the great breakfasts there, but were disappointed to learn there were no hors d'oeuvres served at the weekend. (There was a sign outside the lounge telling us this but we were not informed when we booked.) However, really enjoyed a drink at the 525LEX bar. Perfect position to walk to many attractions and shops. Staff very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to staying again!

The only reason why I don’t rate this place 1 is because the staff has been really nice despite the lack of amenities. I traveled all day, arrived at 10 PM starving in my room, did not see a menu. I called concierge, no concierge. I called the front desk, they tell me there is no room service but I can go to the restaurant downstairs... actually a bar, not a place where you want to go by yourself when you are tired. There is not even a bottle of water, fridge empty. They are supposed to have a shop downstairs opened until 11PM, it was closed at 10.15PM. Not only you have to pay for wifi but it’s not working. I could say a lot about the old brown furnitures and carpet...

I enjoyed my stay there this past week. I like how old and famous this place is. I found the rooms to be comfortable and clean with a good desk and internet. I had access to the M lounge on the 2nd floor and the food was quite good there and the staff was great there also. I also ate at the lobby restaurant and had a good late night meal there, with great service. Check in was smooth too and efficient. I viewed the meeting space and found it to be functional also for mid-sized groups. The location is great, a Starbucks is a block a way and some great restaurants are near by as is Grand Central Station.

Picked this hotel as a family get away. I am Plantiumn Elite and stay many nights at Marriotts. This is the worst experience in my many nights at Marriotts. The so called double beds are not even double beds. Two adults can not sleep in them. They have a so called resort fee which they claim you can use $25 at the bar. You can’t order even two drinks for that. So if you want one drink a day it may cover it. They add a service charge to each thing bought in the bar even if it is only three people. They claim everyone does this in NY. Never seen this in my many nights of travel. They claim they are full service but no room service which I don’t care about.
