The rooms are dated and service is very condescending. If this was a nice upscale hotel I would expect that, but this is an old Marriott in an ok location thinking tourists don’t know better. Went to the concierge‘s lounge and honestly forgot I could only have two people. I normally travel for work without family. So my young daughter who ate very little was charged $35 plus tax of course for mediocre breakfast. If you pick this hotel be prepared for some nasty surprises at check out and no sleep in the so called “double” beds. And just smug managers when you ask for explanations. There are far better choices in this city.

I have stayed here a few times. Rooms where ok but small as expected for NY. I arrived after midnight hoping to get some sleep. Didn't happen. Everyone expect non stop sirens, honking and trash pick all evening. The windows do nothing to lower the sounds of the city. Bring ear plugs!!!!!!!

The location is the main upside to this hotel. The hotel is dated - need some serious updates. The rooms were as clean as they could be. There is a small cafe type restaurant, but it isn’t a full restaurant- no room service. The staff were good and helped. I thought it odd that a full service Marriott didn’t offer umbrellas, but one of the lower end properties down the road does.

You guys are at best a 2* standard hotel and not a 4*. We are still a guest at this hotel and I am so annoyed that I felt like writing this review even before checking out. Nobody would expect a 4 star hotel not to have any room service. Also while you book a room at The Marriott you don’t expect it not to have room service. I called their at your service extension to request them to send me 4 bottles of water and they said they could not even do that because they don’t provide that service. This is absolutely ridiculous. They have one bar downstairs in the lobby and they close for 4 hours in the afternoon so what does one do when they are thirsty during those hours?

The hotel is nice. There are a lot of things to do both inside and outside the hotel. The concierge was helpful. The two negative points are in the bar/dining area there aren’t a lot of food choices. The second was that there was no hot water during our stay. Found out they shut off the water and didn’t notify the people staying in the hotel. I don’t think that’s right.
user_name:
Stacy M
New York City, New York

review_body: The best thing about this hotel is that it’s located within walking distance from several major NYC landmark sights. And the subway station is just a two-block walk up 51st Street. It’s on a busy one-way street with lots of traffic and pedestrians. There are plenty of shops, stores, & eating places in the vicinity. The hotel is an older property catty corner from the legendary Waldorf Astoria. There is a spacious M lounge on the 2nd floor that serves complimentary breakfast and drinks/food in the afternoon. Room size was as expected for NYC and quite comfortable. Overall it was a satisfactory stay.

I’ve stayed at this location twice in the last four months. Disappointed each time. As a Gold Elite member I’ve experienced the quality of service and accommodations that one expects from Marriott and this property was not it. My visit started when I was assigned a room across from an elevator. I asked to be moved and was accommodated. I was moved to a corner room. Two issues, the cable tv was malfunctioning and the toilet had a violent and loud flush. After an hour of being promised that an “engineer” would be up to fix the TV, I had to call again. Within 10 minutes a person came, worked on the tv and then when questioned about why the ESPN channel still wasn’t working (it’s March) he told us that they were having trouble with ESPN. I called to voice my disappointment. Five minutes later the front desk called to offer 10,000 reward points for my inconvenience, a nice gesture that was appreciated. My disappointment comes from the fact that I had to initiate the many requests for a solutions. No follow up and no real effort to proactively solve issues.Finally, there is no room service. Plus you are charged a $25 destination charge to experience NYC and/or to purchase items from the bar, an unnecessary gouge for the customer. Surely Marriott can do better.

Greeted by a very professional doorman when we arrived. I instantly got the feeling of “old New York.” The Hotel is located in a great area and convenient for the subway. I parked my car, typical NYC cost of $75 a day. There are garages near by a little less. Our room was not huge, nice Marriott king bed. Bathroom small but ample. Room was well appointed and clean and had everything I needed. Overall a very good Marriott and would happily return again

Nice hotel on the east side of Manhattan. Beautiful common areas and the room we had was a decent size for downtown Manhattan. Clean which is most important.Service was friendly - didn’t try the restaurant though it looked decent. Went to the bar at 440pm one day but it didn’t open until 5pm so didn’t give that a try. 20mins walk to Times Square..

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The windows are not insulated, you hear all the traffic noise and you feel the breeze coming in. The front desk said that that is the norm, and there’s nothing they can do. Perhaps, invest in double windows? The hot water stopped working at night and front desk won’t even pick up the phone to provide an explanation. I’m not the first to bring up hot water not working nor the management’s lack of responsivenss. Look at other reviews. This management likes to put lip service while issues exist. Avoid this hotel! It really feels like a cheap motel. To conclude, there’s no hot water, the room is noisy, breeze comes through the window, and customer is unresponsive.

We are loyal Marriott platinum members and our experience at this NYC Marriott was seriously disappointing. We can always count on Marriott to greet us with smiles, provide help and recommendations, and the rooms are always clean and all electronics functional. The staff seemed annoyed to check us in. Our TV remote didn’t work. There wasn’t anyone around to help. We regretted choosing this Marriott since there were other options. This was an important trip and our experience at this Marriott was really disappointing.

The hotel is in a great location on Lexington & 49th. Hotel is looking a little worn. Staff is very friendly and the concierge was very helpful in suggesting a restaurant upon arrival.However - we received a "card' when checking in were told we would get $20 dry cleaning and $25 toward any food or beverage purchased at the hotel. This is total BS or at least a very shady money grab!! That $25 was first ADDED to our hotel bill each day (as soon as we bought a coffee or drink) and then a $25 credit/discount appeared on the bill when checking out. So, in reality you do not ever get a $25 credit allowance. Shame on you Marriott. Never again will I use Marriott!!!

The Marriott East Side is actually pretty standard. Rooms are typically NY sized. Fortunately rather clean. However the whole hotel is pretty dated and would need some major overhaul. Location is ok, rather central.The thing which bothered me most was the destination fee of 25$ per room + tax. I do not see ANY added value not to mention that this fee is not really advertised anywhere. In my opinion only another source of income for the hotel. Which is why we will definitely not come again to that hotel again.

Nice locationNice staff many of whom have worked there 20 years or more. Negative is there is no room service. Breakfast and dinner available in the lounge/restaurant. Great bartender staff. Very clean rooms. Try for higher floor. Street noise at lower levels can be annoying if you are a light sleeper.

Hotel was very easy to get to from LGA. A quick bus ride Q71 to the train transfer took us into Midtown right to the 53rd St station. We checked in at 12:00pm without any problem. I believe 4:00 pm is check in. Booked double bed room. Room was large and had all the basic amenities and more. Mini fridge was a nice touch. Staff was great throughout. They charge a $25/day fee that you can redeem for food at the cafe adjacent to the lobby. Ex: 2 bagels, 1 orange juice, one oatmeal, 1 banana, 1 coffee was about $23. Was nice to have a quick breakfast available each morning. I’d suggest sticking with breakfast as we used the credit for the dinner Bacon mac n cheese which was $21, and it was gross. Only downside was when they brought up a microwave and its use caused the power in the room to go out. Maintenance restored power within 5 minutes and I was told it should be ok to try again, however, power went out again. Street noise is a factor. We were located on the 6th floor facing 49th with a view of Lexington. Garbage comes late and again early morning - 12/4am. Sounds like you’re sleeping at street level. Hotel is two streets down from a Duane Reade, and 3 blocks down from a CVS. 5 minute walk to Grand Central. Overall great stay. Big clean accommodating room/hotel.

Spent the weekend here and loved it! The location is convenient with walking to most attractions in the area. The room was incredible with great views as well. The staff was friendly and pleasant and very helpful with suggestions

Old dated Marriott. What is very annoying is the $25 "daily resort fee" I was notified about during check in. Seriously - just raise your rates by $25 a night. Don't tell me I can spend it in the bar or restaurant - I am in NYC for day and night meetings like most of the other guests, don't force me to go to your bar or restaurant just to get my $25 back.

The hotel was very average. The check in staff were nice but the hotel is dated. The rooms need a refresher. The Club Lounge was nice. The hotel tags on extra fees which had no benefit to me. Why not just charge for food bought? I am not sure I would go back.

Let me start by saying that checking in on a Friday evening was a very slow process. You will also be charged $25 a day as a destination fee. Wi fi in room is slow. I didn't meet any overly friendly staff. No one seemed readily available to help. You pretty much get by the entire stay unnoticed. The room was small and furniture very dated. My husband & I, both were very itchy at night. I hope that it wasn't bed bugs. The hotel was not terrible but it also wasn't very good. It is descent for the price. I would not stay here again.

i'm shocked by the positive reviews of this hotel. I'm a frequent traveler (50+ nights per year) and would not recommend this property to anyone unless they are looking for a decent bed in a decent location. I fully agree with other reviews that mentioned the horrid in-room coffee, lack of room service, and limited hours of lobby bar/restaurant, the primary reason for my 1-star review was the deceptive service charge practices in the lobby bar/restaurant. I have never had a 15% service charge included in every check -- regardless of the number of people served -- without being alerted. As a former waitress, i happily overtip -- but i was furious when i realized that i had tipped 25% on a check where i had already been charged 15% (this was for 2 drinks, not a party of 6+ where included service is standard). when I spoke with the server about my concern, i was told that it's standard Marriott policy and they have no control. Not only is that patently untrue (unless they changed policy last week and i didn't notice), it does not explain why the servers don't explicitly tell customers that a modest service charge is already included. Sorry, but they are intentionally deceiving customers and management needs to address this issue.

Stayed 6 nights to celebrate sons 21 st birthday. Check in really smooth and allocated a twin room on 15 th floor. Room really spacious with good amenities,fridge,iron and board,coffee making facilities. No hairdryer though. Beds really comfortable.Having been to New York many times in the last year I didn’t have much trouble at all navigating the local attractions. However a special mention must go to JC on the concierge desk who highlighted attractions further afield and directed us on the best way to get there. She recommended that we purchase a 7 day travel pass which included the trains and buses and this definitely saved us money with the metro station just one block away. No question was too silly and no request was too trivial. JC made our trip so easy and if there is an award for employee of the month she should be at the top of the list!!The bar and food service was good with competitive pricing and friendly staff. We were allowed an extra hour for check out at no additional cost so worth asking.If you are looking for a comfortable base in midtown then I would not hesitate to recommend.

I had a small corner room, nice, great view big windows.. Enough for one, too small for 2 . Small kitchenette. A bit unipersonal but very good service and clean.Good location. Best organic food store next door.

So the state or city of NY needs to intervene and have hotels display the total room cost (exclusive of taxes) and not play with the addition of a destination fee. Yes, it is mentioned at the top of the page with the room rates but in the large numbers listing the room rate, it is not included. I know that many Marriott branded hotels do this and it is deceptive. One star off because of this.The rest of my review...Pros: - good location- fast elevators- beautiful building nearly 100 years old- quiet room (on the 30th floor)- decent breakfast in the lounge- big room for NYC (upgraded due to Platinum Elite status)- clean room and public areas- large TVCons:- small bathroom (I know, cannot do much about it in these older buildings) - with a single sink for two people trying to get ready- no walk-in shower - had to step in and out of a tub with no grab bar- dated decor

I honestly don’t understand the negative reviews this hotel is getting. We had two rooms, adjoining on the 7th floor and stayed for two nights. The hotel was beautiful, did not appear to need updating in my opinion (and I’ve stayed in over 10 different NYC hotels over the past 4 years) both rooms were large, spotless, the beds were comfortable and the hotel was very quiet although there was street noise but the hotel has a white noise option on the tv which helps. The staff from front desk to concierge to bellman and housekeeping were all friendly and helpful. The windows in the room were a little drafty but the shades blocked the draft. The only downside in my opinion was the cafe off of the lobby. The selection was small but we used our $25 credit for bagels, coffee and pastry one morning. We also were able to use our destination credit for tickets for all 4 of us to Madame Tussauds. We checked out the gym on the 35th floor which was good sized with a great selection of equipment, very clean and a great view. I would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again

If you do not travel for a living, in fact if you just travel on holiday and just need a comfy bed, then this hotel is fine. The location is excellent (located in mid town next to N/S subway and the E to Penn Station), the bed is comfy and the staff is excellent. The staff is truly very helpful, professional, interested and can think for themselves to resolve issues. The hotel is interesting from the street but "faded" inside. Having said that, if you travel a great deal for work like I do (north of 100 nights per year) not counting vacation travel, you will not like this hotel. Lets start with the coffee bar in the lobby, sponsored by Iilly that closes at noon and is not open again until 530/6pm and they will helpfully send you to the nearby Starbucks with a straight face. Seriously? Its 5 degrees outside, I do not want to go to Starbucks but I could drink the crap in the room (that stuff is fine at 530am when I am jet lagged and nothing opens until 630am in the city that never sleeps but not at 3pm in the afternoon) and I do not want to do that either. As well, the hotel is old and there is no heat in the bathroom, so that means no AC in the summer in the bathroom. They put in thru the wall system and it does not reach the bathroom but as a tease, the vent from the old system is still there. Did I mention that it was 5 degrees outside? Yes it was sporty in the morning after taking a shower. The final indignity is that the breakfast buffet is $35 and you have to go thru "check point Charlie" to reach it as it is in the M Club, which is for high members of Marriotts membership program (free for them, 35 bucks and a hassle for me). Let me clue the hotel Mgmt in on something, for $35 bucks, I need to see eggs Bennie, an omelet station, coffee from some virgin rain forest and a huge array of fruit, many of which have names I can not pronounce. Let me tell me Marriott this as well, given the last few charmless hotels of theirs that have I stayed in, I have no interest in reaching the level necessary to get a free "breakfast" (really a stretched continental break) or to get the points so on vacay I stay free as I do not want to stay in their hotels. Oops I almost forgot, Marriott now tacks on some kind of fee that gives me dry cleaning credit (don't need it as not here long enough), enhanced local and LD calls (I have T Mobile thank you), a welcome gift (seriously?), NYC local experience (again seriously?) and a $25 food credit. Will not stay here again and as I have control over where we stay, Marriott will not be on the list.

I usually wait till my trip is over to write a review, but my experience here is so disappointing that I had to write it down while I’m still staying here.I’ve stayed at Marriott hotels in different locations around the world and this one is by far the worst. In fact, it fell significantly short of he standard of what you’d expect from a typical Marriott. DATED - First of all, the entire hotel feels like it needed a renovation years ago. The room is small and dated. Furnitures are chipped. DIRTY - The cleaning standard also needs to be improved. It’s also obvious that the room was cleaned at least days before I checked in and the cleaner did a pretty lousy job, as surfaces were covered in dust, including the desk, side table, towel rack and sink counter in the bathroom. The grossest thing is there was even a stray of hair in the bathtub. BED BUGS!!! - More shockingly, there are bed bugs, and I was woken up by itchiness from the bites - the last thing you need when being jet lagged after a long flight! MINIMUM AMENITIES - The amenities are barely existent. Nothing besides soap, bath wash and shampoo was provided. No toothbrush, comb, cotton pad or even shower cap was provided. Again, far inferior to the quality of a typical Marriott. The fridge is empty too and the coffee provided is poor. All in all, this is more like a 3-star hotel and nothing like a typical Marriott. The only positive aspect about this hotel is its location, but there are much nicer hotels for similar prices in the area, so I definitely do not recommend this one.

Stayed here one night whilst in NYC. Overall, this is a perfectly comfortable hotel, if a little dated. Could definitely do with bringing into the 21st century a little, though it is still perfectly well kept and clean. Handy location in midtown, convenient for all of the midtown attractions and more reasonably priced than properties closer to the Times Square and 5th Avenue areas. Virtually opposite the Lexington Avenue side of the (currently closed) Waldorf Astoria.Unfortunately I have had to rate this property 3 stars due to a somewhat rude member of the bellhop team, who (despite not being asked to do anything other than retrieve our bags from the luggage room). The look of sheer contempt on the face of this gentleman when we did not tip him (I did not feel the level and speed of service delivered warranted a tip, having already tipped this team when the bags were dropped off) made me feel somewhat uncomfortable when leaving the hotel. The scowl on his face was quite something.I would strongly suggest that the management educate their staff in this department on the correct way to treat hotel guests, as this attitude may well have lost the hotel a customer.

I’ve stayed at this location twice. They have an excellent M Club lounge, in the top 10 best of ones that I’ve visited. The fitness center is nice, good selection of equipment and a decent 180 degree view of the city. The rooms are decently spacious for NYC. Also my second stay was more enjoyable, the key is to ask for a quiet room facing the back courtyard. The rooms facing Lexington Ave are very noisy! I’d recommend ear plugs in either case to be safe, if you are a light sleeper. Good selection of restaurants and shops within walking distance. This is my preferred Marriott for staying on the East side.

This property is a bit dated, and in need of a freshen-up. The rooms are nice sized for the area, but the beds and bathrooms were quite small. Not quite what we expect from the Marriot brand. On the plus side, the location is great, and the front desk staff was friendly and professional.
user_name:
AHRESQ
New York City, New York

review_body: Truthfully, I don't care if a hotel is a little older if there is silence, if it's clean, if the service is nice, and the people are helpful. And that's what this Marriott is all about. It's true that it's a little older and it's true that it probably could benefit from a rehab but the club level breakfast is great... the the bar in the lobby is staffed by people who are incredibly helpful and eager to get you what you need, and in a compact space very Central for downtown at a very good price it's really a nice spot to be. There are better and there are worse but it works out really well. They take care to make the room the way you want and their doors are the quietest of any hotel I've been to in some time.

I just didn’t like this Marriot hotel the price is exorbitant for what it is and it has a musty feeling all over it. I was not impressed with the service, the bar had no idea how to prepared a basic, and extraordinary expensive gin and tonic, the whole hotel needs a face lift, because tradition does not need to be opposed to modernity. To go to gym you need 3 lifts, rooms where fine but heating was so noisy. I like Marriott but certainly not this one

The last time we stayed here in it was very nice. This time they had not room service. Was rather disappointing. The hotel is in a very good location. It would be perfect if it had room service. If you are going with little kids you need to be aware of this limitation.

I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years for work, but have tended to stay at the Lexington next door (also a Marriott) or the Residence Inn in the last few years as they are both newer and more modern, plus the Residence Inn rooms tend to be larger (for NYC standards) and have kitchenettes. But on my last trip to NYC, the Marriott East Side was the least expensive of the three so I decided to book it for my 2 night stay. Mistake! My room was disgusting! The carpet had obviously not been vacuumed recently as I stepped on not one but two pieces of food on the floor. Gross. The room itself was good size, although near the elevator so it was loud from the elevator itself and people talking waiting for it. I just turned on the fan for the night and it pretty much drowned that out though. But the condition of the room was the major disappointment. It is dated and just feels drab and dirty. The towels are thinner and look dingy. The curtains were ripped. The mattress and bedding all looked old too. The club lounge has been updated and moved to the second floor which was nice, but there were not enough tables to sit down for breakfast either morning nor for happy hour. I asked at checkout about any planned room renovations and they said yes the rooms need a renovation and it is being planned but not for a couple years. Well, thanks for the heads up, guess I will not stay there again until that time and would strongly recommend to others to choose another hotel until that time too. There are so many hotels in the same price range in that neighborhood that are in better condition (although I will also say the Lexington is starting to show its age too and it just renovated in the last 4 years or so). For those loyal to Marriott, now that Marriott and Starwood have combined, the Westin near Grand Central is a much better option as is the Residence Inn.

Pros :Large roomsLarge BathroomsVery Comfortable bedsVery Good WiFiGood LocationCons :Problems with elevators (long waiting time, especially in the morning)Expensive breakfast (30 usd per person - didn't use it)NoisyNot good view from rooms

Booked this room as part of a package deal with Expedia. Best thing about this hotel was the location. My boyfriend and I walked everywhere with ease. Chrysler Building is 5-10 minutes walk down Lexington. 15 - 20 minute walk straight up 49th to Rockefeller, Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping row including Saks.20 - 30 minute walk to Central Park10 minute walk to Grand Central Station15 Minute walk to Bryant ParkPros: Cool old New York building. Has character. Check in was a a breeze. Hotel staff were great - front desk, concierge desk, gift shop clerk, cleaning staff and the lady who takes care of the M lounge on the 2nd floor. She was most accommodating in helping us one morning. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the lounge (not free however)Room had a fridge. Bathroom was roomy and bathtub drained well. TV was a flatscreen. There is a restaurant and a gift shop in the lobby. Lobby area was warm and inviting. Loved the hot chocolate and cookies served in lobby one evening. There are a few Starbucks locations near as well as a Duane Reade/Walgreens, liquor store and various food carts (which were all good btw). Tons of restaurants around. Wifi in the room worked for me just fine. I am a Marriott Rewards member so I did not pay for it. Cons:$25 daily resort fee - however, this can be used for food in the hotel restaurant or for a ticket to some form of New York entertainment. We used ours for food. It is a use it or lose it fee. Instead of complaining about it, just make use of it. Old building, so yes has character, but the rooms could use some updating. Our room was a King room, 6th floor facing front of building. Good room for a single or couple who really like each other and can stand close quarters. Small closet for two people to hang up things. One window could look into neighbors corner room and vice versa, so we had to keep shade drawn all the time. Window was drafty and we had to use towels to block cold air out. However, heating/cooling system worked well and was not noisy. Also nice touch covering it up. When we arrived, only 2 towels in the room and we had to call to get more. They were very quick to bring us towels which was nice. The room was clean but I had some observations. 1. Room smelled like wet dog/dirty mop especially in bathroom and that smell lingered the whole trip. 2. We found a contact lens on the floor and floor around nightstand/bed was dusty. Not sure if room was really vacuumed. I’ve noticed many comments about street noise. If you stay here you will hear cars and honking and sirens. You can use the noise cancelling options on the TV or wear earplugs. It’s New York City after all, the city that never sleeps.

Can’t complain about the location. Standard Marriott level. Staff are very polite and helpful. Room is small compare to other Marriott but average in NY. Updated cable system. Fridge is in the room! Easy walking distance to Grand Central. Will come back again.

This is a standard Marriott and is by no means a terrible hotel. Nor is it a particularly good one. It’s an older hotel and while maintained to Marriott standards, it’s beginning to look a bit haggard. They are also cutting corners in a few areas (e.g. no umbrellas available for guests to borrow?) but nothing too dramatic. If you can get a good price and need to be on the East side then it’s OK to stay here. But a reminder that the far superior Kimberley is just down the road and the Benjamin almost next door has on rare occasions comparable pricing. so shop around

We stayed at the NY Marriott East in midtown the week before Christmas for 5 days. We were allowed to check in early so that was nice. We were given a key to a room specification we didn’t reserve but the issue was immediately resolved and we settled into our two bed room. The rooms were more spacious than I anticipated which was super nice. The next morning we had a slow tub drain but after I called it was fixed. The staff were ALL really nice and helpful. The resort fee was a little unreasonable considering we were already paying a high cost for our room but I get it, a company can never make to much money (LOL being sarcastic). The $25 daily hotel food credit you get with each room reservation makes up for the daily resort fee ($25/day) but only if you remember to use it every day. Also take advantage of the free NYC attraction you accumulate daily you get with your room. We needed extra blankets so that was easy to obtain. It was an easy stay at the hotel. I will definitely come back and stay here again because we did have a good experience. It may be an older hotel but the staff & environment were definitely in keeping up with the standards of a newer hotel.
user_name:
tanstaafla
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Small room--TV bolted to stand--ice machine 8th floor not working---no view--shower would peel the hide off you. You can redeem your $25 resort fee X 3 nights equals $75 resort fee for hotel food. Went to breakfast $35 each buffet = $105. So do the math $105 minus $75 = $30. So effectively you are in the hole an additional $30 bucks. Beware in NYC there are crooks behind the desk at the Marriott to the beggars in the streets. The Big Apple will get a bite of you.Plus side-- clean linens and the toilet flushed

We stay at some 20 Marriotts a year and are platinum level elite. Or so we thought.The hotel charges $25 / day resort fee in addition to it's high rate, but has no service to be had. The restaurant is a shabby lobby corner and is closed any time we needed to have some thing, mid afternoon or 11:30 Friday or Saturday nights. The executive lounge has the most horrible coffee, and the machines wouldn't even make coffee hot.The breakfast is a stampede of hungry tourist and kids in a rush. The oatmeal, the only thing I could reach in the squeeze of people, was horrible with raisins that was as bad.Mind you we go to many Marriotts domestically and Internationally and never have had such a bad experience.

The hotel was fine and concierge was very nice and helpful. Rooms were fine. The executive lounge was great. When we needed help getting a cab, the bell/doorman didn’t help at all. I tried to talk to him and he simply asked where we were going, and then WALKED AWAY from me to go talk to the other bell man. I couldn’t believe it and stood and stared in disbelieve for a few minutes. Then went and got my own cab. There is no room service. That was surprising. Those two things brought the rating down to 3 rather than a 4, which I would have otherwise given the hotel. Three night. Was fine. Future trips I’ll select another Marriott in the city. Definitely not this one.

This hotel is one of the ones in New York City that now charge a $25 DAILY destination fee. This covert charge is tacked onto your rate for the room and not made crystal clear to customers at any point in the booking process or the check in process. On receipt of our bill on check out, I was startled to see a $100 fee for a 4 night stay, plus city tax. As a frequent city traveller, I am accustomed to a citytax at the end of a stay, as this is a smallish charge, but a “resort/destination” fee is daylight robbery. This isn’t paying for the pool and cabanas to be maintained in Grand Bahama, this is a New York City Hotel, not a resort. On check in, we were presented with a hotel coupon giving us $25 worth of food and beverage credit, a gift from the hotel gift shop and $20 of complimentary dry cleaning. We took this coupon and assumed it was due to status as a Marriott rewards member. We did not wish to eat/drink in the Marriott hotel so we didn’t utilise this. (The Marriott Hotel desk clerk said to us on check out that this $25 food credit could have been used daily but even if we had known this, we wouldn’t have spent extra money on dining within the property as a party of 3, even with the coupon). As a consumer, I do not wish $25 worth of credit towards your extortionately priced hotel food services. I would prefer to NOT be charged a resort fee and i would mostly prefer to eat and drink somewhere else (in a city with the culinary calibre of New York the choices are infinite). Warning: Marriott has instigated this daily resort fee charge across their Manhattan hotels and on reading further about this charge, there are concerns that this means that hotels are weasling their way out of paying taxes to NY state. As of 2018, Marriott is one of 85 hotels in NYC who tack on this “destination/resort” charge. I can’t complain about the the hotel amenities, beds and cleanliness-these were fine but you can easily find similar rooms around New York City without a destination fee scam. Marriott would do well to take note and charge their customers an honest upfront price for a hotel room (with a modestly smal NY city tax as extra) as it is well known that consumers do not like hidden extras and being “dinged” at check out with an extra charge. It has been said that a dissatisfied customer will tell 15 friends about their negative experience. I will certainly be telling all my friends and acquaintances about your resort fee practices to warn them away from booking and staying with you.

Just pulled into the Marriott. Despite status, was given a room next to the elevator and first thing that happened was that the shower didn’t work. Thank god I found out while trying to steam out my clothes and not tomorrow morning! The first suggestion they had was to have engineering come up. Hello! It’s 10:30 at night! They finally put me in a different room that was even smaller than the first with the tiniest TV that I’ve seen in a hotel room for years. My goodness, I’d hate to see how they treat people who weren’t loyal customers. Totally disappointed in Marriott on this one.

This Marriott property is close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Bryant Park, etc. Wonderful place to stay in December if you want to see all the holiday sights. Walking distance to everything. We stay here for a few nights every year because we enjoy seeing the tree at Rockefeller Center and going to the Holiday shops in Bryant Park and at Columbus circle. The bar is a nice place to stop at the end of the evening. Steven is very friendly and it's always enjoyable to talk with him.Definitely recommend this Marriott.

This hotel is an old & tired Marriott that desperately needs a refurbishment and could benefit from some improved customer service. I am a Platinum Premier member and stay in Marriotts during most weeks throughout the year. The staff was friendly on arrival, but that's where the friendliness ended. I could complain about the general dated nature of my room, the broken AC/heating unit, or the yellow shower curtain, but my real issue is the massive cockroach that I found scurrying around the bathroom on the last night of my most recent stay. I lived in NYC for years, so I'm familiar with cockroaches. But, I don't expect to see them on the 15th floor of a brand name hotel. I ended up killing the roach and immediately calling the front desk to request another room. After I explained the situation, I was told that there weren't any other rooms available for the night. After I continued to argue and complained to the night manager, a room was suddenly available (wow!) - but, I was made aware that this was a great inconvenience to the hotel and that they would need to "move some things around for me". After hours or arguing with front desk staff and waiting around in an infested room, I was finally moved. After my stay, I submitted a message via Marriott.com and was referred to the hotel staff, who referred me to the hotel manager (Ron)....who never responded. After a followup three weeks later, an assistant manager (Allan) finally emailed me saying that this situation is "very unusual" and that the room was treated after my stay (because that really helped me...). I never received a response to my response back to him (it's been 6 days), never heard an apology during or after checkout, and continue to have the impression that I seriously "inconvenienced" the hotel because of my "unusual" situation. I guess they don't care that I slept two nights in an infested room and probably had roaches crawling around inside my suitcase. This hotel is a dump and they know it (but don't care). Don't stay here.
user_name:
Andrew K
New York City, New York

review_body: As a Platinum member, we have stayed at this hotel many times. Paulina at the front desk is a standout! She recognizes us every time we check in and tries to get us the best possible room. She provides a high level of personalized customer service. We were upgraded to a nice newly refurbished room that was larger in size and on a quiet floor. Bellmen are quick and pleasant. Superb location in Midtown with easy access to major attractions. Hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays. Lounge is large and offers snacks and breakfast for free for Gold and above. Staying again in late January. Save us a good room, Paulina!

I just do not understand the negative reviews. The entire staff was friendly and helpful! The concierge lounge was excellent. The elevators were all working and we never waited. The room was spacious and very clean. Excellent location!!! Being Platinum Elite I see a lot of properties. To me this hotel has the classic NY feel. Thanks to the staff. Great job!

This was a bog-standard, tired Marriott which is well overdue for a refurb. Some rooms are absolutely tiny, whilst others have noisy air-conditioning units. In-room carpets are really dirty, although no complaints about he quality and cleanliness of linens. I suggest you head for the higher floors, which are quieter and in my experience slightly larger (although I only have a sample size of two...).There is an above average hotel gym on the 35th floor, which has some excellent views. Location if you need to be in Manhattan, is excellent.I stayed on business, and would say almost all fellow guests appeared to be business travellers too. I'd be disappointed if this was the hotel I returned to during a leisure trip.

I traveled with my family and when we arrived my little girl found condoms in the drawer besides the bed.One day they forgot to clean the room.The location is very good but the rooms are small and the hotel is old.

Positives: people tried. Negatives: 3 days on business. Checked out Nov 30. Have stayed before. Property has gone down to "garbage pit" level. Even for NY. NO HOT WATER. 11 at night, nope. 6 a.m. nope. NO HOT WATER. 2018 and cold water only. Complained 4x. Nothing. Super premier platinum deluxe (whatever) FOR LIFE. Nothing. "Hotel fully booked" (with dirty people or those that like cold showers apparently). Propery manager should be removed immediately. Terrible, terrible hotel. Dont get me started on new M Club. Worse than any other Marriott. Only stayed 119 nights this year around the world. Maybe I don't know?

Adding this to my new fave list!Excellent location.Well trained and friendly staff.Large, well appointed, quiet room. Small bathroom, well lit, plenty of hot water.Exec club well stocked and worth the $.Old world charm that some have referred to as "dated," but I love this type of large, yet boutique-like hotel. Also, nicely decorated for the holidays.Drawbacks- $25 daily "destination fee" and no room service available.Finally, a hotel that I would be happy to return to in a city full of some not-so-great options.

This is the second time we have stayed here. The location is great for getting around many of the popular nearby places (lower Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center). The hotel is clean and has a 'classic' feel. Not modern and no grand spaces. It seems pretty compact, even a modest lobby and lounge area. We stayed on the 6th floor in a room with a view of walls from other buildings. I get this is the city and not all rooms have great views, plus when visiting NYC, you don't want to spend too much time in your hotel room anyway! The room was clean, small, and no views. So I just have average feelings about it, it served it's purpose. I still think the biggest thing this hotel has going for it is it's location.

I continue to be amazed by how such a prominent property in such an ideal location can be plagued by such poor service, leadership, and administration. Problems included:-one and only one front desk staffer on a Friday evening, prolonging checkin after a long day of delayed flights. No staff person at all at the Elite Check in desk.-completely ignored my online request for extra towels and soaps, followed by completely ignoring my call to At Your Service to have them sent up to the room.-completely ignored the handwritten note I left in the room about it.-failed to follow up about my noise complaint regarding the drilling and blasting going on at the building next door at 10pm on Friday night and again at 8 am on Saturday morning.-continuing to insist on a resort charge-not offering lunch or any afternoon food/drink-terribly confusing the unclear charges for dry cleaning, laundry, and food when the daily allowance and resort fee should include much of it

The location worked well for me as I could walk to many of the places I needed/wanted. It is reasonably easy to get an Uber without a long wait. Unfortunately, the hotel is old and very much in need of total renovation. The bedrooms are tired and long overdue for modernization and, based on my room, for maintenance - for example, the power outlet by my bed was coming away from the wall and possibly unsafe. The bathroom was tiny and the lighting poor. Most women would find the lighting very inadequate for doing their makeup. The extra $25/day charge ("Destination Charge") is just a pure and simple gouge, a blatant move that increases the real price of the hotel. It purports to offer some "benefits" but those are "experiences" that few people will want or a credit against food and beverage (but the bar is not open till 5:0pm and the lounge area is pretty sad during the day) or one item from the gift shop (I chose a bottle of water because there is none in the room). The WiFi is slow and overpriced. As a Marriott Elite member I got "premium" WiFi free, but it is still slow.$1,141 for three nights with no extras - overpriced for the quality. There are certainly better alternatives available.

I liked the location and street view – so decided to give it a try. A mistake. Entry is difficult – automatic doors are not automatic, and you have to push them hard which with luggage is a challenge. Doorman didn’t help me, neither at entry and nor at departure. At entry he asked me to give a proper name of the hotel – a bizarre request – and when answered, asked again for the proper address. It was explained to me at the check in that there are other Marriott hotels nearby and they would like to select mistaken visitors. Well, it was not friendly or amusing at all. My status with the SPG card was not recognized at all. I was given a low floor room (which in NY means a lot of external noise). External noise was not the main problem, as noisy AC unit was spoiling the rest anyway. Fridge was smartly hidden behind the artificial drawers and I have found it at departure checking drawers. In total – a disappointing experience and I am not going to try it again.

My boyfriend and I visited New York in August and had a great time! It was his first time in the city, my 4th. The hotel staff were very nice, and we had gotten upgraded to a “city view” room. The room was super tiny, but understandable for being in NYC. Our mini fridge wasn’t working, but otherwise we had no complaints.The concierge offered a sort of “packaged deal” that came with the room rental. You can claim one thing per day. We chose the hop on/hop off bus option, as we used it as a means of transportation around the city.This hotel was not far from a subway, and less than a block from the hop on/off tour bus stop.There are many good food places around as well! About a 15 min walk to Times Square! I would recommend this hotel.

Great location in mid town within walking distance to most places I needed to visit and a subway within 100 meters. There are a huge number of shops and restaurants nearby. I was given a room with a king sized bed on the sixth floor. The room and bathroom was very clean and included a small cupboard with hangers, iron/ironing board, coffee maker, mini fridge, an armchair, small table and chair. They do charge extra for WiFi and breakfast but our booking included both. Not the most impressive spread for breakfast as it included a few cooked items and fruit and some mini pastries but does the job.The one complaint I have was that it was noisy in the night with vehicles going past. There is a small gym on the 35th floor that offers good views around and since I was jet lagged I visited at 4:30am and enjoyed exclusive use of the gym with treadmills, cross trainers and a few weights. I would suggest you ask for a room on the upper floors (it goes up to 32 for regular rooms).

This hotel is in a great location. The hotel rooms are fine for NYC. A little weathered but comfortable.Be aware of the daily $25 charge that can be used in the bar which is not always open. We stopped on our way out and it was closed and it was closed on our way back. Wasted $75 as it can not be used anywhere else. Maybe breakfast but we are Platinum Elite and we get the breakfast with that tier. Speaking of which, you are not recognized as platinum elite. We did not receive an upgrade as we were told they hotel was sold out. When we got to the room and checked availability they have rooms of every category. Also rather long wait for check in.

I had the worst experience with a lady working at the front desk, extremely rude, had to call the manager who wasn’t much better, the issue I was complaining abour wasn’t as important as these people’s attitude....Another thing I didn’t like was that all the time I stayed at the hotel there were service carts and plastic bags outside in the corridor.Wouldn’t recomend this hotel

I stay at a lot of Marriott properties and was very disappointed by this one. The people at the desk made it clear they do not like interacting with people. The bellman was even less inclined to help. The furniture in the restaurant/bar was shredded up on some of the booths yet prices were definitely upper east side. I am still waiting for the request for something from the hotel staff - it never arrived. It is tired and needs some attention along with a whole new front desk staff.

New York hotels have to be rated on a unique scale. The Marriott Eastside is like a comfortable old pair of shoes. It’s old and comfortable but needing updating. Location couldn’t be better. You’re at the center of midtown with easy access anywhere. Rooms are a bit old world. Quaint is a good description of this property.

What a terrific stay I had this week at the Marriott. The rooms are spacious, updated and had everything I needed. Despite the NYC street noise, I slept like a rock in their comfortable bed.The gym was well equip and no wait at peak times to get on any of the treadmills, bikes or ellipticals. The hotel location was ideal. Many thanks to the Manager, Zach for his helpful and cheerful advice about the maximizing what the Marriott offers.

Not sure why the smell of carpet freshener is so strong in the rooms and hallways, but it does cheapen the property. It is somewhat overbearing. The rest of the hotel is ok although some renovation and updates are required. The location is great so once you spruce it up you can even increase your rates

Most midtown attractions are within easy walking distance of this hotel. The rooms are small and furnishings well worn but beds are comfortable and rooms are clean. As a rewards member I expected the destination fee to be waved and was disappointed when it wasn’t. The hotel does offer a daily food/beverage credit and NYC tourist attraction voucher. The food credit is not accumulative but you could collect the attraction vouchers throughout your stay to be used together. There is a subway stop within one block. We felt safe walking around day and night and found plenty of dining options within a few blocks.

There are three Marriott hotels right next to each other on the East Side, a Residence Inn, the Lexington and the East Side Marriott. I have stayed in all three several times and I like the East Side Marriott the best. Yes, the elevators can be a little slow but I do not think that is so unusual for hotels in NYC. The room size was good, the service was good and it is in a very good location. I thought the gym on the 35 floor was great, decent size and fantastic view while on the tread mill. We did not eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that, but plenty of places to eat in the area.

Outdated and run down and over priced and good luck waiting on dilapidated elevators. But to add insult to injury THERE IS NO VERIZON WIRELESS DATA SERVICE HERE and they charge $17 a day for wifi internet on top of their other fees. Hotel exists is some odd pocket of no coverage. See my photo.

If you are searching for a no frills, close to midtown brand name hotel, this is your place. I gave this hotel 3 stars based on location only. It is very centrally located, it is an easy walk to Times Square and all the theatres. It’s not to far from Central Park or from shopping on Madison Ave, its also close to the United Nations. However, it is a very old and dated hotel. The rooms are small and so dated they almost feel not clean. For a couple a king bed room was cramped, so not good for families at all. The maid service came every morning at 8:30am, not always a problem since my husband was working but that is VERY early. The elevators are slow, old and very small, I was concerned my luggage would not make it into the door. The hotel gym is located on the 35th floor which from the floor we were staying on required you riding 2 elevators to get to it. If you are not a Marriott rewards member, which we are and thus is why we chose the hotel, the internet fee is $17.65 per day, I know this because we were charged it and had to go to the front desk to disput the charge. The bell staff seemed annoyed on Saturday when we asked them to hold our luggage till our flight time. It rained a lot one day when we were there, the hotel had no umbrellas to loan you. There is a restaurant/bar in the lobby with a full menu and after hours menu. This is not a hotel to go to if you are seeking a place to relax and unwind after a full day of sight seeing or working.

We stayed here for my birthday weekend and we had a wonderful time. We arrived about 2 hours before our reservation, and we were given a room with no problem. We had no problem with the distance from the hotel to Times Square. We had a great time walking and exploring the area. The only problem we had was that for some reason, there was a smell of smoke (like cigarettes) coming from our bathroom vent. That was no fun considering the fact that I have allergies. However, I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends. Great price and great location.

This is a horrible hotel where service from the front desk is non existent. They insisted on charging destination fee which come with fast internet even when I don’t need it. It turns out I could not get any internet access. I fed back to front desk manager Kevin who sat on the problem and did nothing, saying that the entire hotel is fully booked so he cannot reassign me to a room with working internet. The next day, Frank is the front office manager. He was also completely unhelpful. Horrible hotel - do not stay if you need internet access during your hotel stay

Checked in here after 24 hours of travel and was very tired.Room on 3rd floor was very noisy from an air conditioning unit parked right outside our room on the roof..Coupled with the aircon and loud traffic and sirens sleep was difficult

This hotel is in a prime location, but overall needs a complete referesh. Rooms are old, elevators are small and breakdown. Overall I was not impressed. Just as bad as the old W Lex. A/C unit in room made a ton of noise. TV Audio continued to cut out even after repeated calls to the front desk to repair.

location is 10/10service is 9/10room size is 8/10bathroom is 5/10beds are 7/10decor is 4/10public areas/lobby/etc... 4/10housekeeping 6/10so yes, a great hotel potential in a superb location, but needs more work. At 450 bucks a night, one should not have heavily scratched furniture, request laundry list and bags, have a has-been lobby, disfunctional elevators, average corridors and so on. Yes, its NewYork, so what ? Marriott does a great job is so many other locations, why let this one go below the mark? ITS A GOOD STAY, but value is not there.

The room was simple but comfortable. The bathrooms are not as luxurious as the ones in the JW Marriott in Miami, but they are comfortable and clean.The rooms are comfortable, although not big. But, as said, they are comfortable. The bell boys are very attentive, especially Cesar. People at the front desk, although hectic, is well served. Paulina at the front desk is excellent.All the maids are very attentive. I stayed at room 1809 and very well waited on.

Stayed for a couple of nights on business. Reception staff could have been in a better mood. Room 3202, was tired and in need of a light update. Position in Lexington is good, walking distance to Time Sq, Central Pk etc. Would not stay again though, there’s better along Lex.

Our stay at the NY Marriott East Side was abysmal. It started with our check-in experience. The front desk check-in line was practically out the door; there was only one clerk....with it being a holiday weekend, you would think they would have staffed at least two, maybe three people. After waiting about 20 minutes, I complained to the bellmen & asked if there was anyone else to help. After a few more minutes, another clerk finally came out to the front desk. When we eventually reached the desk, of course the room wasn’t ready, but they promised to have it ready by 4 pm. 4pm came and went and still no call from the Marriott. I finally called and complained that I needed to rest from traveling all day, and eventually secured a room. Meanwhile, our luggage had been stored in a large, unlocked ballroom with many other people’s luggage. Apparently no one’s room had been ready. Even though they had given me a ticket for the luggage, I still had to go back to the ballroom and show the bellhop which bags were ours...(probably could have taken someone else’s luggage & they never would have known the difference). When we finally reached the room, we learned that, even though we had a large size room with 2 double beds, the bathroom was the size of a tiny closet. I realize that this is NYC, but you couldn’t even open/close the door without maneuvering yourself out of the way of the toilet.During our stay, we called for extra towels, (twice repeatedly), which never arrived....finally had to go into the hallway and hunt for the maid’s cart in order to get a clean towel for a shower. As for the daily additional fee of $25, we were told that it’s mandatory, but can be used at the cafe downstairs. However, the “cafe” is merely a food stand with a few drinks, bananas, and pastries. To make matters worse, it closes at noon! After that, you are out of luck if you want anything to eat or drink, (there is no in-room dining and they actually have the nerve to charge for bottled water delivered to the room...this is complimentary at many of the hotels I’ve stayed at).Overall,I just can’t find anything nice to say about this Marriott, and truly wished we had stayed somewhere else.

The staff at this hotel is great. We checked in with Pauline and she was incredible. She arranged to have a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to our room for my wife's birthday. Amazing!The only reason I didn't give this hotel five stars is because of housekeeping and the age of the property. We kept having to call housekeeping for one thing or another. One day we were out touring all day and when we returned to our room it hadn't even been cleaned. Other times we had to call for coffee, towels, etc. This is an older property and is in dire need of a facelift. Slow elevators, old furniture, musty smell, otherwise it is in a great location.

Great service as soon as we arrived in front of the hotel! Door men created us, and asked if we needed help. Front desk was assertive, and check-in was quick. Our room was awesome, the bed was comfy, the bathroom was huge (for New York), the view wasn't too bad for being on the 5th floor, I enjoy the sound of cars and honking while in the city, it helps me get up and start my day! This location is great for walkers, we walked to grand central station, all the way to 5th to shop, and even walked to Central Park and had lunch at The Loeb Boathouse. It was nice coming back to our hotel, and our room. We can't wait to come back!

The hotel is comfortable enough and seems to have had a refresh about 10 years ago. Good quality coffee in room a blessing. Lots of add ons deceive and the bill comes in rather high. But hey, you are in NYC, where a top of less than 20% is snarled at. It is the American way. A lovely lady at the check in was a highlight.

We were in New York City for less than 30 hours and stayed here. The rooms are old but the beds were so very comfortable. Everything in the room worked. The lobby was old but in an Art Deco way, so it was cool. We arrived at 9:30 am and our room was ready! Check in was smooth. Had drinks at the Lobby Bar, service was excellent. This hotel was about a mile from everywhere we needed to be so it's a touch out of the way, but navigating by foot and cab was not hard. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Sure the hotel is old and the rooms are noisy... but I'll take that over what has happened to me twice now with this hotel.#1: I accidentally left a dress hanging in the closet of my room. I went back 3 hours later and the hotel staff were extremely unfriendly and said that they could not locate the dress either in lost and found or in the room. I find this very confusing as it was only a few hours later and suddenly a perfectly ironed dress hanging in a closet goes missing.but what's worse...#2: I had to cancel my hotel reservation with the Marriott because of a death in my family. I cancelled the reservation 1 day before my booking. They told me that since it wasn't cancelled 3 days before, I had to show them a death certificate in person in order for them to CONSIDER a refund. I will never stay at this hotel again. There are LOTS of great hotels in NYC. Don't bother wasting your money here.

The title of this review says it all. Ideally situated in Midtown East with the building having a bit of history (opened in 1924) and was even the "star" of Homeland in Season 5, Episode 1, the Marriott East Side has such potential to be a great hotel. Unfortunately as others have posted, this hotel, especially the rooms, desperately needs a makeover. As a frequent visitor of NYC for work in the neighborhood, this property is never my first choice. I hate to be so harsh (because otherwise the hotel is acceptable and people who work here are nice and work hard to please their guests), but the only word I ever use to describe the rooms and experience of staying here is "depressing." The mustard yellow/maroon décor/carpet, coupled with dark trims, old furniture (that old, ugly red chair!) and dark sheer curtains -- I just can't stand it. Everything is just old. The hotel stopped providing room service a couple of years ago. Getting to the fitness center is a chore -- you have to take two separate elevators, three if your room is lower than floor 16, I think. The other Marriott hotels that have renovated now have great shower heads, with an option of a handheld, and plenty of water pressure! The East Side still has those big ones that spout water with absolutely no pressure, making for a terrible showering experience.Some positive comments: while not my first choice, I'll probably stay here again (location, staff is nice). As with all Marriott hotels, the concierge lounge is great, especially when it comes to breakfast.

Stayed here for 2 nights in August while in NYC for business. This property was close to my office and I try to stay loyal to Marriott so gave it a try. Check in was fine and the staff there that evening were very professional. Luckily I got a room on a high floor so there were no issues with noise. My room as a typical room for an older hotel that hasn’t been remodeled. It was dingy and dark and frankly a little spooky, although nothing out of the ordinary happened. No water in the fridge and the bed was lumpy. It was however clean and the air conditioning worked reasonably well considering the “extreme heat” wave that week. The morning I left the elevator I got on kept malfunctioning and when I finally got out I tried using the house phone in the hallway but no one ever answered. It was pretty frustrating standing in an un-air conditioned hallway waiting for someone to answer the phone. I finally got down after 20 minutes of jacking with the elevator only to stand down at the front desk waiting for someone to show up. With all that being said, I would stay here again if traveling on business. I would not if on vacation.

I previously wrote a great review on this hotel until I got a copy of my bill. There were several charges related to "Destination Fee". I called the hotel and they informed the "system" was introduced a year ago. That fee is not mentioned anywhere on Marriott reservation site or any other travel site as far as I know. Are hotels becoming like airlines? I will not stay in an another Marriott unless it does not have this hidden charge. It really amount to an increase in room rate. I am considering filing a complaint with the New York State Consumer Protection Office.

This hotel is a story of two halves. Attentive staff, comfy beds and a decent shower in our superior room. We were given a free upgrade and a little fuss as it was our 25th wedding Anniversary. However it has to be said the decor is a little frayed around the edges and could do with a spruce up.

I recently stayed at the Marriott on the East side when visiting NYC with my family. We had 2 connecting rooms. Overall this hotel needs a refresh - big time. The lobby is pretty dingy, the lounge area has chairs and tables that look like they have been heavily used. The elevators are slow, the rooms are pretty dated. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, the bathroom small and not well appointed, the shower didn’t drain. I look forward to when Marriott remodels this one, until then I won’t be back.

Incredible location on the east side of Manhattan incredible sizes of rooms delicious breakfast in the second floor..great fitness center in the 35 floor. I want thank mr. Hugo Guerrero for making my stay over the top . Great limo service and great staff as well also i would like to thank mrs Carpio from housekeeping for been so kind to my needs. Overall an amazing experience totally recommend.

Room was very large by NYC standards, great service, room had all of the amenities you would need. Very attentive desk staff and a great location in NYC.There was a bed, desk, TV, mini bar and full coffee service in the room. Great bagel store only a couple of blocks away and all you would need in NYC an easy walk.

Great location. Walking distance to most mid town attractions. Room was somewhat small but clean and quiet. Marriott club nice with simple basic breakfast items. Afternoon snack hit or miss, but why spend afternoon in hotel. Concierge helpful but overwhelmed with long lines. Would be nice if there was more help at peak times

My room was quiet and the perfect size (except the bathroom, so tiny) for one or two people. . There also really needs to be more food options. No breakfast at the restaurant downstairs where you can order off a menu. Only a buffet that cost $35. This buffet was way too expensive for the options offered. It was more like the kind found at the breakfast included type of express Hotels. The roomes are extremly dated and expensive but the location is very great.

The surroundings were great! (One family member used her military discount.) It was close to lots of restaurants, drug stores, coffee shops, and Grand Central Station (needed easy access to subway). As expected in an older bldg, the elevator was small, and some in my party commented on small rooms. I didn’t go to the bar/restaurant downstairs because it was too expensive, but I would recommend this place to others, regardless!

I was somewhat hesitant to stay after a few of the current reviews but glad we did! Fantastic weekend in NYC! The location of the hotel is fantastic with a subway stop a couple of blocks away. Check in was a breeze, lovely corner king room which was exceptionally clean. Concierge was extremely helpful and really gave us a great plan to maximize our trip. The lobby bar was a wonderful treat after a long day of walking. Angel the bartender and his team were warm and welcoming. The most comfortable bed ever! Even was able to get late checkout to avoid a rainy and stormy morning. Just an amazing experience!

The New York Marriott East side at 525 Lexington Avenue is a classic New York building with modern rooms.I love the beds and variety of pillows from soft to firm, for all tastes. I like soft and not huge hard pillows and I was able to have a comfortable and relaxed sleep.Many restaurants options are close by and a 24 hour Walgreens around the corner. Large flat TV in room and friendly staff at the lobby.I definitely would stay here again

Wow, this hotel was expensive and extremely ugly/dated. And this was an upgrade?! Room next to me looked like an episode of CSI - all taped up, just the yellow police tape was missing. Marriott - spend the money & clean this place up, it’s disgusting!

I really wasn’t in my room a lot as I was visiting friends that live in NYC. My room was quiet and the perfect size for one or two people. A little dated, but very clean. The only issue I had was the last day of my stay when there was no hot water in my shower. I called to report a few times, but the phone rang and rang and no one answered. This was extremely disappointing. I’ve never had a front desk not answer. There also really needs to be more food options. No breakfast at the restaurant downstairs where you can order off a menu. Only a buffet that cost $35. This buffet was way too expensive for the options offered. It was more like the kind found at the breakfast included type of express Hotels.

Many restaurants nearby. No. 6 subway 2 blocks. Grand Central Station and post office 10 minute walk. Times Square 15 minute walk, we walked back to hotel from the Shubert Theatre at 10 pm after the play.Desk clerks, concierge, snack bar, house-keepers, maintenance staff all genuine, helpful, friendly.Our king room was comfortable if a bit compact; high floor view of Chrysler Building.I would definitely stay here again.

I spent 4 nights for a business trip. The location of the hotel is very good. Their destination fee can be controversial and at the beginning I found it as a hidden tax as some others reviewers commented but finally I found it a good value for money. I paid $25 a day and got much more than that in return using the daily laundry service, the internet service and having some drinks at the bar, I didn't have time to use the daily experiences ticket. Finally I put the destination fee into the positives. Regarding the room, it was dark and missing some basics for me. There was no glass in the bathroom, I think this is the first time I see a hotel without a glass next to the sink (at least a plastic one!). They mini bar was there buy empty and no complementary water was offered. The gym is a bit small and I had to take 3 different lifts to reach it from the 3rd floor. They only have one mat available for the whole gym.

The location of this hotel makes it a keeper, and the place is well maintained. With a concierge lounge that it always open, even on weekends, it’s is understandable that Marriott regulars choose this location. However, the so called destination fee is nothing but an invisible tax, upping both the room rate and the concomitant taxes in a less than transparent way.There is no pool, no spa, no room service. The gift shop is not considered a part of the hotel, so the “fee” cannot be spent there. I was looking for lunch or an afternoon snack, and there is no place to do so in th hotel, so I cannot even use my “fee”. Turns out, it has very limited use and is mostly a scam.As I booked several rooms for several days, I have several hundred dollars of these fees, which is nothing more than Marriott picking my pockets, even while I pay a pretty higher room rate even for NYC. I have complained repeatedly to the front desk and concierge desk that I find the fee unreasonable and my inability to use it for lunch absolutely absurd. It is unusually unprofessional behavior for a Marriott, clearly not well thought out, and even less well implemented. But I do a lot of Marriott business, so absent a refund or credit, I’ll just use a different property in NYC until management here gets the message. You ought not charge people such a fee and give them nothing for it. It is unethical.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights, as part of my business trip to NY. The bggest advantage was location, it was just a walking distance from my office.Overall the hotel was good, it takes time to reach a particular floor due to its number of floors. Rooms were comfortable, did not try out any room service due to which can’t really comment.No food after 11PM, eat and reach this place!

Just another Marriott hotel, but this one comes with the advantage of being in a great location. Almost everything in NYC is at a few minutes distance be it Times Square, Central Park, or Downtown. Rooms are decent, with a great view especially if you choose top floor. It's a vintage hotel with a contemporary decor. I did not avail food and beverage service so can't say much about that.

My Husband and I had a night in New York and we stayed at the Marriott East Side. The bell hop took in our bags and helped us out of the cab, he was very nice and respectful. Joshua at check in was the sweetest. We had just arrived from a very long flight and we were exhausted.We knew there would be a resort fee when we booked, so we weren't surprised as some other reviewers were, it said so right on the booking site. I do find it annoying though because mainly they use the money to put towards payment of wifi and they offer money off at the house bar (which my husband says they watered down the drinks on!)we stayed in room 1711, even though it was across form the elevator, it wasn't noisy, though there isn't much of a view. The room was clean and felt very welcoming, one complaint is that on of the windows seemed to lack a black out curtain.The bed was super comfy, and the pillows were nice too. the linens were in good condition, and the set up of the room was nice. I like the soaps and shampoos but one thing in the bathroom I thought was strange was the sink faucets. they turn in a strange way, and in the dark in the middle of the night it is not fun to struggle with the tap. A few things, because this is in a more businessy part of town, there aren't great late night food options in the area. Also this hotel has breakfast for an extra fee. They will hold your bags after check out if you want to explore the city but don't want to lug your bags. Overall we had a great experience and found the staff to be friendly and nice.
user_name:
bek822
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second time staying at this hotel, and I was quiet disappointed. Even though the location is great and the room was clean and had a great view, there were a few things that were a bit frustrating. When we were checking in, my friend and I were told that we were going to be charged extra $50 per day for a non-refundable destination fee. This fee included a $25 credit for food and drinks (like salad? one water bottle?), fast Internet service, and also an opportunity to make long-distance calls. We told the front-desk associate that we were visiting from NJ, and didn't need any of these services. However, he told us that we didn't have an option there. Also, I lost my charger in the city and I called the front desk to ask if they had a charger I could borrow or rent. They told me they don't have any...I've stayed in many hotels around the world, and it's the first time this happened to me. At every other hotel I stayed, there were always chargers and adapters. Come on Marriott, for the prices you're charging, you have to have extra chargers for every room.

Had the chance to do a girls trip this summer with my daughter, and as usual we stayed at the Marriott East Side. I've been staying at this hotel for business and pleasure for over 11 years now.This Marriott property is my hotel of choice. The location is perfect...it's close enough to absolutely everything...but also not over run by touristy prices, crowds, etc.Located on Lexington avenue, the hotel was renovated a few years back. It has charm because it's an older property (small elevators) but the staff and rooms are always nice and clean.You are walking distance from great places to eat on Lex and Third Avenue, and close to Murray Hill, which is a great walking neighborhood that is off the beaten path.You can be in your seat at a Broadway show in 20 minutes, and have the best bagel in the world right around the corner.Rooms are always clean and the staff are courteous. The concierge lounge is also great to pick up a few bottles of water and a quick breakfast to start your day.Can't be beat!!

The location is perfect for business in midtown. Located on Lexington Ave, only several blocks from Grand Central to get to where ever you need to go. I have stayed at this property numerous times and have little complaints. The staff is friendly for NY standards. The M Lounge staff are super nice and will get you whatever you need. Rooms are typical NY with respect to old refurbished NY buildings-turned hotel properties. Some rooms can be small, but a simple request with the front desk for an "upgrade" may get you a larger room. No guarantees, but the front staff has come through every time. My typical go-to hotel when I am in midtown. The décor reminds me of classy, but if you're on business and need a work space, the M Lounge offers plenty of room...if you have access.

I stayed on the seek of July 4 - it was really hot in NYC - in the 90's most days. My room was pretty standard for that property - i've stayed stayed there many times over the past 10 years and have watched the the rooms slowly decay over time. My AC was not working. I called on the first day and they came and fixed it but it only lasted a few hours. It was sweltering in NYC, I got no sleep that night. I called the next day and they sent someone again to fix it rather than Change my room. As a Platinum lifetime customer i would have expected a room change and/or upgrade. The fix again lasted a few hours and then only barely cooled the room. I complained when i checked out and the associate said she would give me 45K point bonus for my inconvenience. I accepted but then 10 days later no bonus hit my account. I called back the hotel and spoke to someone who said she needed to look into it and would call me back that day. She did not. I called back that next day and spoke the manager. He looked into it and said he would credit me the points immediately. Lo, it is now more than a week later and no points. While i can understand that air conditioners break, this makes it even worse by having to call back 3 times to get points for a stay i should never have even paid for. I called the main Marriott customer service number, explained my problem and was put on hold for 20 minutes. Finally hung up. This type of service is really unacceptable and i don't know what to do at this point. I'm certainly not staying at this place anymore and really getting fed up with Marriott which i once really loved.

This property has not been updated in many years. In addition, the front desk folks need a lesson in customer service. I was able to check in early due to being Platinum, but this I can get at any Marriott and soon to be Starwood properties. I have stayed here before and never loved it but thought I would try again. I always request not to be near an elevator, and this room was on top of it. In addition, came into the room and there was a dirty Kleenex next to the couch. Did call downstairs and talked to a manager and he offered to move my room but I was only there for one day. A gentleman by the name of John Rodriguez came in to clean up the Kleenex and looked behind the couch. He said something and I said don't even tell me what is there. He promptly cleaned it up and he was very professional and the BEST part of my stay there. He should get an award for customer service. There needs to be significant money put into this property. Marriott should be ashamed to have their name attached. I am loyal to Marriott but never again to this hotel.

Just wrapped up another great time at the Marriott East side. From the check in with Sam to the end, everything was amazing. It was our third year here and definitely not our last. Can't beat the location and all of the welcoming staff. Thank you and see you next year.

Love the location, used to love the property-But it is worn on the edges, the front desk people are typical NY , but a little harsh to a elite member .My room had 2 widows- both looking at walls of the next bldg. furniture is worn and out of date.For NYC prices it should be better.Enough for this hotel

We are loyal Marriott guests. We have stayed at New York East Side Marriott many times and this last visit was a huge disappointment. Although a great location, our guest room was meager, at least. Old decor and window shades, antiquated air conditioning blowing from a radiator/ blower, and a filthy hair dryer attachment to name a few. We recently heard that this hotel underwent a major renovation but I suppose that was only for the lobby. The rooms weren’t inexpensive either, plus $75 a night for the car. We also had to pay an additional $25 for a daily destination fee plus many assorted taxes. A lot to shell out for a not so classy room. Marriott should be able to provide better service, especially to loyal customers!

We loved our stay at the property - great location, great room, the staff was nice, friendly and helpful!
