However, I am a Marriott frequent guests and their NY properties have recently added a daily destination charge - which I do not like - that gives you a choice of four activities - Ripleys, this tour, a water tour, and the wax museum - none of which I would select on my own. The bus tour was a total bust. We waited at a stop near Central Park and the bus blew by, we had to run to catch the bus a couple of blocks down. Then got on the bus and it took over a half hour to go about six blocks at which time the tour was over - they told us to stay on the bus to start the next tour. We sat there for an extended period of time and were then told to get off the bus - they were changing buses. We sat on the curb waiting for the next bus for over a half hour, that bus was broken they took it out of service. We then waited another 20 minutes for the next bus, then boarded the next bus and waited over a half hour before we left. Once the bus started we learned that our headphones did not work in our seat or any of the open seats. We got off the bus. Over three + hours and only went six blocks - horrible, unacceptable - I can't believe Marriott would want to be associated with this tour, much less virtually force their guests to take it by charging them for it on their room. Would not recommend the tour - wish Marriott would reconsider the destination charges - would recommend the hotel.

This is a nice Marriott with easy access to downtown. Since it’s easy to come/go with no hassle, I will be staying here again! There’s also a couple of great places to grab a quick bite to eat and the rooms are clean. The staff is also very accommodating! Enjoy, K

It was not my first time at this Hotel, but whenever I go, it gets better. Arriving from a South American flight, it means early, the very nice staff at the front desk allowed me to check in, even in an inferior room until the next day. The lady at the desk was superb and the manager even took me to show the room. Unusual for a NY hotel! It is a traditional building, but re-structured to become this Marriot unit. Fitness center very good where one can run overlooking the streets from a high floor. Breakfast on the second floor for elite members is good as well. Entrance personnel also nice and helpful at the time of getting a car to the airport. I believe this is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in NY!
user_name:
Abouch K
State of Rio de Janeiro

review_body: Excellent location, excellent service. Renovated room was lovely and comfortable. Enjoy the M Lounge for breakfast, snacks and relaxing. Bar/restaurant in the lobby is very nice also. Always easy to get a taxi from here.

I was in my room most of my stay watching World Cup Round of 16 but the restaurant provided great dinner whenI ventured out. We did find time for breakfast as Geoffrey Zakarian's restaurant a block a way before we left. The dining options were plentiful and all in walking distance.

Great place to stay, well located, personnel great, the bar has everything we expected. The room was ok, In the rate that we paid was included a 25 dollars credit and a free activity daily, las day the hotel offered a free breakfast.

Stayed here for three nights over July 4th. Staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The beds and bedding were excellent. It's not super fancy, but it's a nice place to stay in a great location.
user_name:
melodyann73
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Overall, my boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay here. First, I think it was very important to point out that people need to get over the fact places in Manhattan have small[er] rooms than what they might be used to. Manhattan is roughly 23 square smiles, housing about 4 million people a weekday. The place is busy and crowded! There just isn't enough room for decently priced, very spacious hotels.Anyways...PROS: The location is key! It's within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Grand Central Station, and two subway stations. Any Lyft/Uber drivers had no problem finding the place. A Duane Read (essentially a Walgreens) is also a short walk. On the same street, for those who don't want to venture off to try a non-chain coffee place, there is a Starbucks close by. Across the street and down a street is a 24-hour market that had sandwiches and snacks and whatnot. The room, yes was a little small, but for two people it was perfect. Our goal was to not spend a lot of time in our hotel rooms anyways. The room was very clean and the bathroom was actually a decent size that was also very clean. The shower had great water pressure. There wasn't a lot of counter space in the bathroom, but the shelf under the sink was perfect for stashing our toiletry bags. We put our suitcases near the window where they were small little area that was out of the way since our suitcases were sort of big. It helped free up some space. One thing I really liked was that if you had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on your door but housekeeping saw you when you left your room, they would ask if you needed your room serviced. The women we ran into were always very friendly and nice and did service our room. One morning we didn't see them in the hallway, so we just asked the front desk to have our room serviced and it wasn't a problem. The people working at the front desk and Milton (I think that was his name) who worked at the other desk (not concierge but the other one) were very friendly and seemed very willing to help. CONS: One great thing is if you arrive too early and your room isn't ready, you can check your bags and walk around. Well, the men working at the bag check weren't very friendly. They weren't rude, just not friendly. The bellhop guys weren't very helpful either. Sometimes they would press the button to open the door for you, but that was it. No one offered to help with our bags when we arrivesSo one thing that really annoyed me was, the night we got in, my boyfriend and I were tired and decided that since we got $25 off food at the restaurant in the hotel, we would just eat there. When we asked if there was take out, they said there was. When we had mentioned we were going to take it to our room, we weren't corrected on that, so we assumed they would bring it up to our room. Well, when I called the restaurant about 10 minutes after dinner started, they told us they didn't do room service. That's fine, no big deal. I put in our order and they said it would be ready in about 20 minutes. About 20 minutes goes by and they are slammed. We go to the bar to pick up the food and they say it will be a minute or two. Okay, cool. I decide to just pay while I was at the bar so when the food was ready, we could just go. Well, when I looked at the bill, there was an $8 service charge because I took it to-go! It wasn't delivered to us. It was to go. I have never seen a charge on a to-go order a person had to pick up themselves. No one had articulated to us that there would be a charge. If we would have known that, we might have just eaten at the actual restaurant or gone elsewhere.Even though I'm glad we didn't. At the actual restaurant, it was busy and it seemed like the wait staff was slow. I watched a few customers come up to the bar, looking very impatient. As far as the food goes, my boyfriend got the burger and said it was pretty good. I had the pappardelle pasta and added shrimp to it. I don't think it had a sauce with it, so it was just noodles with some veggies. Filling, sure, but nothing to write home about. It was very expensive, even with the $25 off. I don't think it's worth it. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Try one of those instead. The elevators are small and a little slow, but honestly they aren't that bad when you don't have all of your luggage and you aren't in a rush. As I said before, overall we enjoyed our stay there. I would look into what free attractions you can do at the concierge. We didn't have time to do them, but it's worth looking into. I would recommend this hotel.

I really enjoyed my stay here, the service was exceptional and the location was also pretty good. The room was pretty decent in size but could definitely use a little TLC. These things can definitely be overlooked though, especially when the price is right :)

This hotel is in a great location and should be a flagship property for the Marriott chain. Instead it’s a rather sad and sadly dirty property but with a great staff. The rooms are the signature 70s Marriott beige and maroon and have not been deep cleaned in years. The air conditioning is ridiculously noisy circa 1970s too and the bathrooms are also very dated. The lounge is large and comfortable - although I really don’t understand why it needs 10 TVs broadcasting 10 different channels! The food offering is good but it’s disappointing that they provide no complimentary cocktails or wine at happy hour - this is after all Marriott’s home market and you’d expect them to at play by the book in NY.Admittedly the rate we had was very good but I think this will have been driven by the Independence Day slump in business travel rather than anything else.

Very nice hotel with great service at the front desk and from the bellhops. The concierge was very helpful and accommodating. Gift shop could stay open longer in the evening. Did not try the bar/restaurant.

I have stayed twice at this Marriott hotel. Both times I have enjoyed my stay; however, I must say the rooms do need some updating. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They can be small, but by New York City standards they are just fine. The staff is very welcoming and accommodating. The location is great for touring, and it places you within walking distance of Grand Central Terminal. If you have lots of luggage, you may want to take a taxi from GCT to the hotel; but otherwise it is walkable. I will be staying at the Marriott Eastside when I return to NYC.

While the location is good (a block from the #6 Lex local) and the hotel room was clean (housekeeping staff very nice) but the check in staff was disinterested, the water cooler in the lobby was always empty (or missing) the one time I tried to get a glass of wine the bartender was dismissive, and the concierge was consistently missing except for the one time he was misinformed. I shouldn't have to have given HIM the address of the Central Park Zoo. Had to search for assistance from hotel personnel in getting a cab while in formal wear (otherwise would have gone out and hailed one myself.) My reward points should have been assigned at check-in rather than have me track them down. Marriott, get a grip, please.
user_name:
Jessica H
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: Stayed at the Marriott East Side this past week with 3 friends. We had fun in the bar and the concierge was helpful and nice. We were having a great stay until $300 cash and $100+ headphones were stolen from our room on the last day. Marriott security proved that the only one that accessed the room other than us was the maid service. After multiple interviews they told us they could do nothing for us. Thought Marriott was an upscale place that stood behind its good name. At $400 a night for multiple nights-did they actually think we were trying to shake them down for some of the money we paid them? Not staying here anymore.

The amenities seem fairly standard for a hotel of this cost. Breakfast on the second floor is not available unless you're a member of some Marriott-worship group. Well, you can get in for a fee which the door-keeper lady was not about divulge to us in a hurry (we must have looked like we couldn't afford it, in our holiday clothes) so we went to the ground floor breakfast place (café by day, bar by night - very functional use of space) which sold inexpensive bagels and coffee (warning to Australians - the coffee here is terrible). House-keeping was of a high standard - consistently over the 4 nights we stayed here. Front desk and wait-staff also all of a high standard.

The Marriott Eastside is one of my favorite go to hotels when in NYC. As a fan of Broadway, it is easy to walk to and from a play. And there are plenty of dining options near the hotel. From quaint neighborhood diners on Second Avenue to plenty of fine dining spots nearby. The staff has always been very accommodating if any issues presented themselves so recommend it highly!

Four of us had just returned from a cruise to Bermuda and landed in New Jersey and our hotel. Dial 7 picked us up from the hotel in a late model SUV. The SUV was large enough for the four of us plus luggage. Excellent friendly driver took us over into the city, to the New York Marriott East Side on Lexington and 49th Street. Comfortable ride for a very good price. Then the fun began. Our reception and registration at the hotel was five-star service. The curb service and desk help were first rate. The hotel was clean and comfortable but we weren’t there for the hotel. We wanted to see the City. The location of this hotel was perfect. Easy to get around town either by bus, taxi, the Ho-Ho red bus or just walking. Which we did plenty of. Again, the hotel staff and location was perfect for what we wanted to do. I would definitely stay there again. Thanks guys for taking care of us.

We stayed here for 2 nights on a coach tour. It was manic trying to get to the front of the hotel with the coach as it was the evening of the Tony Awards and lots of roads were closed by the police. The room was nice and big but very gloomy, the lights were needed at all times. The hotel is very centrally located close to a lot of the sights, but noisy because of this. I can't decide whether it was best to be central or out of the city and a quiet location, it depends what you are looking for.
user_name:
Linda S
Isle of Wight, United Kingdom

review_body: The pros: To begin with, the allure of this hotel was the location. We stayed at a hotel of the same chain in the financial district and were way too far away. This time, we were walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and not very far from Chelsea by Uber. The location is spectacular!The service at the desk was fantastic. They were super friendly, very informative and as always with Marriott exceeded our expectations in every way. I was surprised and impressed by the level of security: when we ordered take in, the concierge always called to verify that we had actually ordered food.The room was spacious by New York standards (King room), and it had everything we needed. The cleaning staff were attentive and diligent!The cons:The space can use an update and I mean major renos! The room itself would be okay but for a carpet that made me nervous to walk on barefoot. I assume and have every confidence that it’s cleaned! But it’s dated. Now there bigger point of contention: the bathroom. It is old looking, and the walls are paper thin. I could hear everything going on from my neighbours. Politeness forbids telling the things I heard, but... yuck. All around the positives outweighed the cons. Other than not spending much time in the bathrooms, I enjoyed my time and would be back!

We arrived very early for check in due to an early morning flight. We’d reserved 2 rooms. One for us and one for our children (not young). We really wanted one of the rooms to be available immediately so we could leave bags and freshen up before heading out for the day. With my husbands’s Marriott status we were upgraded no problem to a very nice room that was available immediately. The other room we would be notified when it was available. We were told where the M Club was as well as hours. Front desk clerk told us it was still open for breakfast (Sunday stays open later). We were also told there was a $25 per night per room resort fee. Of course with NYC adding tax and fees it was more like $33. You are able to use it a few ways. Since it was $50 for us with the 2 rooms we ate one night in the restaurant. Food was good, not great. We stopped in the M Club and had breakfast. The M Club has a great spread of hot and cold items. I’ll just say options were plentiful, replenished regularly and very good. There were quite a few staff working the area. It was definitely busy. Other times we stopped in for hors d’oeuvre’s and there was always a nice assortment. The elevators were usually an issue, very slow and packed with people. They are very small and not air conditioned. Almost every time people had waited quite a while so when the doors opened every last person tried to get themselves in. Not an issue that will be solved if they are busy. We did check out the kids room with 2 double beds it was also a nice room. They had a corner room with 2 sides of windows. There was more then a decent amount of space for NYC standards. It was on the 4 th floor and you could definitely hear more street noise from their room. Our room had a spacious, well lit vanity counter with large mirror outside the bathroom. It was great because the bathroom sink had no counter area at all. The only issue was there was no outlet to plug the hairdryer into. Makes no sense. Especially since the bathroom sink had nowhere to put a blow dryers or brushes down. Also, it would be especially nice to have a close up makeup mirror on that counter, but there was none. I had to blow dry my hair at the desk which had a electrical plug and another mirror. Overall we thought the hotel, staff, M Club and location would have us return.

Smaller rooms. Clean. Close to everything. On site restaurant is not worth you time or money. Take a walk to a real restaurant. We will definitely stay again because it is literally near everything! Easy walking distance to St Patrick’s cathedral. Quick Uber ride to Central Park.

Came into the city for an overnight and chose this hotel based on location and price. I've stayed in the city many times and usually choose a boutique hotel or one close to Central Park but I knew I wouldn't be in the room much for this trip. This hotel suited my needs just fine. The staff were friendly and helpful, the 'grab and go' in the lobby for breakfast was a great option. The bed was extremely comfortable, though the room was small as were the windows. Bathroom could've been a bit cleaner. Yes there was street noise but it could've been worse, and that's going to happen anywhere in NYC. Location is excellent for getting around the city, especially if you're coming in via Grand Central. I would stay here again.

The hotel is in a good location. It is a few blocks away from Grand Central and the neighborhood is safe and vibrant. Plenty of good places to eat nearby ranging from cheap eats to fine dining. Unfortunately the hotel is looking pretty worn out. It is clean, but tired looking. Due to being an older building, the rooms can be very oddly shaped. There was a musty smell to the room too. The conference room was on the lower level and did not have adequate air conditioning. Forget grabbing a glass of wine at the bar to bring to your room. It was $26. I have not tried other hotels in the area, but I am sure we could have done better.

The room was so poorly ventilated and full of condensation (mold?), combined with zero hot water for a shower, that I contracted pneumonia after my stay. The Marriott family should be embarrassed to have their name on this hotel.

Easy to metro, restaurants, Times Square. Is was a small room but we were hardly in there as we were touring but it was clean and good service. We were able to leave our luggage on the last day to collect later.

As a platinum premier Marriott member I guess I expect something special. But not here. No recognition at check in. No upgrade. Had to ask where Lounge was (they should extend invite and tell you where it is!). Basically an expensive bed or room surrounded in the city with tall buildings no view. A silly 25 dollar fee for this hotel that gives people things I already get! If you like long waits for an elevator then this is the place. 3 stars as it is clean (old but clean) inviting lobby and bar.

This hotel is a great location. The staff was incrediby friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet and the beds were comfortable. I would stay here again and would recommend to friends. We enjoyed the restaurant that was on site as well as the work out facility.

Most property in Manhattan is looking its age. Some age gracefully while others can’t be torn down soon enough. Which one of those is the Marriott East Side is difficult to say. Nothing takes away from the great service provided by all the staff members of the Marriott East Side but unfortunately they can’t paper over the fact the property is really standing on its last legs in my opinion. A case in point: when you have to get up off the toilet seat to reach the toilet roll which is more than arms length from the toilet it is not a minor inconvenience but a joke and you're taking the piss. The hotel has the potential to age gracefully but Marriott doesn’t seem to care about this particular property.All the staff made feel very welcome and the 5* go to the staff. There are no stars unfortunately for the property itself.

The reviews of this property are very consistent and very accurate. Great location, friendly staff. However, it’s a worn hotel. Lots of clean up and up grades are needed. The elevators are old and slow. Old rooms that need some love. The bar closes at 10! In nyc. Wow. The fitness center is a total train wreck. I did enjoy being walking distance to all my meetings in midtown.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during a business visit to New York. I am a Marriott Rewards member.Frankly the only positive I could find in this hotel is the great location...right next street to park avenue, very easy walk to Times square, central park and all the nice pubs and restaurants.I was quite disappointed with everything else. For starters, the rooms are very average, bland and somewhere between 2 and a 3 star. It lacks soul. The bathroom and the shower area is equally tiny. The rooms clearly need an urgent upgrade. What shocked me more was the cold attitude of the staff and the concierge in general. I needed to cut open the plastic seal on my bag and the refused to provide scissors!! I was asked to buy one instead at the store below!! I mean does the hotel not have one scissor? They just didn't care. At checkout the concierge kept insisting I book an expensive car drop to the airport when an Uber was available at half the cost. I think overall not happy and clearly one must stay here if available at very cheap cost and just for the location.

The only positive thing what I could say is a good location, nice bed and friendly cleaningwomen and waiters in the members club.Check-in did not went very well. In their system was no bookings even I had got confirmation about booking. All the hotel needs to be renovated. It is so old fashioned. Comparing next door Roger Smith hotel which looks modern and with lot of lights.Destination fee 25$??? Had to pay it even I had no idea what for. Was I suppose to have with that money???Bill was also so complicated that had no idea what they had charged from my credit card. I recommend every one to choose different hotel.

Stayed here in February, 2018 & checked in by Allan. I asked Allan for a quiet room away from the noise and elevator. Got 2704. The bed room itself is fine but due to the two north facing windows I could hear constant traffic noise.Bathroom has got a musky moldy smell, as it was tight and didn't have any air vent/window.Cons: 1. destination charge for the amount of $25. Sounds like another revenue center. Used the bar around 11pm, it was not as bad as some reviews would suggest.2. Wifi didn't work in the gym, which is up on 35th floor. Ironically, there were cellphone/telecom instruments about 20 feet from the stationary bike. So my brain was probably microwaved while I was there3. The Hilton app leaves the Marriott app in the dust.Overall, great location, but both elevators and fixtures were rather dated. I would probably stay at the Residence Inn next door next time I'm in the area

My family and I stayed at the NY Marriott East Side for three nights, and it was great. It's centrally located for access to shopping, restaurants, and the theatre district, and our accommodations were excellent. The room had everything that we needed to be comfortable, including plenty of comfortable pillows and very comfortable mattresses. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were very pleased and will return!

This is a very-well-located Marriott with all the amenities you would expect from the brand. The room (19th floor king) was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is the location though - just steps to grand central and subway lines that will take you anywhere you need to go in the city. Valet parking is pricey, so if you do want to bring a car into Manhattan you are better off putting it in a cheaper garage on the west side and taking the shuttle train over from Times Square.The Lexington across the street is also a Marriott property and is equally nice (while generally cheaper) but it has smaller rooms, so if you value space it may be worth the price difference to you to stay at this Marriott instead..

We won’t be back until they renovate and update the rooms. The tub showers are gross, the wallpaper is peeling, and the vanities are cracked. The toilet bowl handle broke off just before we left. Bed was pretty comfortable but that was the only good thing other than location. Having someone else’s dirty sock under the desk was disconcerting.

Booked a 4 night stay recently and was well aware of the $25 a day “Destination Fee”. It apparently includes $25 per day credit in the bar and a $20 per day dry cleaning credit. I had no problem paying the additional fee. The issue was the $45 dry cleaning charge and the $75 bar charge upon check out. I was told by the front desk staff that it was a “daily fee” to be “used daily” or you forfeit it. Since I had all my dry cleaning some at once ($65) I was only credited $20. The same with the bar bill of $95. I was credited $25.First of all, I’m in New York! Why would I want to visit the Marriott lobby bar and eat the dreadful food 3 nights in a row? In fact both the service and cocktails sucked! In addition, why would I wait all day 3 days in a row for dry cleaning? I simply wanted my dress shirts and jacket all done in one day. Obviously the charge is to get you to spend even more at the hotel. However platinum elite members who spend over 75 nights a year at Marriott hotels should never be charged the fee in the first place. And although I was not angry about the fee but I was appalled that a simple dry cleaning bill for a business meeting held AT the hotel were even charged to me. I will most likely never return to this rather dated, aging and disappointing hotel. I much prefer the Lexington Hotel next door for their excellent customer service, staff and attitude. Thankfully I checked my business guests into that hotel.

had a corner room which in midtown means a larger room. Had a safe that did not work and took 3 calls to get it fixed. Hotel forgot to give us a wake-up call the morning we flew out. good location if you want to be midtown.

Very nice hotel Alora was a very nice vallet and we loved the places around to grab a bite. It was a quick visit but we will be staying again as soon as we get back to New York. The rooms were very neat.
user_name:
jamieoringer2345
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved this hotel. The location is fantastic, whether you want to jump on the subway to go to Williamsburg/Brooklyn, JFK, or even just explore Manhattan. Close to all the cool places like Times Square, Central Park, Madison Square Garden, etc! The gym is decent, and breakfast was great! Luggage storage service available. Great place!

This hotel is old, dirty, with very unfriendly staff. Check in was delayed until 4:30 pm, my room was literally facing a wall of another building with zero sunlight / view. The carpets in the room looked dirty and no one vacuumed them during my stay there.Overall horrendous experience and horrendous service.

The Marriott East Side is located in the best part of NYC. Getting around is easy from here, and the doormen are friendly and very helpful in getting cabs. The staff is also great- my issue is with some of the guest rooms. I have stayed here before, and the room was quite nice. This trip- not so much. I got the feeling that this was a storage closet that had been redone as a guest room. Too bad there was no other choice- a full hotel. I just don't know how anyone can justify this poorly planned space, much less charge money for it! Having said this, I would return, as the hotel is mostly great, but would ensure I did not get placed in this room again!

Great location and great service from check in to housekeeping. But this hotel is desperately in need of an upgrade. Although I was bumped to better size room, the furniture, bathroom and overall feel was dusty and outdated. Can't believe Marriott will allow this to continue without insisting the owners upgrade the place.Used the gym, which had some great views

Spent two nights in this mid town Marriott. Whilst the lobby was ok, the room was old and worn with furniture from the 80s. Service was below par. There wasnt a functioning helpdesk, no umbrellas to borrow (it rained heavily) and no guest service manager. We also missed an electric adaptor from Europe to US standard (which every hotel seems to have these days).

They do not offer upgrades to Elite members. They charge a $25.00 plus tax resort fee. You have the option to talk to the concierge to buy tickets to certain places and they will credit the $25.00. However, it is $25.00 per day and you will need to buy tickets each day. When I spoke to the man at the Concierge, he was very rude and unhelpful. The room that I was given was on the 15 floor. The windows let in all the noise. We could hear everything, especially at night, the wind, traffic moving, horns blowing, sirens, a dog barking across the street. It was like the window was opened. After two nights with almost no sleep, I asked for another room. The lady at the desk, said that she could move me to a room on the 7th floor by the elevators, and I would not hear the noise from the outside. She was right no noise from the outside, but there was a little noise from the elevator. Apparently the street noise is an issue in a lot of the rooms. The second room did have a little black mold between the shower and the toilet. The lounge is great. They have breakfast and dinner. If you are gold or platinum it is free. However, if you are not then you must pay for it. It is on the second floor next to the street. However, there is no street noise. I guess the windows are thicker in the lounge than in the rooms. It is old, but a beautiful hotel. The best thing about the entire hotel is the lounge. It is one of the best lounges I have ever visited.

I typically stay at this hotel 10-12 nights per month. It is very well located and close to the office, therefore has been my first choice. Of late however, a number of things have started bothering me about this place. The elevators for one are very slow and in the mornings (8am-9am) or evenings (5pm-6pm) it isn't uncommon to wait 8-10 mins to get one.The 2nd reason that I am downgrading a previous review (think I gave it 4 or 4.5 stars in that one) is that I've noticed that the rooms and particularly the washrooms, aren't clean to a level I'd expect for a hotel where on average I pay $350/night. A number of times now I've found it fairly dusty, the toilet not really cleaned from the outside and open packs of the q-tips that they put in the washrooms. That tells me that they're changing the sheets and vacuuming the place and then running through the rest of the cleaning. For all hotel stays I have always left tips for the service staff as they work hard in cleaning the rooms and don't get paid much (plus not too many people think of leaving tips for them)...but I have stopped leaving tips now at this Marriott.The people at the front desk though are really nice and that along with the location is the only reason I'm not giving the hotel 1 or 2 stars. Unfortunately, the owners am sure know that they can always fill enough rooms (it is NY after all) so they don't want to invest in upgrading the facilities including the elevators, which are functional, but not efficient.Sadly I'm going to have to look at alternatives and give my $5000/month business to another hotel.

great location but very old hotel out dated small rooms always line up for elevators ,elevators noisy bumpy and scary ,some nice people at the front desk but most people are rude including the concierge ..Bellmen were very nice ,most complain from everyone was the $25 per night resort fee ,food at the club lounge was garbage rather go to bakery to grab a bite to eat ,overcrowded ,room views are non unless you get higher floors ,talking to management is waste of your time not very helpful,if they write back that please call us that's waste of time since we approached at location to get help we got none

At our friend's suggestion, we avoided the Time Square area and instead picked this hotel in midtown. The location is unbeatable - close to all the major attractions including the Grand Central Terminal yet not so crowded. The room we had was very spacious and we had nothing to complain about.The M Lounge provides hot breakfast daily which was really nice! It also serves desserts in late afternoon, and I believe some dinner. It rained during our stay, and I was hoping that the hotel would have umbrellas on loan, but they did not.Another thing that I'd like to mention is that, as a runner, I have set a goal for myself that I would run in every city I visit. So I always pack my running shoes with me on trips. It happens that the new general manager of the hotel, David, and the manager are also runners, and they are launching a Wednesday morning run with guests program. Really neat! I ran with David during the inaugural run for a 3 and half mile loop that included a segment along the East River. I would highly recommend this Marriott for visiting NYC.

The position of this Hotel is excellent for a touristic visit to New York, an old building but very tastefully maintained. Lovely photographs in the public areas and corridors. Reception Staff were most professional we had a double double room (2 double beds) and we asked for a quiet room. We were given a room on the ninth floor no view other than an internal well but meant we did not hear the traffic overnight. They overed an excellent service for a free check-in for your return flights, and the WIFI did not have a limit on the number of machines ...something that annoys me in other hotels when they limit you to 2 machines.Will be returning (I hope)

Stayed at this hotel for one night. There was no hot water in the morning. I told the receptionist the problem and the response was, "Yes, that happens sometimes." Did not receive a discount on the $300 room. Will not stay here again.

I have stayed in better Marriott properties. Being from a lower cost metro area, I am always surprised by what you get/don't get for $250-300 a night in midtown Manhattan. I was in room 605, so there is a lot of street noise well into the overnight. Even with ear plugs I could here trucks unloading and general traffic. My room had two double beds. It felt quite dated as evident by the wallpaper, curtains and chipped furniture. The room was spacious, although the bathroom was very small. The showerhead was excellent, however. Front desk service was very friendly. The restaurant was essentially a bar area with a limited menu. I do like that they provide a $25 meal credit to offset part of the daily destination city tax.I may stay here in the future, but I think there are probably better options in the area.

Rooms were very clean, cleaning crew was very nice and helpful. Typical NYC hotel room, smaller rooms but what i expected. Went for two days last week. Conceirge was very helpful, booked us a dinner at Sparks with no problem. 15 minute walk to Time Square, probably the best deal for the money that is within walking distance to everything. We got upgraded to the concerige level which was definately worth it. I would def stay here again. Really good place, i would give it 4.5 stars if i could.

Nice, clean room. Small elevators. Good bar, but really expensive drinks. Friendly staff, from front desk to porters to waiters. Hot water ran out but management was very responsive. Nice place from which to explore Manhattan.

Good: great location and a lovely old-style NYC hotel. Early check-in availability was appreciated. The bed was very comfortable, though there was street noise. Not so good: If you aren't a Marriott rewards member, they charge $17/day for internet in the room. In this price range, every other hotel I've stayed in has provided in-room internet without charge. The mandatory destination fee of $25 is simply a hidden price increase, even though they refund the fee for in-house dining. Again, other hotels I've stayed in do not charge this fee. There are so many good choices in NYC, and next time I will stay elsewhere.

I'm in a hotel about 10 nights a month and the mattress at this hotel was the most disgusting I have ever slept on. The stains from the blood and feces of bed bugs must have been accumulating for quite some time. This tells me that the staff has no training which means that the management has absolutely no regard for the well being of its guests.

Drive up and you’re apt to be greeted by “Bert” who is all smiles and Service focused. Front desk is capably staffed by “Denise Richard”. Offered an upgrade and warm welcome. Room on 32nd floor looks out over Waldorf Astoria across the street. Room, per NYC standards, is large and accommodates sitting area with sofa. Although close to mid-town this hotel is a subdued jewel hiding in plain sight. No grand fanfare here, just a nice hotel from days gone by. Rooms could use some updating but this is minor when compared to relaxed feeling you get when staying here. Checkout was capably handled by Paulina Hernandez who added her own Marriott touch to the experience. This hotel deserves a better rating!

We enjoyed and appreciated how convenient this hotel was to everything in the city. The concierge lounge was available on the weekend (so nice!), and exceeded our expectations. What we most appreciated was how efficient and helpful the staff was when we arrived at the airport to fly home and realized I had left my wallet in the in-room safe. The person who had answered the phone immediately connected me with hotel security, and within minutes they confirmed they had recovered the wallet and would ship it to me. It arrived within a few days. The hotel staff's professionalism and helpfulness minimized my mistake and was so appreciated!

I've stayed at a number of the hotels in the area, including another Marriott property and would not come back to this hotel. Everything about the rooms is clearly old and requires updating (chips and scratches on doors/furniture; stains on cloth furniture/wallpaper; weird bubble in tub lining; accumulated dirt/dust where carpet meets wall). I complained about my first room (and a rust colored stain on the mattress) and was promptly transferred to a suite, so good customer service.
user_name:
ryandowntowndc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband, three teen daughters and I were in NYC for Scott's Pizza Tour. This Marriott is a perfect location. We had a "Family Connecting Room, Guest room, Bedroom 1: 1 King, Bedroom 2: 2 Double, Bathrooms: 2"....perfect for a family of 5!!!

Room - reasonable size for NYC - south facing with great view of the Chrysler tower - 4.5/5Bar/Resteraunt - limited menu - seen better hotel bars in NYC 2.5/5Location - wonderful - close to everything 5/5Lounge - for gold and platinum - good size - breakfast menus was very good, evening menu limited in comparison to other Marriott’s 3.5/5Overall 4/5I would visit again

We had a room with 2 double beds and 3 people, and had plenty of space. We blew a fuse with too many hairdryers, but it was fixed promptly. This was a good home base for exploring the city. We didn't go to the bar, but it was always lively. The elevators came quickly, which can be a problem in some hotels, and the few staff members we interacted with with friendly and helpful. We had the a/c on and the bed nearest the unit got pretty cold (as you'd expect). Overall a pleasant stay with no issues!

We were in town to visit Hofstra University which is a about 45 minutes away. But we wanted to stay in the city and this hotel had an incredible deal. Very, very clean, nice hotel! I love the old style feel in the lobby! Check-in was smooth and very friendly. The beds and sheets were oh so amazing! Just be aware of the $25 a day fee, (I forgot what they called it) but you can use it towards drinks, which we did, happily. :) Great location too!

Pros:I had a king sized room on a high floor so I was extremely happy with those aspects. The concierge lounge is big and offers a large selection for breakfastThe selection at the hotel bar isn't large, but the food is really goodCons:The gym is tiny and not easy to get toThe elevators are slow and one even stopped working while I was in itThe bathrooms could use some modernizing

Stayed here a few nights last Spring as it was close to some meeting locations. The rooms were clean and were bigger than The Lexington that's one block away. The staff was friendly and got a free breakfast. Would stay here again.

Love the location for a quick weekend stay. Being platinum, we were "upgraded" to a superior room, which couldn't be much larger than a regular room. Wifi worked fine. Bathroom was very small. Bed was a bit soft for our liking. The biggest problem with the room was that outside the window, something was loose, and it banged against the window all night long- not giving us a very good night's sleep.Also, they have a very nice club- except it doesn't serve anything on Saturday afternoons (when we were there). Breakfast on Sunday was standard fare....and it was very, very crowded in the club.All in all we'd probably look elsewhere in the city on our next visit. Just nothing special about this hotel at all.

THe hotel was just great for us. The staff, the location and the facility are all top notch. From the moment I arrived until I departed, I felt totally served. The lady at the concierge desk gave some great recommendations and Steven, our great bartender was super, he was so attentive and knows his stuff. All in all a great stay.

The assistant manager, Allan, was extremely helpful and personable upon check in. With the hotel not full, he recognized my gold rewards membership and gave me an upgrade, provided local travel tips and made sure I was aware of having access to the M Club, a complimentary lounge available to some Rewards members. The room upgrade was great and we enjoyed the weekend.

This hotel is pretty dismal. I have stayed in many Marriott properties around the US and this is by far the worst. For $300, the room they allocated to me was tiny and utterly grim - it looked more like a cheap motel room than a 4 star hotel. I asked to be upgraded to a decent room, and was charged an extra $100 for the pleasure - even though I arrived after midnight, and there was no way they would have sold the room to anyone else at that point. I never do this (and it's the last thing I would want to do on a business trip), but I changed my reservation and moved to a new hotel the following day (the Knickerbocker Hotel - highly recommended) where I was allocated a really great room at a cheaper rate. When I told the staff at the Marriott that I would be changing my reservation and finding a new hotel, they didn't make any effort to address the situation. I asked for a call from management and I'm still waiting for that. I have been fairly loyal to Marriott for business travel over the last year or two (and this was already my second stay this year), but I will be moving my loyalty after this experience.

We arrive at 1:00 thinking we were too early to check-in but the woman at the desk said our room was ready! As Marriot Reward Gold member I asked about a possible upgrade and she politely and apologetically explained why there were none available at that time. (Marriott Reward Platinum customers requesting late 4pm checkouts). The room id booked, a Classic Double, was on floor 11. As noted by others here, this room was a bit small and the bathroom was tiny, with more street noise. Almost as soon as we walked in the room the phone rang; it was the young lady from the front desk saying she had an upgrade available! Room 2208 a spacious king with sofa, larger bath, less street noise. I hesitated because we always specify "not near elevator" and this was DIRECTLY across from the 3 bank elevator doors. Let me say- it was completely quiet, never heard a ding, and no noise at all from passers-by! For Rewards Members, the M Club, aka the concierge lounge for members, was efficiently run. I like that it was so large, tons of tables for busy mornings. Most special was the fact that it is also open on the weekend. The Marriott East side is conveniently located in mid-town but away from the craziness of Times Square & Theater district. Yes it may need refreshing as far as carpet/ furniture but was immaculately clean, the bed was super comfortable, totally sound proofed, the lobby was beautiful, the bar was nice, housekeeping was efficient and timely, and the people were very friendly. These attributes, plus the location, hits all the buttons for an excellent stay!

We stayed here for my birthday celebration (4 nights) family vacation. The location of this hotel is great! The hotel lobby is very nice and clean. The rooms are good size for NYC hotel rooms and very nice and clean! We were offered a $25 a day food and beverage credit which was nice. Its use it or lose it so make sure to use it daily. It does not roll over to the next day! The restaurant downstairs has good food (the wings and mac and cheese are delicious) but the service is a bit slow. I loved this hotel and will be staying here again!

Very good location, reasonable price.You can walk practically everywhere. The room was good size , but everything in it as in the whole of the hotel was faded, tired in need of renovation or refurbishing.The bathroom with just head shower all hotels in USA are so, had no shower cap very tiresome. If you want to wash properly you have to do acrobatics not to wet your hair or water to reach downproperly.Excellent concierge and the people in the booking for spectacles bureau. Nice little restaurant under the hotel at the corner with very friendly personnel and good food.

Great location and outstanding staff from the front desk through housekeeping, but I'd give the condition of the property and the comfort level of the rooms a resounding "meh". Room sizes were perfectly adequate for NY hotels in my opinion, but the furnishings and especially the carpets were very dated, and the beds are not up to contemporary comfort standards.One serious lapse in attention to detail... at check in I was never asked my preference for a non-smoking room. I was put in a smoking room and to housekeeping's credit it was a while before I noticed as the room was quite clean, but eventually I noticed the smell and the cigarette burn on the 80's vintage carpet. By that point it was too late in my one-night stay to bother with a switch but it was disappointing.

Located right in the middle of manhattan, location is its only positive aspect. The room on 14th floor was had poor noise insulation - one could hear street noise all night long. As an alternate room, they offered another room with 2 connecting doors !! The check-in staff has a huge attitude issue, they dont even bother explaining the destination tax details unless asked. No in room dining + pathetic lounge. I wonder how they still qualify as a marriott.

This is a great hotel to stay in New York City. The midtown location is excellent. The rooms are great! Service is good. The only thing that you wait for are the elevators. I have stayed multiple times at this hotel. The only negative is the elevators do not run well. You will wait in the morning, afternoon and night.

Stayed here over xmas - new year 2017/18. Great locality and walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Easy access to subway two blocks up Lex @ 51St. Hotel itself was fine, enough room to house 4 adults plus bags, shopping etc. Nothing too flash about the rooms but nothing wrong with them either, for the price we paid you'd expect a happy ending each day but it is what it is I guess :)Housekeeping staff did their best I'm sure but each day we'd find something not done / not replenished. But anyone making my bed each day is good for me!Would stay here again no problem. Just watch the prices of drinks in the lobby bar - $35.00US for two G&T's and for our "convenience" the 18% gratuity was already added to the bill. Gee, thanks, but I'll offer my own bloody tips thanks.

This was our third stay as a family at the Marriott East Side. We love the location and amazing helpful staff. The M Lounge never disappoints and the double room w got was plenty of space for the four of us (when we were in our room that is).Already looking forward to our next stay.

We booked a 3 day stay and flights from Cleveland to NYC through Vacations by Marriott for about $ 800.00 and were very pleased. The East Side Marriott was the perfect location close to Rockefeller center, Time Square and we walked to Longacre Theater to take in a play and found Bruce Springsteen concert across the street. They did give options on the $ 25.00 resort fee each day to use on food or a guided tour which was nice. Our room was small and cut up. The bed and linens were very comfortable and all was very clean. Staff were very friendly and assisted in calling our first UBER ride to airport. It's the location here that is so important where you are in the middle everything.

This Marriott has a nice location, but is self-serve oriented. They require a $25 add on surcharge which is to be reimbursed if you eat in the hotel or the like—strange concept—just plan on the extra “daily” fee. This seems to distort the real room rate charge. The rooms are clean but are small (as well as the fitness center).

However we had read some negative reviews, we did not face any serious problem.The room -in 23th floor- was nice and clean, We had free Wi Fi in our room.(Just you have to be a member of Marriott Hotels).Also there was a coffee maker in the room. The staff was servicable. The location of this hotel is the main advantage. It is located 10 minutes walking from the heart of the Manhattan. Also there are some restaurants and mini market near it.

I don’t understand the reviews and how this hotel has got average of over 4 stars unless the reviews are 20 years old. The description of this hotel is old and tired. The rooms are so out of date, carpets are worn, the room heating/cooling unit sounds like a Diesel engine when it starts in the middle of the night, the bathrooms have mold on the ceilings.....etc. The only saving grace is that the beds are comfortable but for the price just not worth it. Sorry to the management but you really need to update. The staff are great but then that’s expected these days.

Yes, the hotel building is old, rooms need to be upgraded (and they are in the process of doing that), and there is an annoying mandatory daily $25 destination charge (it does come with $15 food credit per day so not as bad). I did my research before I booked the hotel so I wasn’t surprised by any of that. What’s great about this hotel is its location and the people working there. It’s 7 minute walk (three blocks) to Rockefeller center and 15 minute walk to Time Square. Hotel staff members were super friendly, and they treated Marriott Gold/Platinum members right. And BTW, the room was clean, bed was comfortable, WIFI worked flawlessly during our stay. Unlike most Marriott hotels that the M Club closes on the weekend and during holidays, the M Club at this hotel is open every day, even on Christmas day.

After arriving at Grand Central we walked to the Marriott just a few blocks away. Glad my wife brought hats, gloves, winter coats and scarves. (All the neccessary clothing for an artic trek.) We quickly entered the beautiful lobby and were finally sheltered from the bitter cold. AHH! WARMTH! We checked in which litterally took less than 1 minute. And up to the 15th floor we went (The elevator was pretty fast).We opened the door to our room and saw that we were in a corner unit (Yippy!) With two windows we had good views. The windows were double clad and kept the cold out. The thermostat was already set to 70F, and was just right for us. The room size was OK for us, the bed was super comfy, the bathroom was spotless and kept that way for our stay.We had access to M lounge which was a huge benefit for us. The buffet breakfast was ample even for the hardiest of eaters. Later in the day appetizers were offered in the lounge and after that, yummy deserts. Even though we were quests here, we felt as though we were treated as friends.Over the course of our stay we enjoyed a few very good (value) restaurant/bars within walking distance. Foxy Johns, Connolly, Tommy Bahamas and Toscana.We will be back when the outside temp are just about 70 degrees higher.

Couldn’t have asked for more excellent service from every member of staff! Nothing was to much trouble and the rooms were spotless. Can not wait to visit New York again. The staff were knowledgeable about all the tourist spots around

Recently Stayed here while in the city to attend a Broadway Show and do a Little Christmas display looking. Was a great location for both. Only about 3 blocks to to Rockefeller Center, Saks Fifth Aveand many more sights to behold. The display at Saks was something you should not miss, simply incredible.The theater district was only a couple more blocks further away from Rockefeller Center and many more sights to see while walking over to the theater, including the very live, Times Square.Very friendly, attentive and helpful staff made our stay a memorable one.

Hotel has undeniable charm. bucketloads of style. As usual booking through hotels .com did not work well. ignored request for high floor. ignored request for two rooms together. staff helped and changed the room. you get $25 per room per day to spend in the bar and a free attraction ticket which we didnt use. rooms are good. definately stay again.

I'll note upfront that I booked this hotel name-unknown through a discount travel site so I did not pay rack-rates during my stay. With that being said, I was generally pleased with this Marriott. Its location put it right near the action of mid-town Manhattan but a removed from the craziness of Times Square with convenient access within a few blocks to a subway entrance. Every staff member I interacted with was pleasant if not out-going.I arrived super-early (10 AM) for a 3 PM check-in and, not surprisingly, there were no rooms already available. I was able to bell-check my bags and enjoy the city until the room was ready fairly close to 3. I waited for another in my party at the lobby and it is a small space that always seemed fairly loud and bustling. The cafe in the lobby is very highly priced (expensive coffee, $6 small bottle of Gatorade) and uses K-cups instead of using ground espresso. There was generally a line for this cafe as this property charges a $25 per-night fee (like a resort fee) that can be used for "free drycleaning" and a $25 worth of credit shops/restaurants. The elevators were a bit on the small side but fast and functional, with two banks: one for the lower part of the building and one for the upper floors. Internet was free in the lobby but an extra charge in the rooms.The room itself was perfectly fine with a nice king-sized bed, closet, and safe. The bathroom was a bit on the small side and required a bit of shuffling for closing the door while inside it. The biggest downside to our particular room (probably because it was a discount room) was that it had a connecting door through which our loud-talking neighbors sounded like they were sharing the room with us. Coffee and tea were available in the room.It was a fine stay for the weekend.

My husband, daughter and I stayed here Dec. 14-18th on the 11th floor. I had seen some reviews regarding condition and the daily fee which were concerning. We did attend a timeshare presentation and we had access to the m lounge for breakfast which wad convenient as we were traveling with an 11 year old. The timeshare staff held up their end and did not keep us longer than the agreed upon time and we did not feel pressured to buy. Appreciated the information they were able to offer. The hotel is in a great location, steps away from grand central station and a short walk from times square, 42nd st, etc. I would say it is ranked as a high category hotel for its location in the city. Yes, the room was on the smaller side, some wear and tear on the furniture in the room, but it was clean, met our needs and I did not feel as though we overpaid for what we received. I would consider staying here again because of the great location.

FIrst, let me say the hotel exterior and lobby are beautiful, especially at Christmas time. However, the whole time we were there, it was a mob scene, so please don't book this hotel for its ambiance. The location is good, but we would stay elsewhere next time. The front door/valet area was always crowded as was the check in line and the elevators. There is no complimentary coffee in the lobby or newspapers - one small cup of coffee in the lobby was $4.96!! The room we had was tiny, but that was to be expected and from the floor plan on the door, there are many different size rooms, so if that is important to you, make sure to ask. And of course, the traffic noise is very loud in that busy area from any room, again to be expected. For $376/night, I would stay elsewhere next time.
user_name:
mandjfoy
Manchester, New Hampshire, United States

review_body: We stay in many hotels and many are Marriotts. This one was a disappointment. The staff was friendly and cordial, but our room was the smallest one we have had over the past few years. It also failed my "has the designer or architect ever stayed in a hotel room" test. It does not take a genius to realize that if you put a reading chair in a room, it is a good idea to put a lamp near that chair. They didn't even have lighting in that side of the room. Also, the elevators were lower than we are used to.Our doorman & bellman upon arriving and leaving were very friendly, helpful and good. However, we asked the doorman on Friday night to help us get a cab to go across town. He told us "no way" and suggested his limo buddy, who I am sure would give him a kickback, for $60 and then walked away. It took us less than 2 minutes to get a cab on the corner. Not very Marriott like.

My husband and I checked into this hotel today with our 18 year old daughter to visit NYC for Christmas. The company we booked our reservation through only booked us a single bed (by mistake) and the hotel was completely booked due to the busy season and couldn't get us in a room with two beds. Joshua who worked the front desk went above and beyond from the first point of contact. He was extremely professional, pleasant and helpful after a long day of traveling. He informed me that he would do his best to accommodate us and he did just that. We have been upgraded to a double room with the most amazing views of the city! Marriott has selected an exceptional employee when Joshua was hired. We will absolutely be back to stay here.The hotel is beautiful!

I’m a big fan of Marriott abs always try to book one of their hotels when traveling. The rooms at this hotel are welll appointed and a decent size. The front desk was accommodating. The common areas including elevators need an update. Hotel is a 15 minute walk to Times Square. Lobby bar serves illy coffee which is good but crazy expensive. There is a Starbucks next door at the Lexington however!

We stayed in a 2 doubles room on a high floor with a corner view for 1 night during our NYC trip. The room was on the smaller side as most hotels in NYC are however it was very nice and had luxury linens and toiletries. It's in a very convenient location to where you can walk to several tourist places. If you need to catch a cab, the doormen are very willing to help you do so. It was my son's 1st time in NYC and the front desk sent up cookies and milk for him at night which was much appreciated. As a gold member, we had access to the Executive lounge where we had free breakfast every morning and also had access to complimentary waters, non-alcoholic drinks and snacks which we took advantage of. Great hotel, would definitely stay again!

The Marriott Eastside has been our favorite hotel in N.Y City for 15 years.Convenient location to Grand Central and 5th Avenue and Central ParkWonderful concierge lounge with multi function coffee machine and large selection of breakfast items. Open 24/7 Friendly staff and excellent service Have stayed here over Thanksgiving for 15 years now and always enjoy it!Great comfy beds and cozy lounge off the lobbyMy sister and I love this hotel!

While the room could use an upgrade, it was very roomy and clean. Service was good and the small lobby is nice. The location is good if you will be going around the East side. Lobby bar is nice but pricey as expected. With a good rate, I would be back if the opportunity arises.

The thing I love about this hotel is its location !Oh Boy !! is it awesome !!Bang on Lexington between 48th and 49th, a couple of mins of walk away from the Grand Central, 2 streets away from the 51st station and 4 away from the 53rd, a min's walk away from Park Ave, about 10 mins walk away from Central Park, stone's throw from Madison Ave and 5th Ave. I mean, what else can one want !?!?So yes, that's why I chose this hotel. Specially for the proximity to Grand Central station.Being a Marriott brand hotel, the Executive Lounge exists here. The food is pretty much the same every day. You know what I mean in case you have ever been to any of the Hyatt or Marriotts in Middle East and India.The rooms are VERY SMALL. I mean, they end before they start - almost.And the bathroom - well, I can't close the bathroom door once I sit down on the commode. The door will hit my leg. it is THAT SMALL !!But again, being in the thick of Manhattan has its costs. So i guess these are part of it.Great staff, good quality of stuff around.One thing that I don't understand, maybe is a practice in the US only (because it is not so in the India Marriotts) - they almost never gave me fresh linen and sheets. They would just pull the same ones tight. I realized coz I would be able to see the creases of last night.

I recently stayed at the Marriott east side hotel 15.- 21 oct 2017. I received an urgent call very early in the morning, about 5am, from my family asking me to get a document signed, notarized and couriered over to Melbourne that day. I was not at all sure where I would be able to get this done! But Marriott came to the rescue - i was saved by Angela Cooper, a staff at the hotel, who not only arrived at work at 6.30am, she physically came over to my room, witnessed the signing of the document, notarized it, and didn’t even ask to be paid for doing this! It was all done so that by 8.30am, we could get it couriered to Melbourne. Angela saved our day! A very big thank you to Angela for helping us out so quickly and effortlessly, and to the Marriott East Side hotel for having Angela in their team. The hotel is a bit old and tired, but the great service from Angela is so appreciated that we will stay there on our next trip back to NY!

Service was good but our room had peeling paint in two spots on the ceiling. For the kind of money we spent - and the Marriott points were used - should not be shabby. Not again. Desk responsive but the carpeting on stairs looked worn and not inviting and the place could use some sprucing.

I found great weekend gateway vacation package by Marriott for 2nites 3 days including Delta Airfare for $645, so went solo. Every major sightseeing spots in Mid-Upper town of Manhattan are walking distance from this hotel. The hotel is historic with 1920s decoration throughout hotel. Room is well renovated and well equipped. My room 1919 even came with mini fridge. No room service, but there are cafe and restaurant on lobby level. So many eateries in few steps away from hotel, you don't need to eat at hotel. Destination fee included $15 food credit per day, so I had continental breakfast at the cafe. Very good bakery items with excellent coffee menu. Service was sufficient with NY poise attitude. I will definitely try to stay here again if I can get same great vacation deal.

I am looking at the other reviews confused if they stayed in the same hotel as me. First off, its not a brand spanking new build. Its an Art Deco building, it's old, it has character. My room was on the 6th floor, with 2 queen beds- we had more then enough room to move about, and we are 2 chubby menopausal women. I had no issues with street noise- we are in New York City, you know the city that never sleeps. Water pressure in the showers I took was strong and consistent. For the amenity charge, yes, it's a pain but we were able to easily use it with our love of coffee and breakfast pastries. All staff I encountered were helpful and kind, My reservation requests for extra towels were there, waiting for me in the room. I would stay here again, it's close to the subway, easy for taxis to find. Join the Marriott Rewards and voila, free wi-fi!

We stayed at this hotel on our "mini-moon" to NYC. The hotel was clean and staff was accommodating, but this is definitely a predominantly business trip sort of hotel. Most of the guests seemed to be business people on overnights, and the hotel reflected that. Simple, without anything too exciting or innovative. Great if you're just looking for a place to crash, but not romantic or terribly exciting.

Our room on the 31st floor was very nice. A little small (only 1 person could pass the bed at a time) but it's Manhattan! Easy walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Centere, the theatre district, and the Veteran's Day parade!

I️ stayed here the weekend of Nov 10th and 11th. My room was a good size (especially for NYC). I️ would suggest that anyone that makes a reservation here should request a room on a high floor to avoid the street traffic noise. I️ had a special request and the staff was very accommodating and helpful.I️ did miss having the option of room service but overall I enjoyed my stay and appreciated the helpful staff.

We were there on work assignment. It was average.... but for NYC.. I guess I forgot to lower my expectations. Actual holes in the sheets on the bed.. actual holes! ( they were clean, so that's something)Water in shower on 14th floor? I guess It wasn't just our room- as the lady in the elevator commented on the 'trickle' she stood under trying to take a shower. To say it didn't have pressure was an understatement. It made a quick shower impossible... Oh! And bring your own soap. There is a soap crisis/shortage at this Marriott... lol one teeny bar for the shower and none for the sink. Up side: clean and convenient.

Unlike anywhere else I have stayed in the Marriott brand you should expect a $25 USD per day "amenity" charge even if you have no interest in the amenities. This seems just a rip off way to get more money for nothing even if you are in a room paying $500 USD per night! Read the small print as this is not normal for Marriott to do this.

We went to New York to see my niece run the NYC Marathon. We stayed one night at the Marriott East Side, but you'd have thought we were regulars by the treatment we got from the staff. Everyone was super nice & helpful. In fact, I did not run into one new yorker who wasn't nice. The bed was super comfy and although the room was small by non-city standards, it was certainly nice enough. I would go back. 4 blocks from Grand Central. Close to subway stop.

I stayed at the hotel for a week during my business visit. The hotel is situated at good location at mid town with proximity to Grand central and Times Square. Being the gold member, I had access to M lounge which was very useful. Mainly used the lounge for having breakfast which was nice. All same everyday but saved me time and money before going to office. The hotel is little old but rooms were clean. There is only one restaurant/bar in the hotel lobby. So overall fine hotel to stay if you are looking to visit for business purposes.

Stayed last September 16. Check-in process was quick and easy! I appreciate the Front Desk agent that checked us in as well because as soon as he saw that there are 5 people in my party, he immediately upgraded our room to a larger room with 2 queen beds with a pull-out sofa bed instead of just a room with 2 beds. The room was great, clean and well-maintained. We did not explore much of the hotel but it is close to everything - Times Square and all the other attractions. Will recommend this hotel!

We arrived on the Friday of the NYC Marathon weekend and had our taken as we didn’t need it in the city.We checked in but then Joshua came from behind the desk to explain the daily Destination fee $25/day. In hindsight I think this was so that other guests didn’t hear him. In essence it is a resort fee AKA “padding”. They try to claim that it offers value but it doesn’t. We went to our room and asked to speak to a manager to explain we didn’t want to avail of this and Pam informed us that it was already paid for on our Priceline booking.When we came to leave, the fee was on the bill. Richard, the manager on duty then informed us that it is stated on Priceline but not debited which turned out to be correct. It just created a feeling of uncertainty throughout the weekend.The room was fine if quite dated. Some wallpaper peeling, loose towel rails and bulbs etc but overall ok.The restaurant menu is an embarrassment pulled from 25yrs ago! I understand with the choices Manhattan has you may just concentrate on rooms but still.The worst part though was once I picked up my car and we got to our first stop and it was light I noticed that the interior of the back hatch was scuffed and one of the safety lights broken! This had not been brought to my attention. The hatch had been auto closed onto something. Now it should never have been opened and then someone should have owned up to the accident.I left messages for the Duty Mgr who has not returned my calls.Now, I don’t know about you but if I put my $80k car into the care of others, who charge me $150 for 3pm Fri to 7am Sun, I expect them to take care of it.

Stayed here on business for two nights. Don't stay here if you're a light sleeper at all. My 18th floor room sounded like I was on the 2nd floor with the windows open. Yes, New York is loud, but this was a whole other level. Single pane windows that don't seal at all. Even with ear plugs, it was hard to sleep. Good location, and the staff is friendly and helpful. But the noise...

Got in very late, 2am. Good location, three blocks from Park Avenue! Older and very worn (out) rooms! Bathroom is the size of a postage stamp and all amenities in the room are pretty old. Whatever you do, don't sleep in, because breakfast in the membership lounge is over at 10am. However, if you go there at 9:30, nothing is left and absolutely nothing is replenished! I barely got 2 pieces of white bread to put in the toaster before they removed it. The staff in the concierge lounge are rude beyond words and will literally rip any food or drink out of your hand if it's anywhere near 10am. Lastly, my hairdryer wouldn't work (tried several plugs) and it took way too long to get a replacement, nearly missed my meeting! Way too many issues with all the other choices nearby!

I booked this hotel online reserving 3 rooms in mid-October for 5 nights. After getting my confirmation number, I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and learned that the hotel was in need of some renovation but that the rooms on the 16th floor had been refurbished. I then called the hotel directly (or so I thought). The operator directed me to reservations. I explained what I had learned and requested that my 3 rooms be located on the 16th floor--2 adjoining rooms and the other located nearby. No problem (or so I thought). We arrived for check-in shortly after 3 p.m. Only one room was ready -- on the 4th floor! When I explained to the front desk check-in clerk that I was told my rooms would be on the 16th floor, she said that those rooms were "premium" rooms. I explained that Sherry in Reservations told me that I would be assigned 3 rooms on the 16th floor as requested. I learned that Sherry was actually in Omaha--not at the NY hotel! The check-in person proceeded to get her manager who told me that the rooms were premium rooms and they had none available for me. While disappointed, I agreed to take the rooms on the 4th floor. We were escorted to the room on the 4th floor with all of our luggage and were told that we would be notified just as soon as the other rooms became available. No notification came so we went down to the front desk to get the other keys. We were given a key to one of the adjoining rooms. The third room still was not ready. We were told that a bellman would bring the 3rd key up to us. We waited about 30 minutes and decided to leave and pick up the 3rd key when we returned to the hotel. Upon returning, we went to the front desk to get the key to our 3rd room. The front desk clerk looked a bit puzzled and said, "You didn't already get your key?" We told her what we were told earlier. She gave us the key. My 2 guests proceeded to their adjoining rooms only to discover that someone else was already checked into that room. Back down to the front desk! The front desk clerk was very apologetic and gave me a $50 credit off the cost of one rooms and access for all 3 rooms to the M Lounge. She also indicated that she needed to have the name of each guest in each of the rooms, which the first check-in clerk failed to do. She then proceeded to find us unoccupied rooms. She sent us to the 21st floor with a bellman to transfer our luggage from the 4th floor to the 21st floor. Two of us got into our rooms; the bellman opened the door to the 3rd room only to discover that a gentleman was already in the room! Finally by about 10:00 p.m. we got a 3rd unoccupied room. One of my guests ended up having to leave a day early. The bill arrived under my door Sunday morning. I didn't think anything of this since I was paying for all 3 rooms. I got my daughter into a car for the airport and went to the M Lounge to get some coffee. My key didn't work but the man behind me used his key and I got in to the lounge. I then proceeded to my room only to discover that my key would not open the door to my room. Back down to the front desk! You guessed it . . . the hotel checked me out of my room instead of checking my daughter out of her room.This is certainly not the experience I expected to have from a Marriott Hotel. Marriott is always my first choice when selecting a hotel. I did get a response to my survey comments from someone at the hotel who offered to be my contact person and give me an upgraded room on my next visit to the New York Marriott East Side. I explained that I do not travel to NYC that frequently so her offer was not of much value to me. I also explained that the $25/day per room "destination fee" was nothing more than a junk fee, as I received no benefit from this fee plus the attendant taxes on this fee. I have not had any additional response from the hotel. As far as the hotel goes, the rooms were clean but did look a little tired. The bathroom in the king bed room was small. The bathroom door came within 2-3 inches of the toilet. There is not much sound-proofing. If someone was talking as they walked down the hall, you could hear the conversation in the room. You could also hear all the traffic noise in the streets below.Based on this experience, I doubt that I would return to this particular Marriott Hotel. I appreciated the check-in clerk trying to make up for the check-in fiasco but $50 off the price of one room seems a little lacking since we were all inconvenienced by the mistakes of their back office personnel.

Stayed here for business. Nice hotel, little older and more character than some of the other Marriotts. Rooms are smaller then some other properties I've stayed at but this is New York! Room was nice, clean and well serviced. Only complaint is sometimes the lifts (elevators) where a little slow or you had to wait a while for when. A pain when your on a high floor, but then sometimes worth it if you have a great view.

My husband and I stayed for one night as the first night of a tour. We had a large room on the third floor with a Queen bed. The room had all the usual furniture which included an extra chair which we found very useful as an alternative to sitting on the bed.The TV worked well with a good selection of stations.Our room faced the street but was not too noisy if you wore earplugs. New York is very noisy but that is part of its charm.Breakfast was standard with enough choices without being brilliant.The lifts were large and we didn't ever have to wait.The location of the hotel is excellent - in a nice part of town and walkable to many places.We were satisfied with our stay.

We enjoyed staying in this mid-town location. There are dozens of restaurants in the neighborhood. Walking distance to Central Park. Close to grocery and drug stores. The concierge level has a great breakfast!

I love this hotel. In an area filled with expensive, over the top, luxury hotels, this one has everything a traveler could need or want, without the attitude, drama, or distractions. The area is excellent, all the best of New York is convenient. Our room was spacious and quiet. And, although small, the penthouse gym had mesmerizing views.

Lovely property in an old structure which is well located. The rooms are small, but then again this is New York. The lounge service is fantastic for breakfast and super which I used. this only thing that I feel they need to do is upgrade the lift mechanisms and the sounds that come out when you are going up to your room are scary. Apart from that Love the property and service. Must mention that the Doormen here are the best source of information and help if you need it.

We were going to New York and asked several friends for advice and recommendations as we have not been to New York City much. After checking out several hotels in various locations, we settled on this Marriott which is midtown, not really the east side, I think. I had a lot of Marriott Reward points and so used a lot of points so my wife and I could stay free for 2 of the 3 nights. The location seemed very good and there are many nice restaurants in walking distance. The concierges were very helpful and our room was plenty big enough.
