Our only complaints is that the pillows are way too soft and the mattress is too soft, but we handled it for a few days.

Old hotel, with no refurnish. Looks old, dirty. Very expensive for what you get. For me, maybe a Howard Johnson's or Days Inn are in better condition than this hotel. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!! Marriott was supposed to be a good 4 star chain... this was a 2.5 star hotel for me.

Stayed 4 nights for business including 2 days of conference on site. Arrival was fine and valet easy. The valet staff was excellent, being sure to explain the no in/out car privileges. Checkin was smooth but next to impossible to hear the staff member speaking behind the massive desk. The lobby has a lot of noise. We were told about the daily fee that included $15 in food, $20 in dry cleaning and some sort of service rom the concierge. We were not told though that it is use or lose for each night. Additionally later in the stay we asked if we could use to buy bottled water from the bar - told to go the gift shop. Before purchasing I confirmed again with the gift shop that the food credit could be used there. Upon checkout, an upset front desk person told me that was not ok. I explained how I had been sent from the bar and again verified with the gift shop. It was disappointing to see how Marriott handled their own internal miscommunication. The room was clean and functional. The bathroom very disappointing as there was no fan and barely any water pressure from a shower head that could not have been adjusted for someone taller than 4 feet. The conference facility was not good. Large room but no space to network. My restrooms up or down stairs, and catering just about non-existent. Overall, decent but not great.

This is our go to Marriott when in the Big Apple...love the ease of walking to all of our favorite spots. The rooms are fine - the City is expensive. Staff is consistently friendly and efficient. Agree,the lobby is perfect.

In town with a friend for a doctors appointment. The staff was very attentive from the front desk help, to the wonderful housekeeping that helped obtain a few necessary items. The concierge provided us with wonderful suggestions on restaurants close by. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and LOVE the showers. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

We stayed here two nights, separated by one night elsewhere, because we were celebrating both family occasions and on business. The first night, we found our room to be slightly shabby and were disappointed. When we mentioned this to the bellman who has helping us with our luggage on the way out--Wade--he took us to the front desk manager and asked that, when we returned in two days, if they would make sure to show us a better version of what this property could offer. They most certainly did. The second night we were given a fresher, more updated room, with newer towels and more space. I was glad I asked. I would come here again for the friendly service.
user_name:
Dr R M
North Stonington, Connecticut

review_body: Okay, on a holiday week-end in NYC you are ALWAYS going to pay top dollar, and you are not going to get a huge room for the price, I do understand that.BUT, if you are paying over $500 for a room, and you can't check in until 4.00pm, I don't think it too much to expect the room to be ready at 4.00pm - especially if you have early dinner reservations before a show."We are very busy and housekeeping has not had time to clean all the rooms" is not really acceptable. You know you are going to be full - get more housekeeping staff!In fairness, manager was apologetic, and gave a small discount for our patience. However, would rather have paid the full price and had the extra hour in the room!The hotel itself is okay, pretty standard for mid-town NYC. Still think the Courtyard nearby on 3rd Avenue is better value.Nothing wrong with this place, - just dated and seems expensive for what you get. Also really hate the fact that they add a 'Resort Fee' to the bill. WHY? Its hardly a resort!!!! Just be upfront about the rate that you are charging!

Nice hotel east side near many attractions and restaurants. When we were there, some bus tours, crowded the breakfast lounge. Used the lounge for breakfast. Reasonable basic choices, something for everyone. Room on 32 bd floor had nice view but needed some work. NO ventilation in the bathroom which also had a broken light fixture and bath fixture. Still usable but...Relatively small lobby. Price was right for group meeting however.

This hotel is pretty good on most fronts. The rooms are ok (somewhat dated, the bathrooms could use renovation, but it's ok). The breakfast and common areas are ok. The location is ok - away from the central rush. But it ends up being quite expensive for what you're getting, especially when they automatically add a "mandatory" $25 "destination fee" per night. There are other hotels in NYC that provide nicer service and cost much less - certainly without those additional hidden costs.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel and we loved the location and full service amenities! We had stayed at the Marriott marquis right in the heart of Times Square earlier this year but we found this hotel a much better choice! It was so centrally located to fifth avenue, Bryant park, Rockefeller- we could walk most everywhere we wanted to go but it was also only two blocks to subway if you want to ride. We were also still able to walk to the theatre district. The rooms were lovely and our two double bed room was quite spacious for NYC! I have nothing but good things to say - it feels sophisticated and fun to stay here! Great for a weekend getaway!

I stayed 2 nights at this hotel and having stayed in Marriott hotels in the past, was looking forward to my stay especially after a 25 hour+ flight from Australia. I arrived at nearly 8.30pm. Reception staff were pleasantl. Having read previous reviews I was aware that there was an issue with room service however asked nevertheless. Still no room service however you could order from the bar and take it to your room - I decided that for the time waiting, I could eat at the bar and did so. The food was pretty ordinary and lukewarm.I found the room dated, dingy and tired looking. The noise from outside was so loud I initially thought that the window was open - but no. I found that a bathroom light was not working and that the in room safe was not working properly either. Disappointing to say the least for a Marriott. The next morning I grabbed a coffee and snack from the bar/cafe and walked to Central Park. When I returned later in the day I found that there had been no housekeeping in my room. I joined friends that night thinking that the room would be seen to when I return - but no. Friends staying here for 2 and 3 nights had housekeeping to their rooms. For some reason my room was ignoredThe next morning I had breakfast again at the hotel the standard of which was again ordinary. .While the location is great for those with business or sightseeing at this end of New York, I think you could find a better hotel for the price. The overall standard, given that this is a Marriott hotel was very disappointing. I expected more. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

LOCATION:The NY Marriott East Side is in a great location if you like staying in Midtown away from Times Square. It's easy to get Uptown or Downtown depending on your itinerary and it's away from the madness of Times Square. Did I say that?You're right across from the Intercontinental, W, and the old Waldorf. The neighborhood has 24 hour Delis, restaurants, and bars. It's not a bad walk to Broadway shows and legendary shopping is down the street. Close to Grand Central, too. CHECK-IN Pleasant enough. Arrived there early and was told I would be contacted when a room was ready. I was never contacted though. When I came back after lunch and explained that I had an appointment at 3:00 they kindly checked me in. Nice since they didn't have to do that. THE ROOM: The room was larger than expected, bright, and clean(ish). The bathroom floor definitely had not been swabbed. The sink, shower, and bowl looked clean. All in all, I would recommend it. It doesn't have a flashy lobby and luxe amenities but the hallways were bright, security was at the door, the staff was accommodating, and the price was reasonable.

We were flying in and out of JFK for a long vacation. NY was the kickoff for our vacation. Called the hotel to arrange transport from JFK. Spoke with Bert who could not have been more helpful. Car service met us at JFK and took us to the hotel. Liked them so much we booked them again for the return to JFK. As we were leaving the hotel, Bert came up to introduce himself and be sure all had gone well. Hotel location is perfect. Close enough to major areas but enough off the main streets for easy access.

Marriott's corporate office should be ashamed that this property and these people represent their company. After putting me in a room next to an elevator when I specifically ask not to be next to an elevator, the individual at the front desk moved my husband and me to a room with double beds. I am a Marriott Gold member and I paid for a room with a guaranteed king bed. The building is worn out and the service by everyone from the front desk manager to the bell staff is poor. The $25 dollar fee for non-existent dry cleaning is something special. Shame on you, Marriott!

The hotel is located on 49th and Lex, within walking distance to the M & E trains and the 4, 5, 6 trains. It's also very easy to grab a taxi here, so getting around the city to and from this hotel will not be an issue as it is in a great location. However, I was really surprised to see how dated the rooms were, everything from the furniture to the fixtures - a bit of a disappointment for a Marriott. The room was a bit dark since older buildings in the city have smaller windows, and I don't think the rooms had USB charging. Rooms side, the lounge and the gym were decent. The lounge looked like it was recently renovated with new furniture; the gym is on the top floor of the building with floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook the Hudson River. Last but not least, the staff at the Marriott were pleasant, as always :)!

The East Side Marriott is in a fantastic location, walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, and many other areas. The rooms are on the small side (as expected in NYC), but even when you request a larger room, expect it to be small. We had a wonderful view of the Chrysler building from our room, which was a treat. Once you make a reservation check back with them, the rates went down three times between when we booked and when we stayed. The restaurant has some interesting cocktails as well. This is a classic New York hotel in the heart of Midtown!

The front desk turned their error into my problem by lying to me. I think this is very bad customer service.The company I work for made a reservation for me for two nights. After my first night’s stay the front desk called me in my room and informed me that the company I work for only made a One day reservation for my stay but that the front desk was going to be so kind to me to extend my stay but they needed me to change rooms. I then contacted my company’s hotel reservation staff and they informed me that they indeed made a two night reservation for me and that that they would call the Marriott New York Eastside to find out what was going on. One minute later the company I work for hotel reservation department called me back and told me that I would be staying in my original room.This review would not be written if the front desk would’ve just informed me of their mistake and asked me if I would be willing to move based on their mistake. In that instance I promise you I would’ve changed rooms for them everybody makes mistakes. Instead the front desk lied to me and they attempted to make their problem become my problem. That is horrible customer service! I informed the manager on duty of this situation and the response from the manager on duty was basically no response. Therefore I was forced to write this review in hopes that this bad customer service can be corrected in the future by not lying to a hotel guest and try to turn the hotel problem into the guest’s problem.To the TripAdvisor community I suggest you pay very close attention to your dealings with the front desk of this hotel.

Stayed here during the week of 9/17. The choices in Manhattan that week were few (and expensive) due to the UN General Assembly being in session. The hotel staff is very pleasant, and the rooms are clean, but be forewarned that this place is old and the "classic" rooms are small. Only one floor (16) has been fully updated, and those rooms come at a premium. The M Club lounge (for Marriott Rewards Platinum members) has been updated - the food items (breakfast and dinner) are good and a cut above what you get at other Marriott properties. While my stay was satisfactory, I wish that I could have gotten into the Marriott Marquis (where I stayed the prior four weeks) or at the much newer Courtyard around the corner on 53rd Street and Third Avenue.

We stayed here for a last minute trip since our Cuba plans were changed due to Irma. This was the perfect location! We were close to a lot of the major tourist spots and the subway was only a couple of blocks away. We were on the 10th floor so we didn't really experience issues with the elevator being slow. Room was a nice size for NY and I must have gotten lucky and received a room that had been refurbished because the décor was nice. Since the location charges a "resort fee" I don't think there should be an additional expense to use the computers in the business center. Although it is free to print out boarding passes, I had other tickets I wanted to print. I would definitely stay at this location again.

I stayed here attending a meeting on property. The guest rooms were small but nice. The meeting space was great and the staff were amazing to work with. The M Lounge was one of the best club lounges I've been too in a while. I would highly recommend this place!

Marriott is the signature hotel, and in the states the service reps really take that to heart. Best customer service in the states in is always Marriott and JW....seems like to me. This hotel had one of the better rates in midtown when i booked. Great location, walking distance to central park, a lot of amenities around and great service.

We stayed in Marriott East Side 8-12th August and were totally underwhelmed. Our room was small, there were plumbing issues in the bathroom and the air conditioner beside the bed was noisy. Evidence of wear and tear were everywhere throughout the hotel (creaking lifts, chipped paint on architraves, musty odour in room..). We ate breakfast in the hotel on our last morning and were provided with an extremely limited buffet selection and provided with plastic cutlery! We had limited contact with hotel staff but on 3 different occasions I experienced a less than helpful response to my request. This is by far the worst Marriott hotel I have stayed in and I would not go back again.

We stayed at Marriot for 4 nights. It is a decent hotel located very close to city centre. The rooms are spacious but they need renovation because the furnitures are quite old. The bathroom also needs improvements.The location is great very close to everything. StuffVery friendly. Need to pay extra for wi fi in the room.Thehotel advantage is its location

We just stayed at the Marriott East Side over Labor Day weekend while attending the US Open. Our rate was ridiculously low because we were on a "timeshare presentation" package. Normally, we stay at the Westin near Times Square. The Marriott was a convenient location, about 7 short blocks to the 7 subway to the Open (at Grand Central station). I used the Marriott app to check-in, which was very quick. My Gold status got us access to the M lounge. We ate free breakfast each day, snacks and desserts in the evenings, and all the bottled waters we needed. The M lounge was a benefit for Gold elite members and higher. However, on Labor Day weekend, it was packed - even hard to find a seat. However, the staff kept bringing out fresh food and cleaning tables quickly. Alcoholic drinks were not included. I also got free high-speed internet, which worked very well. The building is very old but the rooms are very modern and included an empty refrigerator (exactly what we needed). The size of the rooms was ok, by NYC standards. The elevators are very small and can be a bother when the hotel is full. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and can't beat our price. If paying full rates, I would expect to pay less to stay here than the Westin Times Square or the Marriott Marquis, our other 2 regular hotels.

When we first arrived, we were a little apprehensive. The building is really "old". The front desk was great during our check-in; they put us up on the 29th floor. The elevators are very old; 3 dedicated to only lower floors, the other 3 to the upper floors. There were times when we waited so long, we thought they were broken?Once situated in our room, all was fine. It was well appointed and modern, comfortable bedding as you may expect of a Marriott. Even located on the 29th floor, our view was obstructed somewhat by all the recent high rises being build throughout NY.We easily walked to Central Park (took the famous carriage ride - YES), 30 Rock, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, a Broadway Play - "From Far Away", etc. To see the 9/11 memorial, we walked a few blocks north to pick up the 'E' subway train which dropped us off there as the very last stop, less than 30 minutes and paid $2.75 one way.9/11 Memorial grounds were emotionally moving, there was a long line to purchase tickets to enter the museum. You may save some time we found out later, by purchasing tickets on the grounds at what look like ATM machines but our a Kiosk. We waited in those lines only to be taken out of line and instructed to use the Kiosk machine located nearly at the entrance. But later, we found similar Kiosk machines with no lines at all. Just take your printed tickets up the entrance to enter. They offer guided tours, with groups of people for an extra charge. We didn't find it necessary, your could also easily just hang around with a guided tour after entering if you choose.We did the "New York in One Day Guided Sightseeing Tour" that took 5 hours on bus, walking, and boat ride. It was tremendous coverage of seeing all of New York City in one day. I highly recommend them.We found this was a great spot to see all that NYC Manhattan has to offer and far enough away from the noise of Times Square!

Great hotel if you're looking for something moderately priced. The location was great if you don't want the hustle bustle of Time Square but want easy access with 15-20 minute walk. Plenty of places to eat around you as well as easy access to the subway. Grand Central Station is an easy 5-10 minute walk and then a straight shot to the US Open by talking #7 subway. It's about a 30 minute ride. Rooms at the hotel were a decent size for New York, plenty of room with hairdryer, in room safe, iron/ironing board. The shower was the only real complaint--very little water pressure. There's been a lot of reviews about the $25 nightly Destination fee being annoying and frustrating to guests. This is also new for the hotel and they are learning about it. For the $25, you get a $15 daily food/beverage credit that must me used daily or you lose it. You also get a small dry cleaning credit daily (which I did not use). There's also a tour credit which I did not use. I did however use the $15 food/beverage credit for a glass of wine on the bar. I found the staff to be very pleasant, willing to help with anything you needed. When I checked out, I did not have one of the credits for my daily food and beverage, but they nicely handled applying it after I asked about it before leaving the hotel. All in all, I would stay again.

I always stay in this hotel when in New York City. Although a bit away from "the action" of Times Square, the location is good. Getting in and out of the city is easy as you need not go across town. I also like the less modernized hotels (less sterile) and this is a more classic New York hotel. The service in the hotel is always excellent and consistent. The rooms are a bit smaller but have all the modern conveniences including WiFi and a coffee maker. On the down side, the elevators are slow and there is no room service (although this is New York City with many restaurants close by). This is a great place to stay for business if you desire things a little quieter than the "touristy" areas.

We stayed here for 2 nights as a couple. The location is about 15 min walk to times square. This was the first visit where we didn’t take the subway at all as we walked about 25 min from Penn station to the hotel. Our room was nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. If you are regular Marriott travellers, then you may get access to the lounge which includes breakfast which had good selection and hot food. You could also go there all day and get pop/water. Would definitely stay here again!

Good mid-town location at Lexington. Park Avenue and all the hustle bustle are close by. The rooms are small, which is expected in Manhattan hotels. Prices are within 300-550 / Nt, usually. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Depending on the room, you might get lot of traffic noise and sounds, sometimes through out the night.
user_name:
manosijr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: As a gold member going on platinum, I expect more of Marriott. Room was clean and large, but don't expect any perks as an elite member. Having to pay for alcoholic drinks in executive lounge is a disgrace with as much money as gold and platinum members spend with Marriott every year. In fact many other Marriotts do not charge for this, and none should. The hotel also rented out a portion of the lodge for company event so there was no seating any time you tried to use the lounge as it was packed. The lounge is to reward members and shouldn't be used to rent out more space. Obviously it shows who they care about. Bathrooms in lower lobby area were very dirty. I will not stay here again based on this unless Marriott reached out to explain how they will address all the issues. There are plenty of other Marriott options now, especially with Ritz Carlton and SPG hotels now being part of the Marriott family.

I recently stayed in this hotel for leisure with my husband. The room was clean, but furnishings dated and bed not very comfortable. The location was great, many restaurants and points of interest were walkable. My one complaint is the Destination Fee. I was charged ($25 + tax). The staff had no clue how it worked and therefore we could not make use of it, but were charged anyway. There was even a sign by check in desk promoting it. This program should be discontinued, it was a very frustrating experience.

This is a great place, so close to every tourist spot, we go to NY at least twice a year, we met friends we haven't seen in a very very long time and it was convenient, they charge $35 dollars for breakfast (crazy) but if you signup for Marriott rewards before you arrive they give it to you for free, if you don't get free breakfast don't worry, there are so many options around this place, you will not be disappointed, rooms are a good size for NY we had a bad shower but who cares, don't clean up... LOL ask for a room up on the higher floors... so quiet!

This was our 3rd time staying at the Marriott Eastside. From the valet and bell hop to the front desk staff, they all have great service. The front desk sent us some milk and cookies to our kids. It's these little touches that set them apart from the rest. We are looking forward to our 4th visit next year!

Nice enough room in Hotel in a great location. That said I felt the Staff displayed 'attitude' that I wasn't expecting. We arrived quite early (about 2) and the room was still not available at 5. When I went to check at reception I was greeted as if I was being unreasonable. As a gold elite member this was a bit disappointing. As with many other Marriotts the Concierge Lounge offers no hors d'oeuvres in the evening at the weekend (Friday and Saturday night). This was not made clear when booking. Breakfast in the lounge was average - if you're happy with plastic cutlery and crockery.

We greatly enjoyed our two-night stay at this Marriott. Very centrally located--we walked everywhere--large rooms, clean, and with unusually good water pressure in the bathroom, which we appreciated. Our room was very quiet despite the central location, which was wonderful. The staff was friendly and the rooms were quite nice. Based on some other reviews I expected things to look a bit more shabby or dated, but that was not the case at all. It would have earned five stars from me except for two inconviences--one small, one large. The small inconvenience is that during busy times you can sometimes wait a VERY long time for an elevator. Since we were on the 17th floor, this was not something we could easily avoid. The larger incovenience was that there was no free wifi in the hotel. Wifi could be had for $17/day. I believe this is not on par with modern industry standards.

Pleasant lobby and great checkin. Friendly staff and housekeeping . Rooms are good size for New York and quiet. Blackout curtains so late arrivals can sleep undesturbed. Excellent location with good places to eat and the United Nations right down the street. On the negative side the ironing board is a joke, don't plan on a good result if u need to iron a business shirt. Can't believe they wouldn't spend a couple of dollars for a decent one. The tub curtain just won't stay put, sorry Marriott I tried but water everywhere. On the good side great pressure on the 5th floor. The floor mat was hung on the bath towel curtain rod inside the tub. Used a towel till I got in shower then found it. Probably good to put the towel inside and the floor mat on the tub edge like everywhere else. A bit of rust on tub drain, could be touched up. Room 523.Overall nice hotel I liked it.

great location and the hotel is very nice the breakfast and club house were good and if you are a member it is pretty good valuewe went as a family and even though the hotel was packed they managed to squeeze us all in

Largest room we've ever had in NYC. The staff was friendly and helpful, room was clean. The business center required the purchase of wi-fi and printing. I don't often use this service so perhaps this is typical. I wouldn't have minded but I only needed to print 1 page & the minimum purchase is $5. Other than that, our stay was very enjoyable!

We visited in July for visiting NYC and found New York Marriott East side very conveniently located to the most popular NY destinations - Times Square, theater district, UN and also conveniently near Grand Central station to go to many other destinations.Check-in was smooth. We arrived early on Friday in the morning at 10am. Though our reservation was much later in the day, the front desk clerk was excellent to find us a room which allowed us to freshen up before we headed out. The hotel was located in a good location which made it easy to maximize the day sightseeing whether its by subway, cab, bus or walking. The rooms were small and clean. The elevators in this hotel are very slow and sometimes the wait was 5 minutes. Breakfast is pricey, being a buffet, but there are many good restaurants and fast food places near by. There is a bar / restaurant in the lobby, but the coffee was avoidable.A surprise was the fitness room on the top floor. Not only did it have a good view of the city but the equipment - ellipticals, tread mill, free weights - was sufficiently equipped.I wish they had a few water bottles in the room.

As many others have mentioned, this hotel is partially updated and partially 80's Marriott. The M Lounge was nice, as was any staff we encountered. Our room was tiny & dated- we had a double for 2 adults & 2 kids (10,7) and we could barely fit all of our luggage. That being said, I would definitely stay here again for the location & price. We had considered paying more than twice the price to stay at the Marriott Marquis Times Square and were so glad we did not once we got there. The East Side Marriott is in an ideal location. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square (without being in the madness of it) and Grand Central Station as well as several other subway stops just a few blocks away.

This is a reliable Marriott property in midtown. A few years ago it underwent some exterior renovation which made it something to avoid, but the work is done and it has all of the amenities one comes to expect in the chain. The lobby is still a bit antiquated and tired, but the rooms are clean and (for NY) spacious. The fact that it is walking distance to Grand Central and the UN are real plusses. I also believe that you can get some very nice rates over the weekend.

I'm a fan of Marriott hotels and use them often for both work and pleasure. This hotel has the usual Marriott pluses, of which a friendly and helpful staff is the most important to me. But it is looking a little tired and needs a face lift for the money. The lobby and reception area is not very inviting. The wall paper in the room we were in was peeling. The lounge was so full on a Saturday morning that getting breakfast - let alone finding a table to eat it at - was a challenge. Against this, the location is great and the staff helpful. So, ok if you're stuck but won't provide the surroundings you might want for a nice NY weekend break. Will try the courtyard next time which I'm told is recently refurbished.

This hotel is in a good position to Times Square, GC station, Broadway etc.My current room is a king and it's a decent size. Small bathroom though.The bar downstairs doesn't open till 5 which I find a bit odd.This place doesn't do room service as such but you can order a meal from downstairs 'to go' and they will package it up as a take away so you can bring it to your room.My current room is quite noisy with the traffic and a very loud air con.I will be moving to a twin room tonight so I'm hoping it might be a bit quieter.The reception staff are friendly and helpful as are the door men.The lifts are a bit slow, especially at breakfast time.All in all its good, better then average.

Location is great. You are close to Times Square, Grand Central and the Chrysler Building. Staff is incredible, especially in the M Club. 10/10 recommend staying here. The corner rooms are big, but you will hear honking and sirens in the middle of the night.

Good location in Midtown East. I did online checkin so our room was ready early! We came to see Hamilton and it was an easy 30 minute walk to Broadway. The room was small but the beds were very comfortable! I didn't really care for the woodsy smelling toiletries though. Elevators were slow. We were on the 7th floor, so by the time we got an elevator to go down, it was full. So allow extra time and maybe ride it up first if you need to!

I was in NYC for a conference and was able to stay at this hotel. When I first got there we decided to valet the car. It cost $75 which I thought was a little high but that's the going cost when ur in the city. The check in went rather fast and painless. The rooms are nice and clean just on the smaller size. The hotel is in walking distance to a lot of things. The valet guy named Jim was great. Over all I would def recommend this hotel and stay there again.

I have 600,000 Marriott points. I was put in a room next to the air conditioning units for part of the hotel. When I called to say that it was keeping me awake, I was told, "yeah, well, We're all full."  I called the manager. She said, "I'm sorry that should not have happened."  The situation was not resolved. I had feared the merger would be bad. It has proven a disaster. For me to give a Marriott only three stars is painful. It used to be so easy to speak so well of Marriott properties.

We stayed overnight to attend a wedding. The hotel is well-located and the staff is friendly and attentive. The elevators are slow and crowded. Allow extra time, especially if you are on an upper floor. Also, reaching the fitness center on 35 requires 3 elevators if you are staying below floor 16.

I have stayed in this hotel in July 17 during a business trip.Good things first, this hotel has a great location with all attractions and major banks close. The M lounge is updated and looks refurbished. I had a good night sleep as well and rooms are rather big.What makes it average: The rooms are very dated and in the old 1980's Marriott standard. Waiting times for lifts are feeling like ages (sometimes up to 5-7min).After check in I found plastic packaging of a previous guest in the room. The M club serves all drinks only in paper cups and there is no bar service. Worst thing was that I have asked for an umbrella to borrow and door men laughed at me saying 'we don't do this in this hotel', which I found is poor standard.In summary, good location but too many flaws for Marriott brand. The courtyards around Penn provide better value for money.Will I come back to the Marriott East side - No.

We spent four days here for a fun grandkid trip this past week. I have previously stayed at this hotel and readily returned. Great location--couple blocks to Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Station, and all the city that you can reach from the nearby subway entrances. The area is business oriented and has a multitude of eateries in the vicinity including Ashley's Fine Foods, a 24 hour take-away across the street. As a Platinum member, we had access to the M Lounge which had a hearty breakfast and evening hors' dourves, a place to sit and relax outside of the room, and attentive staff. I look forward to returning when it is the next grandkid's turn.

So as a good hotel in good location this was totally fine. But had no wow factor and felt a little dates.wifi was great, beds great, service very good but air-con was noisy (at least to start with) and our bathroom needs some maintenance. Felt it was expensive for what it was - but I guess you pay for location. Would go again but before I did I would shop around as it did not wow me at all.

Nice older hotel in excellent NYC downtown location with easy walk or short cab ride to many tourist and shopping locations. As with most older hotels now very limited electric outlets for all our electronic devices. Poor lighting in the rooms and window views are varied and with limited light sources. Breakfast buffet expensive but coffee and bakery option in the lobby. Excellent service personnel and very helpful and prompt.

This was my first time staying at the Marriott East Side and I was very happy with every aspect of my stay. The staff were excellent, very attentive and quick to respond. We used the concierge lounge, it was very clean and plenty of choices for breakfast. I will stay here again.

Family of four stayed at the NY Marriott East Side for four days and it was a perfect stay. The hotel has that old school art deco NY hotel feel to it and the property is showing its age but the great location, decent room size (for NY City), the services in the concierge lounge, and the incredibly friendly staff more than make up for any shortcomings. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Rockerfeller Center and about a 15-20 minute walk to Central Park so the location is great if you're there as a tourist. The staff at the hotel went above and beyond to make sure our stay was great. Good suggestions on everything from transportation options to where to go to get the best view of the fireworks for Fourth of July. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to NYC.

The hotel was a fine place to stay for a quick trip to the city. Nothing special- rooms were plain, lobby was plain, service was fine. The location was great. We were just steps from Grand Central and close walk to all the major sites. Overall the hotel just seemed dated. The elevators were old and small, the hotel room was quite large for a NYC hotel, but is in desperate need of a facelift. Beds were mediocre- I have definitely slept in better. Our duvet was also pretty dingy- glad I didn't notice it until I woke up the next day. I looked on their site and it looks like they have some rooms that are 'premier' and a little more up dated, but we had booked the standard double bedded room and you could tell it had not been renovated in a very very long time.Bathrooms especially need some help. That might have been the worst and longest shower I have ever taken in my life. I am 5'2" so the shower head was perfect height for me, but not for my 6'1" husband who had to bend to get his head wet. The water pretty much trickled out- I have very thick hair and need some pressure to wash all the shampoo/conditioner out.... so that's why it was the longest shower ever... not because I enjoyed it. Then I went to blow dry my hair and the handle on the blow dryer was sticky. So this Marriott gets a 2 star rating from me because it is not the worst I have stayed in by any means, but it really was just below average. I slept fine and the room worked for what we needed... but come on Marriott- you can do better.

We (family of four) stayed here for one night. We had requested an early check in as we were arriving after a long distance flight. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready for early check in at 11am. That made it so convenient.The rooms are of decent size. Our stay there was very comfortable.The hotel us very conveniently located and we could walk around and cover many key attractions nearby. Also there are plenty of restaurants and take away places nearby.Overall we enjoyed our stay here.

Clean and Neat, very Professional team and good location...Just 10 minutes from central station...The gym is ok, but it have a beautiful view...If you want to take a Trip to New York to discover around this is your place

Great Marriot service which always makes a trip pleasant. It's about a 25 minute walk away from Central Park and about the same to Broadway. We like walking so this was perfect for us. We had a corner room which has a nice NYC view if you stopped. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. The rooms were small but that is standard in NYC and I thought these were larger than average. There was a small fridge, kettle, safe and iron in the room.I would happily stay here again!

I stayed at the Marriott East Side for a week when in New York on business. The good:- Location very convenient for those meeting with various financial institutions whose offices are in midtown. Also convenient to Grand Central and several subway stations. - Many good places to eat very close to the hotel.- Staff were friendly and efficient on check-in - Rooms were (for New York) spacious- Fitness centre is pretty well equipped - Bed and pillow was comfortable.The bad:- Rooms had only small windows and limited internal lighting so they felt dark. Not great given that I spent a fair amount of time working in the room. - Airconditioning was noisy (I turned it off at night to sleep more easily)- My room always smelt musty although there was no detectable dampness.Overall... I will try somewhere else next time I'm in New York but if you stay here (especially if you are not spending much time in the room) you might find it fine.

The property itself was clean and the rooms, while quite small, were very comfortable, if a little noisy. The staff was very friendly. They made a mistake with our room rate, but they fixed it after we brought it to their attention. Had we left without checking our bill- I'm not sure it would have been as easy to fix. The location itself was really convenient.

The hotel is an older building in NYC, so we didn't expect it to look like the brand new Marriotts we might stay at elsewhere in the country (we've been at many). That could easily take down the rating for many I know, but I like to consider where I am vs. what every other Marriott looks like. The hotel was clean and the staff (mostly) extremely friendly (just one guy in the lounge was a little grumpy one day). The location is close to everything, but we did walk about 95% of the time so I'm not sure what it would be like to pay for a taxi or Uber from this location. We spoke with many of the concierge and they were all beyond friendly and helpful. The lounge was a huge benefit for us and was always stocked with good options. We wanted to give a HUGE online Thank You to Kenda the concierge. One evening we went up to see what desserts were out and started talking with the concierge in the lounge. My daughter couldn't have the option because she is gluten-free. She's a teen and used to this and was perfectly fine with that, but Kenda felt bad there wasn't anything for her. She started asking questions about what type of desserts would qualify as gluten-free and apparently did some research and found a macaron place nearby because a day later in our room was a package of macarons for our daughter to enjoy. You really don't see this type of customer service on a regular basis. She went above and beyond to make our stay just that much nicer. It was completely unnecessary and unexpected. Thanks Kenda and Marriott East Side!!

I recently stayed for 6 nights at this hotel for a business trip. Staff were very friendly and when I arrived at the hotel the television wasn't working correctly. After having a maintenance man visit I was told it was not fixable and so I was moved swiftly to an alternative room. The rooms felt a little like they were partially refurbished with new beds / TVs etc but with things like the decor, doors, windows, and the safe feeling like they had been in situ for some time. I believe I was in a standard room (which was a bit of a disappointment as I am a Marriott Gold card holder and they should upgrade you if they have availability). It was a decent size although the bathroom was very small. As the building is old, the room shape was a little quirky :-)For those who like to use room service be aware that there is no room service at this property. However they let me order via phone from the restaurant and then I just ran down to collect it :-) I can recommend the Macaroni cheese. The Executive Lounge was generally pretty busy (the hotel is fairly close to a number of office locations so is a prime option for business travellers) but there was a choice of hot food and cold items at breakfast time plus juices, yoghurts, pastries, bagels etc. I didn't check out the evening offering but did nip in to get a bottle of water most evenings. The lounge also has TVs with news running to keep you occupied whilst you eat.

This a nice hotel. Comfortable beds and clean rooms. Staff if friendly and very helpful. They are great at remembering your name. Was on the 26th floor pretty quiet for NYC. Had a bite at the restaurant. Meat had a lot of flavor.

Located on the east side near Lexington and 50th this Marriott is an older property but the hotel is quiet, comfortable and really good service. It has a great location within easy walking distance of Times Square, but outside of the gravitational pull of time square zaniness.

I'll keep it short. I'm a frequent business traveler and in the city for 8-16 weeks per year for the foreseeable future. I'm wrapping up a roughly seven week stretch (weekends home) this week and this hotel has impressed, as always.Front desk staff are always friendly and accommodating. Rooms are comfortable. Housekeeping is excellent. If you have status with Marriott and are able to use the concierge lounge, it's the best I've run into. The concierge lounge and management are incredibly helpful and friendly. Bell men out front are the best. Once they get to know your face you'll get a nice, "Welcome back" from them as they see you approaching with your luggage. Small things like that matter when you spend a lot of time away from home travelling. When I come into the city and can't get into the Marriott East Side, It's just not as good.Thank you Marriott East Side.

This was our second time staying here in two months. Both are in the lower floor rooms. Based on carpet and hallway appearances, our guess is just upper floor rooms have been renovated. Our rooms were slightly dated but everything is working fine. We got a large corner room at previous stay (see pics). Got a much smaller room this time.The difference was dramatic. Even the smaller room has a good design making the most out of a tight space. So as the small and cramped bathroom. It's just that we had a bigger room before. We knew how much better it could be. Location on the midtown east by a cluster of hotels on Lexington and 48th st. is OK depending on your needs. They are close enough to midtown shopping and attractions. We prefer midtown west or time square area better but hotels tend to cost more there.
user_name:
CliveNYC
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Every year around the month of June I spend a week in New York City and stay at this hotel. I have been doing that for at least twenty years.Although the hotel is not perfect nor fancy and also doesn't have an specific character it is very correct and specially very convienint specially due to its location. Subway station is just one block away and all the main attractions can be done by foot.Besides that the receptionists are friendly and helpful for a New York City standard.The rooms are on the small side and beginning to show its age and the cleaning also needs to be improved but on the other side are still very comfortable.This year I stayed there one week also but this time I want to specially thank Angela Cooper the guest relations. Thanks to her I could check in early after a long 9 hour night flight arriving at the hotel at 9AM did not have to wait in the lounge until 4PM like some years before...

Stayed at the Marriott East Side on a Monday & Tuesday night. Love the location of this hotel as it is central to a wide variety of Midtown activities and businesses.Compliments to Pauline at the registration desk. She was very courteous and professional in the several conversations I had with her over two days. My room was ready when I arrived (3PM) and was very clean and neat. Nothing I would have changed. My room was generous size for Manhattan though it lacked a view which I knew when I accepted the room. Daily room service was very good. All amenities worked well and the iron, hair dryer and refrigerator came in handy. I was on a lower floor so the elevator wait times were not a big issue for me. I do like the staggered elevator routine with certain elevators serving higher floors.The four stars is indicative of meeting my expectations and nothing that wowed me during my stay, nothing over the top. Highly recommended overall.

We moved to Marriot from another hotel, we wanted something special for our 25th anniversary. Marriot met our wishes, we were very satisfied with everything. The bed was really comfortable. The last day we had breakfast for free, and were allowed to a late check out. Polite and cheerful staff made us feel welcome. We loved the area, a short walk from 5th, and with a lot of restaurants nearby. Two different subway lines are within a seven minute walk.

We love to stay here on our visits to NYC. Good location, close to most everything; but still fairly quiet compared to Times Square. Rooms are good sized and there have been a number of updates over the years. Concierge Lounge is one of the best available.

Our experience at this Marriott was completely underwhelming and quite disappointing. Of course in New York you expect high prices and small sizes, but this hotel is very dated, dirty, and rooms are tiny. Our room had plug plates falling off of the walls (had to be a safety hazard), non-working outlets on the desk/desk lamp, and very dirty window sills and windows. The provided hairdryer was disgusting and looked like it had never been cleaned (covered in hair, dust, dirt, and hairspray). Road noise, while expected to a degree, was also bad. The bathroom was insanely small and had water damage on the ceiling and walls and dirt everywhere. The service was disappointing too. One member of our party was in need of a hair straightener (a pretty standard beauty/self-care item in this day and age) and the front desk staff was incredulous; like they could not believe we would request such a thing. They flatly pointed us to the closest Duane Reade with no apology. In addition, on check-in the staff provided no information about a business center, gym, breakfast or gift shop information, etc. I look younger than I am and feel that being treated this way might have had something to do with that (frustrating in itself). But I was staying on business and was interested in those services provided by the hotel. Thankfully, the price and location was great but I would definitely look elsewhere first next time.

This hotel was perfect for us . It was centrally located for everything. It meant walking but that was fine. Grand Central Station is just a couple of blocks away so the subway can be reached from there. Times Square and Broadway are also within easy walking distance. Th rooms are fine but just a little tired. I was surprised that the elevator to room levels did not need you to use you room key.

This is a nice clean hotel in a great location. Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, Theatre District, Etc. and subway stations close by for access to other areas. Paulina at the front desk is awesome and took great care of us! She got us a nice quite room with free card access to the breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor and always greeted us with a smile every time we came or left for four days. Very nice stay in NYC!

I'm a hotel snob, and tend to be hypercritical about air, space and cleanliness. This Marriott is somewhere in the middle of acceptable -- because it's New York. Price was reasonable, room was small (for an extra large King), windows didn't open and the room smelled old. Bed was comfortable. Not enough pillows and I'm too neurotic to use the extra ones in the closet. Everything was clean, but not sparkling. The staff was aloof and not particularly welcoming. But it's New York.  The surrounding area is good for a less insane part of the city, which I prefer. You won't fall in love here, but it's totally functional and won't give you bedbugs or nightmares... because it's New York.

I'm not sure about upgraded rooms but I stayed in a standard room for a business trip and it was pretty bad. The bathtub flooring was coming off the bottom and the fact that the room was directly facing a wall of a building, it felt like a 350 sq prison (zero sunlight and dark). The bed was also caving in the middle and the carpet felt damp all the time. The front desk service was terrible as they acted like they did not want to be there. During check-out, I tried to address some of the issues but the front desk asked if I received my bill under the door. When I told them I did, they just said ok that's all they need and thanks for staying with them. In my opinion, for the price, there are better places to stay in the city.

A centrally located hotel not too far from most of central New York. A few blocks from the subway. The room was large although we thought the beds were on the smaller sided. Safe, refrigerator and coffee machine all in the room. No charge for leaving hand luggage on the day of departure.

I arrived early at the hotel, 10:30am, having already used the mobile app for checkin, the process was very smooth. On the front desk they explained the lounge and I was even able to grab breakfast as it ran until 11:00am, which was great as I had checked out of the Marriott in Baltimore Waterfront before breakfast had started being served to get to New York early.The hotel itself is in a great location, I love the fact you are right there in the centre of Manhattan island.Lounge was large and selection for breakfast was not bad, with egg, sausage, cereals, yogurts, oatmeal, fruit juice, coffee, water and other soft drinks. Was also able to charge my electronics while I ate with convenient usb / power sockets at some locations.After breakfast I checked out my room, 29th floor, for a New York location room size was good, with a view of Chrysler building. Then it was off sight seeing, I enjoy walking and it's central location was great, you can also grab the subway which was close by or a cab from outside the hotel.When I got back I checked out the gym, just to see it, great views from the 35th floor, and various machines, not a huge gym but okay for a quick workout.I was traveling alone, quick break between business meetings and I would recommend the hotel, staff were helpful and friendly, location was great and hotel was clean.

Just a decent hotel on Lex. Like many NYC hotels, this one looks a little outdated but otherwise it's comfortable and does the job when you're in the city for business.The room is just the same as any other Marriott room, no surprises there. I wonder why they don't get rid of those synthetic bathtub curtains -- just what's wrong with (plexi-)glass?. I stayed at this hotel twice and I'd stay there again. You can't really miss with Marriott -- it does the job alright and staff were friendly and super-helpful.To be honest, it's not as nice as W Hotel a few steps up on Lex -- that is a fact.But the rooms are larger at Marriott and so is the lobby, the bed and everything.

I quite like this hotel and the location is excellent - just down road from the Subway (51st and Lex Av). So easy to get up or downtown on the Green 4, 5 & 6 line and also to get back to Pen Station, Times Square/Theatre District, Village or Soho area on the Blue A, C & E. Staff were friendly on arrival, no issues checking in. The lobby has a feeling of old charm. The hotel is perhaps in need of a modern day makeover, but I had no complaints. The corridors, carpets and bedroom doors do look a bit dated, but the bedroom itself was fine. Pictures posted by guests on Trip Advisor are reflective of what you'll get.We got a great rate in advance for a Friday night a few weeks ago and jumped at this one. The room we had was pleasant, bright, spacious and clean. Some reviews say they are small rooms, but if you look at the guests pictures where someone has photographed the floor plan from the back of the hotel door, you can see how varied they are. We were in a square corner room. Every time we've been at this property, it's been in a corner room with double aspect - purely by chance, so this is my only experience I can comment on. There was plenty of drawer space, a chair by the bed, a separate desk and chair, built in wardrobe and working safe. The room even had an empty fridge. It didnt have a mini bar with contents, but I prefer this. There was also an in-room coffee maker. This room size would be great if you were here for a few days or a week's visit. You could easily unpack.Even the bathroom was a descent size. There was a massive shower head in the bathroom (like the sort that comes down from the ceiling but in this case, it was attached to the wall and the water pressure amazing. A real wake up and not the usual dribble I was expecting! Bathroom had the usual Marriott Amenities - hair shampoo, conditioner, body lotion etc.Room had good air con and it wasn't noisy. We were on the 18th floor, so we didn't hear much road traffic noise, except the odd police siren, so I suspect the windows are not that soundproof, but up high, that's not an issue. If you are in the inner section of the hotel, in one of the U's, so you face the building you will loose the view but I suspect it's quieter.The bed was large, clean and very comfortable.We are Marriott Gold so had free internet access and access to the Lounge on the second level. Of all the hotel clubs, this is my favorite. This hotel's club was also open on a Saturday morning for a really decent breakfast - cold and hot items. There was also free water, cold sodas and a coffee machine in the lounge. Access to the lounge was available throughout our stay (some hotels shut their lounges at weekends and just offer points instead, so it was really great bonus, particularly in NYC).Would I stay here again - yes!

This is an annual visit to NYC. The rooms are on the small side but that's typical for NYC. Service is good and the workers were all friendly. Check-in was efficient. Being Marriott Rewards members we were very happy to get a room on the quiet side.

This is a full service Marriott and it lives up to its reputation. It is in a quieter area of midtown, which is a huge plus for us. Walking distance to all midtown sites - Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th Avenue, Broadway and great restaurants!

We stayed at this hotel for 8 days and could not fault the staff for helpfullness regarding any issues. Show and cab bookings were made with ease. The rooms were spacious and very clean with all facilities required. Being centrally located, we could walk to most places and the tube was cose by if needed. There was no specific dining room but a great cheap eatery is across the road. All in all a great experience and we would return there again.

I don't write a lot of reviews but decided to write one for the staff of this hotel. I had a couple minor issues when I got to my room after checking in. I called to let the hotel staff know and the issues were addressed immediately. While addressing issues, I received a call offering to change my room. Since the issues were being addressed, I declined. Later, I received another call to make sure everything was taken care of. After returning to my room from dinner, I was greeted with a plate of snacks and a bottle of wine. A true example of great customer service!

We were there for a very quick weekend trip. The location was convenient in the middle of Midtown and an easy walk to several attractions. We were thrilled the restaurant bar was still open when we arrived at 11 pm Friday night and again Sat evening when we came back from the theater. The elevators are super small but the rooms are sizable for a family of three. There was a bodega on the next bock and also a wine shop but not a convenient "quick bite." We loved the M club on the second level with drinks and yogurt all day as well as breakfast and evening snacks. We would absolutely stay here again.

I have stayed here several times because the location is unbeatable. The help at the front desk is also courteous. Wifi, even for "gold" guests, is inadequate--in and out even for simple sending of emails.While the hotel and rooms could use a bit of an update, I wil stay there again--location, location, location!

Overall, The hotel is in a great location and has a beautiful lobby. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. However, we could hear street noise and construction all night long through the thin windows. The cleaning staff entered our room without knocking at 8:30 and woke us up. So, we didn't have the best rest and learned to always use the privacy door tag!

My wife and I travel to New York City often and Marriott on Lexington is at the top of the list. This was our first stay at this location, we had a corner rooftop suite and it was well worth the cost. The suite also gave us access to the Marriott Club which serves breakfast daily, and offers beverages and snacks throughout the day. Wonderful staff, great city views, and convenient location. Our next stay has already been booked here.

Elegant old-style hotel in midtown East, convenient to subway, and many attractions within walking distance. Friendly and easy check-in. The hallways could use an update, but the rooms are very nice. Small gym on the very top floor. One minor negative: the breakfast buffet room (for those with breakfast included rates) tends to get very crowded at times.

We had a great stay at this property. I was with my sister in law and two nieces to celebrate a bday/high school graduation. Denise at the front desk was wonderful at check in and all of the staff during the whole stay were awesome! Room was clean and we had no complaints at all. We loved the location, close to subway stations and Rockefeller center area. Both concierge we talked to were fabulous. Will definitely stay at this property again.

We reserved two rooms for our family weekend. Some of us were arriving very early; the hotel was very accommodating and allowed early check in, in one room for luggage and freshening up. Breakfast is varied and good. Convenient location--easy walk to theater district, and Grand Central. Easy subway or bus to museums and restaurants. We would recommend this hotel.

The Marriott East Side is located in a fabulous part of the city. There are many wonderful restaurants and lovely places for cocktails within a block or 2. This location makes getting around NYC extremely easy, even by subway. The staff is very friendly and the guest rooms were spacious and clean. I would stay here again, no question.

very comfortable room, bed, sitting chair; friendly staff; nice walking neighborhood with stores, restaurants and pubs. I was able to check in at 230 PM. Very nice bathroom with high-end toiletries. Welcoming check-in person named Joshua

I've stayed at the New York Marriott East Side on three separate visits and have enjoyed my stay each time. It's close to Grand Central Station (7 blocks) and walking distance to the Theatre district (a fifteen-minute walk) and close to 3 subway lines/stations. The hotel lobby is small but adequate. I have waited in line to check in but it was not a problem or long wait. Rooms are small but comfortable. The beds, as in all Marriotts, are quite comfortable. The bathroom is small but adequate. The staff was friendly. I requested more hangers and the housekeeping staff was very accommodating. Breakfast in the club dining room was a good buffet type breakfast. Wi-fi was adequate. The business center had some problems. Two of the computers were not working and I had to wait a while for anyone to assist me. I ended up walking into a room with employees to ask for help. I was helped but had I not walked in, I don't think anyone would have been aware of the problem. Overall, I've had pleasant stays here and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Went for daughter birthday and needed (wanted) a hotel room with 2 bathrooms. That is REALLY hard to find, especially affordable.The Marriott Eastside fit the bill! You really can't go wrong with a Marriott brand and this was no different. Because of the birthday, I called ahead and asked about champaign and strawberries and of course they had them waiting!The location was very convenient for where we wanted to go, the staff was friendly and attentive, the room was clean, fresh and well kept.Would stay here again, no doubt.

This is a great hotel for easy access to theater and the main sites in the city. The Concierge Lounge, unlike other Marriott properties is open weekends. Great breakfast. Decent exercise facilities. Elevators probably need a computer programming upgrade, but the hotel is overall wonderful.

Fantastic, clean close to all the shops and reasonable for NYC.Fridge,coffee machine in room.Stayed here several times all a good experience highly recommended.The staff were very helpful and satisfied all our needs and were checked in on time, which is a plus if you've been traveling all day.

Stayed at the Marriott NYC East Side for two nights on business and arrived at the hotel mid-evening and had to queue to collect my room key, having already checked in via the mobile app. There was only one person manning the front desk and had to queue for about 10 minutes, which is fairly unacceptable for any hotel especially one in a busy city like New York.I've been on the road a couple of days and just felt like relaxing in my room, catching up with some emails and eating room service; however this property doesn't provide an in-room dining experience!The room was very ugly, two tiny windows looking into an alley and probably the smallest bathroom I've ever been in. The room wasn't very well appointed and appeared to need updating.Internet was not free, this was $17-20 per day, unless you booked via the Marriott site/app but as a business traveller this isn't possible as we use a corporate travel agent. In this day and age, Internet should be free at all hotels, regardless of which channel you book from.I've stayed at the Doubletree (one block away) which was better experience; given the expanse of New York City and the options/choices available, I'll probably stay elsewhere upon my return for business and/or pleasure.

When we travel most times we stay at a Marriott, unfortunately, this Marriott was the worst Marriott we have stayed in for many reasons. The elevators are so small and SLOW, and was uncomfortable when the elevators were packed. Many couples in the elevator also shared their concerns too with the hotel. For starters, I booked our trip with Marriott Vacations and am disappointed with Management on the outcome of our complaints. When we thought we were getting a rollaway bed brought to our room, there was a couch that opened into a bed but this was horrible, the bed opened up against our bed and for the other person on the other side of the bed had to get up to use restroom etc, had to climb over the bed, there was no room at all in this room to walk around and my husband is disabled. The rooms are outdated. In addition to that we heard a leak/drip in the shower all night long which my husband took a video. The most horrific part of this was when security banged on our door early the next morning and asked for ID because he thought we didn't belong in that room. He scared the heck out of us, I could not attend the seminar that Marriott Vacation was holding because I was so upset. I will say that the front desk moved us into another room after all we went through, NOT Marriott Vacation. Upon returning from our trip, I called Marriott Vacation to complain about our stay and what I was told was that they would not charge us for the difference in rate change for room for not attending the seminar. I cannot believe we were not compensated in points or something for all that we went through. I must also add when I booked my stay, I was told there was 16 rooms available with two beds and when I call back in a month to pay there would be rooms available and there WERE NOT. This was the beginning of our nightmare, that where the rollaway bed came into the story.A disappointed Marriott customer for sure.

If you're in town for tourism, take my advice and stay away from the chaos of Times Square. A short walk from Grand Central, the Lexington Avenue area offers the perfect alternative because it's close enough that you can walk to 5th Avenue, Times Square and if you're up for a longer walk, Central Park. What makes this location the best is the easy access to many excellent (non-tourist) restaurants on 2nd & 3rd avenues. The Marriott East Side is one of a good number of hotels in the area. I can't tell you how it compares to those others, as this is the hotel where we usually stay. The people are friendly, the rooms are on the small side (but aren't most in NYC) If the hotel is full, the small elevators can be an issue, which is the only reason for 4 stars and not 5

This is an older property, but the service is second to none. From check in to check out, it as all top notch.We were originally given a room with the view of a brick wall, literally...a brick wall. However, I take some of the responsibility for that as they got us into a room at 11am, well before the official check in time. I checked back in with them later in the day, and we received a great room. Much larger and a better view.

If you don't want to read my whole review, here is a pros and cons list:PROS - mattress, staff (housekeeping and M Club Lounge), location, breakfast buffet, lack of street noise CONS - Room 2802 (window, brick wall view, lighting, TV)This is my first time staying at this hotel. We usually stay at a hotel one block south (a Marriott affiliate) but I felt like I needed a little change so I went with the New York Marriott East Side. We got there around 9:30pm after driving in from Boston and check in was great. I was assured that we would have a king bed room. The man at the desk (was very pleasant) said something along the lines of, "you'll be in a great room on a high floor". I assumed this meant a great view. Clearly I was wrong in assuming that. We were up on the 28th floor (2802) to be exact. When I entered the room I realized how dark it was, even with the light on (this light would no longer turn on by the end of the trip). The room was a decent size for NYC. I walked over to the only window in the corner of the room to look at the "view". I opened the blinds to find....a brick wall staring right back at me. We went out to walk around for a bit and came back around 11pm and my husband wanted to catch some updates from the NFL Draft. Something kept happening with the TV and it kept freezing and you couldn't even turn the TV off. My husband had to keep getting up and UNPLUGGING the TV every 5 minutes to get in unfrozen. The next morning we went into the M Club Lounge for a nice buffet brunch. The staff in the Lounge and also the housekeeping staff were some of the nicest people here!!! We stayed for 2 nights and left on Sunday. I do have to make sure to include the bed in our room was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We called the hotel on the way home to see what kind of bed it was but they just told us to look at shopmarriott.com (which did not have the manufacturer information).

This hotel is mediocre at best. Nothing unique or novel. I don't know what it is trying to be. Had better service at the Courtyard brand, which is pretty comparable to this. The staff is pretty nonchalant and rude. No room service. The "Club" severed hot dogs... Yes, hot dogs. The Wifi was $17.00... Yes, $17.00. I know it's NYC, but seriously?! Wish I had stayed at the W across the street.

Love this Hotel we return year after year. And will be back whenever we return to NYC. Close to everything we want to see and go to.Please don't make me more than I want to.Stop so you want my review or not?

I opted to stay at the Marriott East Side as it was closer to where some of my meetings were and I try to stick within the Marriott brand. Let me begin by saying that the staff were quite friendly and always trying to be helpful - I almost went to four stars simply because of the staff but in the end, the hotel itself moved the rating down. Rooms are decent sized for New York - however, they look like they have not been remodeled in years. Shower heads are placed for someone under 5'10" and my room had a window that was constantly covered in condensation. Would probably not stay at this Marriott again unless I heard that it had been refurbished.

I visit NYC once or twice a year in recent years. I've stayed in several hotels in various neighbourhoods over the years. For some time now I've stayed exclusively at Marriotts but only stayed at the Marriott East Side for the first time recently. Different neighbourhoods have their own pluses but in the final analysis I like Midtown. This hotel will likely be my first choice for some time to come. Naturally access to the subway is convenient but don't assume travel on the subway will always be quick, allow enough time to get from A to B. It's easy to get from JFK to the hotel by subway but it will be crowded in rush hour. Grand Central Terminal is a 15 minute or so walk.Being an Elite Member lounge access is a perk that's important to me. It's always a bit of a mystery which lounges are open on which days. Some close on weekends others are open every day. The lounge here is open daily for breakfast and evening light meal. All my interactions with staff were pleasant. The room was fine. The hotel seemed well maintained but it is a heritage type property.

Such a tired hotel. I can appreciate the vintage styling of old school NY, but the aging carpets, furniture, light fixtures, etc.. that is not vintage, that is just neglect. Stayed this past Friday and was so disappointed. This hotel is in desperate need of a refresh and by no stretch should be a category 8. Another huge disappointment was the M Club. This cannot hold a candle to other M Club experiences I have had. Even though it is open 24 hours there are no snacks Fri-Sun. The only thing I saw was a Nature Valley granola bar which was gone later in the evening. If I had paid an extra $100 for "access" I would have been looking for a refund. What are people paying for on the weekends? In addition to the limited amenities, the setting was simply repurposed conference space with the room divider pulled open. This is the 1st M Club in NYC and it makes the new lounge concept seem like a scam.

The hotel is in a nice location - good point for walking, catching a cab, or taking the subway to all parts of the city. Decent foot traffic so as to feel safe pretty much all hours of the day and night. There are doormen and someone was always at the front desk so that is a good thing. Plenty of food and shopping close by. There is a sales counter for Marriott vacations trying to make a sale so unless you are interested, steer clear; it's placed right by the concierge desk and in front of the bar. The bar looked busy, I didn't go in so can't speak to that. The rooms are fine. Not very large but not super small either. Decent size bathroom, again nothing spectacular. Closet, dresser, side tables, plenty of room to unpack and store your things. Also a mini-fridge (not a minbar though, just a fridge to store your things, which is nice actually) and a safe. A single cup coffeemaker as well. The shampoo/soap etc is fine and restocked daily. Decent water pressure but I did start to lose heat and have to adjust before the end of my shower and I'm not a 40 minute shower person. Overall the hotel could use some upgrades - a new coat of paint, etc. Lots of families and groups of friends, also lots of airline staff staying at this hotel. The elevator service was terrible. Tiny and during our 4 day stay it seemed like only one would be working at a time. Truth be told, I booked this hotel because I booked the trip at the last minute and didn't want to pay too much for a long weekend. I doubt that I would stay here again with all the other great options in the city.

I spent five nights in NYC at the Marriott East Side. You couldn't ask for a better location. Close to Grand Central Station, close to shopping and many restaurants, walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre District. The room itself was a disappointment. While I hadn't expected a spacious room (square footage is expensive in NYC), I was disappointed in how dark and dreary it was. The carpet and upholstered chair weren't exactly dirty, but they were dingy. Also, every surface was black: table tops, dresser, desk, bathroom counter. Not only did that add to the oppressive darkness of the room, but it was hard to find objects placed on them: cell phone, iPad, small objects, etc.Although I didn't have to pay for Wi-Fi, I think it's ridiculous that, in this day and age, it isn't offered as a free amenity. The bathroom is small but well lit. No magnifying mirror, and it took me two days before I realized the hairdryer was hanging in a black bag in the closet. The bathroom amenities were very basic: one bar of soap, one shampoo, conditioner and lotion. No shower cap. I travel with my own mirror and shower cap, so I was fine, but be forewarned. The towels were plentiful and thick.What I absolutely hated was the shower. It's a regular tub shower with a bowed-out shower curtain, which is fine, but I think they did one of those remodeling jobs where they place a new tub liner over the old tub. That's the only explanation for the fact that the bottom of the tub is like a large bubble...it moves when you're standing on it! It was like showering while standing up in a canoe! Anyone with even the slightest balance problems will be terrified of it. After a few days, I figured out that if I placed my feet on the outermost edges of the tub floor, I wouldn't feel so insecure. Water pressure was excellent, though. (But I really, really hated the tub.)The elevators were outrageously slow. Now, I understand at peak times this would be a problem, but one had to almost always wait a ridiculous amount of time, regardless of the time of day. Then when the elevator would arrive, it might be so full, you couldn't get on it. Unacceptable.The best part of the Marriott East Side was the M Lounge, but that's only available to people who upgrade. They have wonderful buffet breakfasts (scrambled eggs, scrambled egg-whites with spinach, bacon, potatoes, cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, bagels). Delicious coffee and fresh orange or grapefruit juice. There are always small bottles of water, cans of soda, and small containers of Dannon yogurt available 24 hours. They do more food at dinner time, but I always missed that; ditto the dessert hour. The eating areas in the M Lounge are very nice: some are traditional tables. some are sofa areas, others are counters with stools. This is spread over an area of two fairly large rooms. One morning, I had a lovely conversation with the concierge on duty. I don't mean a brief, "Hello, are you enjoying your stay?" kind of exchange, but a genuine conversation lasting perhaps 10 minutes. Very nice touch, especially when one is traveling alone.So, would I stay at the Marriott East Side again? Perhaps. The lack of room service, the overall dreariness of the room, and the ridiculously long wait for elevators would give me pause. However, the location is great, and the M Lounge was extremely nice (did I mention there's no room service?) There are a lot of other hotels in the area. I might try another one before staying at the Marriott East again. it would depend, of course, on the price.
user_name:
Sai I
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is centrally located. The lobby is clean and the the service and the staff is friendly. The rooms are functional but needs to be renovated. Its a bit dark and gloomy for my taste. It felt like an old hotel and the windows are small. The elevators are also small. However the the concierge lounge accessible to elite members was nice and they served a decent breakfast: Ham, eggs, bagels, pastry...etc and its open 24 hours with water and soda. In the evening they also snacks and cookies and liquor & wine on honor system.

I recently stayed at this hotel along with my teenage daughter and sister in law. I am from California and it was my first trip to New York. Love NYC!!!! The hotel is in a great LOCATION. Centrally located and easy subway access. The concierge, JC, is the best. She helped us navigate the subway system everyday and is so smart and polite. I also left my iPad in the room and Luis shipped it back right away. I don't know why people say New Yorkers aren't friendly. I found them to be appropriately friendly, and not fake!!! I can't wait to go back.

We stayed there as a family of five with three kids. Rooms are not welcoming nor spacious which is usual for New York. Furniture is definitely old and needs to be changed.
