I would rather staying at another hotel with a big party like this. Wi-fi is not included which is not cool. In my mind, it ranks at the bottom of four star hotels.

My comment is on the lobby bar, it would be really nice to have some quick to-go pastries available. We were at the bar, and several individuals came up to the display case & requested a muffin or other pastry. The items in the case are for breakfast only & the bartenders can't sell them. The bartenders did offer the bar menu, but it'd be nice to have brownies, cupcakes, cookies, etc. on display that they could sell.

If you are looking for a simple and clean room in a great location, this hotel is a good option. I wouldn't stay here again for business, but maybe for personal travel if I just wanted a convenient home base. Pros-everyone I interacted with in this hotel was very friendly and helpful-room is clean and fairly large for this area-great location and easy walk to many attractions, restaurants, etc.-coffee shop right in lobby was convenient and had a good selection of food and drinksCons-rooms don't even have bottled water, also no mini-bar and no room service-wifi is not free and it is pretty expensive ($16.95/day or $19.95/day)-we were here for a conference and the meeting rooms didn't even have wifi (the organizers told us it was too expensive)-a little run down and in need of new carpets, updates etc.-printer in business center was not working and the tech support is not on-site, very frustrating as it probably just needs a new cartridge, but I could not get any help with this and had to just give up on printing my train ticket (they did refund the $10 I was charged for less than 5 minutes of computer use!)

Great location close to everything !! The showers were awful. You adjust the water and it quickly went icy cold then scalding hot. There was no in between. I stepped out more than I was in. I was in room 519. Our friends were on the third floor. Several others also had this awful shower. Front desk said there was no issues. I think a small child in this shower would be dangerous. Would not stay here again. Very disappointed in this Marriott.

I've been staying here for work over the last 10 years and while I like the location, m club and lobby, the rooms are in desperate need of updating. While they are cleaned well, everything is so old and worn with a lot of the finish gone from wooden furniture. Hopefully they'll make changes soon, now that the weather is nicer I'll walk further to get a nicer room for the same price.

be back. Small dark noisy room. The only chair in the room is a desk chair. Only one bedside table, peeling stucco on the ceiling, even on the ninth floor the street noise is loud all night, apparently no soundproofing done. On the first day we called to get the safe fixed, five days later it's still broken. Housekeeping staff is very nice especially Bella. I do not feel that this room is up to Marriott standards at all.

Our family of 4 (2 boys ages 15 and 11) took Spring Break in New York City. We elected this hotel because it is in a nice location, I am a Marriott member, and it just off the hustle and constant bustle of Times Square. We got in at 1:00 am after a long travel day. Paulina welcomed us with a bright smile and was so kind. As an Elite member, I asked for an upgrade. Unfortunately, there was a business conference and there wasn't an upgrade available, but she told me to stop back the next day and she'd work something out-and, thankfully, she kept that promise. We got a very nice corner room for the last several nights of our stay. She also made us feel very special every time we saw her. The concierge lounge was great for our family for breakfast. Lots of great options and very delicious. We also stopped up a time or two for happy hour/apps before dinner. It was nice to be able to grab an apple and some waters to snack on throughout our busy tourist days. The concierge, Margaret, was very helpful - she helped us several times. Thanks for the great stay. We loved NYC! I do think if we come back we might choose the Marriott Marquis as we spent a lot of time in that area and with the rainy weather we had most of the week, it would have been nice to be a little more central. But, this hotel was awesome and highly recommended. Paulina was awesome!Try the 212 Steakhouse just a few blocks away. Amazing!!

This Marriott is a good place to stay if you can get a good deal, as it is usually much less expensive than the other Marriott properties in the area. However, if it's not a good deal, just skip it. The rooms are very small and this hotel is not nearly as nice as other Marriotts. Also, we had a huge issue with using the club lounge at this Marriott. It was clear that no one was really monitoring the key swipe in and out of the club lounge, so there were groups that had maybe one room with club lounge access that brought four or five rooms of people along with them. There was never seating available and all the food was gone whenever we got there.

The hotel saving just good location and that the hotel in New York! The price per night is too expensive compare to the conditions of the hotel. The hotel is uncomfortable with Marriott hotels in SEA region where status of Marriott equal to high luxury segment.

I travel to NY frequently for work. This time was for pleasure with the wife and kids and needed more room than usual (NY hotel rooms are smaller than average).The Marriott East Side was great. Ideal location for a December family trip (near Rockafeller Center for the Rockettes, tree, skating). The room was clean, the service was very good and the concierge was helpful. Great views too!Only one minor issue - our toilet backed up twice, but staff responded quickly, so no big deal!I would stay again with the family!

I stayed here for two nights this week and It was fabulous.I had a hi floor with an upgrade, thank you Colette at the front desk The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is friendly.Great locationA winner.

The room was quite small ... the hotel infrastructure in general seemed quite old ... maybe liked by some as vintage ... but not to my liking ... the in house restaurant / food options were not that great ... check in and check out was quite fast though and location wise quite ideal if you want to visit the nearby Time Square and Rock plaza

Stayed here 2 nights to burn up some Marriott points before moving to the Waldrof Astoria which is literally across the road. The rooms are great. Don't like the bar much because it feels too much like you are sitting in the lobby. I have stayed here twice but never had a single meal here. You are spoilt for choice in Manhattan so it doesn't make sense to limit oneself to the hotel.

The Hotel and Rooms feel a little bit tired but the beds are very nice and apart from a reading light and a drawer everything seemed to work properly.Our room was on 49th street and that can be a noisy, but nothing compared to the aircon which makes a lot of noise! It works, but I could not imagine having it switched on during the night (at least not without earplugs). Staff is good, not all smiles, but very efficient. Late checkout was arranged in less than a minute. Location in Midtown is great! I would stay here again, although the aircon needs work.

We were in part of the hotel that wasn't redone and you could tell it was due for updates, but the room was large by NYC standards and adequate. The bed was very soft.It was nice that the club lounge had water, tea, and other beverages and light snacks available, and the gym on the top floor was just what you need for a quick trip.

Full disclosure: I have never been a big fan of Marriott’s beige-bland big box business hotel emphasis. Stripped of character, it can feel like sleeping inside a cardboard box. This is an older renovated hotel, and Marriott, thankfully, has been unable to strip it of all character. Really good location, and the rooms are comfortable, in a three and a half star hotel at Manhattan’s four-star prices kind of way. My only real complaint is room service. “We don’t offer traditional room service,” I was told after a grueling 18 hour flight that left me hungry and too tired to go find a restaurant and actually sit upright without falling asleep. But they actually don’t offer any room service at all. I am not even sure they had a vending machine. They offered menus from three local restaurants which delivered as their official room service alternative. One of the three was appalling. One was good. One was untried.
user_name:
Pat B
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: I stayed here with my adult daughter for a fun weekend. It was in a good location for our activities. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room was very comfortable, spotless, comfortable bed, great shower, small refrigerator, coffee maker in the room. If you are an 'Elite' member (repeat client rewards program) they provide free internet and a nice breakfast with many offerings, also water available during non-breakfast times. If not an Elite Member, you would have to pay for internet access. They had a small gift shop, and a nice lobby bar with food available. I printed up my flight boarding pass in their complimentary area. There are two sets of elevators, depending on the lower or upper floors (this made it nice, as you never had to wait long for an elevator). I slept really well as the room was so quiet, and the bed and linens so comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Sondra stayed here two nights while visiting her grandson graduating from NYU. My room was just the right size for one person. I had a VERY COMFORTABLE king size bed with premium white sheets and down comforter....which was needed during the cold two days I stayed. The location is great for visiting NYU and a Broadway show. There are several good restaurants nearby. The rate was reasonable for NY. The Concierge was very helpful in attaining shuttle service to JFK.

Although a Marriott Elite member, this is the first time I have stayed in this hotel. Being NY I was expecting an expensive but slightly tired hotel and I wasn't disappointed. The building is historic which is great however this makes the maze of rooms complicated and my rooms was very small and bathroom tiny with a small window looking onto a wall. The room was therefore dark and the AC was incredibly noisy. It is not a centralised AC system but individual ACs in each room. The club room was nice and appeared to have been recently renovated.

Hotel is nicely appointed, many room amenities including a mini refrigerator and awesome brand of coffee for use in single cup coffee maker. The location has great access to restaurants, shops, Grand Central Station and Times Square is just a short walk.

The hotel is comfortable, but needs some upgrades compared to the other hotels close by in a similar category. The rooms are okay, the bathroom is very small, but not unusual in NYC. The A/C / Heater was very old and that dirty that you don't really wanted to use it. But the staff is very helpful and tries to help as much as they could. The location close to Central Station is for sure a pro for the hotel location.

Overnight stop. Comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable rooms with good amenities though not large in size, more than adequate. Good location as walking distance to Rockefeller Centre, St Patrick's Cathedral, Saks and other shops as well as central station, 42nd st etc. Good selection of shops restaurants etc to suit all budgets nearby and definitely a safe secure area.

I liked this hotel. It's clean, and very nice. It was only a couple blocks from St. Patrick's cathedral. Lots of things to do within walking distance, and easy to get to subway from here as well. Sound traveled really well through the bathroom, but with the door closed at night, it wasn't bad. Not a huge room, and no view from our room, but for a midtown NYC hotel, It's good! Staff was friendly. We didn't eat or drink there. Dropped our luggage with bellhop in the morning. Was great to store it while we were tourists

The hotel was nice. Location was excellent. Bathroom was really small and positioned in a weird area in the room . Great pizza place, drug store right down the street. Times Square and central park are all within walking distance.

From the moment of our arrival, welcome by Carmen at the desk, assistance in finding the right room for two light sleepers and kind offer to send a beverage to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary, this hotel in the Big Apple proved to be just right for us.

We stayed over the long weekend. Room was a terrace suite. Room was very spacious but a few recommendations to improve:There were no room darkening shades in the living room where the pullout couch is. Lots of lights from building across the way even at midnight. Contacted hotel and engineer informed us there is not supposed to be shade for that window even though the other 3 windows in the room have additional room darkening shade.Netflix on TV did not work all weekend-had to repeatedly sign in but no service.Need more trash cans in the room.Breakfast in M Lounge was mediocre at best. Elevators are slow. 30 minute wait to retrieve car from valet on day of departure-plan accordingly.Would possibly stay again-Location is terrific-perfect for walking to lots of destinations.

we have stayed at this hotel so many times in the past but this time we were quite disappointed . The service and the personnel are still wonderful, but the accommodations are starting to show signs of wear...It might be time for Marriott to spring for some new paint and carpet. The concierge lounge is still one of the better ones in this chain of hotels and again, the personnel in charge there can't be anymore gracious, but you still have to go to your room and that's where this Marriott is slipping. The hotel is priced fairly when there isn't a major event in town. Take advantage of the knowledge of the doormen...they are a wealth of information and fun guys to talk to. This is the first time we have stayed here for more than three days....they have already gotten to know us and anticipate our needs with taxis and information. We will probably stay here again but hopefully they will start some kind of remodeling effort before we arrive the next time.

Been staying here since July. I travel to NYC frequently for work. Great location. Clean. Convenient. The rooms range as far as views. I get a few that have a nice Lexington ave view and are on a high floor. Other times I get a brick wall, which is typical in NYC. But overall having stayed several places this is the nicest.
user_name:
Michael K
Scotch Plains, New Jersey

review_body: So far this has been a great stay. Everyone has been very cordial and helpful. The rooms are very well appointed and recently updated within the last 4-5 years. I would definitely recommend this hotel due to its close proximity to major attractions and subway lines. Also ample Starbucks nearby. 3 more wonderful nights left!

Hotel is easily accessible by subway and airport vans. It's within easy walking distance of Rock Center and Grand Central Station. Rooms are clean and the staff are very friendly. Price was reasonable. I thought breakfast was included but was told not at the rate we paid.

This hotel is in a good location, rooms are a good size and beds are very comfortable, which after a day of exploring the steeets of New York is a welcome thing. The concierge is very friendly. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but I would recommend the 'Comfort Diner' which is a couple of blocks away, there is also 'Ashleys' across the road and a small supermarket on the right. Wifi is free in the lounge but there is a charge if using wifi in the bedroom which is annoying. There is a gym in the hotel and access to computers and printers if needed. The hotel can also book you a transfer to the airport. There is a computer in the lounge on which you can book bus tours but I think you would be better doing your research and buying off the sellers on the street as they work on commission.

Would of gave this 5 stars but for some reason shower head is on my chest and Im 6 foot. I noticed the door was big and handles everywhere and perhaps the room since its disabled friendly is the reason for it. Still awkward showers as i had to bend. Also construction out on street.

Stayed over Saturday evening this past weekend. It was a great stay. The room was clean and well maintained. The hotel staff were friendly and courteous. I was thrilled with our room at the end of the hall as it was very quiet. The breakfast in the executive lounge was great. Nice hotel.

The rooms are tired and need renovation but they are very ample-sized for NYC, the beds are comfy and the shower great. My trip combined business and pleasure so I stayed here. If it was just for pleasure I would have stayed closer to Broadway or Central Park. There are many businesses in the area but not a lot of night life.

Stayed here for just one night prior to last snow storm. The lobby was nice a nice entry. The front desk was very courteous and professional and welcoming. Because we are platinum level, we had access to the lounge, which we did not use but a nice to know if we had time. Check in was quick. Made our way to our room and it was clean and simple. Had the usual , a chair, 2 beds, coffee maker. Bathroom was shower/tub, basic but everything worked, no issues. There was an issue with WIFI connection. The bar in lobby was friendly and was able to have one beverage before they closed at 11:30pm. Overall, great location, clean friendly staff. Would recommend.

I have been staying at the Marriott East Side since the place opened more than twenty years ago, and without a doubt, I have spent more nights at this hotel than any other hotel. I return again and again because the Marriott East Side always meets my high expectations for a relatively small, full service hotel in a big city environment. There are at least seven good reasons why I choose the Marriott East Side when I stay in NYC:First, while the Marriott East Side, with 646 rooms, may seem large on paper, it is a postage stamp compared to the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, the Midtown Hilton, the Waldorf Astoria, and other large hotels in NYC, with their multiple restaurants, bars, shops, and amenities that I would never use. The Marriott East Side has one bar, one restaurant, and a small gift shop, and is rarely crowded with the busloads of tourists that can overwhelm other places. Although the Marriott East Side might be a big hotel in a small city, it plays like a small hotel in a big city. Second, the historic building with its compact, Art Deco lobby and public areas, is warm, inviting, and an aesthetic delight. Third, the staff at the front desk is professional, efficient, and accommodating, and I especially appreciate their efforts to book me into my favorite rooms. (Like many hotels in historic buildings, the room sizes and configurations can vary considerably. As a long time, regular guest, I have my favorite rooms, floor, and view.) Fourth, many of the doormen, lobby attendants, bartenders, and housekeepers, have worked at the hotel for years, and they obviously like their jobs and enjoy interacting with the guests.Fifth, the Hotel is located on the cusp of three safe residential neighborhoods (Turtle Bay, Murray Hill, and the Upper East Side), where tourists are scarce and real Manhattanites live, eat, and drink; and yet, the midtown business district, theater district, and Grand Central Terminal are only a short walk away. And for those people who like to explore, two subway stations are within eyesight (4, 5, 6, E and M lines) for easy access to the rest of the City. Sixth, while some of the rooms are a bit small or in need of a touch-up, they are very clean and comfortable. Lastly, for Elite Marriott Reward Members, the Concierge Room on the second floor is outstanding with one of the best breakfast buffets that I have experienced at any Marriott and an evening hors d'oeuvre spread that could pass for a light dinner.I obviously recommend the Marriott East Side.

Perfect location: close to many of the sights, and a short walk from the Rockefeller Center and Times Square. My room was comfy, although not huge. The bed was very comfortable. The area can be a bit noisy, if like me you don't come from a big city (the cars honking the whole night can disturb your sleep even if you are staying on a higher floor - bring earplugs). The only minus was the heater - quite loud when turned on (at first I thought there was a garbage truck parked under my window!). The problem is however easily solved by turning the heating off during the night.

Another great stay at a Marriott as I've come to expect from this brand. This was my fifth trip in a row where I've needed to request early check-in at various Marriotts and have been accommodated without hesitation each time. The lobby is nice and the bar/café area gets the job done but really you should be dining outside the hotel as there are literally hundreds of various restaurants (a few are very famous) within easy walking distance to the hotel. Our room was a little on the small side but not cramped by any means and had just enough space but really didn't spend a lot of time there. The room had a small view, was clean, bed comfortable and house keeping well done. There is a basic gym/workout area on the top floor and should be visited at least for the view that can be had from there as it is nice. The staff were quick to suggest restaurants and hail a cab for you so let them help get you to enjoying the city. As others have stated this hotel is in a great location if your main area will be the mid-east side of Manhattan and we will be returning.

I've stayed at this hotel several times for on both business and pleasure trips. The hotel is a bit dated, but is well run and efficient. The location is superb - walking distance to all the sites of midtown and near subways to get anywhere in the city quickly.

My husband and I love this hotel. It is in a perfect location. The subway is near by and endless food options all around this hotel. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay memorable and up to your standards. Our room was very large and clean. The front entrance is beautiful and we enjoyed eating and having drinks at the 525 LEX Restaurant & Lounge. The grab and go breakfast was also a nice option. We have stayed here several times and will be back!
user_name:
Toni K
Vestavia Hills, Alabama, United States

review_body: I recently stayed at the New York Marriott Eastside, and was very pleased with every aspect of this hotel. Upon check-in, I was greeted warmly by front desk attendant Fred, who helped me change me room type and upgrade my room for no extra charge. We are gold members, and took advantage of the M club, which is the concierge lounge. The M club was very spacious, and served a hot breakfast every morning with assorted cereals, pastries, eggs, bacon or sausage, breakfast potatoes, fresh fruit, breads, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee, espresso, soft drinks, and bottled water. They also served hot food on weeknights which was fresh and tasty. The lounge is open 24 hours a day, with coffee, soft drinks, and bottled water available anytime. The room was large by NYC standards, and had good beds and other room appointments. The shower pressure was bad on the first day, but I called engineering and they repaired it promptly. If you are like me and like a quiet room, ask for a room on a high floor and "inside the U", which has a view of the interior of the hotel. Much quieter than a room facing the street. This hotel does not offer room service, but there are some great restaurants nearby. Wifi is offered in the hotel for a fee unless you have gold or platinum with Marriott.My family's had a blast in NYC, and will return again in the future!

We used to stay in this hotel a few times a year. We have family in New York City and this location worked well for us. The problem with this hotel is that they just don't care about guest satisfaction. The hotel is usually sold out so it doesn't matter if your satisfied with things because there is some one right behind you ready to take your place! The rooms are also small and dated. Find someplace else to stay, just not worth it!

We're Marriott Gold members so they put us on the 16th floor with lounge privileges. Room thermostat settings have no relation to actual room temperature. We were hot under heavy bedding both nights we stayed there even though we set the room temp to 68 deg. F. I'd suggest a different hotel if you're temperature sensitive. Members lounge has sparse pickings in the evening and I'd suggest staying clear of the decaf labeled coffee because it probably isn't.

The hotel is great. The room was comfortable and clean and consistent with the Marriott brand standards. Staff was professional and helpful. It is an easy walk to 5th Ave, Grand Central Station and the subway. My only complaint was the night time noise outside the hotel. I was on the 12th floor and heard every siren, every dump truck and horn. Stay here but be prepare for noise while you are trying to sleep. This is nothing within Marriott's control but something a future guest should know about.

Based on some of the negative reviews posted earlier I was a bit concerned prior to arriving. However, my experience was very positive. I was in town for a meeting at the UN and was able to get there quickly in the morning. The hotel is in a good location and is close to many restaurants and other attractions. The staff was very helpful and the M Lounge was quite nice. I would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
JCJD2
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: In a city full of overpriced hotels, the Marriott East Side is a hidden gem. Walkable to lots of attractions and entertainment, and a short walk to Grand Central Terminal. It is also good to have the Marriott predictability on cleanliness, safety etc. Very nice for a weekend getaway.

This hotel is in a great location but really doesn't meet Marriott's good standards. The desk clerks were fairly rude and our room was very small and really needed updated. One the good news side, the breakfast for the concierge floor was excellent with lots of offerings, the lobby is really pretty and the bar is nice. They badly need to update the rooms and maybe change the sizes of some of them.

This hotel is mid-town east and is walking distance to Grand Central Station (trains and buses to JFK). There are some good restaurants and attractions (Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park) within an easy walk. The room price is reasonable for the location, but the rooms are on the small side. Street noise can be an issue, but the between-rooms noise is quiet. As a frequent traveler and light sleeper, I always ask for a room on a high floor away from elevators a ice/vending machines. On this visit I checked in early - apparently to the displeasure of the reception staff - so there were limited rooms and was given a room on the 5th floor, street-side (over the hotel entrance) just around the corner from the elevator and down the hall form the vending machines - pretty much my nightmare scenario. The room was small (no upgrade offered), but adequate and, with the exception of the constant street noise (sirens, and damnable constant taxi honking - thought that was illegal), it was reasonably quiet. The M Lounge was large and comfortable.

Nice restaurant with please try atmosphere.Rooms are lovely.The only thing is that the music is a bit loud to try to have a conversation!It's convenient, in Lexington, where everything it's around you!

I stayed at this hotel 20 years ago and remembered it as being a fine place, in a good location, but with tiny rooms. I was pleasantly surprised when returning last weekend. Our room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The size was fine, larger than the room that I had last time. Staff friendly. It is an older property that has been renovated. Elevators are small and older, but they were fine. We stayed on the 12th floor and never had issues with the elevator. Watch the rates...we were able to get a room for under $200/night in January without a daily resort fee. In this neighborhood, we saw this as a bargain. Just recommended this hotel to a friend and will continue to recommend it to people who want to stay in midtown east. I think the next time we visit NYC, we will select a hotel in another part of the city just for variety. However, if I need a place in midtown to stay, the Marriott will be at the top of the list.

Nice hotel. It is a old hotel but nicely done. Rooms are a bit small but clean and quiet. Staff seemed willing to help and close to everything. We were here on business. My only complaint was the old elevator. It was slow.

Are you kidding me a hotel in downtown Manhattan that is supposed to be full service with no room service? This hotel is across the street from the Intercontinental stay there instead this hotel is across the street from the Lexington stay there instead go to a real hotel that has real room service! Unbelievable that a full-service Marriott does not have this.

Let's start with the positives. This hotel is mid-town east and is walking distance to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal and a bunch of great restaurants and attractions. For the location, it's price is actually pretty good. The lobby is actually very nice and when we came in December was decorated seasonally and was very festive. The hotel gym was on the top floor (I think 35th or something like that) and had a nice view of the surrounding buildings, the East River, and Brooklyn to the south and Queens to the North. But for positives, that was pretty much it.Now for the items that disappointed us.1. We are Marriott Gold Elite members, where Marriott typically automatically upgrades your room upon arrival. I believe our room was actually downgraded to the lowest quality room available. We stayed on the 6th floor in a corner room. The toilet flushed slowly and the sink drained slowly. The room was dark, poorly lit, and several outlets did not work. There was no alarm clock. There was no luggage rack in our room (but we discovered later there were racks in other rooms). No hangers. When asked if we could switch rooms, they said no.2. The service was pretty poor. When we called and asked for things like toilet paper, tissues, a luggage rack, we were met with responses like, "they'll be right up." A day later, we grabbed some toilet paper from a cleaning lady's cart, and when she found us doing this, she asked if we needed anything else, to which she found us a luggage rack in another room, and gave it to us. Thank goodness for her!3. The M lounge was pretty pathetic. I've stayed at other Marriott's where there was a much better selection of snacks, fruit, appetizers, and desserts pretty much at any time. This one only had Nutrigrain bars and diet Pepsi. The breakfasts were not too bad though.4. The gym was pretty nice as stated above. However the elevator from the 32nd to 35th floor stopped and a cleaning person was caught in there for a few minutes. I was thankful they had stairs.OverallIf you don't care about the amenities and service and are looking for a location, this is pretty prime real estate. However we were pretty disappointed with the service and amenities (except for the gym) especially at around $400 a night around the holidays.

This was the second time I stayed in the Marriott East Side for 5 days. The first time was a few years ago when I did not even had a status on Marriott. With Platinum status I got the same room. Seems they don't really do upgrades. With your status you can go into the Lounge, which offers free breakfast and some drinks. But if you compare this for example to the Copenhagen Marriott, the lounge is really basic. The location is OK. It's a few blocks from the shopping area and the staff is nice. But the rooms are getting old and are running down. I understood they upgraded the 16th floor, but they need to speed up with the rest of the rooms. There are better choices around.

I stayed here for two nights during a recent girls' trip to NYC. One of our friends is a frequent business traveler who was able to secure our room using her points, so we were really blessed by her generosity.Four of us stayed in a room with two double beds. The room was large enough for our luggage and for us to spend small amounts of time relaxing in the room. Everything was clean and the staff was extremely attentive. This was perhaps the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in. I did not hear one single noise from the surrounding rooms. The shower was amazing - great water pressure and a luxurious shower head. It was a treat to enjoy the Elite lounge which had a great selection. We were disappointed it was closed Friday night, but took advantage on Saturday.I really enjoyed this stay, and will consider Marriotts much more highly in the future.

I stayed for almost a week for business. We were on the 10th floor. The mattress was worn. We requested slippers and it never arrived. Being a rewards member, I am hoping my stay in January will be much better.

Great Location, Friendly staff and the rooms were nice. It was my first time in New York and i felt very comfortable and safe in this location. The staff were great and extremely friendly, Every staff member said hello and gave some sort of acknowledgement. I will recommend this hotel to anyone i know that is travelling to NYC.

We stayed at The New York Marriott East Side not once, but twice on a recent visit to New York City! Initially, we stayed 8 nights while enjoying all the Big Apple has to offer and we were very happy with this hotel. Travelling with two teenage boys challenges our family on room configurations and possibilities and this hotel had the ideal space. We enjoyed a suite with a lounge-room (with fold out bed) and a bedroom (with two double beds) along with a bathroom, wardrobe space and mini bar area. Two televisions made everyone happy and a desk space came in handy, when planning excursions and writing about our trip.The décor reminded me of an art deco feel and the rooms were clean, well planned out, if a little dated. I think the price point was great, given the space we had and facilities available in the hotel. On both our visits we enjoyed the Marriot Lounge, which served a good breakfast (including fruit, eggs, cereals, toast and bagels and more), all day drink refreshments, great evening treats and coffee to go! Having Cappuccino’s and water bottles available each day before we enjoyed the tourist sites was a real treat! The evening service included anything from pasta, mixed salad leaves, cheese plates and fresh made blueberry pie. Often you could feast on the available dishes on offer and not head out in the cold…The Restaurant 525 Lex, was fantastic with a delicious array of hotel favourites. Burgers, Mac and Cheese and a full bar were only part of what the restaurant offered, but it served us well before an early flight the next day. The staff were incredible at the hotel. From the moment we arrived and very attentive bellman took our bags, we were swiftly ushered to the Marriott Elite Desk and shown our room within minutes. We were also advised of the M lounge availability, which proved a life-saver to us on this trip. The front desk staff (and Sam in particular) were always happy to see us and most helpful. We were shown our room on our second stay by a fellow that has worked at the hotel 32 year. His knowledge of the hotel and NYC was very impressive! The tour office staff were super helpful in suggesting restaurants that matched our taste and budget and on one occasion, patiently dealt with me on three visits about which best hop-on hop-off bus we should take, given our limited time frame and desire to keep costs down. Peter (the tour desk staff) had the patience of a saint!Housekeeping were very good at the hotel and always ensured we had fresh towels and our rooms were cleaned well. On one occasion, we required more toiletries and the lady (who was deaf) was very obliging and accommodating. The location of this hotel was ideal. With only a short walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue and most of the sights we planned on seeing. We only caught a taxi once in our 10 days there in total and happily walked everywhere or took the subway otherwise.

Their rooms are spacious, clean, but walls very thin. Air conditioning in my room was just very loud and that would keep you awake at night. At some point security came and nocked my door really loundly for having TV sound too loud. They could have called in advance. TV sound was too soft and neighborhs' kids were running around and making noise. Regardless, their location is good. Just few blocks down from Rockafellar Centre, Central Park, 5th Avenue. Breakfast is not included into room's price. They have a lovely coffee shop. There are other places to get good breakfast around hotel.

Im currently staying at the hotel, and want to send my thank you to Paulina Hernandez. She checked us in and was amazing. Very pleasant and cordial, she gave me some tips about the city that really made our stay even more enjoyable. Rockstar! Hotel is nicely located and very clean. Great experience.

Tipical hotel from big chain in NYC. Everything is OK, but nothing tou would remember afterward. It might seem overpriced for the service but after all it's Manhattan. It was chosen due to its proximity to a conference venue, Waldorf Astoria.

Marriott East Side is an older hotel and although dated the rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious for NYC. What's best about this property is the location… just a short walk to the subway (6 train uptown/downtown), Rockefeller Center, Central Park & Times Square. Grab a coffee to-go at Starbucks (less than a block South on Lexington) and take a walk and enjoy all that NYC offers!

We met friends at the lobby bar around Christmas time. Even though is was busy, the service and drinks were excellent. The bar is spacious enough that the conversation areas all seemed like every could have a private small party and not intrude on each other. It's obvious that the people designing and using this space knew what they were doing.If you're in the area and want a good place to meet - give the Marriott East Side Lobby Bar a try.

We stayed three nights here over new year, the room was $300 a night, but given it was new year etc. and the location I could just about justify the cost to myself. The truth was it was a very average room, it was really noisy (OK I know it's New York, but you can triple glaze) and the whole experience was underwhelming. We arrived and there was confusion over check in, after 40 min we eventually got access to one of three rooms we'd booked, when our friends arrived later around 5pm, they were told there room still wasn't ready. We got back to the hotel on new years eve around 12.30 and the bar was closed!! Give it a miss, there are better hotels where they care about service.

This Marriott is an older hotel with great staff. The front desk and housekeeping responded graciously to our needs. The hotel is centrally located and walking distance to Times Square, Rockerfeller Center and Fifth Avenue. The subway was 2 blocks away. We enjoyed our breakfasts in the M lounge, and had dinner there twice as they served a hot entree and sides. If you are not a gold or Platinum member it probably is worth the upgrade to the club level for the lounge benefit. Soda, coffee and water is available 24 hours daily. We saw families with 2-3 children eating in the lounge, which I probably saved them quite a bit of time and money. We were here during the Christmas holidays and The city was very crowded. The hotel offered a warm and comfortable retreat. We were fortunate to receive an upgraded corner room, the trade off was that we didn't have a view. The room was clean, large and comfortable. Would recommend this hotel. Previously we have stayed at the Marriott Marquis and Residence Inn/Midtown, however the their rates were much higher than the East Side.

We picked this place during our stay for the NYC marathon and it was a great location. We are Marriott people and my husband has a status with the chain. We were within walking distance from where we had to pick up the bibs (10-15 min) and it was within walking distance to library; in which we had to take the bus to the starting line for marathon day. However, after the marathon it is a decent walk back to the hotel. The breakfast was ok, but not the best we ever had in any of the Marriott properties. I just really get gross out with buffet style as people have the worse etiquette from sneezing/coughing and grabbing the serving spoons without washing their nasty hands or returning food back to the serving plates. The hotel it's centrally located to other attractions, the room was a decent size (NYC style, small) and the staff was excellent. If we ever return, we"ll probably stay in this hotel again.

This hotel is very old and tired looking.It's very central,near Times Square and lot of other attractions.For everything you need in the room you have to call and ask on reception.I also hate those shower heads attached on the bathroom wall.

Nice place. Too bad our view of the room was not great. The room was a very nice size and location was great. The elevators are a little narrow and take long. Hope to stay here again next year. The hotel is clean

The Marriott East Side again is the best place to stay in NYC if you want to be near the theatre, shopping, Times Square and Rockfeller Square. The rooms are well appointed and staff maintain a high degree of cleanliness and comfort.

Marriott EASTSIDE made me feel I was home. Immaculate, older oasis near everything. Staff is exceptional. M Club had replaced the old 32nd floor concierge. Better facility but the old intimacy is replaced by modern food and lots of seating.

Room was large and nicely furnished. Bathroom was clean and spacious. Unfortunately window was frosted glass so could not see outside at all. Did not eat in hotel- many local options within walking distance.

Stayed with my family in a room with two double beds. Room was cozy but not too cramped considering there were 4 of us. Staff was extremely friendly and was able to answer all our questions. We were there for only one evening but it was a pleasant experience, checking out at noon was a huge plus!

Great location, friendly staff all around. Excellent free breakfast for Elite Marriott members. Rooms good, just a tad tired and need an update, which I think is underway. Lots of restaurants and bars all around. Quick walk to Rock Center.

Stayed at this hotel and it was beautiful in the lobby decorated with a Christmas tree and lights. The cafe has coffee and danishes, the best danishes I might add. I was not impressed by the service at the front desk- I asked for water at 6am and they said I did not have lounge access. Guess I'm not important enough. So, I finally figured out to go to the cafe and get it for $4/bottle. Yikes. The location was great, the room pretty quiet and vintage for sure.

we've been a family group of 5 persons and we stayed in a two bedrooms/two bathrooms mini appartment. we enjoyed our stay very much. As for the location... just 8 min from times square walk, and 2 min from central station....

Ok hotel but not much to write home about. Stayed in room 632, good size for New York just that the plumbing from the room next door (626) was dreadful. So very loud, we had to move room! Hotel seemed so surprised when we complained, until we played the video highlighting just what happened when next door took a shower...like having a pneumatic drill next door! Food good and staff very helpful. Would stay again just not in room 632!

Older hotel with a welcoming lobby. Not one person greeted us at the door as would be expected over the 3 days. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Elevators are small and slow, and always had a line. If you stay on a lower floor you can take the stairwell, which many people did. Considering the amount of foot traffic in the stairwell, one would think they would try to make it somewhat attractive other than the just functional grey. I felt like I was in a service entrance. Our room (301) was very small, even for New York standards. When we first walked in I thought it was a closet. Very dark and 2 windows overlook a roof and mechanical units. In general the room was clean, however there was a hole in the carpet, and the edges of the carpet were pretty old and dirty looking. Only one end table so no where to put anything. TV at far end of room from the bed, awkward to watch TV when we were there. (which wasnt much). Not the worst room we have stayed at in New York, but in no hurry to go back to this property. Also, found it odd that they stop serving drinks at 11:45 on a Saturday in the Lex bar. The place was packed, yet they wouldnt serve. So our after play night cap was at the W across the street.

Stayed in this hotel for its midtown location. The room and bathroom are relatively small but comfortable. Amenities are typical for Marriott. The concierge room is large and well stocked. It is expensive, but within the range for high end NYC hotels. Service staff were responsive and helpful.

This hotel is fabulous! We stayed for 3 nights over Thanksgiving for the parade. Very helpful and late check out too, 2pm! The hotel is clean. Great location to the subway and some places to grab a quick bite! 99 cents pizza just down the street, great pizza and a tex mex place that has the best burritos I have ever had! They serve cookies and a hot drink in the afternoon and have to say the hot chocolate was the best I have ever had! YUMMY. The Cider was good too. This hotel makes you feel like home. Always greeting you as you come and go with a smile. Can't wait to go back and this will be our hotel of choice!

Decided to select this Marriott for a one night stay for our annual wedding anniversary trip to the city with dinner and a Broadway show. Early check-in was quick and easy, and we were given a nice room with a view of the Chrysler building. We enjoyed the concierge lounge in the morning for breakfast - the lounge is rather large and the choices were good in the morning. There are so many wonderful restaurants within walking distance - we decided on Smith & Wollensky as well as the The Smith for dinner. They did not disappoint. The hotel is not new - but it emits an old NY feel with nice ambiance and good vibe.

We have stayed at this hotel for years. At our last stay, Joshua at the front desk was enormously helpful and friendly. All the staff is welcoming. The rooms are clean. We came with our children and grandchildren. The lobby is alive and full of excitement. Today they served muffins and cider which our grandchildren enjoyed! The hotel isn't new or modern but makes up for it with its welcoming ways.
user_name:
risagaron
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Awesome location in Midtown, friendly staff. Our room was very clean. A bit small, but that's to be expected in a big city. Pillows and beds were very comfortable! Vast and delicious breakfast buffet.

I had just finished a long day at work. I called Marriott East Side. The reservation process was quick and painless. The check in upon arriving was both polite and fast. The accommodations were outstanding. Needless to say I was comfortable and very happy. My highest regards to everyone there and thank you.

I was in town for a trade show and wanted to be at a hotel central to everything. This Marriott has it all.There was a slight problem with my reservation as it didn't show up correctly in their system. The Manager was extremely apologetic and gave me an upgraded room which gave me more space to spread out. The furnishings in the room are older, but well maintained. The bed was great and I loved the rain shower head. The bathroom is small, but there is a vanity next to it, so plenty of space for your things.The staff was awesome. They know most people are tourists and all are extremely accommodating with any question. The Concierge was able to give excellent service and recommendations. I didn't eat in the restaurant...the only reason being you are in NYC and there are so many outstanding places to choose from!The Lounge was outstanding. Wonderful breakfast and appetizers in the evening. What was really great is they had it open 24 hours - so if you wanted a coffee or water; it was available to you. I really appreciate how this hotel recognized that their very frequent guests appreciate this type of service. The selection on all food items was excellent - very fresh and appealing.The hotel is in a great location and convenient to everything. You are two blocks from the subway. LaGuardia is about 40 minutes away.I will definitely stay here again!

We stayed for one night at NY Marriott East Side. In hindsight, we should have stayed at W hotel right opposite which is newer and is owned by the same group. Hotel is terribly old with outdated carpet. My allergy was acting up likely due to the dust kept on the old carpet. Need to store my luggage for a week but was charged about $10 even though I was guest there. Bell boy were non existent and wasn't helped with my luggage. Door man who directs traffic was very unhelpful. Bad experience, won't come back again.

Everything was perfect.Staff very ettentiv to help you and assist, even to find you an Italian restaurant or the closest pizza place.Room was large enough and very comfortable. Location just great will come again.

This is our favorite NY hotel. We much prefer it to the pricey/crowded Marriott Marquis. Marriott Rewards points go further here. It's a few blocks from Times Square but is a quick walk to all the major tourist spots. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. They have the best concierge floor I've seen. Great breakfast and heavy enough appetizers that we used it for dinner. Great place!

I was in town for the NYC marathon for four nights. I rarely write reviews but I had to sit down and recognize the superior service Joydeb and Norman provided in the Marriott Club. These two dedicated employees came in really early on the day of the race to help get our day started off on the right foot. They made us feel so special throughout our visit and really went above and beyond to take care of our group. Overall the hotel is lovely but these two employees made our trip extraordinary.

I attended a conference at the hotel and stayed 3 nights. It is conveniently located, well kept, and will provide the services and quality one expects at a big city Marriott.That said, the hotel is a bit quirky. It is an updated version of an older hotel has illustrated by assorted sign. Apparently, Clark Gable once stayed next door to the room I was assigned on the 18th floor. The downside of the structure (at least in the case of my room, #1810) was a relatively small window and crowded bathroom. While not as bad as some micro-rooms I've gotten in other Manhattan hotels the bathroom quarters were cramped. The bed was comfortable, the flat screen TV worked fine, and the light was good. The shower head had a very high pressure spray that could not be adjusted downward. The work desk and seating in the room were comfortable.I would recommend it as a good quality option, if the pricing for the nights you want is competitive.

We stayed here for 4 nights and found the whole stay very enjoyable, we had a massive room and the staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed them.The breakfasts were good and a decent variety on offer as well.We found the location ideal for getting around the city and the metro stops were close by and a lot of things were in walking distance from the hotel which really helped.

Stayed here for the first time in November 2016 and was pleasantly surprised. I had meetings near Grand Central and have grown tired of Times Square so I chose the Marriott East Side for my one night stay. I was upgraded to a "superior" room which was a nice size and plenty comfortable ( I am gold on the Marriott program, FYI). The furnishings are fine if maybe a little on the older side; there was a wooden box covering what appeared to be a 100 year old air conditioning unit, but the temperature control in the room was fine. Bed was crazy comfortable. A couple of quibbles - it took a very long time for the water to get hot in both the sink and shower but eventually it got plenty hot. And the shower head was about a foot too low. Elevators are small but efficient- I never had to wait long.The concierge lounge is top notch. The food at dinner time was enough to keep me from having to go out - it was Salisbury steaks in a brown gravy, mac and cheese, and asparagus spears, along with a nice salad. Perfect, as I arrived around 7pm and didn't want to go out. Breakfast also included a bunch of hot dishes along with the usual breads and yogurts. And the lounge is gigantic. Sadly they serve Pepsi products and charge for alcohol, but overall this lounge was way nicer than the one at the JW Marriott I stayed at in DC the week before.Wifi was decent (I had a couple pauses while FaceTimeing but not too bad) and the TV is small but offers Netflix (and maybe Hulu and Crackle if I remember) channels. They have the NFL Network too. Overall I was very satisfied with the Marriott East Side and will surely consider staying there again in the future.

Very well maintained midtown property - great location on Lex and 49th - easy subway ride in from JFK on the E. Full service bar and restaurant on site. Friendly staff. Rooms are NYC-sized, but very nice

I just checked in and received the best service from the front desk agent, Collette. To make a long story short, my purse was stolen right before the trip which was obviously terrible timing. ID, Credit cards. etc. She went out of her way to assist me and make my stay comfortable. I used to work in luxury hotels and the level of service she provided was 5 star! Hotel and rooms are very nice as well. I will be back.

I never thought that I would be raving about a Mariott.Stayed one night for a medical conference. We loved the room: it was clean and very welcoming and elegant, quiet. We had a king size bed, there was a small fridge too.I assume that conference food for breakfast and lunch was prepared at the hotel. If it is so, I want to warn people about mediocre food: sort of like in holiday Inn. However there was an abundance of fresh berries and so-so supermarket quality bagels and cream-cheese.Lunch was also of a mediocre quality.This did not spoil my impression of the hotel. After all, getting a good breakfast or lunch is easy in NYC. I booked on TripAdvisor secondary to promotion: $25 Amazon gift certificate of i I book a hotel and write a review.And so I did. Thank you.

Some of the reviews say the hotel is older. It is - and when you walk into the lobby it has its own character. The rooms are typical Marriott - and to me that's a good thing. Beds are very comfortable. Furniture nothing special. yes, older - but everything works. And there are a variety of floorplans. The "But" is that my first room was on the 33rd floor. And there's a banging sound all the time. I suspect it has something to do with the elevator. Kept me up all night. But I was so exhausted I couldn't get up to change rooms until the next morning. Next room was on the 10th floor. Bigger room area, smaller bathroom ... and quiet.

Business meetings on the East Side. Convenient. Good location. No room service but fortunately lots of good places to eat nearby.Good upscale Korean deli and market across the street for quick eats.Friendly staff.

The hotel is located near Central station and Chrysler building, and you can almost walk to most sightseeings and museums. Time square is also nearby. The room was Clean, quiet and cozy, with Air condition but no free wifi (free only at the lobby). We did not had breakfast included since it was extra charged, but we found excellent spots nearby where you can enjoy various types of breakfast. We recommend it!!

We loved the convenience of this Marriott to subways ,dining & coffee shops etc. The hotel was very clean , quiet and the staff welcoming and helpful. Our long weekend in this bustling city was eased with the comfort of great accommodations with the glam of older NYC hotels For being in the city I felt our rooms were spacious and beds super comfortable. I would recommend!

This was our second 3-night stay at the Marriott East Side -- comparable October weekend in 2015 and 2016. We liked the hotel well enough to return, but had a better experience this year overall, and would definitely stay there again. It is true that the hotel has an overall dated feel, but this should not be a deterrent if you are looking for an extremely convenient location with friendly and polite staff and simply-appointed but comfortable rooms. Our room was spotless; we didn't hear a thing from adjacent rooms; bell staff and housekeeping staff were on the ball. Last year we had a problem with a noisy heater/air conditioner unit in the room, and that was taken care of during our stay. Last year the elevators were packed and slow. No such problems this year. I think sometimes the guest needs to get the feel of a place and understand its quirks, within reason. We like the Marriott East Side and look forward to our next stay. I didn't use the exercise facilities this time but I did last year and found them to be very satisfactory.

I always like to preface my reviews with my Platinum status(ie. I travel alot for work). This hotel was a 5 star experience! I was so glad to spend the weekend here. The proximity to Grand Central makes it very easy to get around the city as well as restaurants and Broadway. I appreciated the upgrade to a nice spacious room with ample of natural light, that allowed me to get some work done. The only con is the thin walls, I had to call downstairs for a noise complaint that was quickly resolved. I would stay at this location every time I am in the city if possible!

Our company arranged a conference here, and we were quite disappointed. Price was high, room was barely standard (plus for size and decent bed, minus for noise from street, no minibar, dated interior). Hotel has no roomservice and you need to order from outside if you are hungry after the restaurant closes. Service at front desk was also below par.

This was my first time staying while on business in the area. I have to say it surpasses what I've experienced with other hotels nearby. The room was spacious and clean and the location was convenient. I will definitely stay again. Check in and out was easy.

I stayed two nights in mid-October at the NY Marriott East Side. Very little would have made the stay any better. Check in and out via the mobile app was easy. The room was spacious enough for two with bags. The closet was offset in a small hallway/room which helped to provide additional space. Otherwise it was a typical NYC hotel room; three foot walking space, king bed, and then about six feet to door. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The hotel is old so it has a wonderful charm about it. There was plenty around the neighborhood for a good walk. I really enjoyed the location as it allowed easy access to the touristy spots, but one block east and it was much calmer. If there was something to grip about, albeit it small, housekeeping seems to visit the room earlier than at most hotels. Overall a wonderful stay.

Great location for exploring Manhattan. Overnight parking at $75 per night is a bit steep but you can find overnight parking within walking distance online for as little as $25 per night.Our room was nothing special and could probably be renovated. However, the gym and Concierge Level were both nice.Great recommendation and "Free Drink" coupon from one of the doorman for nearby pub

Friendly, Courteous, Attentive staff. Having read reviews before booking, we were not expecting more than a place to store our luggage. We felt comfortable, even though the room was tiny by our standards, but, normal by The City standards. The Staff made all the difference!

The location of the hotel is very convenient and the staff are very friendly. The room was decent but not newly renovated or more modern. My major issue was the mold in the bathroom. I smelled something funky when I arrived in the room but I thought it might have been the lingering scent of the prior people who stayed there. I ultimately tracked the smell to mold on the door jamb of the bathroom. I did let the hotel know about it when I checked out and they took a little off my bill. I advised them to get it taken care of right away...hopefully they did. It was pretty disgusting.

The hotel has a wonderful location. The lack of upkeep makes it look tired and worn out from all the travelers. My room was located on the 14th floor, the hallways had dented plaster, rub marks throughout, paint over painted chipped doors, overall worn out and tired appearance - not typical of updated Marriott properties. Overall, outstanding location, great staff - well overdue for a makeover.

Our room was quiet at night, at end of hallway. The bell hops were very friendly-Would hold bags for no charge after check out and before returning home. Nice lounge area to hang out in and do a little work, after checking out and flying out.

Perfect location at 49 and Lex. Just slightly outside the fray but convenient to everything. Wonderful and efficient service by all staff we encountered. Hotel ambiance is warm and historic - not the cold and stark gray, white and black scheme that is prevalent in hotel design these days. Rooms are fine and as expected for a mid-tier Marriott property.

I have stayed here multiple times over the past 5 years and this hotel is excellent. The staff are so attentive to the needs of the guests and treat me my wife and children like family every time we come to visit NYC. Bert is just the best and I look forward to seeing and speaking with him every time I stay. This last stay they upgraded our family to a bigger corner room and also gave us access to the M club. The hotel is so centrally located to all of our favorite midtown sites and restaurants. Excellent place to stay. It feels like our NYC home.

My daughter and I just returned from a birthday trip to the city and we always go back to the Marriott East Side on Lexington. The location is fabulous and there are wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood.We had an over sized room that made our stay even more comfortable. The bed and pillows were great, but the number on reason for staying at this hotel is Patrick! When he greets you, you feel like you are home!!!

Our first night we had a room opposite three elevators and overlooking Lexington, non double glazed windows, they were full so no options, this was a bad nights sleep. Second night they managed to get us probably the quietest room in the place well away from elevators and overlooking an enclosed courtyard, and with double glazed windows. a really quiet and well furnished room. Extra points to staff for arranging this.

What a nice hotel to stay in,very clean and close to all shopping, shows and restaurants.The doorman was very helpful.We are staying here this weekend for the 3rd time in a month as we are looking at real estate.Excellent to stay here for both business and pleasure.Highly recommended.

The Marriott east side an amazing Marriott property centrally location on the east side of Manhattan. You can walk to the best shopping area that NYC has to offer and find many amazing restaurants along the way to stop for lunch.

Great location, pleasant and helpful staff, and spacious, clean room. When we asked for additional blankets, they were delivered promptly. We did eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on dining. Would come back.
user_name:
Tom D
Naples, Florida, United States

review_body: Great location on the east side. Lexington and 49th. A few blocks north is a metro station and a few blocks south is Grand Central. To the east is the UN. Coming/Going from LGA is easy and convenient. The rooms are nice size and there is a desk and comfy chair to get your business completed. The internet worked fine and was included in our room rate. The bathroom is tight, but functional. I had access to the 2nd floor Concierge Lounge and had a nice breakfast and late evening waters, soda and snacks. The bellmen set the tone for a great stay. Each and every one of them had a great attitude. No room service, but who cares when you are in NYC and many places are open late. Read the reviews and you will not be surprised when the elevators are slow. We often stay on the west side, but this property has me rethinking that strategy -- we will be back!

This hotel continues to be a consistent Marriott with great location, good service and clean rooms. I will say this visit the Concierge (one guy and one extremely wonderful girl) were so helpful and friendly. I did not feel rushed or pushed into making a decision on tours, restaurants, etc. They patiently explained the subway, pointed out helpful tips and had fun doing it. I love to see people who enjoy "working"! Thanks again for the awesome weekend! Those two should be commended!

Older hotel showing signs of age. Staff (other than restaurant) is great but can't overcome the many shortcomings. Biggest problem is intermittent internet and lack of an operational business center. This hotel is not suited to business travelers who need a well designed work area. The desk in my room was missing the pull out keyboard table making it almost impossible to use my laptop without causing back pain. In room internet was expensive with a spotty signal. Printers in the business center did not work. Pro's are a very good location and good AC.

I read the reviews of this hotel. Some love it and others do not. My review is mixed. We were in NYC for a funeral. A friend with whom we traveled usually stays in this hotel and has Platinum status. He visits NYC frequently and has great things to say about being a Platinum Elite member and staying here (usually upgraded to a suite, etc. Did not happen this time since we arrived 5 hours late at 1 AM).Our hotel room was the typical standard room - comfy bed and clean. We were on the 21st floor and faced Lexington Ave. We were high enough that traffic noise was not a problem. Other friends had a room on the 4th floor and viewed a wall (as one would expect). The bathroom is small - but the shower was nice and warm and the shower head generated lots of water pressure.The hallways do have some wear and tear - scuff marks on the walls and some worn carpet pulled away from the walls.The reason for the downgrade from 4 to 3.5 for me: the fitness center is under renovation. The normal place is on the 23rd (I think) floor and has a nice view. Instead, it was a basement conference room. Nice cardio equipment but the room was stuffy. The staff was efficient during our encounters. Our key card acted up and security responded very quickly to assist us. The front desk staff was also very helpful. We did not eat or drink at the hotel, so I cannot evaluate (other than bfast in the M Club).I would stay here again. If you want a luxurious hotel, this is nice but will probably fall short of your expectation. If you want a good location and (at least for our stay) typical mid-range luxury for Marriott, this is a good choice.

We tend to stay at Marriott Hotels whenever we travel because we are reward members; this particular one in midtown is pretty average. The rooms are a decent size but the bathroom is tiny. The distance between the toilet and the shower is less than six inches and you have to be really strategic when closing the bathroom door! That said, we stay here because of the location. It's right in midtown so very accessible to so many major attractions by foot. The gym is currently being renovated but do have a temporary one which is fine. The front desk and staff are welcoming and are eager to assist in any way possible. Good for quick weekend stays.

As a Platinum Marriott level member I go out of my way to stay loyal to the brand. I've stayed in a few other Marriott properties in New York but this was the first time we stayed here. It's plain awful. I reserved 2 connecting rooms at a pretty steep price of $600-700 a night. I asked for a quiet room and noted my check in time of 1pm. My husband got there first and was unable to check in after 1pm. We were also given rooms facing Lexington/49th street where we could hear every car horn and other noise. One of our showers barely had any water pressure. The elevators are terrible. You can wait up to 10 minutes just to get to your room. And the executive lounge seems open to everyone since I saw tons of people presenting tickets to get in. By 8am this morning there were no bananas left and I was told they were "coming". Our toilet seemed to almost clog several times. And I never felt like the hotel appreciated my status. Definitely would not recommend this hotel.

The Marriott on Lexington is a perfect way to experience New York City as it is in walking distance from all key main attractions including Grand Central; Library; Times Square and Rockefellar Centre. Although the hotel is slightly dated, the rooms were clean and the service was excellent. We were there in May for a wedding and would definitely go back.

Fantastic staff! Very friendly and extremely helpful! The concierge helped my husband and I figure out the best photo location for us to snap a photograph of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn. Rooms were clean. You're still close to everything without all the noise. We were considering staying in Times Square prior to picking the East Side Marriott. We were very pleased with our decision and would definitely stay here again.

Check in: Upon arrival check in went pretty fast and without any problems. Front desk staff were very friendly.The Room: The room appeared to be very clean and well kept. All the furniture in the room was in great condition and the bed was one of the cleanest hotel beds I've ever been in. I only really had 2 big issues with the room overall. 1. The water in the shower took a pretty long time (roughly 2-3 minutes) in warm up.2. the mini fridge in the room was hidden in a cabinet that looks like a chest of drawers. At first I just thought there wasn't one in the room until I tried opening a drawer and it swung open and had a mini fridge in it instead. That's just a personal pet peeve of mine is when hotels hide the mini fridge.Aside from those 2 minor annoyances everything else in the room was perfectly acceptable. Rest of Hotel: The rest of the hotel was fantastic for the most part except for 2 things.1. This is just another minor annoyance for me personally. The ice machine on our floor was shooting ice everywhere but into the ice bucket. It was just annoying to deal with.2. There seems to be some mechanical issues with the elevators in this place. I got onto an elevator to go from the floor my room was on to the lobby and it dropped me off on a random floor and wouldn't go down anymore which forced me to wait for a different elevator. also these have to be the slowest elevators ever!!! They literally took like 5 - 10 minutes to show up when i called for one. Overall: Overall i kinda have mixed feelings about this place. It has very friendly staff and nice and clean rooms. At the same time it has elevators that need a maintenance check and some other minor things that need revised. A lot of it is just based on personal qualifications. If you're someone who can overlook my complaints and pass them off then you'll be fine here. For me personally I would still stay here again if I come back to NYC.

We spent Labor Day weekend in NYC. I have stayed in this hotel a number of times over the years and, while the rooms are small, the quality of the furnishings and room comfort were always quite good. I found, however, that the rooms are looking tired and the level of service has declined. Our TV never worked correctly throughout our stay and, despite our complaints, it was still not receiving a proper signal by the time we left. No one could diagnose the problem.In addition, one day our room was not made up despite a few calls to the service desk. So we settled for new towels being delivered at 11pm.

With plenty of time, I made reservations to stay for the long weekend of Labor day. The hotel is a classic hotel, old style, great lobby, even a better lobby bar with excellent service. If you make your reservation with plenty of time, you could get a great rate.

Sunday morning no hot water till 10:30, was told boiler issues and also told the hotel next door had same problem. None of that matters when forced to take a freezing cold shower. They did give me 10,000 reward points for the trouble. Don't think there is room service either. Rooms were clean. Hotel is in good location. Not our normal place to stay when in NY.

The continuation of the sad saga of Marriott's going downhill fast. The room is filled with run down broken furniture that needs some desperate TLC. In the bathroom the storage under the sink looks like it had been hit with a hammer and never replaced. The desk is so old you could get a splinter if you run your hand along the edge of the chipped sides. Not to mention the 6 inches between the glued down TV and the bottom of our bed. What a disgrace and we are gold members but never again would we stay here. In a city filled with new hotels the Marriott East is one to SKIP.

Due to its proximity to Broadway & Times Square, and subways, we chose this Marriott. Spacious rooms, however they placed us on the third floor. Don't expect upgrades or specific room accommodations even if you are a Gold Elite. I would stay again given its ease of check-in and typical expectations for a Marriott at the current price point.

This is a good place to stay if you are spending a few days working at the law offices up and down Lexington - short, safe walking distance. The rooms are not large or particularly modern, but perfectly fine for a business traveler with working internet, adequate bathroom and comfortable bed. The attached restaurant is a bit pricey (maybe not for NYC), but is quite good. Staff is professional and helpful with recommendations for airport and city travel scheduling.

Stayed at this hotel for three nights in July,2016.The room was a good size,no mini bar,no fridge but it had ironing facilities and was in an excellent position,coffee and tea making facilities and was within walking distance of a lot of new yorks landmarks,would definitely stay there again.

Cozy, comfy hotel close to the great sites of NYC. The Concierge was very helpful in knowing where to go and what subway line to take. The rooms were large enough for 4 ladies and the bed were very confortable.
user_name:
Amber K
Cape Coral, Florida, United States

review_body: This was basically an average Marriott in a big city. Located in an older building, the small rooms, slow elevators and narrow hallways hark back to halcyon times in New York. But today they feel outdated. Location and staff were great, breakfast at the M lounge was standard but very decent (except the coffee machine seemed to keep breaking). The one major issue I had was that the fitness center was closed for renovation. Yet the only sign was after you sought it out on the 32nd floor access elevator, and had to go all the way to the temporary fitness room in the basement, lacking in everything except the basic fitness equipment in a conference room. At the very least, the front desk should have indicated its relocation upon check-in. They should have updated the signs in the elevators and lobby as well, since it's not just a brief closure.

Is a nice hotel, it's the perfect place to stay is near the subway and you can get easy to different parts of the city.They also had a beverages available all day also breakfast.Carlos the men in the breakfast area was very nice and helpful.

So the hotel is old, and it's NYC, so don't expect huge rooms and a brand new look. Hallways are small, elevators are slow, but the staff is outstanding...helpful, friendly, and accommodating! The club lounge is definitely worth the upgrade, breakfast was very good and is open for a long time. I didn't make evening cocktails last night, but wish I would have because I can't imagine it wasn't equally as good

Enjoyed staying here this past weekend. Convenient to Grand Central, Time Square, and shopping. They also had a concierge level open 24/7 for beverages, and daily for breakfast. The only negatives were that their restaurant was open for full service only at dinner and the seeming lack of security. Almost anyone could get on the elevator (my wife was not happy).

My husband and I went to NYC for a long weekend of Baseball Games and shopping. We usually stay in the middle of Times Square where it can be very crowded and just too intimidating. The Marriott East Side was just what we were looking for. The staff was incredible, and extremely helpful. The rooms were great and it was just an overall good experience!

We are a family of 5, with three adolescent kids. We took two rooms in it was perfect. The rooms are very spacious, with everything tou need. Most comfortable. Service was very good and great location. .

All the best, in a great location with great service. Great member breakfast, exceptional staff. We stay here every year for our Summer weekend in NYC. Perfect in every way. Looking for an exceptional place to stay in New York at a reasonable price with consistent service this is the place.

This hotel is wonderful. Location is excellent. Service is wonderful. And the wedding rate they provided made our trip to this destination wedding so affordable. A family affair not to be missed. Thank you , Marriott on Lexington.

I had not been to NYC in over 20 years, but my friend I was traveling with always stays here when she comes for business. The location is perfect, just blocks from Rockefeller Center, St. Patricks, and many other sites. The room was not big, but comfortable after a long day of walking around and site-seeing. Since my friend is an elite Marriott member we had upgraded internet access, but it cut out on our first night. We had to call it in and quite a while before it was restored. This was not much of an issue for me, but it was for my friend and the teens I was traveling with. I also noticed that their elevators are slow. We found that we often waited quite a while for the elevator to arrive to our floor (17th) or the lobby. Be aware, that because this hotel is so centrally located you will hear the traffic, the honks from drivers, and trucks loading and unloading all day and night, even if you are on the 17th floor. Also, we were not aware that on Sunday mornings Lexington Ave. closes and stalls pop up selling all kinds of stuff right in front of the hotel. It does cause some back-up on the adjacent streets, so take that into account if you have to get to the airport Sunday mornings.

It is the second time we stayed here while visiting NY for vacation, first time was back in 2014. This hotel have such a great location that everything else is just...out of concern.
