It gives you a kind of "oldie" taste in the first place but it turns to a feeling you ignore very quickly. Our rooms were both times booked from our agent so not sure if we have experienced their best ones or no. This time our room was on the 17th floor, quiet and cleaned on a daily basis but at the end what matters most is that i would hardly change this hotel just because its location. It takes you really minutes to get by foot on 5th, on Grand Central Station, 2 blocks away from metro station and just a few $ taxi ride to Central Park, Time Square and so many other places of interest.Only one negative vote (which i further give to any hotel around the globe may applies)Dear All: Stop charging the Internet

I would absolutely return ! this hotel was early accessible to every thing! we were able to get ubers or taxis right away, I have stayed in time square hotels and it is not my first choice, it is always a hassle to get anywhere because of all the traffic.the rooms were good size, the bathrooms were great as well. I felt like the downstairs bar could be open later. it is a smaller hotel but doesn't lack any amenities. they also have kiosks for you to print boarding passed at in the lobby. there is always consistency with Marriott !

This is an older building, but service was outstanding. The location couldn't be much better, as it is in the heart of Midtown. Check-in staff was warm and welcoming - they even accommodated my 7:30 am check-in request. Bell service was also fantastic. Our room was oddly shaped, but certainly adequate. The beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. Our view was nothing to speak of, but everything else about the hotel was very good.
user_name:
Dan K
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: The best thing about the hotel is its location on Lex Ave. A 5 minute walk from both Grand Central & 51st Street Subway. The hotel has a slight old world charm to it. But the rooms facing the Lex Ave on the lower floors can be a nightmare. Too much street noise creeps in. I had a tough time on the night I arrived. Imagine a bad sleep after a 27 hr flight half way across the globe. But Marriott more than made up the next morning. My room was supposed to be in the higher floors & they shifted me immediately. The new room was more spacious and better and the rest of the stay was pleasant. The house keeping staff were nice but I cant say the same about the door man or the folks in lobby... had the typical New Yorker attitude. The location is something you cant beat and is the best part about this hotel. Easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan any time of the day. That's the reason this carries a 4 star. Other than the street noise problem I dint see any minus to this property. I would definitely stay here again.

I have just stayed in this hotel. This hotel is situated within partial walking distance from downtown New York. The position is relatively quiet as compared to the extreme crowded environment downtown, which is comparable to HK. The room is relatively proper considering near downtown.BTW, I think hotels in USA probably do not provide slippers, toothpaste, toothbrush which are constantly available in some other countries.

Large corner room (603). We had plenty of room for 4 women and luggage. The whole place is EXTREMELY quiet. No problem sleeping after seeing the city. I feel this is true for all rooms as I saw multiple airline pilots who need a good nights sleep. Pull your shades though as the man across in the next building enjoys window watching.

The location is great, only 10 minutes walk from Time Square, and 5 minutes walk from Grand Central station. We had a regular double room with king size bed. It was really spacious and comfortable. However the rooms on the Lexington side are noisy and as a result we woke up in the middle of the night, and we stayed on the 7th floor. The bathroom had a shower head attached on the wall so you had to take a full bath / shower every time you want a quick bath.

Great location, clean rooms, good service, etc. We requested a room with a view and got it. We had a room for 3, and it was plenty big. Hotel is close to several subway stops. The only (small) complaint we had is that we had to wait a while for elevators - they are slow and small.

The room was always really clean, and the service was great. The room I got had huge Windows, which enhanced the quality of the rooms. There is a little shop in the lobby which can help if you are looking for a snack. The location is great because, it is close to subway stations and attractions.

Subway-accessible location, friendly staff, good customer service, and spacious/quiet room for NYC. Elevators can be a bit slow and packed during "rush hour", so be patient. Breakfast is pricey, but it's NYC so the options are endless! Otherwise, would stay here again.

We stayed three nights in this hotel. Rooms are small and air condition is very noisy. High time to refurbish. Staff is not friendly as I expected and compared with some of the other hotels. Bathroom amenities are not up to the four star hotel standards. Generally you cannot expect 4 star facilities. Rooms rates are not worth for sure ! I recommend only the location.

This hotel was great, with great location and the staff was great.We were able to walk or uber most locations. We were able to get a corner room and the front desk associate Paulina was a gem! She helped get our room early and even was willing to give us her own umbrella.I could tell everyone in the hotel was working really hard to please guests.We did have a glitch when the Explorer passes we bought the trolley people told us they were expired. It turned into a real mess as all we wanted to do was to start enjoying the city. It took About 3-4 hours to fix, but the hotel allowed us to use the lounge for the inconvenience.Everyone who works here was wonderful!I will definitely make this our NYC location in the future.Thanks so much New York Marriott East Side you made our vacation special.

My husband and I were in NY for Yankees game and opted to stay at Marriott East Side along with my brother and a family friend. We needed 3 beds and we selected a Junior Suite at Marriott East. We were not disappointed! It had a bedroom with 2 dbl beds that was separated from the living area by 2 double doors. The living area had a full-sized sleeper sofa, thus giving us the 3 separate beds needed for our trip. There were 2 tvs, one in the bedrm and another in the living area. Service was excellent as we arrived at 10am and we're allowed to check in as our room was already available. It was also a great location for us to sightsee various parts of the city. Uoin checkout we took a cab from the hotel to La Guardia for a reasonable rate of $45. We'll definitely stay at Marriott East Side again!

This hotel has a great location and is working in a fast moving lane , it's busy all the time at check in and lobby and there for check in time can take longer then expected and room check in time is likely to be 16:00.On the positive side I will put the usual great friendly and helpful stuff who did not disappoint , at the front desk , bel boys , concierge and lounge team . ALL where very helpful very friendly and caring - definitely made us feel welcome and supported thrue out the stay . The Lounge is a big plus as it give you another working and meeting space and of course complimentary breakfast light dinner snakes ( and drinks 24/7) Location in my few is perfect close to everything but not to hectic . around the hotel there are everything you need from 24/7 deli to a chemist .The only few thing thing that are not great: the room condition - it's old it's dated and have seen many guests ,so there is so much that house keeping can do .... And they don't do the best job - the room was ok can be cleaner and has no wow factor .the gym on the top floor is small and cluttered the view is nice but the experience is a bit claustrophobic. the lifts are on the slow side especially on " rush HR " waiting time can be 10 m!!!Food /litter left in public places can take sometime a day to be removed.All in all its a good hotel and give you good value for your stay, if they can improve room decor this will help allot . Still good for Buisness or with family - I can not see it for a romantic break .

Just spent 4 nights at the Marriott East Side in NYC with my 10 year old son. Our original reservation was for a 3 night package promotion through the Marriott website. The package (as booked on the website) included NYC Explorer passes for 2 adults to 3 NYC tourist attractions (from a list of 68). When I originally booked I called to ask if the passes were provided for each night we stayed or just once for the whole stay (so 3 passes each for 3 sites vs 1 pass each for 3 sites). After some discussion, the employee I spoke with said we would get a pass for each night of the stay (so access to 9 sites based on 3 nights) . The package advertised included a $15 gift card for breakfast at a local Illy café, a NYC tour book and free internet, This all sounded great as the room rate was also really low ($180 the first night and ~$220 for the next two nights for a King room)... over all a great deal so we booked and were ready to go!Anyhow, after some travel drama on the day of our arrival (our flight was delayed 10 hours), I called to ask if they could secure a late check in and a higher floor room (per recommendations on this site). They were very accommodating and ensured a late check in was fine and that they had upgraded us to a larger room on a high floor.Fast forward to arrival. When we checked in, we were met by very helpful staff who quickly got us our room key. When I inquired about the package they were a bit befuddled b/c they said very few people get that package and the passes were locked in a special safe. They had to get a manager to come help us, which took a little time. When they brought the package it was all in a small clear bag and included 4 NYC Explorer passes (2 adult and 2 child) and was clearly labeled a Family Pack... I asked if that was what they meant to give us (since I had assumed we would just get 2 adult passes per night, as advertised) and showed them my reservation info I had printed off the Marriott Website at the time I reserved the package. They were definitely perplexed and said they had never seen the package outlined that way. They even asked for a copy of it to discuss with Sr Management. I decided it wasn't worth arguing (it was already 10pm). So we took the materials provided and they said they would substitute access to the M Club for the Illy gift certificates each night. That worked out just fine b/c the breakfast there is decent and they also provided drinks and snacks round the clock. So, while it wasn't what I expected, they did a good job with substitution. What I thought was amazing was we were the first people to get the package (they had a sign in sheet to prove we had secured the passes). How does no one else take advantage of this? Make sure to look at all package options on the Marriott website people! It was a great deal. The passes go for $77 each and we got them as part of the room rate!At the time of check in I also asked for another night (so we could actually get 4 days in the city) and there was some confusion about whether we could continue in the same room at the same rate as the last night (a Monday) was well booked. After some back and forth over the next day, they were able to secure the same room for us at a $50 increase (not bad given the going rate was $379 that night and we got it for $279) with access to the M Club continuing. Overall, while there were some snafus around the package, everything was handled graciously by the staff and it worked out.As for the room, it was great. A larger King size corner room on floor 18. Close to the elevator, but we couldn't hear the noise and it still had a view onto Lexington. The room had a small pull out couch and at nice bath. Everything looked like it could do with a bit of refreshing (paint, etc,), but it was clean and bright and spacious. The location of the hotel is perfect for accessing subways, walking to Times Square, the Empire State Building, Central Park and anywhere in between. We used the passes to see the Empire State Building, a night bus tour of lower Manhattan, the Intrepid, and a Shark boat tour on the Hudson. All were great. We actually didn't have time (with our other scheduled activities) to use the remaining 2 tourist sites the pass would have given us. So more passes likely would have been excessive. Just wish I had someone to give the remaining passes to! (they have to be used within 30 days of activation).The M Club had a decent amount of variety at breakfast and the food was always being refreshed. Seats in the M Club were not hard to find and the staff were helpful. We never made it to the appetizer time (5-7), but did get drinks (soda, water, juice, coffee) often and got dessert one night (served 7:30-9:30). There are lots of cute restaurants right nearby and also places to just pick up a slice of pizza or a snack (lots of food carts).The staff (front desk, bell stand, M Club and cleaning staff) were all very friendly and accommodating. My son left his bag in the room at checkout and the cleaning staff was already on their way downstairs to get it when we realized it was missing. The bell stand secured us a car service to the airport and held our bags all day while we were out for no charge. And every time I had a small issue with a key or anything, the people at the desk were very helpful and more than generous.No doubt I will consider the Marriott Eastside for my next trip to NYC. Looking forward to 4 years out when my next child turns 10 and gets to go on his trip to NYC! I give them a 5 for service and a 4 for quality of the rooms. That said if I could give a 4.5 I would!

Really enjoyed our stay at the New York Marriott East Side, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. They gave us a great room and had it ready well before check in, and also gave us a late checkout which really helped us in enjoying our last few hours of our trip. The location is very central to all activities and has lots of options for transit, dining, and sight seeing. Rooms are fairly large for NYC and the beds were very comfortable and I always like the Marriott bath amenities. Definitely recommend and I will certainly stay here again when visiting NYC.

The New York Marriott East Side was a very nice property to stay at, the rooms were a bit smaller but very clean and modern for an older hotel. The location was central to everything and walking distance to the subway, all the midtown sites, and central park; there are also a lot of nice restaurants and bars in the area. The only drawback was lack of free wifi in the rooms which was not that much of an issue considering they had free wifi in the lobby. I would stay at the New York Marriott East Side again.

Overall there was more good than bad. Check-in, one person had something else to do when it was time to check-in. The person that checked me in was nice. View was wonderful and room was bigger than I thought. It was not clear if I qualified for free Internet or not so passed. Lots of restaurants near by.

I stayed at this hotel 12-15 years ago and it seems like it is exactly the same. I stayed in a double occupancy room with my family of four and it was cramped. Additionally the bathroom had no source of ventilation so it got extremely stuffy and damp any time someone took a shower. I understand New York prices and small spaces - but they need to update this property for it to still feel like a mid-range Marriott property. Great location, however.

Hotel situated perfectly too many major attractions in the city. Not as crowded or loud as the Marriott Marquis. Staff was incredibly friendly. Josh was great when I checked in. Margaret in the concierge lounge was extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations as well as local attractions. The furniture is in need of a dating and one of three elevators going towards the top floors frequently it did not work. Was a decent value for the money.

This hotel is located in a very good location near Grand Central Station and the Rockefeller Centre.We were lucky to be upgraded to a larger suite with a separate sitting area with a pull out sofa bed. It was facing the back of the hotel and extremely quiet.We had access to the Marriott Club Lounge which is open 24 hours and serves a good breakfast with hot and cold items. They have cold drinks and a great latte machine that is available 24 hours. They serve some cookies/ cakes on week days evenings. Not much else for happy hour. They do have beer and liqueur available for purchase.The house keeping was excellent. We always returned to a spotlessly clean room. The Internet was quite fast and worked well in the room.The only two minor issues were the carpets in the room and the corridors were starting to show their age (they are quite clean though) and the water pressure for the shower was not very strong.We will stay here again when we return to NYC.

The Marriott was in a good location. Safe area, which is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Times Square area. The hotel staff was accommodating. We ended up switching rooms after the first night because our room on the front side of the hotel allowed us to hear every horn, car door, and siren. Beds were comfortable and the catered food was good.

Wanting a full week of NYC excitement and stimulation, this was a perfect location with pleasant rooms and helpful concierge. I would definitely head back here again when I need a fix of plays, good food, museums and plenty of interesting walking!

Lobby of hotel was beautiful; 24 hour lounge with free drinks; came with breakfast; great expresso machine to make lattes, hot chocolate and coffees; great, comfortable bed and pillows; clean room; very nice bathroom; near Grand Central and United Nations; near 5th Ave and Park Ave; had a very nice stay.

This was our first time staying at the Marriott Eastside. About once a month, my husband and I go to the theater on a Friday night and stay over at a NYC hotel. We decided to give the Marriott Eastside a try based on an attractive rate and our status as Marriott Gold members. We could not have been more satisfied. We had a beautiful, modern, quiet room. Check in was efficient, for a Friday. Breakfast in the M Lounge was a plus. The food was varied and ample. The hotel is close to Grand Central Terminal. There are many restaurants in the neighborhood. We will certainly come back.
user_name:
Marcia A
New Rochelle, New York

review_body: Was able to check in early, room was clean and larger than my daughter's one room apartment. Hotel staff was accommodating and friendly. Wish the bar/dining was open mid day so we could cool off with a drink in our hotel. Good value for NYC and convenient to subway and main attractions.

Early checkin was not available but other than that the hotel is terrific. Staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was spacious for NYC. We had a high floor and the view was nice. For more views, go to the fitness center on the roof and check out the gargoyles peering down on the pedestrians below!

We stayed here only for one night. We were scheduled for 3, but had to cut our vacation short due to a work commitment. My husband is a Platinum with Marriott and we had the use of the concierge lounge. Wow! What a set up! The breakfast is hot or cold. A lot of variety. There is a barrista machine that you can get hot cappuccinos, lattes, or hot chocolate. We were greeted by the valet upon our arrival (we drove on our way back to Kentucky). They helped with bags and were gracious enough to extend our 24 hour parking time without additional charge. We were then greeted with the excitement and lovely smiles of the check in desk. The ladies there were the most welcoming staff I think I've ever encountered. They were lovely to the children and took care of all of our needs. The room was on the 16th floor. This floor is newly renovated according to the hotel. The rooms are spacious and modern. Huge flat screen TV and the shower is a rain shower. Beds are super comfortable! Just had a wonderful stay!! Fridge in the room along with a coffee maker. Safe also. Can't wait to come back!!!

This visit was with my family and like always Marriott never disappoints. Great location but the hotel and the staff were amazing. Always helpful and courteous. The front desk made the change and gave us a bigger room on a higher floor which put the biggest smile on my kids face.

I stayed here one night. Our check in didn't go as planned due to several flight issues and rerouting. I called the hotel to let them know we would be late, WAY late but we were coming. We ended up checking in around 2am. The front desk guy said he had been expecting us. We were pretty miserable but so glad to finally get to the hotel with a warm welcome.The lobby was very New York and so were the small elevators. They are small! but charming. I love when hotels keep older characteristics. Our room was surprisingly big! We had a corner room. It was very nice.The rooms are a bit dated style wise, but for the space, I didn't mind. A lot of Marriott properties are getting rid of desks and dressers so I love that this hotel still had them!Location of the hotel is great. Lots of places to eat near by and attractions.About the Lounge for Gold and Platinum members:Open 24/7 for water and other drinks.I found it small for a New York Lounge but well appointed. It had great design, with some very nice light fixtures. It was pretty busy on Friday the 22nd at 8am. It’s not really “lounge” or “club” like to me. It’s more “business” style. Grab, sit and go! It didn’t make me want to stay and relax. It was also very “closed in”. It was not one large open space but several broke up spaces. Still the overall design and finishes were quite nice.It was your basic breakfast with eggs, sausage, potatoes (no grits! Not in NY), yogurts, fruits and cereals. Honestly I can’t really complain about any complimentary breakfast. It was nice to have especially after the terrible previous day and night (due to the airline). It was great to have a place that I knew of to sit down and eat before dealing with the day (and lost luggage!)I would stay here again.

Very clean rooms and the bed was amazing. The bed linens were soft and very high quality. On the 22nd floor with a limited view but I was impressed with how quiet it was.Bar was well serviced and the bourbon flight special was a delightful treat. Need to improve the elevator speed but overall a great place to stay.

My husband and I stayed for 3 nights over the weekend. Check in was quick and painless. The room was exceptionally clean. I booked a standard king and somehow we ended up with a nice view, which was great. The cleaning staff was incredibly friendly. Every time we passed the cleaning lady in the hall she asked us how our stay was going and if there was anything we needed.I will say there was some noise due to emergency vehicles and some construction, but this is NYC and that is to be expected. Our AC worked well for a while but Saturday night it shut itself off for no reason, so we did wake up hot. I'm not sure if it was a setting or what. The elevators are very small and need to be updated. Aside from that, I really don't have any major complaints. We did some drinking at 525Lex downstairs and the bartenders were very friendly. Overall, it's an older hotel that could use updating, but it was very clean and comfortable. I would stay here again if I end up needing to stay in the city.

I have stayed at this Marriott for close to 60 days over a three month period. I would say that it is a clean hotel with great beds and sheets. Street noise, size of bathroom, and wear and tear on rooms would be some of the main drawbacks. My recommendation is to stay on a higher floor.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott East Side. The check in clerk could not have been more friendly and accommodating. Our room was larger than I thought it would be and very clean and the bed was very comfortable. We will be back.
user_name:
John T
Glen Ridge, New Jersey

review_body: This is my third time staying here and I choose to use points for a trip with my daughter. The rooms and hallways are very rundown and are way past due for a remodel. Location is great to see the city, but not worth 90,000 points for the stay.

From the moment you check in till you leave everything about this hotel is underwhelming! No room service, no mini bar, no wifi, elevators that struggle to have their doors open, disinterested staff.....whether you are coming for business or personal avoid this hotel!

This was a family vacation and we wanted to stay at a location that was not in the "heart" of everything. Great choice. We had chosen another hotel, but cancelled it. This location was more money, but definitely worth it. The room was on the 16th floor and all amenities were newly updated. We were all very comfortable and hated to leave. The location is within walking distance to most attractions.

A great NYC Marriott. The hotel has a lot of charm, and was the perfect location for our recent weekend. The room was a good size. We ate at 525 Lex for late night and lunch. The food and service was good, and we liked the food and drink choices.

I had a room on the third floor overlooking Lexington with a single big bed. The room was not quiet, but the A/C covered for most of the traffic noise. A/C worked well, bathroom was fine, bed was comfortable. I didn't get the impression the hotel was full, so service was fast with no waits at the desk or bell stand, and I checked in about an hour early with no problem and a choice of 3rd or 20th floor. I got a good price through Priceline Express so I considered this a bargain, although it would perhaps have seemed lackluster at full rack price. At the same rate, I'd stay there again.
user_name:
LEONARD O
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed on 7/5-7/6. Great location! My husband is a Marriott rewards member so we like to stay at Marriott properties. We have stayed there before and is within walking distance to many attractions. We were there on an overnight trip to the city to see a couple of Broadway shows and to celebrate my husbands birthday. The staff is excellent and very helpful. This goes for the doorman, front desk,security, concierge level staff, bellman, etc. The ladies at the front desk were very friendly and had wine and cheese sent up to our room upon seeing it was my husbands birthday. The next day the front desk staff helped us with parking for our car as we were going to be leaving later that evening. Will stay there again!

This was another great Marriott property overall. The lobby and housecleaning staff were all very friendly and polite. We had a corner room on the 23rd floor that was spacious for New York standards. The bed was excellent. The bathroom had some paint noticeably missing on the door frame. I think it stems from the fact that the bathrooms are poorly ventilated and retain a lot of moisture after, say, using the shower. I'm not sure what the hotel can do about that because the building is very old. In any event, the M Club Lounge was a great option. The breakfast had a complete selection of hot and cold foods...there was something for everybody. I will note that it was extremely busy both days we were there. I was surprised because the lounge covers a huge space yet almost all the tables were full. One of the best parts of the hotel is its location. It's located near the intersection of several major subway lines so it has easy access to just about anywhere in the city. I wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again.

Very outdated hotel and overpriced for what it is. No fridge in room and very noisy air conditioner. Not my idea of heaven. However it is centrally located. Look somewhere else would be my suggestion. We ate at Ashley's deli across the road and food was expensive in the hotel.

I can't say enough positive things about the staff that work at this hotel. Most of the time you feel compelled to write a negative review when things go wrong, but rarely complete a review when they go right. Everyone from concierge, valet, room service and especially Jackie from the M-Club Lounge was perfect. Kudos to a wonderful staff.

They have now moved the concierge lounge (for any Marriott Gold members) to the second floor. The new version is very modern and attractive but I still prefer the older one on the 16th? Floor. But it was great.It must be a great place to work because I have been coming for at least 10 years and I still see a lot of the same people. Especially this sweet Indian man in the concierge lounge. He always wants to make sure you have the best experience and enjoy the wonderful coffee! It is an older hotel and some of the rooms have less than ideal rooms. This past visit, we had a junior suite on the 8th floor 8029? and our view was of another building and more specifically, a toilet! That was a bit disappointing. I wish as a Marriott allowed you to pick your own rooms as Hilton Honors does. We would definitely not have picked this room for the view. That aside, it was a great and spacious room - comfortable bed and couch.Breakfast at the concierge lounge was plentiful and had lots of fresh fruit. Coffee options are excellent.Will stay again.

This is an older property that Marriott has refurbished nicely. The hotel elevators are a bit odd with some elevators only servicing certain floors, which requires two elevator rides to get to the gym on the top floor. Since one elevator was out of services, had to climb the last three flight of stairs to the gym....not a problem since going for a work out anyway. The room was of good size for NYC and was well appointed and comfortable. The hotel concierge lounge has been remodeled per the new "M Club" standard and was quite large. The location is fantastic within easy walking to distance to everything in mid town.

Being a Platinum Elite with over 200 nights for this year, you get used to being treated a certain way at Marriott properties. This hotel did just that. I had used points to stay here, as the location was prime to everything you want on the east side. And it was near to all the subway stations you need to take to get anywhere. First I have to say Kevin on the late shift at the Elite counter was great. When I arrived they said that I was on a high floor and an upgraded room. Didn't seem like it. I was on the 8th floor with a superior king. But still felt small. Kevin helped me into a premier King suite with a sitting room, and onto the 15th floor. That was perfect. The property is great. The M Concierge Lounge is spacious and open 24/7. Hotel is a little dated, but the furnishings are very comfortable. Great location, and some of the most friendly and helpful staff in NYC.

Just blocks from all the hustle and bustle of Times Square without all the noise and crowds! Love the charm of this hotel. Staff was EXCELLENT!! I was very pleased with the room size for a NYC hotel. My only negative was the shower curtain was stinky and needs to be replace. Otherwise it was clean. Again location and staff was excellent!

The Front desk very helpful when we wanted 2 Queens instead of King even at short notice. Room was nice & to our liking. Free Wi Fi available only in Lobby which is not a plus but then again they need to get what they can from Lazy Guests. This did not deter me from giving 4 stars though, I would have liked it. My wife did not mind going to the lobby and I was not happy to do it & deprived myself of Wi Fi.

My husband and I stayed here one night for our anniversary. The hotel was modern and updated. We usually stay in Midtown but was pleasantly surprised at how close of a walk this was from Times Square and our usual hangouts. It's in a great location as far as unique restaurants and bars are concerned, and the Sunday we arrived there was a street festival spanning several blocks in front of the hotel with food and other vendors.The room was very spacious for NYC, and there was a tub in the bathroom, which is always a plus. The bed was comfy, our room was quiet and had no outside or hallway noise. We had an enjoyable stay. The lone negative of the trip was that wi-fi was not included in the cost of the room. It's crazy in this day and age where free wi-fi is everywhere from street corners to coffeeshops that a hotel would make you pay extra to access wifi. If you're thinking of coming to this hotel for a lengthy vacation, it'd be enough to convince me to find another hotel to stay at. However, we were just in town for a night so it didn't negatively affect our stay but it could have long term.Overall, it's a quality hotel for a one or two night stay and we enjoyed our stay, but the wifi fee would stop us from making a long term stay here.

I can only rate this as average/good. The plus sides were that the hotel is in an acceptable location (10mins walk to times square) and central station a few minutes away. The rooms are clean and ours was quiet (although this is because it was not street facing and the windows looked into other blacked out windows) - no view at all. The beds were comfortable and the junior suite was handy if you need 3 separate beds (hard to find in hotels in NY which is why we ended here). I cant comment on breakfast as this was not included. There was a TV in both rooms and they had good channel selection. A few aspects were disappointing though and left us likely to look for another hotel next visit. I imagine NYC hotels can get away with whatever they want being in demand all the time, but a few things were irritating when you pay good money to stay here. We stayed in a suite which cost a fair sum. After you get out of the small elevators, we found our room was dated. Whilst I appreciate its hard to renovate these old places in NYC, i think 4 stars might be a bit generous. The room (which was tidy) is smaller than pics imply but still acceptable with bags on the floor (i did not see any case stands). Strangely the basin is not in the bathroom and so you brush your teeth on carpeted floors outside the bathroom. The shower head is set for someone 5 foot 9 or less. Wifi is not included in room cost. The service was disappointing. We asked for linen on the first night and after 40 minutes rang to ask if we could please have it as no one had come. The reply was that "I had already told someone". Not really an acceptable reply, please just bring the sheets! The doormen did not open or greet at any time during several days, barring when we left and came down with our bags needing a cab (hence a tip). There were 1 or 2 nice folk at the concierge who helpfully advised us to get washing done elsewhere when asked (i.e. it costs $6 to get one pair of socks washed in the hotel). I was also frustrated to have to pay the minimum $5 fee to print one concert ticket in the business centre. Whilst i was grateful for the conversation with the reception manager who had to follow policy, the policy was unacceptable when you are paying above standard rates for this hotel. Ultimately its a clean and adequate hotel, but it is not up to the standard of the Marriott reputation at this time if this is what you think you are paying for.

This was a very nice hotel, but just a little pricey. Hotel staff was very nice and welcoming! Parking is a little outrageous. It is very close to the trains and a lot of nice restaurants and spas. It is easy to get a taxi to commute through out the city.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott East Side for 3 nights and absolutely enjoyed our stay. We didn't have to worry about anything. Immediately upon arrival, we were checked in (even early no problem), were upgraded to a room with a great view and were treated with the utmost care. I am a Marriott Rewards member and not sure if that is the reason but definitely we were surprised on the upside with the hospitality. I have come to appreciate Marriott as a hotel even more recently. I now live abroad in the Netherlands and we travel quite a bit. When in doubt, I make sure we stay at a Marriott. We have not been disappointed...always consistent. With our room at Marriott East Side, it was truly perfect for what we needed. I can't say much for all the amenities because we ate out and didn't spend every moment at the hotel, as you would expect visiting New York. When we were there, it was perfect in every way. Rooms are spacious, clean and have a nice decor (very Marriott). I have stayed at hotels often in New York and I would not hesitate to stay here again nor recommending it to others. It was a great value and central location to everything New York has to offer.

The hotel is located close to the times square but not too close. There are two metro stations near by and a lot of options for food. The room is a bit small but nice and clean. There is no free wifi in the room.

This is a great hotel in a fabulous location. Small clean room close to everything in mid town. Walk to St Patrick's Cathedral, walk to Radio a City and Rockefeller Center..very short walk to Grand Central and all subways and trains.Bar is VERY expensive...As far as I'm concerned, I'll be back! Great value for location.

Hotel is located next to the Waldorf Astoria in a great location of Manhattan, near Times Square and theaters, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and Madison Ave shopping, St Patrick's Cathedral and Central Park. Exercise room and pool. Nice rooms, small, no view, great customer service. Since I am from NYC, I really appreciated location to the sights.

For the Marriott members this location is on 7 blocks from Grand Central Station and only a 10 minute walk down Lexington. The rooms are nice and modern and the higher you are the better your views. The lobby bar and restaurant is very good and the staff is friendly. I recommend a top floor on the south side so you get a nice view of the Chrysler Building.

We have stayed here several times while going to Memorial Sloan for tests. The site is centrally located, old and not too clean (more on that later). The bus staff and front desk are top notch and very helpful. Back to the cleanliness issue, my wife dropped something on the floor, when I went to get it, I noticed something under the bed. It turned out to be a pair of socks which were covered in a heavy coat of dust. This is unacceptable and why we won't be going back. (BTW our friend also stayed there and the garbage receptacles were full when they entered their room)

We stayed during the Christmas week and it was an amazing Christmas vibe in the Hotel. The hotel is in the best location just right in the middle of New York, great rooms. Top floor rooms have excellent view of New York.

We stayed here for two nights this past weekend and could not be more pleased. After staying at the Renaissance and Marriott Marquis, this east side hotel was great. As platinum members we were hoping to get upgraded to a suite, however at checkin they said the hotel was full, so we were given a large king room (2401) on the back side of the hotel. I would highly recommend this room to anyone looking for a very quiet location. The staff were great and always smiling. The concierge gave us great recommendations of how to get around town and what to expect. We ate at several restaurants close to the hotel, with our favorite being the Empire Steak House, which had a fantastic bar menu. The M Club was consistent with other Marriott properties and had plenty of seating. Our room was a reasonable rate, considering what we used to pay at the Waldorf. We would definitely stay here again.

Spent a night here on business recently and had the classic Marriott experience. Didn't have my rewards number handy on check in, but provided it later and I was given a new room key with access to the executive lounge.  - The room is what you'd expect from a Marriott although I did find the air conditioning unit a little primitive - Bed wasn't up to the usual Marriott standard - definitely not as luxurious as usual - Lifts were easily accessible which isn't always the case in NY hotels - Well located for my needs - Good selection of food in the lounge for breakfast with snacks available throughout the dayA good stay, but not reaching the typical 5 star experience I expect.

Want a nice place, great location and service all the while in the heart of NYC then next time choose the Marriott East Side hotel ... you won't regret it. Not sure what else to add other than we had a most wonderful time in the city.

We were so impressed with this place - from the bellhops to the desk clerks to the concierge! The concierge was so friendly - she gave me so much great advice the week before we came! There is delicious fruit-infused ice water in the lobby. We had a room on the 17th floor with great views. The room was beautifully appointed, clean and large. The shower head was huge, and the shower was great! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. We could walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park.

Although I may not be the most experience city-goer, the Marriott on Lexington and 49th was beyond ideal for our large group of 19 "bar crawlers" on a hot summer night. We were in close proximity to the subway and our locations of interest. I would definitely stay there in the future if I were to be doing more exploring around Midtown. Being only my second trip to NYC, while everyone else in the group lives only a short drive to the City, I was impressed by the amenities available at a decent price and overall appearance of the hotel. The M Club Lounge was a first for me, so I found that to be extravagant and convenient. Although I didn't have time to check out the fitness center, I did run stairs bright and early the next morning for some exercise, which I find more effective than the gym; 35 floors and all.

This hotel is a very old hotel and a bit disappointing compared to other Marriot. Room is spacious and clean but look outdated and old. Service is good and staff are all helpful and responsive. Location maybe its prime reason to choose to stay here given it is near central park, rockie feller centre, and many famous steak houses in nyc including sparks, benjamin, wolfgang's. Wifi is at extra cost though.

Was booked here for business. Pros:Ease with check-in (and friendly staff)Gym on 35th floor has good viewsGreat locationQuieter streetElite Members can get breakfast/snacks/water on 2nd floorCons:Tiny RoomsTiny Window w/no viewElevator to gym was broken (didn't mind since that just made my workout better)No bottled water in room (but if you access to lounge you can grab waters on the 2nd floor)Overall, an adequate room, just didn't have any glitz or glamor.

The hotel is in a good location but be warned-the rooms are terrible. The noise proofing is exceptionally poor with incessant traffic noise (despite being on 10th floor), noise from other rooms and corridor etc. The rooms are small, old and worn out especially the carpets. I felt exhausted after 2 nights due to poor sleep. Only good thing to say was that the beds were comfortable. Reception was helpful and breakfast was ok

Hotel well situated and offers all the usual amenities. Managed to get an early check-in and room was clean. Spacious and comfortable room with internet somewhat unreliable. Breakfast in morning was ok, but not great. Staff helpful

This is basically what one would expect from an expensive Marriott in NYC. There were some annoying issues however. The elevator to the fitness center was broken and based on the fancy signage that they had it seems like they are in no hurry to fix it. (Yes I realize that it's strange to complain about steps to a fitness center!). The center itself was so cramped with people and equipment that it was not usable. Finally a fellow guest ordered room service and left the tray on the floor in the hallway (as is typical) however the hotel staff left it there for at least 14 hours. Although these are admittedly trivial complaints I expected more from an expensive NYC Marriott.

Great location, period. I asked for early check in and was granted at 1pm (instead of 4pm). They gave me a corner room. Large room for NYC. Quick bellman and valet park service. Helped with restaurants and the neighborhood. Would stay here again without question. Good value too

As New York hotels go, it is adequate. As far as Marriott is concerned, it's not their greatest hotel. But, it's central, and close enough to Manhatten's business area, the theatre ditict, the garment district, the Grand Central, Broadway & Central Park.The room has all the usual fixtures. A double bed, a flat screen TV, a coffee maker, an electronic safe, and a bathroom with a tub.The restaurant in the lobbydownstairs serves breakfast & the happy hour drinks & dinner. There is a guest services lady who gives you relevant information. There's no airport pick up & drop off, which can mean a bit of discomfort.For the price, location is a great value.

The location is excellent. The rooms are large and clean. The concierge lounge is wonderful and provides a variety of food selections. We enjoyed the restaurant's food and atmosphere located on the first floor.

I was in NYC for three nights for a business trip and wanted to try this Marriott. I was greeted very professionally with a nice smile. I was able to check in online and request a noon check in. I was very happy that the room was ready. The room is nice but does need to be updated. Very comfortable though. The M lounge was great. Hot breakfast in the morning and nice snacks in the evening with 24 hour access for water, coffee, etc...Delightful service in the lounge. Everyone working at the hotel was very pleasant. Location is excellent and you are close to many restaurants. I will be back!!!

The NY Marriott East Side is our go to hotel when we visit Manhattan. It is close to the subway, across the street from the hop on/ hop off bus, and within reasonable walking distance to 30 Rock, Times Square, and the theater district. I usually get a platinum upgrade, and the M Club lounge is very comfortable, with plenty of snacks and drinks. Highly recommended, and we will be back.

I had a good decent stay. Staff was friendly at all points. The room was decent size for NY and was fitted out in standard Marriott Colorado scheme. I was a bit worried about noise in room facing Lexington avenue but it was quiet enough for good sleep quality. The hotel gets a fair amount of traffic and is a little worn in spots. The location is great for business.

Hotel ok .But with late check in (4pm) and early check out (12pm) made it a dear experience especially with added tax and city rate ?.Good location but noisy at night .Had to ring guest services to change bedding as it was dirty .Didnt eat or drink here though so can't comment on them .

I made a reservation for two rooms for our trip to see the Thanskgiving Day parade. I had no trouble switching one room to my brother's name upon arrival as the front desk staff was quite helpful. The hotel is a short walk from the subway, so it was easy getting to and from the airport. The location was fabulous for our short stay in the city. We had access to the M Club Lounge which was great for snacks and breakfast. The staff in the Lounge was very helpful in securing a late checkout so I didn't have to stop at the front desk in case of a line. I was unable to obtain a Platinum upgrade as the hotel was booked and larger rooms/suites were taken days before I arrived. My husband and I had a king room which was somewhat small without a city view, but we weren't in NYC to stay in our room. The room had all the usual amenities, was clean, and met our needs. My brother's room was much bigger as it had two double beds and was at the end of the hall. Our rooms were adjacent to each other, so that was great for organizing our time. The only "problem" we had was that two different people at the concierge desk told us we wouldn't be able to get a spot for the parade unless we camped out on the street overnight and suggested we head to the start of the parade. We headed out very early to do that, but on our way to the subway station we headed to the parade route and found a great place not far from the hotel to watch the parade, with only one row of people in front of us.The elevators are small, but we never had a problem getting one in a timely fashion. There is a small gift shop off the lobby. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas when we were there. We will stay here on our next trip to NYC.

The extensive tunnel network of Grand Central will bring you just a few blocks from the hotel, which is located a short distance from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and the UN. Good selection of restaurants in the general area and you can find a fair number of the subway lines within a quick walk as well. The hotel is older and keeps some of that charm. It has the service you would expect from a Marriot, with attentive front desk staff and a good number of staff to handle baggage as well. It pays to be a Marriot rewards member, otherwise the WiFi is $16 per day. $30 buffet breakfast is available, but we opted for a delicious Ess-a-bagel just a few blocks away. The room was clean, comfortable, and typical size for NYC. The bathroom seemed to have been recently remodeled and was very clean. One thing to note is that the technology was a little behind the times - clock had the old 30-pin dock for phones, not the smaller lighting connector. And while they had an impressive selection of a/v inputs built into the wall, there was no where to plug-in a USB cable to charge your phone. Bring your pronged AC power adapter. Facing Lexington Ave the hotel is exposed to a lot of traffic as well, which kept things noisy [even on the 12th floor].

Spent a week end at this hotel. As previous reviewees stated you just cant beat the location. It's very central. I really can't say anything negative about this hotel. The rooms were a bit on the smaller side yet very clean. The beds were super comfortable. Shower was great. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. This is an older property but well maintained. I consider it old New York charm.The restaurants and bars are very expensive but I find this to be true of most hotels. There are plenty of inexpensive options around for breakfast ( not included in our rate) or to pick up a quick bite. We were on the 22nd floor. The view wasnt great but we were far from the street traffic noise. A pleasant stay all in all. I would stay here again.

I like old hotels. I like this location a lot. We have stayed here before and not much has changed in 2 years. Rooms are clean, larger than normal. Not exciting. Lots of windows but could be washed outside. Same as 2 years ago.Bigger bathroom, good shower. Large towels.Bed good. Lobby OK but far from grand. Bar on 1st floor OK but again, not exciting. Go to another bar or hotel if you want a drink. Love the location. Having said that there are 10 other hotels within a 2 block radius.So why did we pick this? Price and Marriott points.Depending on the prices in surrounding hotels I would recommend a stay here. You won't be excited but you won't be upset.Service very good. People seem to enjot working there.

Property was a standard Marriott property. Booked as a Memorial Sloan Kettering patient....paid significant more than if I booked with my triple A....imagine, charging cancer patient more than people with a triple A card

The property:This older, east side building lacks some of the grandiose lobbies and entrances of other hotels, but works well and is nicely located, near the subway and a short walk to Grand Central Station. It feels more like a neighborhood apartment building than a hotel, and that's a good thing.Check-inThis couldn't have been a nicer experience. My compliments to Collette and Denise at reception. They were beams of sunshine! The process was smooth and I was in my room in no time.The roomI was fortunate to have a small suite on the 33rd floor and it was very nice. A long foyer, with closet, led to a sitting room. There were french doors leading to the bedroom and the bedroom had its own entrance to the bath (with another door to the foyer). There was also another closet near the bath. The rooms were a nice size in which to relax and not feel cramped after a day in the city. Lighting was good, considering the size of the room, and the light blocking curtains functioned well. It was, generally, very quiet, and I heard no foot traffic.It was nicely appointed, but I'll offer some observations:•the design is dated (for transparency, I am a designer by trade), the color palette, carpeted rooms and furnishings appear from another decade. All, however, were spotlessly clean! But it could use a refresh.•it is an upper level room and the bedroom windows reach from the floor to about 4' high. The sitting area windows are fine. (It has to do with the building's architecture.) I wouldn't trade a nice suite for higher windows, though. Relax and enjoy.The bathroom:A large, well lit bathroom with the usual amenities. There was no tub and the shower was on the smallish side. Not an issue for me, but could be for others. I like that it had a small foyer entrance from the bedroom with a closet. It was practically a dressing room.Water temperature and pressure were good, especially considering an older building and being on the 33rd floor. One issue, but it's rather common, the bath vent shares with the neighboring room and you get to hear a lot of their noises...and they, likely, yours. Just an FYI.Extra notes:-Standard Wifi is an exorbitant $16.95/day, unless you book through Marriott or are a Rewards member. I travel extensively and it still irks me that hotels are still charging for the wifi. It did, however, work well.-Rooms on 33-35 (35 has the fitness center) must be accessed by an additional elevator. Not a big deal, but keep it in mind for timing. During my stay, the additional elevator had a mechanical. I phoned to inform the front desk, but they were already on it, and I just used the stairs to go down one flight to catch the regular elevator. Not worth complaining about to staff, but know your options going in.-The M LoungeThis was a nice perk, with morning breakfast and heavy snacks in the evening. The breakfast was vast and quite nice, with the concierge personally visiting with guests to help them with their day's plans, a nice touch. Evening selections included salads, pasta, cheeseboards, and the like. You could make a light supper of it. It was good, the variety was nice, and the staff, again, very nice and eager to please. One observation, the evening snacks were cleared at 7:30, even though the serving vessels were still full. No one had a chance for seconds and some guests arrived at 7:40, shocked that there was nothing to snack on. It made no sense, with all that food, to shut down so early. I didn't see a posting of serving times, and that may be helpful to guests to plan their evening.The verdict:A nice property, convenient to transportation, food and shopping. A quieter neighborhood feel is very nice, too. Overall, the great staff makes up for any inconveniences.

I have stayed in this hotel twice and the rooms were very nicely fitted out on both occasions. It is a lovely, traditional building but with modern facilities.It is in a great location for Subways and within easy walking distance of Fifth Avenue and Central Park. I like this hotel very much.

I arrived at the Marriott late afternoon. The hotel was busy. I attempted to check-in but found there was a mix up, of my own doing with my reservation. In my confusion I lost track of my garment bag. It was hours later when I realized my bag wasn't with my other suitcases. I was in a panic. I contacted the Bell Stand and was helped by Ward and Manny. They started a chain of action that continued with Hector and Lee at Valet, Alma and Dan at Front Desk but the man who had the "prize" was Steve at Loss Prevention (apt name). They all stopped and put sincere effort in helping me. Seven people from four departments, that's impressive. #gratefultourist

This a a typical old NYC hotel which is just one of a number of Marriotts here. Great location on Lexington/49th makes for easy walking access to many places and close to Grand Central Terminal for Subway etc. And plenty of choice for places to eat within easy walking distance.Room seemed fairly large compared to what I often have in NYC but this could just be because it is a corner with with dual aspect windows overlooking Lexington Ave. Not what I consider large compared to newer hotels but room to spread out a bit. Plentiful, instant hot water and great shower. Comfortable bed and blackout roller blinds but due to location pretty noisy from street below. As is normal in big city 'upmarket' hotels it costs $16.95 upwards per day to access wifi in room but the free wifi in lobby is fairly fast with quick connection. How these hotels can get away with charging exorbitant rates for what most guests treat as an essential now I don't know. I guess only business people with unlimited expenses use it.

I travel every single week for work and stay at a Marriott property. My 'usual' NYC hotel was sold out, so I ventured to the Marriott East Side. When you travel 50+ weeks a year and spend 3 or 4 nights a week in a hotel, your standards are bound to elevate,and little things that may not bother the non-traveler, bother the road warrior. The lobby was beautiful. The location was perfect. The hotel staff was pleasant and genuine. The rooms were awful. Broken, crooked, dented lamp in my room. A line of dust on the light switches that were stained from finger prints. Stains lining the base of the wallpaper at the floor level. A giant stain on the carpet when you walk into the room. Three small orange stains ON MY SHEETS (disgusting). Peeling wallpaper throughout many seams in the room. Apparently, the alarm clock had fallen off the end table from prior guest or during cleaning. I picked it up and set it back on the end table--after three days, the cleaning staff never fixed it. This hotel needs to be renovated. I will never stay here again.

The rooms are smaller than the Marque and there is no room service which was disappointing as I arrived late at night. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Location is good with lots within walking distance. Rooms are fairly quiet.
user_name:
Angela D
Pewaukee, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: We stayed for a girls weekend. Very close to rockefeller ctr. Also there is a cute deli within 2-3 blocks you can grab cheap good breakfast and pizza. Our room was quite big compared to some of the other girls rooms.

We met children and grandchildren in NYC for a long weekend. Shopping, Broadway play "Beautiful", Yankees game (they won), a prospective college and museum visits, and fine dining. This hotel was a good location and provided many amenities to help the weekend be a great one. The staff is friendly, courteous and professional. Jokingly, I asked a hostess in the concierge lounge if they served ice cream for dessert for the kids. She told me they did not, but returned 20 minutes later with four containers of Hagen-Das ice cream. Now, that is customer service. We will stay there again.

One of the best hotels I ever stayed...From arrival to leaving I can say FIVE STARS PLUS . Room was large with a beautiful viewed east side, the restaurant was very clean like all the hotel, well educated waiters, food from excellent to heaven

Pricing: nobody said that NYC is cheap. This one has variable pricing and it differs everyday. So, do your homework shopping. Styling: It is a rather old building, yet it is not particularly bad. Bathrooms have been renovated and everythings seem to work. But bear in mind that this is Manhattan, so expect smaller room and fewer amenities. Bathroom has no active ventilation (cannot hear or feel any air movement) and often we can smell cigarette smoke seeping through the system.Location: It is about 15 min. walk to Time Square, Central Park or Empire State Building. So do expect some walking to do for mid town attractions. Otherwise, taxi is not that expensive (if you can flag one down).Food: bar/cafe downstairs offers simple meal only. I would spend my money elsewhere. Gold Reward Lounge: most disappointing that we have to pay for beer/wine (at restaurant prices). Also, everything is put away (or locked up) after 9pm or so (don't know exactly). Only thing left in the lounge is soda and water. This is a bummer.
user_name:
TM M
Union City, California, United States

review_body: Stayed here in January - the weekend of the 26" of snow! Great location as within walking distance of many of the central attractions and easy to pick up the tour buses or subway. Had a large corner room on the 27th floor. We booked breakfast and it was varied and plentiful. Staff very helpful and coped cheerfully with the large numbers who chose to eat dinner here when the City was cleared of all traffic on the Saturday evening. Would highly recommend as the price we paid was amazing.

Lovely place: excelent location, very easy to get to. Everything is within walking distanceOur room was little but nice and very clean! Tha bathroom also nice and clean. Free Wi-Fi is available only in the lobby

A group of us ladies went up for the 2016 Tartan Day parade and thus hotel was one of the cheapest we could find within a mile radius of the parade. The room was large for a NYC room and all four of us were extremely comfortable in the room. Just wish the TV had HDMI input, we tried to watch a show from our iPad on the TV and we weren't able. Hotel did not subscribe to the channel we needed. Also wi-Fi was really expensive at almost $20/day, which we had to get to watch out show. Otherwise, everything we needed was brought to us, cream and extra coffee, extra towels, cab service, etc. will definitely be staying here for next year's parade!

The Marriott East Side is a centrally located base of operations for a NYC trip. As noted before, we were within walking distance of many sights- NY Public Library, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's and a longer walk to Times Sq. and the theater district.Our room was comfortable and well lit, big enough considering it is NYC, with 2 full size beds, a desk and sitting chair, desk unit along a wall.We were early for arrival, and the check-in staff was very accommodating; we checked our bags in with the Bell Captain. We used this service on our last day, too, so we could check-out but still explore the city some more without our luggage.I'd recommend this hotel for any family visiting midtown.

Lovely place really: Very easy to get to, rooms are nice and the service is very good. Couple of notes:1- Plenty of elevators2- Rooms are nice, our room smelled not great, not sure why. 3- They have couple of nice options for food.4- Walking distance to great places, good food around adn some good shopping not far. I recommend it. B

This is the third time I have hosted a business meeting at this hotel and stayed on-site. Excellent meeting services staff here. David our banquet manager was awesome. The hotel room is very clean and cozy, typical NYC size. Nice bathroom- very clean! The hotel would be good for a personal stay also, take note of the room size square footage if you have a family- you may need 2 rooms. The hotel front desk staff are excellent, they are friendly and very helpful for any information needed. The bar/ restaurant is very nice and relaxing if you don't feel like venturing out after a long day, the servers spoil you with TLC, relaxing with great ambiance. Had a nice glass of wine and a wonderful salad. There is a small gift shop too. This hotel is in a super location to stroll around the neighborhood and venture out in nice weather. Quick to Uber to shopping or nice restaurant on the East Side. I enjoy this property for business because the staff are excellent, they get it! Thank you for the consistency of providing a great product!

Everything is within walking distance- many sights such as Rockfeller Center, Times Square, Grand central Station, 5th Avenue etc and also many cafes and nice places to eat are all around. The staff are very kind and friendly and there is free WiFi in the lobby. Our room was on the 25th floor and we had a magnificent view of Chrysler tower and other tall buildings. It was quite big, very clean with free coffee-tea equipment and a fridge. We would definitely stay again at this hotel!

Nice room and good front desk. Do you have working room service? I am guessing no on the weekend. Good sized bathrooms. Clean and wonderful beds. Prices can run hot and cold. The location is a little off the normal business grid. Doormen are good at handling taxis.

I had a pleasant stay in this hotel. The hotel is very good, it looks good and it is clean. The rooms are spacious and offer all the amenities one can expect, except for free WIFI in the rooms. Free WIFI was only available in the lobby area, which was unfortunate for me as a visitor/tourist. A stayed in a room that was facing the back and not the street. The view wasn't great but at least it was quiet. One problem that i encountered was that the heating unit in my room made a lot of noise while it was on, which was disturbing. Apart from that, the rest of the experience is positive. The service was great with everyone being very helpful and polite. There is a dedicated office in the hotel (Concierge) that helps guests make reservations in restaurants, events, shows etc. and gives you information and maps of the city. The best thing has to be the location of the hotel. It is in the center of Manhattan, in a nice neighborhood with many restaurants, cafeterias and shops. It is a 12-minute walk away from Times Square and it has a subway station really near, so transportation is easy. I would like it to be a little cheaper and offer WIFI in the rooms for free.

Stayed in the classic double room which was a decent size for three (except for the bathroom). The room had a fridge which was convenient and coffee and tea were always restocked. The restaurant on the main floor had a good selection of offerings but at competitive NY prices. The concierge was quite helpful when our flight returning home was cancelled. He helped us look up alternate options and allowed us to use the office phone to arrange our flight. Overall, a lovely hotel in close proximity to many of the major sites.

I arr 01Apt wt both my girls. Marriott Marquis was a great choice...I was battling between York W times square and Marriott Marquis. I think I make the right choice. Hotel was huge right at Broadway St. Everything was round the corner or beside it. Hotel was fantastic. A lot of people's sat that's noisy at night of cause you choose the busy street to stay. For me it was fantastic. I arrival early in the morning and I still able to check in a room. Front desk reception was friendly and helpful. With not much hesitation she check in in speedy know that we all are tired. Room was huge and clean. Due to one of my girl need special meals wt ask for a fridge to send to our room. Love our room. Oh! room service was the best. The foods was really really good n till now I kept taking of it. We order 2 night room service. Seriously service was the best N food was delicious. I love everything about the Marriott.

The front desk staff, doormen, bellmen - pretty much everyone I dealt with - was courteous and professional. Really a pleasure.But - and this really astonishes me - there is NO ROOM SERVICE. After a very long day of work and meetings, all I wanted to do was watch a hockey game and have dinner in the room. I was directed by the staff to order dinner from one of a few restaurants nearby that deliver. I chose The Smith. 90 minutes later -- seriously, ninety minutes - still no dinner. I called the restaurant to complain, and a delivery guy showed up shortly thereafter. So if you want cold food very late, this is a good system. Otherwise, fuggedaboutit. This is a dealbreaker for me. As a businessperson I can't imagine that abandoning room service is a moneymaker for Marriott. As a weary traveler, I just want a damn sandwich and a hockey game.

Just landed at JFK and headed to Manhattan. It was a longer than usual ride due to the rain. Upon arrival at hotel, i had an easy checkin. You should be aware that in general hotel rooms in NYC are on the small size compared to many cities i travel. Otherwise my accomodations were as expected. As a Marriott Gold member, I was delighted to see their members lounge and all the food and snack offerings at night and again for breakfast, all complimentary. That lounge which was spacious for all receiving that benefit made my visit even more pleasant. I had a comfortable stay and luckily didnt hear much street noise as i have experienced at other NYC hotels. So i had a good nights sleep for someone on a business trip which turned out to be pleasant. I will definitely go back to this hotel again.

I recently brought some of my family members to stay at the Marriott East side as it was convenient to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, where we were taking my mother for cancer treatment. The hotel was nice as you would expect from a typical Marriott but the staff was what really stood out on this trip. I cannot say enough great things about how accommodating everyone was during our stay but the person that stood out the most was the bellman Albert. While assisting my family members to their rooms Albert found out about my mother and the fact we were there to take her to Memorial Sloan hospital. Albert then took it upon himself to make arrangements to upgrade my parents to a suite in which we would all be able to gather with her and visit after a long day of doctor’s appointments. Furthermore he sent some special treats to the room and he even bought a card for my mother and had the staff sign it. He went far above and beyond to make her feel special and to help us make the very best of a sad trip.I am a Platinum Elite member and have always been treated very well at the Marriott properties but this experience was by far the best in regards to how hard the staff worked to make sure we were very comfortable and could make the best of our time together. Everyone was so kind and made sure that my mother felt like a rock star.My mother has that card proudly displayed on a shelf in her home now. It meant so much to her that a stranger(s) could care so much. I can’t thank Albert enough and he has made a lasting impression on all of us. He is a true gem and a huge asset to Marriott. Additionally, the club lounge at this property is one of the best I have ever visited. The selection was excellent at all times of the day and the staff, like in the rest of the hotel, always went out of their way to make sure everyone was taken care of. I highly recommend this hotel when visiting NYC, and I will absolutely return. In fact I already have reservations to return in the next few weeks and my husband is currently staying at the hotel as I write this review. I would also chose this hotel over others, even if it is not convenient to where I need to be in NYC solely based on our experience with Albert.

On the pro side, this hotel is near Grand Central, it's clean and safe. For the cons, the rooms are small, the elevators are slow (there was always a wait), there's no personal service and it's average quality. I had to call housekeeping twice. There was no blowdryer in the bathroom. It was stored in a small closet outside the bathroom. There was no coffee in the room. It was delivered in 10 minutes or so. Our room, 301, looked out on the backside of other buildings so there was only a view of brick and pigeons but on the plus side, it was quiet. I used my Marriot points for this stay so I can't comment on value.

Title says it all with one caveat - in the renovated rooms they have installed new shower heads that in order to turn on you must be in the shower. The result is for anyone under about 6'4" you get blasted by cold water from the top of your head to the tips of your toes! Bad planning on the part of the bathroom designer.

My friend group stayed for a night for birthday weekend festivities. We were able to leave bags with the bell man when the room wasn't ready. When we were all ready to check in our room was still being occupied by the previous people staying, which was inconvenient. Also, our key cards needed to be redone a few times with still not working and had to have security let us into the room. Besides that, the hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful, and the accommodations worked fine for a group of people for a short stay.

After looking several options in the mid price range, we choose this hotel based in reviews. Location and price were the main drivers of the search, looking for a centric enough hotel to explore Manhattan, for a 4 days getaway.Hotel is not new, not fancy, but it is wonderfully located in mid town, very close to Grand Central Station.The hotel is what you can expect from a good Marriott, well managed and organized. Room size was very spacious for Manhattan standards, very comfortable. Service was always very good and attentive, but we didn't use any additional service of the hotel.The conclusion of our trip is that the value offer of the hotel is very good, you have a good hotel for a reasonable price, good size of the room and everything clean and neat, and a good location to move within the city, walking distance from all mid town attractions and with multiple transport option at Grand Central. Great hotel to use as sleep hub for days to enjoy in NYC. We will return in the future!

This hotel is stunning!! The foyer with the gorgeous chandeliers are breathtaking!The staff friendly and all knowing :) We love the location and would love to stay here again!!We stay at Marriott all the time and there is a reason for this...dependability, cleanliness, friendly staff and just all around good atmosphere.

Great location! Received everything we asked for regarding type of room, floor. Complimentary breakfast was terrific! Felt very welcome by staff.Easy one block from Penn Station, Madison Sq. Garden. Convenient to Highline walkway, all villages in both directions. Subways right there (at Penn); very quiet street. Had to check out but still wanted to do the city before a 7 pm train; hotel very accommodating regarding keeping our luggage safe while we spent the day trekking around. Rooftop lounge was small with very limited selection of beverages - but the view was fantastic.

We are Marriott Elite members and usually get a great room, on a higher floor. However, this trip was booked as a package deal with my airfare, so I don't think they realized we are faithful Marriott customers. We ended up with room 620, which was like a closet. The view outside our window was to a dark, brick wall that went up to about the 8th or 9th floor. So, we had no view, and NO ambient light. Even with the two lights on, the room was dark and dingy. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. The upside of the hotel is its location in Midtown Manhattan. It is next to the subway at 51st and Lexington. It also located just close enough that we walked to and from a musical on 44th Street. We enjoyed the M Club amenities, and the gym on the 35th floor was fine. The Concierge, Peter, was the best! He recommended a hilarious musical ("Something Rotten"), and an equally great restaurant. He arranged for our tickets to be delivered to the hotel, and another concierge made our dinner reservations. Manuel, the bell man, arranged for a ride to the airport for us, and the rest of the staff was fine, as always. I'd stay there again, but definitely be pickier about which room I'd accept next time.

I arrived at 8.30am and I was given a room immediately. That is very good service. I dropped off my case after checking out the very large room. Immaculate hotel which has an old style charm. I was working one block away so it was perfect. The bed was a dream. The bar area was nice for a blue moon drink but a little expensive. Gym on top floor is small but a wonderful view. Excellent food close by. All staff incredibly courteous. Great for business or leisure.

I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side a few weeks over the last months. I must say that Marriott lived up to its fine reputation, clean rooms, modern, welcoming and customer oriented. Aside from this hotel being in a prime location in New York, accessible to everything New York. I was very impressed with the staff at check in and through out my stays. Especially, three associates Carmen, Paulina a "check in" and a gentleman that (so sorry, I forgot his name) made you feel so welcome and they were so kind. They make up the kind of staff that helps Marriott keep their loyal members. I can not "thank" them enough!! I would recommend this Marriott to anyone visiting New York City for business or vacation.

We have stayed here a few times but had not stayed here for a couple years. We really liked this hotel and the location is great for walking around. The area is busy enough but not quite the crazy hubbub of the Marquis or Central Park Marriotts. This hotel is smaller and always friendly...the rooms are very clean and the accommodations are adequate, just wish the bathroom counters had more space.The concierge level has a nice breakfast on the weekend and refreshments 24/7 which is quite convenient and always appreciated. This is a very nice hotel with an old cozy feel...will stay here again.

We arrived at check in and we're directed to a large double double room on the 20th floor. The room was clean and very spacious by New York standards. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was fabulous very central, close to many restaurants, subway, Times Square etc, whilst not in the thick of all the noise

Hotel was very busy, checkin at the elite desk seemed rushed because of this. Nice room but pretty small for a Marriott. I have to say the premium wifi was not very good at all. Only one chair in the room was a little annoying too. Breakfast in the M lounge was very good and the staff there worked very hard to keep everything stocked and keep the tables clean in a very busy spot. Enjoyed ample fresh fruit, yogurt, croissant, egg white and spinach, scrambled eggs etc. Elevators were very busy too so long waits. Overall a good hotel but not as upscale as previous stays over the years. Hotel was in a good location for midtown. Would stay there again in any event.

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Conveniently located in midtown NY. Bed was very comfortable, great water pressure. Very quiet considering the location. Maid came in everyday and cleaned. Always stocked up on fresh towels and face clothes. Bar staff were very friendly as well.

Marriott rooms, lounge and service - all great but the noise from road and hotel reconstruction (Intercontinental) across the street was horrendous. Windows probably need to be redone due to the extreme noise. Love Marriott but this was terrible even with ear plugs. The hotel under construction is not near completion so I advise getting a room at the back if noise is a problem. The construction lasted well beyond 11:30m and was going at 6am.
