My daughter and I stayed for five days for our spring break. The room was spotless, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfast was perfect to get us going for a busy day. We are from the North West and admittedly coffee snobs and honestly the coffee in the cafe met our standards! Thanks.

I have stayed here twice before, but have to say that the customer service was excellent this trip ! I was traveling with a friend we were treated to an extra large corner room. Beds were very comfy. We were glad to have gotten an early check in, as well. Be sure to ask for access to the concierge lounge. Breakfast, a light dinner, beverages, and desserts are available in a quiet setting on the 2nd floor. There is a fee if you are not at the Marriott qualifying level for frequent guests, but it's well worth it. Looking forward to my next visit in June!

A nice Midtown hotel for a quick weekend getaway. My friend and I were in town for a Broadway show and sightseeing, and found the hotel to be a clean and quiet respite after a day exploring. Quick access to the subway (Lexington and 53rd) just a few blocks away, and an easy walk to the Theater District and other Midtown landmarks. The room was small but not uncomfortably so (unlike other NYC hotels), and the beds were incredibly comfortable, too. I'd stay here again!

Spent 3 nights at the East Side Marriott and had a great time. Hotel is nice and people you interact with are friendly and helpful. Great location. Room was adequate but only had one side table with the king bed. A little too tight to fit a table. So phone charging, water and TV control all ended up on the floor. Unless -- you flip over the trash can and make it a table. Worked fine. Trash can by day, table by night. Marriott management today is always looking for ways to "enhance the customer experience" that costs them less. Here it is.

Good location. Solid choice. Nothing special about this location and the rooms are NY small but the staff was helpful and friendly. A solid choice. It won't wow you but it will not disappoint you either. It's away from the craziness of Times Square which is good but a quick walk or can ride to anywhere.
user_name:
PW11803
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for 6 days. The place is clean and the location is excellent. The rooms are a little small but the bed was extremely comfortable. The gym was ok but needed some more space. I would recommend staying there. Also for coffee and quick breakfast I would recommend Ashley's across the street.

Located close to the subway, Rockafeller Plaza and Times Square. The rooms are small but clean and the bed was very comfortable. It isn't the most modern hotel but I would stay there again and recommend it friends.

You know a hotel is accommodating and service-oriented when you request and early check-in and you actually get it! Arriving 3 hours before the 4 pm check-in I was skeptical that the request would be granted so I was pleasantly surprised when it was! As Gold Elite members we were promptly served in the dedicated line. Within 3 minutes we were on our way to our 30th floor room and, much to my surprise, my other request for extra towels had also been satisfied - we were off to a great start!The concierge called a short time later to welcome us and offer her services, which was a lovely and welcomed gesture. The concierge lounge on the 2nd floor was a perfect perk to stock our mini fridge with bottles of water.Since we were here to enjoy the city, we didn't utilize many of the hotel's amenities so I can really only speak to the staff -they are friendly and will go out of their way to welcome you. The location speaks for itself!

This is a great Marriott property, close to the subway, easy walk to Rockafeller Center and the hotel is cozy. Room was small, but it's downtown NYC and we were barely in there. Easy Metro ride to Central Park.

I was waiting to get a satisfaction survey from Marriott to air my concerns. The only reviews on the marriott website are from invited customers who receive a survey. My off booked a double room for a night on the town, show and dinner. I did the Mobil checkin so was just picking up our key....as we were walking away from the check in desk the woman who gave us the key said, "Oh and by the way we have your message to leave a key for Antonio *****. We said, "WHO???" We did not leave a message to leave a key for someone...needless to say we were freaked out for the entire night and felt funny going back to our room and sleeping through the night. What they did was went up to our room to make sure nobody was in the room but in retrospect what they should have done was given us another room. No wonder I did not get a satisfaction survey. The bed seemed comfortable but I didn't sleep well...wondering if Antonio would show up....

The location is very convenient to many tourist favorites, Grand Central Station, theatre district, not far to Rockefeller Square. I agree with many other reviewers that the rooms are a bit dated, but beds/bedding is not. Rooms are clean and comfortable and even though very busy weekend we were there it was quiet at night. The staff was friendly and helpful.

I stayed in this Marriott earlier this week for work. The staff were lovely. My company used their private space for a presentation and networking reception. Everything went without a hitch. Very attentive event staff. The rooms were cozy and clean. I'd definitely stay again.Tip: make sure that you enroll in the Marriott Rewards program prior to your visit in order to have access to the lounge where you can purchase breakfast. Otherwise, you need to leave the hotel to grab a bite to eat in the morning.

Midtown Manhattan gets such a large throughout of visitors - business and leisure alike - that most hotels probably see little need to spruce up their rooms when they are such cash cows. For Midtown standards, rooms are huge but also predictably tired. If you're looking for the kind of holiday where you have an additional excuse to stay in your room for longer, this would certainly get you out the door. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. However, I was told that they did not have a King size bed, but only Twin beds for me. This was despite my Platinum Marriott status (which I had thought would have guaranteed my preferred room type) so that was disappointing. The club lounge was located on the second floor so it's convenient for those who just want to grab something in the morning and dash, without having to wait for the lifts during morning peak hour. It's well-stocked with drinks. I did wish to buy a glass of wine and the staff at the lounge had a bit of an attitude about that, like I was inconveniencing her by wanting to spend some money.

Comfortable beds good staff out of way area but less hassle to get around. stay in lots of marriotts decent breakfast if you have Marriott status and appetizers at night. My room was nice size and no one else complained of room size that stayed there. Rooms did get hot at night

This is a great mid-range hotel, great location, and friendly staff. The beds were comfortable, the shower was great, and our room was a good size. When we needed anything, the staff was friendly and helpful. We never ate breakfast there.... right across the street is a little diner that is open 24 hours a day, and we enjoyed a few meals there. Good pizza right around the corner, and if you are looking for something fancy, try The National a block up the street. Metro stop 2 blocks away, and there were always taxis out front.

On a recent work trip, we had the pleasure of staying at the New York Marriott East Side. Agreed on some of the reviews that the hotel is a little dated but that is NOT why you should stay here. Stay here because:***Location, location, location: It's in a great place where you can quickly reach Grand Central Station and it's walking distance to the Theater District, the MoMA, great restaurants etc***M Club Lounge: The concierge lounge is enormous, modern and gorgeous. It's also open on the weekends (not sure why another review just written said it's not)...Don't quote me on the hours but I believe Saturday breakfast is til 11 and Sunday-Thursday it was open all day with limited hours on Friday. The breakfast is nice too with regular eggs, egg whites scrambled with spinach, a breakfast meat like bacon or sausage, oatmeal and potatoes. And then there is the typical continental breakfast stuff and my fave part: The big fancy coffee machine that makes lattes, Americanos etc. ***Internet Apps on the TV: Yes, at night we binge-watched the Netflix show that just came back. Why don't all hotels have this? It was so great to log in to our Hulu and our Netflix! The rooms are a pretty nice size and while the bathroom has a standard tub with a shower curtain, there is room to put down your toiletries. And at night we could just ask for water and were handed multiple tiny bottles! We will definitely stay here again!

Stayed here for three nights while visiting NY for business. Excellent location, staff tries to be nice. That's probably it. Arrived late in the evening - no water, no room service. VERY noisy - you are in the room, but feels like on the street: cars beeping, people yelling, trucks gearing... And on the top air conditioning system in the room creates a lot of noise. Rooms are clean, but smell is very strange. If I would not be told that all rooms are not shocking, I would think someone have been shocking in this room. My recommendation, if you need to sleep in the night choose different hotel.

I have always found the Marriott East Side to be nice and comfortable. While I do not like the placement of the concierge lounge on floor 2 (I loved the 16th floor location), I understand why they did this. The lounge is closed on weekends which is a negative.The rooms could be updated a little but overall, it is fine. I personally do not stay in my room all day long so as long as it is clean and comfortable, I am fine. The Waldorf is horrid when compared to the Marriott. It may be older and more grand but it is a dump.The staff was pleasant and helpful during my stay. I will be back next year around the same time.

Sure it's historic. Hopefully you enjoy history a lot. It will help you forget the small cramped rooms with porthole sized windows, the lack of water pressure, and most notably, the fact that the hotel offers zero room service. Yes, there are restaurants on the same block, which is still no fun in snow, rain or cold to schlep across the street for breakfast. Otherwise the location is very good and nearby to many sights. The elevators are slow and tiny, the meeting spaces windowless chambers mostly in the basement and the fitness room two elevator rides away. The staff tries to be helpful, but for he price of these rooms Marriott should be ashamed of itself. Go elsewhere.

We have stayed at the Marriott East Side multiple times over many years. This last trip brought us back to our roots after some difficult times. We started with a room with a rather loud commode and requested a move. No problem! We received nothing but excellent service and will always choose to make this hotel our home when traveling to NYC. Thank you Team Marriott!

Not bad for a NYC hotelThey warn you it will take 45 minutes for valet parking; $65 per night - ouch Small roomLukewarm showerRoom cleanFee for wireless20 min walk to Times SquareQuick breakfast-lunch-dinner place on the corner Decent but smaller bar area Long Check in check out long lines Lobby small and congestedOnly 10 min walk to start of central parkGood rate through Expedia but beware as we booked for three people and Expedia reserved us with only a "king" bed; no doubles available - crazyVery few amenitiesDefinitely a lower end Marriott. Small and slow elevatorsMany staff waiting outside but not one opened door for us!

OK, I confess, I'm a lifetime platinum so I am biased. Having said that, our recent weekend stay, at $150 per night was not only an excellent value, it was also excellent, regardless of price.The staff is eager but not pushy...meaning, you don't need to fight the bellman for your bags...if you need help it is there immediately, if not, the bell staff doesn't pout. The rooms are everything you expect from Marriott...clean, spacious and well appointed. And, it is small enough to be intimate. There is no mob scene at the elevators, as happens frequently at the Marquis. The amenity that sets the East Side apart is the Marquis lounge. Recently remodeled, the decor is elegantly warm and modern. Being open on the weekend, they served a full breakfast, just what was needed for active, fun filled days. The East Side is my benchmark for a room in Manhattan.…l like the place that much.

I was here for work and booked 3 rooms. Getting drop off was little interesting as there were lots of cars in front of hotel. the check-in was fast and easy. I wouldn't say this is the best location but it is close to subway and lots of food places around, therefore it is convenient. The Good:- I was upgraded to a larger room which was really nice. - The service in the hotel was good, having bowl of apple at front desk was good touch- there is a mini-refrigerator but no microwave- the bath room is average size but comfortable- The location is good, 5 minutes walk to Grand Central Station or 15 minutes to time square. The not so good:- Elevator in the morning can be a long wait. - Internet not free if you are not a rewards member. I would stay here again.

The location is central, area with lots of hotels and restaurants. walking distance from 5th and Time Square. There are much better hotels in near neighbourhood and they definitely do not cost much more. Check carefully. This one is kind of aged, many rooms have a depressing view on brick walls, but they are clean and quiet. Was quite disappointed by the quality and selection (or lack thereof) at the breakfast buffet, for which they charge USD 30 (free for Platinum members). Ripoff, if compare to the Starbucks just down the street. Rainy day? The whole hotel has not one single umbrella to give out for a quick walk. Really? But they charged USD 400 for a relatively small room. A pity. The staff was friendly and helpful, but here I came away thinking that management is on the greedy side, especially after having been in other hotels in walking distance from this one.

Im a big fan of Marriotts in general and lifetime platinum member . This hotel is excellent and the location is very convenient for restaurants or business in NYC .The lobby bar area is great for a drink with friends or for a business discussions . The rooms are comfortable and the staff very friendly .i certainly can recommend this hotel for visitors wanting to tour NYC .
user_name:
Richard A
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel was awesome, location was right near the subway. Also was walking distance to my office for the two weeks I was staying. In February the closer I can get to my office the better. This Marriott provided that for me. The rooms were nice, the associates were friendly. I had no cause for complaints. Plenty of locations surrounding the hotel in a 2 block radius to get food. I must say there was confusion on whether the wifi was free, but I made a phone call to the front desk because it was unclear.
user_name:
spartigus15
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location was very convenient for business meetings in Midtown Manhattan. Service was very friendly and capable. Executive lounge was a nice environment and plenty of food and drink options. Hotel room was good but clearly in need of some updating and redecorating.

This is a great location, and the price is comparable to any nice hotel in NYC. It is about two blocks from the subway. The staff is extremely friendly and we had great service during our stay. The room was comfortable and the bed was typical Marriott - meaning very comfortable. There are some decent diners in the area for a quick breakfast. We will stay here again the next time we visit the city.

The hotel was very nice, a lot of history, and interior has been remodeled beautifully. It's in a great location in Midtown east with many eating establishments and walking distance to many popular tourist spots, like St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Plaza. I loved the architecture of the hotel, and the staff are fabulous!

Just Returned from a 3 night break in New York where we stayed at the Marriott East Side. It's trip advisor number of places to stay do not do this place justice. Some of the most helpful staff we have ever come across from front desk who ensured our pre arrival requests where met, the concierge who found us the most amazing places to eat that we would of never found and all very good for our needs. But a special massive thank you to Wade who was outstanding on making us feel so welcome and for organising my wife's birthday surprise. The hotel is very well located close to the main tourist area's in midtown, everywhere is walkable. The rooms where spacious with good facilities and lovely bathrooms. The lobby was well presented and felt special when we arrived. Only downsides which were minor free wifi only in the lobby area might of been our rooms as they were on 9. Beds are comfortable and where fairly soft we had doubles would be worth paying extra if you budget allows for bigger beds. 5 stars for location, value, staff and facilities.

The location and the staff help make this Marriott an excellent option for any stay business or pleasure in the New York area.A quick walk to grand central or up to Central Park for a jog means you're right at the heart of things in the city for transit or recreation.Also Sam at the front desk was super helpful and made the stay great!

Had a room the first night that was too small to turn around. As a Marriott Platinum they upgraded us to a "suite" that was much bigger and had good views. The lobby is very pretty and the bar is nice. Good location. We hung out at the Waldorf for happy hour.

Had a really pleasant stay last week. Every member of the staff was always smiling, conversational, efficient and ready to help. Especially liked the bartenders in the lobby bar... Perfect balance of service and good company. The room was comfortable, and clean, but the window or HVAC unit was letting all street noise into the 14th floor room. Without my noise-canceling earbuds, no way I would sleep. The sirens, traffic, garbage trucks, etc. are charming if you want extra NYC flavor. But I rather prefer a quiet room. Loved the central location; lots of places within walking distance.But again, I can't say enough about the great staff. They make the hotel.

I have stayed a number of times at this property. Each time it is getting better .. The staff quality maintains a high standard .. despite the turnover in New York Hotels in general, this property has a solid mix of old timers along with experienced professionals coming in from ofher parts of Marriott .. Alan Hartwig, Kenda, Joshu and JoyDeb to name a few. Even the housekeeping staff have a very pleasant attitude. The upgrqded and new Executive Lounge will soon become my defacto NYC office!! Keep it up

Very nice hotel. I was really impressed with the room size, nice and spacious. Hotel value was good too. A little on the old size, and in need for renovation soon. Otherwise, It is recommended for its cleanliness, value and comfort.

What a perfect location for a girls' weekend in NYC! Excellent service (shout out to Paulina at the front desk), clean and comfortable room and bed, superb location--what's not to like? Easy walk to Bliss Spa (49th), numerous restaurants, Bloomingdales and MOMA, this hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. We will be back!

Reliable full service marriott near grand central on Lex. Good concierge lounge. Decent service. Rooms small and small windows. Try to get upgrade and request an avenue view. There are some superb suites but pricey.

As an Elite Marriott member, I choose to stay in a Marriott while on business in NYC that I am here for up to 10 days/month. I decided to stay in the Marriott East Side and had a wonderful stay. Management was very nice and honored my request for a high floor and room with kind size bed. Room was updated, clean and quiet. Elite/Concierge floor was very good for breakfast and appetizers at night. Staff courteous and attentive. Large gym on 35th floor. Great location and highly recommend. Look forward to coming back.

The Marriott East Side is conveniently located with respect to Broadway theatres, MoMA, and St. Patrick's Cathedral. All are within easy walking distance. The concierges were informed and helpful. However, the rooms were quite small, and breakfasts and internet access were both expensive.

Stayed here during a recent trip to NYC to see the Yankees play. It's location is perfect and easily accessible to all the things to do. Room was nicely decorated and the service was excellent. Great lounge to relax in after a long day of sightseeing.

Nice location on upper Eastside. Friendly staff, spacious clean rooms. Beds were comfortable and nice big flatscreen TVs. Near Rockefeller Center. Plenty of food options and bars nearby. Sam greeted us upon arrival and offered several food option recommendations nearby. Would definitely come back.

Overall I really enjoyed this hotel; nice location, great fitness center, excellent lounge for elite members! The one down side is the level of noise in the rooms. I'm a bit of a light sleeper, but I found myself being woken up at least 2 times a night because of traffic noise. I'd stay at this location again, but would come prepared with ear plugs.

The hotel was in a great location for our purposes and the room was fine. Very small, but fine. We found the maid's name tag under the comforter of the bed, so that was a little concerning, but otherwise, clean and neat. The concierge was a great help in finding dinner reservations, even coming back to help us although she was on her way out for her break.

We usually are very loyal to Marriot hotels. This time we choose this hotel over the JW to try a different one. We didn't like it. The hotel looks very old and dated. The rooms are totally unattractive and dull . Our room and bathroom was clean, but everything there must be at least 30 years old (including the mattresses). The service, though, was incredible. Paulina at the front desk was amazing, friendly and very professional. The housekeeper service was great too. We originally planned to stay three nights, but we spent there only one, and moved to another hotel.

My husband and I spent the weekend in NY with friends. This hotel is conveniently located near Rockefeller Center and Saint Patrick's cathedral, yet the area is not as busy. The check in process was very quick and everyone did an outstanding job at making as feel at home. Very nice, clean and updated king room on the 11th floor.I am not giving it 5 stars because we did have a misunderstanding when trying to get breakfast on the second floor (they have coffee and pastries on the first floor but we wanted something more formal). When we arrived to the 2 nd floor we were told we were not M club members but that we could buy breakfast. We were not thinking of "not buying breakfast", the conversation sounded awkward, we left and had breakfast at another near by hotel. After thinking a little bit more about it, had it been presented differently we would have stayed.I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would defenitely stay there again.

As the location goes, it can't be faulted. As a long standing Marriott fan (gold card holder) I can't say I was blown away by the hotel. Don't get me wrong, service was fine, but then again, everything else felt average. The lounge has limited opening hours, and frankly, the cost of a drink is almost the same as a downtown bar. Also as a gold card holder Wi-fi is free in the room, I would be very upset to have to pay teh standard 13-17USD per day for Wi-fi had I not had the privilege of not paying for it.I'd go back of course, but would potentially look at cheaper non-Marriott hotels.

I am a Marriott fan through and through so I probably had high expectations for this hotel, especially after my brother and several friends recommended it. To be fair, I usually stay at the Marriott Marquis in Times Square but I don;t much care for Times Square so I wanted to try something different. The hotel is okay but it's not what I consider a great hotel. Upon check-in, which took over 20 minutes, and I'm a Marriott Gold member, we went to our room. The room was very small and pretty dingy. My daughter used the bathroom and the toilet overflowed things that were not heres. It was pretty disgusting. They changed us to another room, almost identical to the first...so they're all small and dingy. Service level were just very average, not Marriott-like at all. I would not recommend this place, nor would I stay here again.

I chose this hotel due to proximity to Rockafellar Center, because I had won tickets to SNL through the ticket lottery. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay. Our room on the fifth floor was very clean and comfortable. It was small which was what I expected based on pictures, but it was updated looking and nice. The bed was super comfortable. The location was perfect for Rockafellar, only about a five minute walk. It was also close to Grand Central Terminal and about a fifteen minute walk to Times Square. The staff were so helpful and friendly. Peter at the concierge was especially helpful in giving us great directions on how to use the subway. This was our first trip to New York and we were initially a bit hesitant to use the subway system but he explained it all to us and we found our way around no problem! The bellman was able to put us in a town car to JFK for a flat rate of $65 which was a lot cheaper than what we were prepared to pay for a taxi. While it is true that there is no room service available and the lounge was pricey for us, we found a place across the street (Ashley's fine foods) to have breakfast in the morning - it was great, affordable food! You can also get drinks and snacks for your room there. There is a liquor store across the street if you want to get a bottle of wine or something for the room, as well as a good pizza place across the street from the lounge entrance. I would definitely stay here again if I travel to New York again, which I definitely hope to do!

Frankly my stay here was average, and I have had better service at lower tier Marriotts in NYC. The rooms are in need of a refresh, with fading paint, bedding, dirty windows, and slow elevators. These factors aside, the customer service left a bit to be desired. They we extremely backed up at check-in with only two people at the desk. After waiting for 10 minutes to check in one of the staff walked over to me and asked if I had done mobile check in. They handed me my keys and left. They did not offer a room upgrade(I am a platinum member), explain what floor the lounge was on, tell me what times the lounge was open, or offer points since breakfast would not be served the one of the mornings during my stay. Later that evening when leaving for dinner we were disappointed that the doorman did not hail a cab for us nor was a there a line of cabs waiting to pick up any guests. While not a huge deal these number of small things left me disappointed with the regular service I receive when staying at other Marriott properties.
user_name:
andrews532016
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I really appreciate that I was given a nice platinum room upgrade and the location is fantastic. The Concierge Lounge is ample even though the food is mediocre - typical.If you are below the 16th floor it takes 3 elevator rides to get to the gym. The hotel also has that busy "convention" atmosphere that I don't like.
user_name:
SeatOfMyPntsTravelr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I'm a Platinum Marriott Member, have been for 20 years, so believe me when I tell you, I'm used to staying at hotels that have the best amenities available. This place, though nice, is horrible from an amenity point of view. There are Zero Restaurants, Zero Room Service, you can't even get water delivered to the room. For 350.00 a night, you can stay at other places that cater to your needs, certainly this is not one of them. Certainly, for 350 a night, there are other place where you can simply "lay your head", which is what this place is. Never ever, ever again......avoid this place like the plague.

Rooms are great for NY -- large and comfy. But the hotel has few amenities -- no room service, no shoe shine, no free Wi-Fi (unless you're a Marriott rewards member). Concierge was great -- he made dinner reservations for us twice. Front desk was always helpful, too. The buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor was terrible -- and definitely not worth $25!

Working in NYC but sometimes needing a hotel due to some long days/nights I decided to make reservations here. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were also! The staff was friendly and would help with questions when needed. They have a nice bar to gather in after a long day with a small coffee bar and sitting area for meetings. The only disappointment was the gift shop is extremely overpriced and does not take credit cards. You can charge it to your room but too much of a hassle for me.

Reasonably priced & less than 2 blocks to the subway. Away from the Times Square madness, but close enough to get to the Broadway shows. Lobby is traditional & comfy; elevators are old (small) but lots of character. Service was excellent, staff was great, rooms were larger than other NYC hotels that I've stayed in. Our room was on the Lexington Avenue side (11th floor) - street noise is sometimes an issue, so if you're a light sleeper, request a room on the other side.

I just love this hotel. This was where Georgia O'Keefe lived for many years. It exudes charm. It is close to everything, has a great staff, and a very good concierge lounge. I usually take the train to Grand Central, so this is perfectly close enough to walk to.

I love this location! It's away from the chaos of Time Square, so the rooms are quiet, yet still a quick walk to all the sights. The rooms are larger than many in NY, though their decor is outdated and could use a makeover. Aesthetics aside, the beds are comfy, the place is clean, and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful! A great place to stay if you're looking for a convenient yet quieter location!

We had a great experience at the New York Marriott East Side. Our check-in was fast, the staff was friendly and responsive, and the rooms were what I expected from a Marriott. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms given other NYC hotels that I have stayed in. I am pregnant, as was a friend of mine in my group, and I called Housekeeping to get some extra pillows, and there were two options and they were delivered in 15 minutes, which is faster than any service that I have ever gotten at a hotel. The location cannot be beat. It is right by the subway, on the Lexington Avenue bus line, and an easy walk to pretty much anywhere.

I stayed here recently for a work trip, and fortunately enough I will be staying there again soon. From the minute I walked in until I left, the staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful - from those at the front desk to the housekeeping staff to one specific engineer/maintenance man.I had a major problem to begin with in that my shower pressure was enough to hurt. I had called down one morning after I left to ask that they could change the shower head or do something to reduce the pressure. After I returned that afternoon, there had been no change, but I ran into one of the maintenance men - he first asked me about my stay in general, and when I told him I had this issue, he helped me out immediately. Although I know he had to be busy, he took that time for me on the spot and even refused to take a gratuity. I didn't get his name but I did mention this to one of the supervisors right after this happened but for those else that may be reading this from the hotel, I wanted you to know as well.Rooms were clean and comfortable, and it was convenient to have the concierge lounge open throughout the day even if only to stop in for a water or soda or snacks. The concierge lounge seemed stocked with more stuff than you'd normally find during the off hours - plenty of soda selections, granola bars, and even yogurt in the refrigerated area. As one person mentioned, the elevators can be a little slow and temperamental at times, but it wasn't too big of an inconvenience for me.Good sleep quality as well for Manhattan, but as always, it doesn't hurt to have a noise generator to drown out the sirens and horns.Gym was decent with a few treadmills and ellipticals and free weights up to about 60 or so lbs.I had stayed in the Waldorf Astoria two weeks prior. Even though it's the Waldorf, this hotel was better, and I'm happy I'm staying here again in a couple weeks.

Stayed here numerous times due to location is very convenient. Rooms small but consistent Concierge level is very good but only accessible to certain levels of rewards guests. Dining area never busy. Reasonable price for overall quality.

Not sure why the mediocre reviews. I have stayed in 5 star and 2 star locations in New York City several times and trust me this place is not that bad. The location is prime and off the beaten path so you are not overrun by tourists like in Times Square. This location sits near UN building and close to Rockefeller Center and a few blocks over from Times Square smack in mid town near Grand Central. The property is quite large with a spacious lobby and bar area with a very nice and helpful staff. Sure rooms are small, like any New York City hotel room, there is not much to the room, but if you are visiting, you aren't in the room much anyway so who cares. Beds care comfortable, rooms are clean and equipped with all you need and everything seemed to be updated so not sure why those are reviewers mentioned that. If you are looking for a mid town location at a better than reasonable price, this is the place. Plus you can grab a cab to anywhere in the city within seconds. Book it, you won't be sorry!

A slightly dated hotel but adequate for 3 days over New Year.The lifts are very slow and very small so always a wait to get to your room.The hotel bar is ridiculously expensive for poor service $6 for a glass of soda water!The concierge service was excellent offering great advice on where to go and how best to get there at the busiest time of the year for the city.

I was in town for a wedding and stayed in a junior suite for two nights. Ended up extending the trip by a day and moved to a standard king bed for the last night. The junior suite cost twice as much, but it was still a good deal and it was nice to have the extra space. The bed was very comfy and the room was nice. The TV worked but Netflix and Hulu did not and some channels didn't come in. I called the front desk about this and someone came up but it didn't get fixed. When we moved to the standard king the TV worked, but the room was a little stuffy even with the AC on. In both rooms, there was fridge but it was empty (no minibar). I consider this a huge plus since I like having a fridge that I can put my own low cost drinks and leftover food in. There didn't appear to be room service food which is a bummer for a romantic getaway, but a nice restaurant right next door makes this OK. Overall the price was right for the location and class of hotel. On departure the doorman guided us to a car to take us to LGA for a flat $45 which was much more comfortable than a cab at about the same price. At first I thought he was "up-selling" us but it was much nicer than riding in a claustrophobic NYC yellow cab and $45 is about what that trip costs anyway.

It's nicely located on Lexington Ave- close to grand central terminal and close to Central Park. The ground floor lobby is very noisy not good for meetings- the bar is ok - service could be better. Rooms are nice size - don't stay in lower floors - 16th rooms are nice.

Tiny room. Needs updating. No room service.Location is good but the hotel leaves much to be desired. Hard to believe its a full scale Marriott (as opposed to a Courtyard, or Spring Hill Suites). Have stayed there twice in past 2 months and won't go again. Many other options in the area. Choose wisely.

My first trip to New York and this hotel was in a great location. Patrick at Bell desk gave us great tips for getting around and he was extraordinarily helpful. Kendra and Margaret in Club lounge were extremely helpful too. Got us money-off vouchers for shows etc. Reception staff weren't quite so friendly; perhaps they didn't enjoy their jobs as much as the otherswould stay here again and recommend it highly

Great price, and easy to access thru public transportation from JFK airport thru E train. Walking distance nice restaurant. Prime area of NYC. The concierge, the doorman, and the reception it is just well coordinated and they take care of every of your need for you.The room are a good size, and extra clean. Corner room (double windown-city view! Highly recommend.

Great hotel, great location, great staff. I consider myself pretty picky, but this is a really nice place in a great location. Is it the Plaza, no.... However, it doesn't have Plaza prices. We loved it. We traveled as a family so we got the Family Connector room and we could not have been happier. I don't understand the complaints below. Sometimes people like to complain. If you are on the fence about booking, book it. Unless you want The Plaza. :)

After staying at the Marriott residence near the hotel i decided to try the Marriott hotel for a week stay. What a mistake, this is the worst Marriott I have ever been to (was even wondering if it was the real marriott or some sub brand). The look from outside is nice, the reception is ok although you ask for high floor and they try to give you 3rd...Once you open the door of your room you discover a very old fashion environment. The light is poor and there is no direct light control on the bedroom side therefore you need to go to the end of the room to switch on a desk light. The heater makes an awful noise when it starts and the windows have very poor isolation so the cold comes in but because of the heater noise you cannot sleep with it. The bad isolation contributes also to a continuous noise from the outside and neighbor rooms. The shower is like most of the ones you can find in NYC hotels thus no control over pressure which in my room was not great but acceptable. The other shower surprise is the temperature switching form hot to cold which makes it really annoying. I would not recommend anyone to stay there.

We stay here every time we are in NYC, great midtown location, walk to plays, Rockefeller Plaza, St Patrick's, 5th and Madison Ave, Grand Central Station and Subway.Small European style hotel, rooms are on the small side but comfortable. Great friendly and efficient staff. Housekeeping does an excellent job and very helpful, bellmen/doormen are excellent and extremely helpful.

If there's a USP that this hotel can boast, it's its central location in NYC. Times Square, the UN Plaza, the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden are a stone's throw away! Coming to the hotel itself, the facilities and amenities are indeed great, all trappings that you would associate with the Marriott brand. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff is efficient and courteous - a special thanks to Baptiste and Rosario for an incredible stay! Just one caveat - the rooms do not have wifi, you'll have to descend to the lobby for that. Otherwise, Marriott East Side is the place to be!

I spent 3 nights at this hotel in July 2015. The location was very convenient as very central in New York mid town and very close to my meeting places. Plenty of shops, restaurants and pubs around. Time Square is 10-15 min by Taxi. The staff is very friendly and helpful when you want to catch a taxi or organize a trip. The room was OK, with all necessary amenities. I liked the buzzy lobby lounge and the food experience. Don't miss the Cheesecake they serve. This was the best I ever tasted!

We've stayed at this Marriott twice. Great location to mid town NYC. The rooms are small but clean and not dated. Good Bar and close to many restaurants. We would stay at this hotel again when traveling to NY.

We had a great time in there, all staff was was super attentive, Thank you Beba for keeping my room spotless, Thank you Peter for making my getaway even more enjoyable with your recommendations, Jeffrey and Rosario were very kind and helpful too.We enjoyed the view and convenient location, and a gym in the top floor helped me erase the guilt after eating in Katz Deli.

The hotel is very nice, the room are so big and nice. The bathroom was great. Large closet. The location great near so many restaurant and coffee shop. Has many train station near. The check in and check out super fast.

I've stayed here probably 25-30 times in the last couple years and it is a great full-service marriott.Check-in is always very smooth, and the staff has been very courteous, sometimes offering me free drink tickets for the bar which I can't complain about.The concierge lounge was just redone as the "M Lounge" which has an intimidating black door. Once you're in you realize you're not in a nightclub like it appears from the outside. It's a standard Marriott concierge lounge with an honor bar and breakfast/nighttime apps. They need to stock greek yogurt! I also hate that it's on floor 2, because taking an elevator one floor is obnoxious, and the stairs are annoying with luggage.Gym is on the top floor so it has awesome views. There are quite a few treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes along with a few machines as well as a free weight area. They cram a lot in there and it manages to not feel claustrophobic. At some points there are 6-7 others and it still feels somewhat spacious (somehow).

I stayed at the Marriott for two nights midweek on a recent business trip. The staff was courteous and the hotel has the amenities you'd expect. Complimentary Wall Street Journal and fresh fruit in the lobby is nice. Be sure to check out the fitness center, I believe on the 37th floor. The view will inspire your workout.

First of all, the location in mid-town is excellent, near transportation and shopping, which is why Family Member and I stayed here again. Second, Bravo to the doormen and bellhops, who are so kind, helpful, cheery, and efficient! However, this time, our stay at this hotel was not as pleasant as it had been in the past. Due to an unavoidable last-minute date change on our part, the room we'd originally requested was unavailable. Okay--that happens. According to the Snippy Desk Clerk, only rooms with one bed were available--okay, sigh. Family Member and I are related, but we're not THAT close, so we asked for a room with a pull-out sofa or a roll-away bed. We were given a room with a bed (comfy) and a single pull-out chair (no, just--no). I have never slept on anything this uncomfortable, lumpy, twisted, old, and sagging, and I happily stay in hostels, State park facilities, and friends' sofas. This was just awful, considering the price--if it had been a flea-bag youth hostel, okay--but the Marriott?!? In Mid-Town?! We also had to plead for additional soap (must they skimp on soap?) and Snippy Desk Clerk kept refusing our request for the special rate we'd originally booked--an issue that the Manager graciously resolved. A second Snippy Desk Clerk (in the Elite line, as Family Member has Elite status with Marriott) waived away a request for a newspaper as rudely as she possibly could. So, Bellhops/Valets--great! Room was drab but clean. Pull-out bed? My cat would have rejected it. Desk Clerks? Could they be any more unpleasant while retaining the bare minimum of phony etiquette? I'm done--I travel to NY quite often and have my own fave hotels, and this is not one of them. Will not stay here again.

We just completed a 4 day stay at the Marriott east side. Having stayed at the Algonquin and the Marriott Marquis we opted for a quieter location away from Times Square. However with lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood, Grand Central Station a close walk and the shops of 5th Ave close by the hotel is well located. We used the online check in and were assigned a very nice room on the 32nd floor. Our room was spacious, king size bed, in room coffee maker, flat screen TV and a nice bathroom. The room was clean and modern. The bed was really comfortable!! As we were on the top floor we never had any issues with having to wait for elevators. However as there are 3 elevators servicing the hotel I did note that people on the lower floors would sometimes have to wait for a non crowded elevator. We took advantage of the concierge lounge on the second floor. This Marriott served up an excellent breakfast buffet for the gold and platinum members. Also they serve hot snacks in the evening and we actually skipped dinner our first night as the hot snacks were sufficient. The hotel does not have all the bells and whistles of the Marquis or the historical ambience of the Algonquin but we were happy with our choice. The staff were excellent and the concierge very helpful. I did not use the gym but it was on the 35 floor via special elevator and I understand the view is fabulous. There was only one restaurant and from what I gathered it was not really full service but had snack/bar type food. The morning buffet was pricy and there did not seem to be an al a carte option so we went elsewhere for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again. It was a great location and comfortable stay at a good price.

We were in town for just a couple of days while my husband was on business. Let's be honest - based on other reviews, this is NYC, an old building and sure, the rooms are a bit on the small side. But it's NYC and located in an old building, what do you expect? What you can expect is that 1) great location 2) check-in quick and they're polite 3) fantastic concierge level on 2nd floor and 4) it has been updated so that it's not 'too' dated. I didn't expect it to be the Montage or other Marriotts in other areas so I can definitely say it was as expected. Bathroom was nice, great water pressure (this can be an issue sometimes in these old buildings) and plenty of towels. Plenty of outlets. Creaky, old elevator but a decent gym (either go early or off-hours, it can get busy). Get where I'm going? You want large windows with fantastic views and huge bathrooms? This isn't your place, but if you're in town on business, want lots of restaurants within walking distance, a clean room, nice breakfast in the concierge room, and helpful staff, then this fits the profile. I gave it a 'very good' because we arrived late and the staff was friendly and nice - - - sometimes a rarity in this city.

This property is definitely in need of room renovation. The edges of the furniture have the finish worn off, the marble in the bathrooms is the old grey stuff and long since lost any shine. The carpets are worn and dirty. The bed is comfortable though. The best part of the property is that they do a decent job in the concierge lounge and avoid the typical fried junk that most Marriotts serve. Usually good taste with the exception being vegetarian night.. and they don't know how make mac and cheese...

First, the location of this hotel is fantastic. You are closely located to the historic Waldorf, 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center, and only a few blocks from Times Square. The room itself was just average--not good or bad, just average. It was on the small side (typical of NYC), and our room looked into the back of a brick wall. The lobby was clean and nice, but the rooms could use some updating.

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the past two years as my daughter lives in NYC. I went to NYC this past weekend. I checked in Friday - My room had no soap or shampoo. Didn't think too much about it. Then Saturday night I came back from being out all day to find that my room was never cleaned or provided with bathroom toiletries (soap/shampoo). I called front desk. Was told hotel manager would call me along with housekeeping manager. Operations Mgr called me and provided toiletries, but never heard from anyone else. When I pressed further for manager on call, I never got a response. Very poor customer service...

This hotel should not be branded as a Marriott Hotel. The room is below average with uncomfortable beds, small bathroom, and it is very noisy since it does not have proper window insulation - you hear street noise as if the windows were open - even when you are in a high floor (cannot imagine how bad the lower floors are).The lounge does not open on weekends and this hotel does not honor free continental breakfast to gold members when the lounge is closed. In all other Marriott properties we have stayed on the breakfast is offered in the normal restaurant when the lounge is closed, but not in this hotel - so being gold member here is useless and you better off staying in a better hotel.My reservation also included 2 tickets for the Top of the Rock which they did not have the actual tickets (maybe they never do) and offered $40 total discount, but the ticket actually costs $32 per person ($64 vs $40 - so this hotel is ripping off clients for $24 dollars with this fake promotion). Hope someone from the Department of Justice or the NY Attorney General Office sees this.During check out I stopped by at the front desk to discuss about the breakfast charges and the manager (Kevin [ - ]) was very well prepared to explain all the disclaimers listed in their hotel website and the fact they do not honor the free breakfast even when it is clearly stated in the reservation. This guys is a disservice to the Marriott brand. Anyways, I have always been loyal to Marriott and this bad experience warrants a formal complaint and it will make me reconsider whether or not Marriott can be trusted since apparently any hotel can claim they do not participate in the Elite program and act in bad faith like this one did.By the way - the very poor hot breakfast costs $34 dollars per person - so watch out.

My daughter and I chose this hotel for its midtown location and good rate on Marriott website (we paid weekend rate for 3 days and used Marriott points for the 4th night in early December!). To be honest, and based on some reviews I expected a rather run-down room. On the contrary, we were accommodated into a nice double room with comfortable king bed, rather small but complete bathroom, big TV (including netflix), coffee-machine and small fridge (not minibar). It is true, however, that the desk corners and the bathroom door are a little bit chipped, but nothing serious). Everything was clean.The lobby is renovated and has free wifi (not in rooms). Location is central, 3 blocks from 5th ave. near Waldorf Astoria, easy to walk back from Broadway at night, metro is 2 blocks away and buses run along Lexington Ave. We even took the Airtrain from JFK and it proved OK!There is a restaurant on site (which we didn't try), other dining options nearby and a deli market just across the street.Service was outstanding especially one night when I called the lobby asking for a bottle opener. I explaned that it was my birthday and I wanted to enjoy a Brooklyn beer before going to bed. A few minutes after my call, I received not only the bottle opener but also a lovely tray with champagne, an excellent fruit plate and a nice birthday card from all the staff on duty. I couldn't believe it!! We spent most of the day outside the hotel, but once we were back in our room we had everything we needed.This hotel was a pleasant surprise and we enjoyed it very much.

We usually stay in Marriott properties for the points. This one is centrally located & fairly easy to get to. No extra frills & the hotel could use some sprucing up, but overall it was ok. I think if I was a business traveler this hotel would be better suited for me, because it's just simple w/ no fuss. Staff is overly nice & helpful, but the property, as I said, could use a bit of sprucing up. Bathrooms were small & I always request extra pillows in my profile on their reservation site (none given this time) & to be away from the elevator - we were directly across from it. Stayed for 2 days for Christmas shopping & staff was lovely.

I stayed at this location for several weekdays over a span of a few weeks in the spring of 2015 after moving over from the Marquis in Times Square which is a great hotel but just too many people for me. As a business traveler and a Platinum/Diamond Marriott member, I have never had staff treat me so badly. I have always been able to check a bag and a few suits with the bell staff on weekends instead of having to travel with them at every Marriott property I stayed at in the past (usually (forty + weeks annually around the U.S.) but this bell staff is terrible and made it clear that I was not to bother them with this even though they were tipped generously! They are some of the most unhappy and unprofessional people I have ever met at a luxury hotel anywhere in the U.S. Thankfully the rest of the staff was fantastic including checking in and breakfast but the first impression I got from the bell staff was they were doing me a favor and I was not welcome on the property as I was putting them out expecting them to do their jobs (possibly because I am from Charleston, SC and have a southern/gullah dialect). Thanks to their unprofessional attitude and manner, I moved around the corner to the Courtyard until April and have since been staying at Hilton properties around the U.S. including across the street at the Waldorf. I will continue to not stay at Marriott properties due to this experience.

Very average Marriott hotel but for the price you pay you definitely don't get what you expect. As my first time to visit New York City I was expecting something at least exceptional from this style of Marriott but I think they are lacking updates in the rooms such as a very small beds, windows, out dated tv's and most of all the restrooms need the most improvements as there were cob-webs in the sink and rust stains all over the drain (which didn't work at all). The only people I would give 5-stars to are the doormen and the bellhops which were outstanding!I expected more with the type of status I had coming in but I think they care more about themselves then the people that walk through the doors.

I stayed here on January 2nd to the 3rd, 2016. The staff was wonderful. I came with three pieces of luggage because my cousin was leaving next day from JFK and when we checked at 9:30 am the room was ready. Next day they let us leave the bags in the hotel at no charge while we went sightseeing. The room was beautiful, spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were very confortable and I slept for 12 hours due to the long walks. The hotel is within walking distance from the Grand Central Station and several other attractions. I walked to Rockefeller plaza, Times Square and several other attractions from the hotel. This hotel is the best I have stayed at out of the several times I go to NYC for the last 20 years. Front desk was awesome, taxis are right in front and town cars are available for $65 to take you to the airports. I am very pleased with my stay at this hotel. I will definitely bbok this hotel again.

The hotel is centrally located on the east side of NY. It was clean and quiet (for NYC). This is one of the only hotels that will guarantee you attached rooms. They call it a family lock off, one room has two double beds and the other has a king. It was perfect for us. The only down side is that there's no room service. We had a problem with the heat in our room when we first arrived and they sorted it out no problem. Concierge, door and bell staff were all very helpful.

Good location to our offices in Manhattan with tons of good restaurants around. Location is great for walking to Times Square, Rockefeller, and Radio City Music Hall. Rooms are well maintained and clean. Good staff and the restaurant and room service are good.

it's an ok hotel with tiny New York rooms. Clean and with your usual Marriott service (which I like don't get me wrong). But it just lost two stars as it's 12:03am and I open the minibar to get a bottle of water and realize it's empty. I proceed to call room service and realize there's no room service available. I'm in the middle of Manhattan, at an international hotel chain and there's no room service! So I had to dress up again and go down to the lobby to beg for water. They were nice enough to give me three small "complimentary" bottles. I expect more from Marriott. Especially once you've acquired some status.

I have been a loyal Marriott customer and an Platinum Elite member for years. Booking the New York Marriott East Side was a no brainer for my stay in the Big Apple. Unfortunately, this hotel should not be allowed to wear the Marriott name badge. Why? Because they only care about the bottom line and customer comes last instead of first. My guaranteed "upgrade" was a joke. Room looked like one from a Super 8 motel. The lounge was closed and apparently this is one of the few hotels that only gives you points instead of breakfast. Forget about a restaurant voucher. I would not recommend this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel on the weekend before (Dec 18, 19, 20) Christmas to see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular, see the tree at Rockefeller Center, explore Time Square and take in NYC during the Christmas Holiday. This was a great location within walking distance of Radio City Music Hall, Time Square, Empire State Building, Sak's 5th Ave light show and window displays, Macy's, ect... We stayed on the 14th floor so the City noise was minimal, the staff was excellent, the restaurant down stairs was pricy but expected in NYC. My two complaints are 1. they do not offer Room Service ... my 6 and 7 year old daughters look forward to room service when we stay in hotels and 2. they charged me for a full day of parking even though we left by 10 a.m. of the morning of our departure ... we paid $65 a day with no in and out privileges. Last thing ... This hotel is a $15 cab ride to Chinatown and Little Italy

This was a great place to stay for our New York trip as we spent the majority of our time in Manhattan. It was great having my last experience as a Gold Elite member there because they have an awesome lounge (big breakfast and evening appetizers were really a meal). Nice little touches in the lobby, water with fruit, hot chocolate on Christmas Eve. Only criticism, no maid service one day so that when we arrived back at 5:00 there were no clean towels to get ready for our evening out. They did send someone pretty quickly to address it.

We spent four nights at this great hotel. The staff could not have been any better. Stephen helped get us checked into the perfect room for our anniversary. Dan, another of the managers sent wine and chocolate covered strawberries to the room and Colette at the Elite Desk was perfect in every way. I cannot say more about the staff at this Marriott. John, the doorman, taxi catcher, a helper in every way was awesome. It was great greeting him at least once or twice a day.The New York Marriott East Side is perfectly located. About a mile from both Central Park and Times Square. The metro is only a couple of blocks away. Just perfect.We expected a little more out of the M Club as we have experienced at other M Clubs. But can't lower the rating of 5 because the M Club staff were exceptional and there was always an abundance of drinks, food and snacks. The M Club was extremely large and was always packed with people and like I said there was always food. The room was very clean and extremely large. But we do manage to spread out and take advantage of every inch. As with most Marriotts', the bedding is just wonderful. This will become our Marriott of choice over the Marquis.A big thanks to the New York Marriott East Side Staff for welcoming us so wonderfully.

Directly across the street from the Waldorf Astoria, and a much better value. Centrally located. Ask for access to the 'M Club'. Worth the upgrade-b'fast, afternoon appetizers, late evening desserts. Appetizers actually constitute a light meal... Very clean and well appointed, all you'd expect from a Marriott venue.

3 nights for a business trip from France. (I am used to go to NYC, and will commute a lot in the next months)One of my worst experience in a 4 stars hotel.- Room very dated, and bleak- Lexington ave : very very noisy (7th floor)- bed cover dirty, I asked twice before someone came to replace it (apologizing)- Service : one of the worst I experienced. For example, I asked if an umbrella was available for guests, and the doorman answered ironically that he only had his own, without looking at me.- Wifi charged 20$, in 2015....purely unacceptable- No one never asked me to help when I was setting on the front of the hotel waiting for a cab (I did by my own)- No help from the bellboy when arrived or left, with my luggages Very bad experience at all. I will never go back, even if my NYC office is very close. I will find somewhere else.
user_name:
thomassW7252PY
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for one night. It cost a small fortune but everyone went out of his way to make our experience perfect. Location was perfect for us too. Diagonally across from rear entrance of the Worldorf Astoria. Hold on to your hat but buffet breakfast was $45 pp with tax and tips. But don't worry, lots of takeout within a block or two. Very lovely room.WiFi was expensive so I checked my mail on my phone.If you travel on business and not personally paying, I recommend this hotel.

We decided to stay at the Marriott East Side in NYC for our 30th Anniversary in December, just to be a little away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The staff was wonderful and they upgraded us to a Superior King Room on the top floor as a "gift" for our anniversary. The M Club Lounge as well as the Concierge Service was excellent in helping us make reservations and plans for upcoming days. I recommend this hotel whole-heartedly!

When I come to NYC, I like to stay at the Marriott East side, it is a great location for mid-town business and close to great restaurants. Also, it is easier to get to LGA or JFK. It is a business hotel. The restaurant is OK, but better options are a 10-15 min walk. The rooms are small, typical of an older property that Marriott has renovated. Staff is great, very friendly and very, very helpful. If you are a Marriott club member, the lounge is often really good, nice food and great selection. Also, very comfortable and a lot of places to relax. I've been to this hotel many times, always as expected and perfect.

I got it thru the Priceline bid and it had no option to select the room type - two double, 1 queen or king. Front office said the only available room for two double was with no views. Whether I believed it or not, I had no choice. The room was large enough for the city standards but virtually no view. There was no Wi-Fi in the rooms but you could buy with additional $$s. Cleaning crew was very friendly and spoke fluent English!! Location of the hotel was quiet and away from the Times Square jungle. Check in was 3pm and check out was 12 contrary to 4pm/11am in most upscale hotels. You can conveniently leave your luggage free of charge (with tips) after check out. We liked it.

What a pleasant surprise the Marriott East Side was on a holiday weekend in early December. We usually stay at the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, but it was booked, and we decided to come here. We booked superior king rooms, which were a great size, and well kept. The lobby was well appointed for the holidays, and the building was a classic. To top it off it was an absolutely great location. Recommend.

My wife & I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side over a Saturday night. Great location, but the room & service didn't meet out expectations. First was the room assignment. The front desk gave us a handicapped accessible room that we didn't ask for, which lowers usability of the bathroom & closets if you're not in a wheelchair. We didn't ask for a switch because it was a corner room far from the elevator, which we thought would keep us away from one source of noise. Then my wife was awakened by people talking in the hall at 2:30 am. They moved into the room adjoining our, and I had to put a rolled towel at the base of the connecting door to block the sound. A noisy soda machine was positioned in the 5th floor hallway by the way, although far from our room. Finally, while the bed wasn't *bad*, it did sag in the middle. Also it had one of those weird pillow-top mattresses, which some people like but not me. Oh well. But the location's good!

My family and I stayed at the Marriott East Side for the Thanksgiving Day parade this year. The hotel was decent... Typical of an older hotel in New York. The rooms could use some sprucing up. I am a Marriott Gold member so we had access to the Club Lounge, which I will say was very nice. Full breakfast and dinner every weekday with cocktails and dessert at night. I have to say though, the Lexington Autograph Collection hotel right across the street is a little bit nicer. It seems to have been renovated more recently. However, there's no lounge (only very limited breakfast in the morning). I guess it depends what you want when you travel.

I got a great deal on this hotel, I had booked months in advance and wasn't sure of what to expect from some mixed reviews. We had a party to go to in the city an thought we may as well stay down there..It worked out great , it's a prime location , so close to Grand central and the room was perfect! It was spacious and clean! The bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to get out of it.. The bathroom was spotless which is a big deal for me Coz I freak out if I see grime in the shower! One thing though someone knocked on our door at 10am an woke us up to tell us check out was at 12pm... Not a major deal but annoying to be woken up since I didn't get in till 4am! But over all it was pretty perfect.. Would definitely stay again but next time il be putting do not disturb sign on the door!!

We had a great staying!Everything was perfect!!Our Agent from Greece booked this hotel for our staying ( 22/11/15 - 28/11/15) and left us the best impressions.It's located at the center of Manhattan just few blocks away from all the sightseeing's such as Rockefeller center,Empire state building,times square,Columbus circle and more...The staff was very friendly and helpful!Wade (i hope i'm spelling the name right) gave us very good tips & info.If you want something really cheap & good nearby is 24/7 Ashley's restaurant which we loved it!We were very pleased & satisfied with our room!!We had a memorable staying!!!!!Effie from Hellas

We went in New York on April 2009 on our honeymoon.This hotel offers you the perfect way to explore the big apple.It is in a very good area at the centre of Manhattan just a few blocks away from Rockfeller centre ,Grand Central Station ,Times Square.We have really enjoeyd every little part of our trip and this hotel made everything even more wonderful!

I had a good stay, I was able to upgrade my room to a double bed but all the suites were taken. The reward members longe is closed on the weekends but closes about 1pm on Saturday. I got free soda and water but no appetizers were present. I utilized my early check in at 8am on Friday and was able to get the free breakfast which is also used for the rewards lounge. For the weekend days there is no free breakfast due to the lounge being closed so I was given 1200 points. The restaurant at the hotel did have a breakfast buffet which is expensive $46. Parking at this hotel is valet and cost $60/day. The hotel room decor appears a bit dated. Bathroom door did not lock, bathroom has no exhaust. The room I had was a double bed, in which the beds were nothing great. This room was not a suite but was a decent size. TV was an older flat screen. Staff at this Marriott were very kind and helpful with my upgrades and check in.I am comparing this Marriott hotel with my other Marriott brand hotel stays from greatest appearance to least: Las Vegas, Philadelphia, Arizona, New York.

Great beds coffee machines in rooms. 4 instead of 5 because no free wifi. Very convenient to attractions. All staff especially concierge and bell men super helpful. If it had wifi would be perfect place to stay in NYC . Will stay here again. Restaurant for breakfast expensive but NY luncheonette nearby so no problem

My family and I visited my hometown of New York City while visiting colleges for my daughter. Our room was a lot bigger than I ever expected (family of 4). It was the typical small room you see in NYC. It was pleasantly spacious and was a great location to just hop on the subway and visit the different schools (Pace, NYU, etc.). We also celebrated my birthday downstairs in the bar area and used the concierge whenever we needed help. They were very professional and helpful. We also did some major sightseeing by just walking around the vicinity. We were very central to a lot of the major tourist attractions. I'd definitely stay here again!

Stayed at the Marriott with my family on a trip that included the Radio City Christmas show. The location is perfect if you are in the city to see the sights. It's not in the middle of Times Square madness, but it's in walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Avenue, etc. The rooms are a bit dated and room service is not available, but the hotel and service more than makes up for it. The room was very clean, and the Marriott Club lounge was a large area with lots of seating and plenty of good breakfast options. On the day we checked out, they had a big table set up in front of the tree in the lobby with macarons and hot chocolate, which one of the bell man pointed out to my children as we walked by. It was a sweet ending to a great trip, and we will definitely return to the Marriott East Side.

This is the only hotel we choice to stay in when we have the opportunity to come to NYC. This trip consisted of 6 family members and three rooms, all superb. The staff is vey accommodating. The rooms are always comfortable, clean and quiet no matter which floor we have been on. As a rewards member I appreciate the convenience of online booking and available rates. Oh and let's not forget the location. Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and an easy trip to Broadway for shopping and shows.

Perfect location!Love this hotel visiting with two teenagers for School of Rock production on Broadway.Peter, the concierge on duty, recommended the fantastic Italian restaurant, Nanni's. Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere, and steps away from the hotel. Could not have been easier! So thrilled with the service and experience at New York Marriott East Side. We will make it our go to NYC hotel for future trips.

Its close to rockefeller center Park & fivth Av . 4 blocs from central station and have restaurants and bars around Also duane & rea de and food supplies , The waldorf astrosa hotel is in The next block

Seconds away from the chrysler building, opposite the Waldorph Estoria, blocks from bloomingdales and a couple of roads away from madison and 5 th avenue this hotel is perfectly situated to explore a lot by foot. Clean spacious and very friendly. Breakfast was $34, but had a really good selection.

I've stayed here a handful of times on business. The rooms are pretty standard for a marriott but the lounge is one of the newer M-lounges so food offerings are a bit nicer than average. Service was fine.

Rooms: Clean and spacious. Larger than the typical NYC hotel.Staff: Polite and accommodating. There was a back log with housekeeping when I arrived and they upgraded my room as a result.Location: Excellent! Lots of upscale restaurants and bars nearby.I've stayed here before and will likely stay again the the future.

Consistently excellent in all ways. Convenient location, beautiful rooms, friendly, helpful, professional staff. As an executive assistant, I need to know that I am booking superb accommodations for my boss and the Marriott Eastside never disappoints!

Upfront, the hotel accommodations are good--good room, good bathroom, clean, not too worn. The issue here, however, was the limited bar and restaurant service. Our plan was to grab a night cap at the hotel bar and watch some of the NY Met playoff game. Instead, as we took our seats at the bar at approximately 11:20pm on a Friday night in the city that allegedly never sleeps, the bartender announced last call. We quickly ordered only to find that a serving of Glenlivet cost $22--outrageous even for Manhattan. So I ended this short, expensive outing with a discussion with the bar manager, asking why the early Friday closing? Apparently, it has to do with union issues. That is Marriott's problem, not mine. Seems incredible that union issues would force a major hotel to close its bar at a ridiculously early time on a Friday night--with the home team in the playoffs no less. We stayed in the next night to watch the Saturday night game but to make matters worse, discovered the hotel offers no room service. So, it's an decent choice if you are looking for a comfortable room but not if you expect full service food and drink. Overall, a disappointment for a major NYC hotel stay.
user_name:
James P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location, excellent hardware after renovation of the rooms.You can feel is a classic hotel well positioned in Manhattan, with several renovations in the skin, but still attractive to the public.Service, according to the hotel, correct and professional.If you prefer modern stuff go next door to the W, if you are a classic......is your place.Dont expect cheap ratesGreat experience

This is typical of New York Hotels of a certain age. The rooms are very comfortable, well appointed and with all the mod cons. The beds very comfortable too and the staff friendly and helpful. The A/C is noisy however. It has a nice bar/lounge area not extortionately priced even if the waiters pester you too often which is annoying. The hotel facilities are good so a very nice place to stay except for one thing, the lifts!These are small, antiquated, slow and unreliable for such a tall and large hotel. This was a real pain during our stay and for many other guests too. We waited 15 minutes once for a lift from the 15th floor. What a shambles these were particularly when you were in a rush to get down. You just could not trust the lifts to come and frequently on the rare occasions when they came more quickly, they were full of suitcases or guests with suitcases. I have seen the management responses to similar comments and quite honestly, it is blatantly apparent that all you will get is platitudes. So if this is going to be an issue, I suggest you stay elsewhere, the lifts really are that bad! It’s a shame, they spoil a rather nice hotel. I would have rated this hotel much higher except for these lifts.

This property offered a pretty good price compared to the level of hotels in the area. Stayed Fri and Sat night and most hotels charged more on Sat than on Fri. This location had the same rate for both nights. Staff are friendly, location is pretty good...10-15 min walk to Time Square, and felt safe. Only thing that bothered me is a large box I was shipping out Sat morning never went out. Saw it sitting in the common area Sun afternoon when we were checking out. Staff didn't seem too concerned.

Always enjoy this hotel. Close to so much in the city but yet out of the way of the hustle and bustle of Ties Square. Rooms are good size and of Marriott standards. Check in was quick and easy and friendly staff. Bed was comfy although we kept rolling into the center. New mattress needed. Otherwise pleasant stay and good location with a decent price. You can never go wrong with Marriott.

My husband and I grew up in new york city, but now stay in hotels when we come to visit. The Marriott East Side was perfect for walking to many places and near the subway to get to all of the others. Room was small, but very nice. The lock on my door broke and I could not enter the room. I called the front desk and within 5 minutes someone came up. It did take about 30 minutes to fix it- but I waited in the club while it was being fixed. Breakfast in the club was great (as were evening appetizers and then dessert). Only complaint is that the club was not open on week-ends.

I have stayed here for over 100 nights about 15 years ago when I worked for a different employer so when we decided to do a couples trip for our anniversary and wanted to stay in midtown, we naturally picked this hotel. I called the hotel prior to our arrival and explained this trip is for a special occasion and asked if we could be upgraded to a nicer room. I explained I and a Marriott rewards gold member but would like to be guaranteed an upgrade as opposed to taking my chances during check in. No promises were made but the lady I spoke to said she would make a note on my reservation. We were assigned a room on the top floor of the hotel and was probably twice the size of any Manhattan hotel room I've stayed at. However after unpacking and settling into the room, I noticed a constant low volume booming noise that wouldn't go away. Turns out, it's the elevator banks and our room was located directly across from the elevators. I knew there was no way I would be able to get any sleep with this noise and we ended up going back to the front desk to request a room away from the elevators and packed everything and moved into a much smaller, but still upgraded room. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel as we were able to walk to Times Square, up 5th Ave to Central Park, and the subway was close by which took us downtown to the 9/11 Memorial and TriBeCa. We did not try the food at the concierge lounge as we stayed over a weekend when it was closed and why would anyone dine at a hotel restaurant when there are thousands of great restaurants in NYC?As others have commented, yes the elevators are small, the elevators are slow, yes the furniture is old, but I must commend the service provided by the valet, the bellman, the cleaning staff, and especially the front desk as they were able to find us a less noisy room and offered to help us pack our things when we needed to move. Kudos to all the staff at the New York Marriott East Side.

Hotel service was good. Room was quiet and right sizes. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Discounted price was very fair. I would stay there for any purpose even if it is off the beaten tourist path.

I typically stay at the Marriott in Times Square. I had a conference on the East side so this was my first time staying here. It was very nice. Excellent staff. Spacious rooms. Very clean. Nice lounge for Marriott Rewards members. It's a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Cathedral, Museum of Modern Art, Grand Central, and the Chrysler Building.
