So, even though you're not in the heart of Midtown, there are plenty of things close by and plenty of great places to eat.

I've stayed in this area before and found it ideally situated for Times Square or Central Park. The hotel was very welcoming, the staff were helpful and courteous and the room was very good as well. We ate in the restaurant on a few occasions and again all was good - would definitely visit again

We stayed here four nights for a friend’s wedding. The rooms are a nice size, the bathrooms are great with good hot water and shower pressure, the beds and pillows are comfortable. The bar area is lovely and the service is good. The art déco décor is nice especially the woodwork and floors. The only downside to the hotel is the elevators. They are small, noisy and very slow. At checkout time it was maddening trying to get an elevator as only a few people could fit at a time with their luggage. That being said, by far the worse drawback to this hotel is its location. It is not convenient to anything really. It’s not close to Time Square or the Broadway shows. It’s not close to Central Park or the museums. It’s not close to the Empire State Building or the Freedom Tower or the Statue of Liberty. I guess the only thing really kind of close is Rockefeller Center. The hotel is in the middle of everything but not close to anything. It’s a long walk or cab ride anywhere you go. My advice for staying in New York is to pick an area that interests you and stay there. If museums are your thing, stay closer to Central Park. If Broadway shows are your thing, stay closer to Time Square. This hotel, while lovely to stay in (except for the elevators) unfortunately is not very close to anything.

We stayed for three nights on a mini break. The hotel is a handy mid town location. Rooms aren’t huge - but they rarely are in Manhattan. Comfortable bed. Scrupulously clean and everything worked properly. We’d booked direct through the Marriott web site and therefore got free in-room internet – I’d have been aggrieved to have had to pay for it. Using the Marriott website to do on-line check in a day ahead meant everything was waiting on arrival – we just grabbed our key - I don’t think I’ve ever checked into a hotel so quickly.A few minor quibbles. The décor is so predictable, are hotel designers restricted to brown and beige? Tea and coffee making facilities are in the room but putting out only a single tea bag seemed a touch mean. Finally, on departure, when we mentioned to the bell hop that we would take a taxi to the Brooklyn cruise terminal he said “oh you’ll struggle to get a cab to take you there – let me organise a limo, only 70 bucks”. An old trick but so disappointing to see it still happening. We refused, got a cab ride with ease and the cab ride was less than 30 bucks…

We stayed here Oct 9-12, 2015 and absolutely loved our stay. We were with a bus tour so arrangements were made for us. Our room had 2 double rooms, was large and the bathroom was very big. I was expecting a small dingy room as some other reviewers had suggested but that was not the case with us. The beds were super comfy and the linen was luxurious The bathroom had a tub and shower and the soaps and shampoos were top notch. There was no free wifi in the rooms. The hotel was very elegant and the location was great. It was one block from Park Ave. Everything was within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again

As Platinum elite members we were very disappointed that a breakfast option was not available on weekends. This is so simple to do....as required. I recommend staying next door at the Lexington..marriott which provides a nice breakfast every day.

Another very large busy, impersonal Marriott and not one of the best. Our room looked over the back areas of the surrounding buildings with just a glimpse of the water.Free WiFi only in a very limited part of the lobby otherwise nearly $20 per day which is really not on when you consider the charge for the rooms.The room was clean and well furnished. We were at the end of a corridor and protected by the FBI stationed outside the next room 24/7 - never did find out who was in there but must have been a VIP.

Enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The staff were helpful and polite. This hotel is fairly well located for getting out and about, a bit further away from Times Sq but peaceful at night. I was on the 30th floor and had a typical Manhattan building view out of my window. The room was clean with a super sized king bed compared to ours here!The hotels big breakfast was $34 but there were lighter options. Depending on the room you stay in you can have a free breakfast included in your room rate, this is more than adequate but not available every day, I think it was Mon -Fri. Just along the road though are other eating establishments and there is plenty of choice around the block.The bell man assisted with our transfer back to JFK in a decent car which was better than having your knees tucked up in the back of a yellow cab, cost $65 inc. tolls (watch for tolls being added as an extra plus local tax).Tipping seems to be on the increase, last time I was in NYC 15% seemed the norm, I found many places giving you a bill with 3 suggested options all calculated out for you e.g. 15%, 18% & 20%, so be prepared it can add a lot to your bills as the week progresses! And don't forget the local tax, room tax etc etc. Even though the £ is good it's not cheap when you add all the taxes and tips!

Close to a lot of mid town attractions, although in a quiet area of town. The hotel seems somewhat dated, and would do with a general upgrade. Believe it main business is seminars and conferences. Ok and classical Marriott standard on the room.

when you pay 450 $ or more for a room, i think you have not to pay a 16$ extra charge per day for wifi in your room….that's ridiculous, that's not a normal price.the hotel is comfortable, but i'm not sure that the extra price compared to a cheaper hotel is always and totally justified….but that's New York as one says...

This is your typical classic Marriott - reliable, clean, standard rooms. This hotel is good for a business traveler looking to be on the East Side of town - it's very conveniently located to the subways and midtown east. No room service is offered - but there is a good, basic restaurant in the lobby area that serves a tasty breakfast buffet - and Seamless/GrubHub is a good way to order from the many local restaurants around the area.I stayed in Room 823 - a fairly spacious (especially by NYC standards) room with a King bed away from the elevator (therefore fairly quiet). No real views - windows face an air shaft so the room can feel dark (but at least there is bright lighting throughout the room).

My sisters and I spent Columbus Day weekend there and had a wonderful time. The hotel is centrally located so we walked almost everywhere. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the shower was as good as it gets! We did not eat in the restaurant because that looked a bit pricey. However, there are plenty of places nearby with good affordable food. The Concierge was also very helpful when we asked for directions.

the Marriott East Side is a very nice Marriott location. Hotel is nicely updated, rooms are very comfortable, decent view, but small windows, and located in a great part of NYC - just a few minute walk from Time Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue. Lots of nice local places to shop and eat on Lex and other streets close by - you get a nice NYC feel staying here

The Marriott on Lexington Avenue is convienent to the famed 5th Avenue shopping district and to Grand Central Station. The restaurant in the hotel lobby is pretty reasonable and convienent as well. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Take it from a Platinum member (75 nights a year) this place didn't impress me. This review is more catered to business travelers. First, I did mobile check-in which was great and my key was ready the moment I got there. However, the front desk person failed to ask me if this was my first time and I had to go back to ask where the elevators were, time of the concierge lounge and he didn't even recognize me for my platinum status or ask if I wanted points or food credit for my welcome gift. They gave me a room right in front of the elevator; really? I can't believe this is the room where they want to put their most important customers in? I got the room changed to a corner room at the end of the hotel which was nice. The hotel room itself needs to be renovated. The room reminds me of an airport hotel where everything looks worn and used. For the $400+ rate per night I paid I was upset. So, I finished working and after a long day I got in the room at 8pm and couldn't find a room service menu. I called down and they don't offer room service. What, no room service at a Marriott? The lady who answered my call was very abrupt, didn't ask if there was anything else I need and hung up quickly. The M Lounge Concierge area is very nice. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendly which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of two. However, this one nice feature isn't enough for me to come back. Next time I'm in town I'm staying at a different Marriott property who treats their platinum members like important customers and has a hotel that is worth the high price per night.

I stayed here recently on a business trip for work for 2 nights. Room was comfy enough although the bed was a little overly soft. Sheets looked a little worse for wear (pilly, attracting dust) and the towels were definitely worse for wear (I noticed some had light stains, which is gross).Size of room was decent - desk and bed and TV stand. Very much appreciated that there was an empty mini-fridge in the room, that I could store snacks and cool beverages in. Wifi worked pretty well, I had no issues getting work done, including downloading large-ish files. Temperature of room was fine and adjustable. I'm an elite/gold member, so I had access to the M lounge, which was very nice. I went down for evening snacks one night, decent selection, and then breakfast both mornings, which was nice because there was toast, fruit, cereals, and then also a hot food selection. Cooler to the side filled with yogurts, waters, and soft drinks available at all times which was MUCH appreciated. Decent amount of seating. It was nice to have access to that.Decent location, easy to get a cab out front, and convenient for the places I was going.

Stayed here for conference for a few nights and I could barely get any sleep, despite changing rooms twice. There are not really any quiet rooms in the whole place, so if you are a light sleeper, just go somewhere else.Rooms are so-so (particulary for the price you pay). Not too small for NYC, but very outdated. Smallish TV, comfortable bed, small bathroom, but plenty of hot water with decent pressure. Could have been cleaner. No room service, empty mini-bar and they do not offer deliveries from local eateries either. So if you are hungry, prepare to venture outside (or at least to the bar downstairs). Nice hotel staff, they try to accomodate, they just don't have the means to do much.Also, the temperature in the conference room was really low in the mornings (to the point that a lot of people were rushing to get hot beverages out of the hotel during breaks.

I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side for one night when I was over there for business. The rates were pretty competitive when compared to the other hotels nearby. And its close to all the happening places in the city. I think those were the plus points for that hotel.The service of the hotel was average. And the rooms were not that great - not upto Marriott standards also...

It was my wife and daughter's first visit in New York and I wanted it to be very special. My wife is very particular when it comes to cleanliness and smell of everything around her specially when we had our daughter and as expected my 8 months old daughter are having the same OCness. If she doesn't like the smell of her surroundings she will not stop crying. So during the time That I am scanning the available hotel in the middle of the City I considered those factors. At first I was not convince staying at NYME because of the latest bad reviews about the size, the cleanliness and other negative comments. But I took the risk because of its location and also the price a bit costly but still at my range. When we arrived at the hotel It was very early for the check in time but they accommodate us without any additional charge. When we enter our room I saw my wife face lighten up means she loves what she saw. It was a king size bed tidy, clean and spacious as well as the bathroom. It was indeed a wonderful and very relaxing stay at your hotel. We really enjoy our stay and super appreciate all the staff for being so polite, helpful and nice. We will surely come back soon. Thanks.

I brought my family here to celebrate our 23 rd wedding anniversary and my wife's upcoming birthday. WE ate at Smith and Wilensky before going to the Lion King at the Minskoff Theatre. The room was clean with the usual Marriott superior bedding. What was obvious was the room decor was very dated. The bathroom was not well designed and had no serious upgrade in many years as it had the old style 6 gallon flush toilet instead of the 3 gallon toilets that became common over 10 years ago. The restaurant in the hotel has a very limited menu with limited desserts as well. I became incensed about this as we wanted to have some nice desserts after returning from the theatre but I had to raise hell before they sent out to another restaurant for some chocolate lava cake. I found out this is a corporate downgrade from Marriott at many of their urban hotels. I have been a loyal Marriott customer for years but I cannot support this policy. Marriott has always had an excellent reputation for their food service and room service. Now they have abolished room service and turned their hotel restaurants into canteens.

The building is old and some of the bedrooms are in pretty poor shape with paper peeling off the wall. They keep it pretty clean though and service is pretty good. A big plus is the lounge which is fairly fancy and offers a good selection for breakfast. Lots of construction noise in the area during the day but nights were fairly quiet.

Full Disclosure: We're able to get from our home to midtown NYC in about 90 minutes, so, a hotel is a sorta-splurge for us. We don't NEED to stay overnight just to see a Broadway show (and seldom do). We usually "train-in" Saturday morning, get our discount TIX (at TKTS),have a nice lunch, enjoy the show and be home before bedtime.We had tickets for a Friday evening performance ("On Your Feet" - 5-stars BTW) and thought it might be nice to stay over (and take advantage of the Saturday matinee option). Not even realizing it was Columbus Day weekend, I found the hotel prices to be ridiculously high and had resolved to plan on returning home Friday. However, remembering a good experience with Priceline several years ago, I put in a bid for a Four Star Midtown hotel and "scored" the Marriott Midtown East.We were quite pleased with the price/value (at least, at the price WE paid). Room was clean, comfortable and a generous size. Staff was pleasant and efficient (and let me know that as a rewards member, I was entitled to the lower tier <which was fine> in-room internet access). For a Broadway weekend, you can hardly do better for location (at 49th and Lexington) - 6 blocks from Grand Central Station - 6 blocks from most of the Broadway shows.BTW: I had SOME concern as our room happened to be right across from the elevator - never heard a peep all night. That said, being in the front of the hotel, we did get SOME street noise (not much, really from the 11th floor) and a constant - moderately annoying - humming noise all night. It seemed to quiet down somewhat in the morning (hmmm?). There is subway project underway nearby and I can only speculate some harmonics from compressors or electrical equipment that may(?) subside during the day. A light sleeper MIGHT have less trouble with a room off-the-street. Last comment: we were able to leave our one overnight bag for "no charge" - the completely optional gratuity was well worth the convenience.

Great room and hotel. Elevators take forever! Plan 20 min wait or take the stakes...sent a terrific tray of cookies to our grandson for his birthday. Great location. Very upscale hotel. Nice and cold air one.

Stayed here on business and found the hotel room to be ok, but recommend avoiding the lounge / restaurant. Many others from my group also stayed here and complained about the noise. Luckily, my room was an interior room. My view was a building....which worked well since it was quiet. Noisy rooms were the ones facing the street. The choice is yours....quiet or view. The AC system wasn't intuitive.....still wondering what all the modes represented. The size of the room was big compared to most New York properties, but lighting wasn't good. The hotel accommodated my request for featherless pillows, but not for an extra towel. May sound odd, but the shampoo from the hotel was super nice. Use the Marriott app for quicker check in. Hotel is pricey...likely because of location. Would stay here again if it is on someone else's dime, but not if I had to personally pay.

The location is good but that's about it. I have frequently stayed in Marriott hotels and am an Elite member who's earned many points. This is meant to be a four star hotel but it doesn't come close. It is very tired, poorly maintained but yet it was more expensive than I've ever paid in a Marriott (circa $400 a night) and was the worst experience. Leaving aside the things I can't blame Marriott for - which was that New York was full due to the United Nations which was underway which resulted in much more external noise with sirens going day and night, and a reception area and elevators constantly full of extremely rude Chinese and Japanese guests (Apparently part of the UN event). The double glazing in the hotel is very poor which filtered out very little of the outside noise. The air conditioning units are so noisy you have to choose between being kept awake by them or to have a stuffy room. It was the same in both rooms we stayed in. The lifts were extremely temperamental and clearly need to be replaced. We were told only one floor has been renovated with the others to follow but it's clear they are long overdue for renovation - by about 5 years I'd say! We were initially checked into a room on floor 8 which was dark, very noisy but more importantly not clean! Additionally, the sink plug didn't work so we wasted water to use it at all and there was only one tea bag and 1 paper cup for a room with 2 beds! (they did bring more when asked). See attached photos. We asked to be moved to a higher floor and this took place on day 2. On floor 19 the room was brighter (more daylight) and cleaner. Clearly there are inconsistent standards in cleaning from floor to floor. However it was still very dated - including cheap quality blinds and wood-chip paper on the ceiling!! Really? I wouldn't expect this in a 2 star place. We ate here only once and apart from the wine which was nice, the location has no atmosphere at all, the bar area lacks comfort or warmth, the steak was overcooked and hence tough and the quality didn't match the price ticket. Worst of all was the service. One older grey haired waiter appeared to deem it his duty not to look at any guests, definitely not to smile or speak to guests and always served whilst looking away with a sneer on his face. It seemed there was some kind of dispute between the serving staff and this was causing a very uncomfortable atmosphere. This was so annoying we almost walked out and we noticed other guests also commenting on this. We wouldn't recommend unless you get a renovated room at a reasonable rate on a high floor - and don't eat here.

Hotel bar staff was extremely friendly. Rooms are relatively large considering NYC standards. Location is great to walk to shopping and local restaurants. Had everything we needed for a weekend away close by. Will definitely stay here again!

Location is good, if you don't want to stay in the Times Square area. The rooms were quiet, clean, small and well-equipped. But the photos on the website do not meet reality. This is not a luxury property. The bar is very basic, and the lobby area needs a remodel. I ordered a cocktail that was expensive ($18) and watery. The Club facility was very basic and had little to no atmosphere. A remodel here would go a long way. I would not choose to stay at this property again, when there are so many more to choose from that are nicer. We did have excellent service from the front desk and the bell staff. But the whole place looks tired, dated, worn and uninviting.

I was really disappointed in this hotel and it is subpar for a Marriott property. My room was dingy and dated. The window shades were grimy, there was sticky gunk smeared all over the light switch, and when I checked in there was an empty sweet and low packet on the floor that was never vacuumed up during my 4-night stay.I was on the 11th floor and there was a ton of street noise. You could hear sirens, car horns, and garbage trucks all night long making it difficult to sleep. I tried running the HVAC system on high to drown out the racket but the air conditioner is an ancient standalone unit with a very noisy fan so it did little to provide white noise or mask the traffic sounds.At one point, I left an almost full, large bottle of Fiji water sitting on the table when I left for the day. When I came back to my room it was gone. I called the hotel operator and was told that they "would try to replace it". After waiting an hour for my replacement water I finally went by the front desk on the way out and told them what happened. When I stated that guests don't appreciate having their personal belongs disappear the woman at the front desk said that housekeeping "probably thought I was done with it". I was given a little 8-ounce bottle of generic brand bottled water to replace my large bottle of Fiji water and with no apology.I could overlook the ancient, slow elevators and the smallish rooms but I can't deal with rooms that are dirty and noisy and with unhelpful staff. I was supposed to return to this hotel for business again next week but I have cancelled the reservation and will be staying elsewhere.

The staff was quite friendly and accommodating, and the room clean and relatively quiet for NYC. Centrally located, easy to get around walking, subway, cab rides. Very nice members lounge for breakfast and dinner through the week. Enjoyed my stay!

We visited this hotel as part of a trip with our young son, excited to show him the city, but unfortunately the condition of the hotel and our bedroom really took the shine off our trip. Our room was very dated, the furniture was old and scratched, paint was peeling off the ceiling and we even found our son playing with an old dirty slipper he had found under the bed. The hotel looks nothing like it did in the pictures and we would never recommend staying here. Such a shame as it is a very expensive hotel and we expected more.

Conveniently located in NYC but that goes with some drawbacks: very noisy area (but hey you're in NYC), no free WI-FI, expensive breakfast but there are loads of options close to the hotel. We had a 2 queen bed room, room size was ok but the size and quality of the bed are pretty poor. If you sleep alone, you can manage but 2 adults in this kind of bed is a challenge! For a 4 star hotel, quality of bedding should be a priority.The bar offers excellent wine with nice service.

This was a great location, close to Park Ave, walk to Central Park, UN site, easy stroll to Broadway. The hotel has historic characteristics yet has been upgraded and met all of our needs. We stayed in an junior King suite. In room Wifi free for Marriott reward members. The hotel staff were terrific. The hotel lounge was enjoyable. We stored our bags until late afternoon and then took a taxi to LaGuardia. Recommended!

Unfortunately, our four days in this hotel coincided with both a papal visit and a general assembly of the UN - many of the delegates of the latter were staying at our hotel. The upshot of this situation was that a massive police presence existed around our hotel, many of the major avenues were blocked off and barricades had been erected along the remaining streets and attractions e.g. Central Park. Under normal circumstances the location of the hotel would be considered ideal with easy access both on foot and public transport to places such as Times Square, Grand Central Station, Fifth Ave etc Our hotel room included two very comfortable large beds with four pillows. The TV faced one bed but as it stood on a swivel stand accommodated all viewers. There was a safe, an empty bar fridge, a separate closet for hanging and a large chest of drawers. We found the room to be quite spacious for two people although it could be a tight squeeze passing between the end of the first bed and the chest of drawers. As with most hotels the cost of laundry was frightful and there are no laundromat a close by. A full size bath was a bonus and bathroom amenities were a cut above the norm. Soundproofing the rooms would be a great advantage to block out the seemingly never ending sirens from both police and emergency vehicles. The breakfast buffett was average and overpriced.

Stayed 5 nights before out tour with Trafalgar and 4 nights after the tour finished,we just loved both our stays,all the staff were amazing.Our rooms on the 7 and 9 floors were just what we wanted,clean,modern and comfortable beds after a hard day of sightseeing.Great central basis to explore the city weather on foot or the subway.Did not want to leave,will be back hopefully one day.

Our room was very small and the toilet ran all night. Our view was bricks lining other buildings and rooftops. The desk staff were friendly enough but for the outrageous price I would have thought they would have been more accomodating. No one gave us any details about any of the services they offered like breakfast, the bar, etc. It was just an average experience. Kind of out of the way from the center of midtown or even Grand Central.

This hotel would be the best of the Marriott's that my family and I have stayed.The staff was extremely helpful and very well organized. The room we had was a corner double and was very spacious for NYC. The hotel is centrally located to all of midtown attractions. The lobby is quite nice with a very well managed bar and restaurant. We will definitely return

This was the first time staying at this Marriott in New York. I was very pleased with the size of the rooms. Amazing for New York. It contained a refrigerator and a safe. The location was perfect. Short walk from Grand Central terminal. Easy walk to the theater district and close to many good restaurants. The workout room was rather small and cramped.

Stayed here over labor day weekend and had a very positive experience. The location was perfect. I requested an upgraded room because we were celebrating anniversary and birthdays. They gave me a very nice corner room with a safe and refrigerator. It exceeded my expectations because I had heard that the rooms in New York City were very small. I would definitely stay here again. Also, the congiere lounge was very nice.

We needed to update credit card details. not only did we update concierege daily 3 times - they started calling our room daily, leaving notes under our door and then came to our room. Clearly the staff have a communication problem. We were then pinned out of our room after a day in town with all our belongings still inside and nowhere to go. After resolving our credit card details they then accidentally locked us out again the next day and took an hour to fix it. We had a booking that night at the theatre and were late because of the hotels idiocy.Daily cleaning wasn't daily! We had to call concierge to remind them to clean our room half the time and when cleaned most facilities were not replaced.Our shower flooded from day 1 of our 14 day stay and was never fixed although promised.From the floooding and heat our fire alarm went off and no one came we had to wait.Daily WiFi was $17USD (for 24 hours)I have stayed in several hotels in NYC and Marriott has always delivered but this hotel and it's staff all do - not only the bare minimum to make a your stay comfortable - but if you experience a hiccup there is absolutely no customer service or support. We were also refused to view our terms and conditions/rights as customers when locked out of our room. Absolutely disgusting.

This Marriott is located in the heart of midtown on Lexington and 49th and a convenient walk to anywhere in midtown Manhattan.I checked in online through the Marriott app and was handed a key to a room on the 22nd floor. As a Marriott Rewards member, I was disappointed to find out that my room was located right as you exited the elevator. However, my disappointment was mitigated when I entered the room to see an unusually spacious room, almost "suite like", so I decided not to lodge a complaint and change rooms.The location of the hotel lent itself to a "Grand Central Station" type atmosphere; a lot of people flowing in and out of the lobby.For NYC, the room itself was remarkably spacious, although the bathroom was cramped; seems as if they could've spared some excess space in the main bedroom for the bathroom. Same for the closet. The room was equipped with a small coffee maker and safe; nice amenities.The fitness room, although well equipped, was very cramped and as such, disappointing. The bellhop staff seemed to take every question as a bother. They either need to be better trained or management needs to find staff with better attitudes.Although my room turned out to be fine, it's still a bit of wonder to me on why I was assigned a room smack dab in front of the elevator. All in all, a big hotel with an unremarkable staff.

Excellent service and great location, very quiet! The room was clean and spacious by NYC standards. Staff was very helpful. Easy access to the subway and close to Rockefeller Center and Time Square. We will stay here next time we are in NYC!!

Stayed with my niece for several nights so that we could visit many galleries. This remains my favorite hotel in New York for its location, quiet rooms and excellent friendly service.If you need a quiet room to share with your teenage niece ask for an interior junior suite. It was perfect for our needs.

Very classy hotel with extremely pleasant workers. Everyone greats you and one bell hop remembered me that I was looking for a nice Italian restaurant to eat. He asked me how I liked the restaurant. It was great. Right around the corner called San Martin. This hotel is located in the heart of all the things to see. Close to TImes Square, Broadway, Central Park and just a short ride on the subway or taxi to other sightseeing activities.

Excellent service at the East Side Marriot on 42 and Lexington. The rooms were spacious and clean, which is always a priority. Stayed there for the 4th of July weekend and the staff was efficient and very professional. Recommended for families and also business travel as it is located very centrally, with Rockeffeler just 7 mins walking distance and Times Square just 15. Free wifi also available for Marriot rewards members. Will definitely visit and stay here again.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location was amazing, right across from the Waldorf Astoria. The room was HUGE by NYC standards. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. It was reasonably priced too. I would definitely stay here again while in NYC.

We just returned from a four day stay at the East Side Marriott. Loved the hotel, easy access to many places we wanted to see. Lovely superior king corner room! Sad that the M Lounge was closed over the weekend, but we tried lots of neighborhood spots, including the New York Luncheonette for breakfast. Welcoming staff, all very helpful. Will stay again if we find ourselves in NYC.

I love Marriott, but the Lexington Ave facility doesn't deserve to be under the Marriott umbrella. A totally substandard hotel and overpriced. I was given a room with a horrible odor and used Kleenex on the bathroom sink. After I mentioned this to the front desk, I was moved to another room, which had the same odor, sheets that may not have been changed, a moldy bathtub that didn't drain, erratic internet, no room service. The rooms are shabby, the elevators old and slow. And no one seems to care. Marriott member status doesn't matter at this facility.

I was here for a business function and due to weather, was delayed. Rooms updated; very nice, clean. Hotel staff was very friendly. Did their best to accommodate us when we were stranded even though hotel was booked. Food was excellent, concierge gave us great ideas for things to do; assisted with tickets. Can't say enough about them! Would stay here again.

I've stayed in this hotel several times over the years. Location is great! It is located across the street from hop on hop off bus stop on Lexington, about 10 minutes walk from Times Square and Broadway. Hotel is clean, spacious, well run. I had no issues as far as anything goes wrong. In my taste hotel missing the uniqueness of a boutique hotels, but as far as chain hotel is a good hotel.

Stayed here for two nights as part of a tour. The locale was very good for such things as Grand Central and the Rockerfeller Centre. The room was comfortable and well equipped, the service seemed good but a bit impersonal compared to other hotels we stayed at. Never really felt like I was welcome here - I'm not usually one to complain about such things but the feeling was pronounced.Although perfectly adequate for our needs, the room was a little dingy, having one tiny corner window which provided very little light and a dull colour scheme which enhanced the slightly claustrophobic feel of the room. It also felt a little worn at the edges - loose sockets, old bathroom fittings and such. Trivial things, but noticable.Otherwise a very good hotel.

This hotel is in a very good location. It is a typical Marriott which is a good thing. However, it is a much older hotel and definitely dated. The rooms are very small though and furniture is also dated. Fitness center is located on the top floor which can be a challenge due to the elevators which are not the most speedy. Fitness Center equipment is also older and small when considering the number of hotel guests. So this is not a horrible choice and you get a consistent experience with Marriott which is a big plus but it really could use a refresh.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel in early November. Very comfortable beds, spacious rooms for NYC. Slightly dated but that would be the only criticism. Great location near local sights. There is a great little cafe a couple of blocks away.

My family had great experience at this hotel. Having tickets for the tennis tournament, we found out that the hotel in just steps away from Grand Central. Check in was pleasant and prompt. The room was decent size for Manhattan, very clean and well appointed. Overall, we highly recomend the hotel to visitors of New York, who are looking for location and not willing to fork up a thousand dollars per night for accomodation.

From the minute we walked onto the lobby I knew we were in the right hotel in NYC. Paulina met us with a welcome smile and the check in was quick and easy.The room was spacious for New York and very clean. The real plus is it was feather free. If you have allergies it is the place to be.Sam and Margaret in the M Club lounge are very professional and helpful. Breakfast was well prepared, with a good variety. Margaret knows the city and her hints on what to do saved us time and frustration.The hotel location is great, near Grand Central and the bus line. We would definitely recommend this Marriott.

Are the rooms outdated? yes but it was clean and it isn't new construction so your expectations should adjust to it. Is the restaurant in house any good? Not for a fancy sit down meal, only good for a drink and a limited somewhat fast food meal. Is it overpriced? Yes but you are in midtown Manhattan, again find a decent hotel in the area that isn't. This is an old world hotel, don't expect modern bathrooms and amenities. its location is great, the staff are second to none, and the "club" room offers breakfast and dinner (limited but enough) for me and my guests in a relaxing environment. If you follow me as a "Waldorf/Hilton" soldier you would be surprised that I would even choose a Marriot. I couldn't get into a Hilton and my wife was having surgery so I needed to stay near the hospital. I booked connecting rooms and in the panic of the moment I mistakenly booked only one night when I needed 3. I realized my mistake at 5am and they were sold out BUT realized my wifes dilemma and they did not make us move. In a society that frowns on humanity and a handshake,......piece of mind was priceless to me and something I will never forget.....the staff made the difference....
user_name:
truthintravel60763
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked a weekend at the Marriot expecting first class service seeing we paid over USD 400 per night including taxes.Well to say we were disappointed is an understatement. The room was small and the bathroom the smallest I have ever experienced for such a high priced hotel.We paid extra for a city view we got a view of the building next door.Also be careful about additional charges. Our bill was 936 with taxes but the credit card was charged 939 plus two additional amounts of 21 and 22 USD which do not appear on the the bill.Don't take a car parking cost USD 65 and they put on a valet fee without asking. They also don't have free wifi in the rooms. For this they charge USD 19. All in all not worth it. For the same money you can stay at the Waldorf.We won't be staying here ever again

I recently stayed at the New York Marriott East Side with my wife and daughter. We were attending an event over on 1st avenue and needed a conveniently located place to stay on the East Side.The location of the hotel worked out great. It was relatively close to our event and to the restaurant we were eating at the night before. We arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon. We had driven to New York so we needed to park. The hotel offered valet parking which was rather expensive, but typical for this part of town. However, when we got the hotel, the entire block in front of the hotel was filled with cars waiting to be parked. We had to drive around the block several times until a space opened up. The valet was busy talking to someone in one of the limos, so we ended up waiting another 5-10 minutes until he decided to come take care of our car. Not the kind of service I expected from this hotel.Check in was fine. We went to our room, and as expected, it was small. The three of us could function reasonably well in the space, but it was not ideal. The room had some work done to it, especially in the bathroom, which was also very small, but clean and nicely appointed. Since we were there overnight, we were going to live out of our bags, but that was a bit of a challenge given the space, as well. The bed was quite comfortable. The air system in the room worked okay, but didn't keep the room a consistent temperature throughout the stay. The next morning, we decided to get breakfast on our way to the event and had to wait too long to get our car back from the valet. I had called down 20 minutes before we were departing, figuring that should be enough time to bring it around, but we had to wait another 15 minutes before it arrived.Overall, our experience was not ideal, but given the options in this section of NYC, this hotel was acceptable.

The Hotel was right in Manhattan and within walking distance to just about every attraction you would wish to visit, if walking isn't your thing there are many modes of transport right outside the door. Room was clean which is really all you want on holiday. One trap I fell into was ordering tickets to a Broadway show through the Hotel. Huge fee added on, I later found out I could walk a few blocks to Times Square and get then half price. Staff friendly and helpful, restaurant was good although drinks very expensive.

Great value for money hotel on Lexington Avenue. It is walking distance from the central station and if you do not mind walking a bit from the Rockefeller centre and Time Square.The staff was friendly and I stayed there twice in a month around Business trips to visit New York.

This is a slightly old-fashioned (+) place that is really well located in midtown Manhattan. Just about everything is walkable. Rooms are simply but tastefully set out and the staff is helpful. Plenty of interesting sights and restaurants/bars in the neighborhood. Attentive service that never seems rushed, even when the hotel is busy.

Love the Marriotts - this is just not one of them! VERY small rooms, lobby small and crowded (lots of tour groups) - Bellmen/Doormen - nothing - no hello - no help with cabs, Very not up to Marriott standard. Clean - bathrooms remodeled but smallish. Lots of better options in Manhattan.

Good location on the Manhattan's East Side for those looking to escape a little of noise and congestion of Times Square. Rooms are a bit smaller, but well appointed and the staff is highly professional and helpful. The only negatives are the cost of the breakfast buffet and no room service. There are plenty of other options for breakfast nearby if you don't want to drop $34 for the buffet, so not a deal breaker for me. Also, room service is not an issue for me in NY as I would rather be out and dining in a great food city versus sitting in a hotel room. I would definitely stay here again as the rooms and customer service are top notch.

This is a pretty nice hotel in a great location on Lexington and 49th. Close to grand central station, Chrysler building, Times Square , Empire State Building etc. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Bar seemed expensive to me though. $6 for a small bottle of evian seemed excessive to me. All prices do include 15% tip as standard

Went there after a disastrous stay at it's sister hotel, the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 (a word of advice, avoid that property). We stayed there for a night. Staff was excellent, the executive lounge seems to be great (we arrived on a Friday and the lounge was already closed, but we were able to sneak in and take a look).Room was big with a beautiful view of the city. I must say that it is not a facility that makes you feel at home, but it is very good.

My family and I stayed here for 4 nights. Ideal location. Not too-hectic [in NYC standards] yet close to everything.. 15 minute walk to times square, 10 minutes Bloomingdale and Rock center. Footsteps to subway. Breakfast not included, but there r many places to go to around the corner[s]Drawback: I booked a room w 2 double beds but they gave us was more of an over-sized singles. Sleeping uncomfortable.There is free WI-Fi. Extremely expensive laundry service [highway robbery], OK staff. I give them a 7 out of 10

This building is old and cold, matching the Gotham City style of its location in Manhattan. Its effectiveness comes from the fact that you come in, you sleep and then you go out, i.e. you do not really want to spend time in it. The overall services match its style as well, i.e. you ask and you obtain within the boundaries of your booking class. Use this location if you want to an experience like in the Jon Voight movies.

This is a good property to stay at in your doing business in Midtown that's walkable from Grand Central, Times Square, or other midtown locations. It's certainly quieter than the chaos over at Times Square, so that's a big plus, while still close to almost everything. It's a bit aging and needs to be refreshed a bit. My upgraded room was nicely sized with a great bathroom, but I heard complaints from my colleagues about the smallness of their rooms. I also had to change elevators to get to my room, which I realize is a NY thing, but a bit of a pain.The only downside to this hotel was that most of the good dining or bar options weren't nearby. Sure, there were chain restaurants in midtown, but if you want authentic NY places, you have to go a ways.

Stayed in a standard king size room. The hotel overall was very nice, the room was particularly spacious and up to date by New York standards and with a decent bathroom! The bed was incredibly comfortable and the staff I spoke to in reception were very genuine and approachable. Location is great - walking distance to tourist areas and lots of places to get coffee and breakfast nearby.My one and only issue was to do with noise. Our room faced the courtyard at the back, from what I could tell there are some utility buildings at the bottom of the courtyard which hummed and buzzed along all night. Given how exhausted we were it wasn't enough to ask to move rooms and to be realistic finding a quiet room in Manhattan is a bit of an ask anyway, just something to be aware of.

The new lobby is great -- flows into a nice bar & lounge/work area with nice big tables (great for the business prep meetings!). The staff were all very friendly -- from the doorman, bell, front, restaurant - I really appreciated that! Location (for me) was great -- I wanted to be close to Times Square/Theater, but not too close. Short walk in multiple directions for all kinds of business & fun. The building is older, so the rooms are little "tight feeling" but otherwise, good. Street sound not an issue (but it helps to get a high floor).

Excellent stay. We stayed for the U2 concert and they serve us very well. It was cery centric. 3 blocks from time square, plenty of places to hang out at night. We use the city bike service for $20 daily an we run almost the entire city in just 3 days.

It was the best decision to stayb. The location is awesome. Subway a couple of blocks. You can walk to the Rockefeller Center. The National restaurant one block to your right is a very good option for breakfast.Rooms are quite small, but understandable for a big city.

This is the second time I've visited this hotel and will more than likely be the last. I love the location of the hotel, it's convenient for lots of activities, Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central, 5th Avenue shopping are all within walking distance (and as an added bonus, Ess a Bagel is just round the corner but I'll do a separate review for that ) I'm here on day 2 of a 6 night stay staying in room 317. We needed a room that would accommodate 2 plus my 16 year old daughter so we booked a premium 2 x double bedded room. I have to say that the room is huge. I also have to say it's the dreariest room ever and very dated! There are 3 small windows that look into a central eyesore surrounded by tall buildings and you can see easily into other people's rooms. No natural light, you can't even tell what the weather is doing outside, it's just grim I will add photos of the 'views' On a more positive note, even though we're only 3 floors up its pretty quiet as were in the middle of buildings and not on a road. Air con works well in the room, but does randomly 'buzz' every few minutes which is annoying. The bathroom is spacious, the shower is powerful but the temperature changes randomly so one minute it's on the chilly side, the next minute it's almost too hot to stay under. For the rates they charge you can get better rooms elsewhere in NYC.

We got a good corner standard room for the price, comfortable and pleasant and a great view of the Chrysler Building. Service was good and quick, location great in mid-town Manhattan. No breakfast included but there are many other options outside. Wifi was good, though it was charged. Would certainly stay here again.

Excellent location, v friendly staff, limited services but all good if you aren't high maintenance! We had a wedding around the corner and for a summer weekend got a fantastic rate - I would stay here again!

This hotel is well located in NYC. The rooms are very comfortable as are the beds.The staff at the front desk, especially Denise, were very accommodating. In fact, all the staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge gave good directions and advice. There are good restaurants within a quick walk -- no transportation needed.

We loved our stay here. The staff was great and the rooms were comfortable. We had a great view from our windows. The neighborhood was very quiet at night. Plenty of restaurant choices in the area. Will definently return in the future. I love NYC!
user_name:
Jim B
Hampstead, North Carolina, United States

review_body: We spent one night here at the start of a Trafalgar tour. As it was quite expensive, we chose another hotel for our extra nights.This is a large grand old hotel centrally located in a nice area near the Waldorf Astoria and the W.Luckily our breakfast and wifi were included by Trafalgar, as the breakfast prices were very high. There plenty of places to eat in the areaWe were given a well appointed corner room with a very comfortable king bed, and views on both sides. There was a coffee maker and a safe in the room.Would stay here again if the Aussie dollar was stronger.

I don't know what everyone is complaining about. You are in New York City for god sakes - so what if the rooms are on the smaller side - ours was clean, smelt fresh and the noise from the street was inaudible. The girl who checked us in was informative and let us know where we could go to eat, and gave us the room we requested. What more could you ask for? And on the note that the rooms are small - why are you staying in your room all day? Get out! You are in the big apple!This hotel is close to the subway station and is on a main road next two a couple of shops and late night eats. Loved our stay - and if the price is right we will be back!

We usually stay in the upper 30's but decided to try out this Marriott on this trip. The location was great! Safe neighborhood (across street from Waldorf-Astoria), two blocks from Subway station, a couple blocks from Rockefeller Center and walkable distance (but out of the noise) from Times Square. Room was good, although bathroom was small (like most NYC hotels) and hotel was quiet. Friendly staff. Did not eat/drink at restaurant/bar so cannot comment there. Breakfast was expensive at hotel restaurant ($34) so found other nearby places for breakfast. Will definitely stay here again.

I love the location of this hotel. Within walking distance to shopping, theatre, Central Park. This was a mother daughter trip and the people at the Marriott were wonderful. Denise at the front desk was able to help us with a room that met our needs for the three day stay. The concierge JC and Peter gave us outstanding dining recommendations. Marriott East Side is my go to hotel when in NYC!!

Stayed at the Marriott East Side with family pre Xmas. Great location, rooms were good but a little bit tired, particularly the bathrooms. Door staff very friendly, lobby very busy and only a handful of seats in the lobby considering the size of the hotel. Lifts were VERY slow and you could wait 5-10 minutes. Overall very good and would stay at again, although would not be my first choice for NYC.

Just checked into this Hotel and absolutely disgusted to find that not only is the Executive Lounge closed but the Hotel wish to charge me $42 per person for a Breakfast because of that!As a Platinum member I don't expect to be paying top dollar to stay in Marriott Hotels and then I get charged for things that should be complimentary for Platinum members.Oh and the rooms are absolutely the worst I have ever stayed at in a Marriott in fact it's not fit to be a Marriott property. Avoid!!

Good hotel staff and helpful bellman. Very knowlegdeable about the area, restaurants and attractions. Good sized hotel rooms for NY too. Fun lobby as well and bartenders were very engaged with customers.

My two teenage granddaughters and I spent three nights at the New York Marriott East Side. The hotel was built in the 1920's, (originally called the Shelton Towers Hotel where Georgia O'Keefe once lived) but has been nicely updated. The rooms were large with every comfortable beds. The location is within walking distance to many attractions - Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, Grand Central Terminal and Rockerfeller Center to name a few. The breakfast was expensive, (it's NYC!), but we found a deli with great selection of food nearby. The Lexington subway is close by and we were able to go to the Brooklyn Bridge in about 20 minutes. A great first experience in New York for my granddaughters!

I really want to love the Marriott East Side; the staff are wonderful, particularly those in the M Club, and I like the location. In fact I like everything except the rooms. The rooms in this hotel ruin the hotel experience.Run down and outdated rooms - broken window shades, cramped bathroom (shower curtain hits the toilet, door hits the toilet, it's cramped like an airplane bathroom). Lumpy bed unlike any Marriott I stay in. And my room - 1707 - seems to be where the cigarette and cigar smoke from somewhere in the hotel accumulated. A small vent in the bathroom let in the smell throughout night, so someone is smoking in the stairwells or bathrooms. 1707 is also next to a storage room. Avoid the room.It's strange to have such a dual identity in a hotel; until it's renovated, if ever, it's too hard to be comfortable in these rooms.

I have to say - I won't be back. The hotel has a nice lobby and the front staff were friendly - but that's about where the amenities ended for me. The room was smallish by other NY hotel standards. There is NO ROOM SERVICE - not even for coffee. And the in room coffee - they had this box in the room that contained the coffee grounds, sugar, stirrers, three cups, but only TWO little mini-moo creamers. What a joke. I called down one day for more creamer and they guy brought up a bag of 10 - clearly he knew how many it would take! ;-) And the ratio of stirrers to sugar to cups to creamers was different each time.The bathroom had the loudest toilet I've heard in my life. It was like someone killing someone in the bathroom every time I flushed. As a test, I flushed, went out into the hall and with both the bathroom and bedroom doors closed - I could easily hear it filling. The controls for the shower were loose - and considering this was allegedly an assisted living suite for people with physical disabilities - there was no excuse for that. Ironic given it was the 25th anniversary of the American's with Disabilities Act. And I kid you not when I say I slipped in the shower every single time I was in there - the material they add to the bottom of the tub to make it non-skid was all but completely worn smooth. The phone in the room didn't work either (the handset). Again, given it was a room for the disabled, what a miss! I couldn't help but imagine having fallen and the frustration of not even getting the phone to work. And the elevators were among the slowest I've ever seen in a hotel.
Like every Marriott Hotel, it was a pleasant stay.The rooms in general could be a bit updated, but in general everything is good.Very classy and very well located, walking distance from many places.

I think the best thing about this hotel is easily the location. Unfortunately I do not have an idea of NY room rates or the room rates at this hotel since we were put up here as a part of a conference, but I'm sure it is expensive thanks to the location. Views can vary a lot depending on floor and direction. The service was discreet and excellent.

After a delay at Orlando airport for 9 hours due to technical problems at La Guardia airport, we were finally relieved to check into our hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan. It is within walking distance to many attractions i.e. Central Park, Times Square/Theatre District, Chrysler Building, Rockerfella Center and Fifth Avenue (shopping heaven). The hotel had a gym, which, unfortunately we did not use as we ran out of time. My one and only disappointment in my stay at the hotel was that the bar closed too early (11:30pm). Also, the prices of drinks at the bar were very expensive (2 large glasses of white wine, including tip cost approximately $60!)

Stayed at the Marriott for thanksgiving, 2014. Good location for all the manhattan christmas activities including Macy's parade, Christmas show at Radio City Music Hall and shopping. The hotel is a little outdated but a good value. I normally book a longer stay then anticipated and change dates when final plans are made. Great way to get the best price. Business services are very poor at best.

Stayed at the Marriott Friday and Saturday nights. I was very pleased with the room size, quite large for New York. The room was very clean and quiet, bed was comfortable and shower was very nice. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay here again when I visit New York.

I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side in July 2015. The location is good and convenient. The restaurant is fine, and the executive lounge is decent. My room was at the 35th floor, away from the street noise. It was was standard small New York size. The AC was very loud and makes it hard to sleep at times. It kept on making these screeching noises off and on all night. I had to shut it down, although it was real hot. The room was clean but did not have a bath tub (which was Ok). The problem was that showering was an adventure as the shower is not well designed and the result is water all over the bathroom. The lounge was Ok and crowded with kids who were roaming all over the place. The rooms are old but functional. The WIFI was great. The staff were Ok.

I love Marriott but this one certainly falls short. No room service?? Really??? And the restaurant was expensive with very limited choices. No bottled waters in my room? No on demand movie selection? What's going on? I'm at at Marriott and I'm in NYC!! And why does every negative review on trip advisor get the exact same response from the management team? Am I at a Marriott? Am I in NYC? Not sure! Never again!

Rooms are decent size for an older hotel, and well updated. The lobby has very little room to sit and relax, however. The hotel staff was great, and very helpful. Carmen at the front desk was very helpful, and the doorman was always very helpful in getting a taxi. Would stay here again if I could get a reasonable rate.

We stayed here as part of a Trafalgar bus tour. As it was our first day on tour we had to check in ourselves. They asked for our credit card for any incidentals while staying there, as part of the Trafalgar tour wifi and breakfast were included. Fortunately we checked our credit card the next day to find 2 charges, 1 for wifi and one for breakfast totalling just over $90. We emailed the hotel who responded quickly saying our querie would be forwarded to the appropriate people. They replied stating this would be attended to within the next 3 to 5 days. Naturally we were quite angry about this time delay and responded stating this was unacceptable and we would appreciate a credit immediately. To their credit we did receive a refund but this matter took almost a week to fix. There were others on our bus who had the same problem and unless you sent a complaint it wasn't fixed. I have no idea how long we would have had to wait for a refund if we hadn't complained. The amount on the credit card said 'pending'. This is totally unacceptable.

This hotel charges New York prices (I paid $470 for one night) but provides limited service. There is no room service, which was an inconvenience in light of the fact that I had plenty of work to do both when I arrived and in the morning. The wifi signal was spotty. The restaurant is a pretty mediocre option too.On the positive side of the ledger, the location is very good, the staff friendly, and I was upgraded to a nice room. But I will not willingly return for a business trip.

Stayed for one night on a business at the end of July 2015. Very centrally located hotel. Had a one king bed room which was decently sized. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I was on the ninth floor and the traffic noise was very loud all night. The hotel has a gym with many cardio and weight machines on the 35th floor. To get to the 25th floor, you will need to change lifts twice...so in 3 lifts altogether...as it is a old building and the lifts don't go up all the way.

Just spent a few nights at the Marriott East Side, our fourth visit in the past couple years. Staff is friendly and helpful, location is central to Manhattan, all offered at a good value. I would recommend the hotel anytime.

I've stayed at this hotel many times, but not sure I will be back. It has become very dated and needs help. From the revolving door that you enter from the street that malfunctioned twice while I was there, to the elevators that took way too long, to my room where you had to move the desk chair to get to the bed, and close the bathroom door to even use the toilet, and to the fitness center with well used equipment. Need to spend some money on this one! And, you need to offer room service.

I was in NYC for a work conference and added a few extra days and stayed for the weekend. We stayed at the Mariott East Side. It was a nice hotel, nice lobby, lobby bar, door men etc. Good location, easy 10-15 minute walk to Time Square and the sites around midtown. Minor things in the room made it look like it needed a little refreshing, scratched up tissue box, lots of caulking in the bathroom etc. Overall, the hotel was good, comfortable, quiet, clean, comfy bed and very convenient. I would stay here again.

We had the worst experience at this hotel. We just stayed one night, but one staff opened our door directly around 8 am. When we sent the feedback to the front desk, she replied us it's the room service. We felt so bad and scared of the service. Please be careful to the personal security and their bad service. And the bathtub was soooooo dirty. A lot of dirt and fur floating on the water. There are many other choices , please don't choose it. It's my first time to send the negative review. I hope they will improve it and no one meets the same situation in the future.

I have a very short stay for a quick meeting. The location was perfect for my needs and it is walking distance to many places even if you are on leisure. Upon my arrival late at night I was never greeted by a doorman, who was busy chatting with a taxi driver, the front desk agent said hello, but it was it. All the other questions and procedures were done robotically and never tried to understand the reason of my trip. The room was small and outdated, many parts of the room needed painted. Unfortunately, I didn't feel the warmth of the employees to make me feel comfortable. A simple hello and 30 sec interaction to get to know me probably would had make a difference on my stay.

Stayed here recently as a Marriott Gold Member...no Marriott welcome or thanks on check-in, no concierge on weekend (no meal voucher like many other Marriott's) "we do nt do that".........no double beds as they were all pre-booked (yet I arrived at 1120) ....parking expensive (65/day?).....good location....sundry shop is expensive even by NYC standards ($2.5 for a small bag of Lays).......stayed here and did nothing else hotel based.....many Marriotts seem to be better Mon night to Friday am check out and do nt go out of way for Elite's on weekends

This hotel is located a few blocks east of Rockefeller Plaza. Our room with two double beds was one of the largest I've been in in Manhattan. The room was clean and comfortable and the beds had quality firm mattresses. The bathroom had a tub shower and was also clean and well maintained. The Lobby and lobby bar area were nothing to write home about but were OK. the room price was a good value.

Very good location. This hotel is the excellent place to stay. Great service! Room was wonderful, not facing the outside wall. Good for local transportation. Good location for walking and taking the bus line. Great location to walk to the shows, restaurants, etc. You need to stay here!

The hotel has a number of restaurants and bars within a couple of blocks so is a great base for exploring around the area. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with checkin and directions. The room was large by NY standards although my room lacked much of a view, other than some nearby room tops and neighboring walls. The bedding was very comfortable and shower had plenty of hot water and pressure.

Great location close to all that NYC has to offer. Friendly staff and concierge service which offered great selections for dinner and things to do around the city. Prepaid for my trip to guarantee rate and had my room ready upon arrival. Biggest complaint is my room faced other buildings with very little natural light. Not sure if that was because I prepaid but it was disappointing to have no view.

On my first visit to New York with my family I decided to go for Mariott for many concerns as follows:- comfortable place and room setup - Clean place - in the heart of Manhattan I found all that with no doubt.BUT at check in the guy in the reception was not at the level to clarify that they charge incedental fees, also he didn't give choices for payment method; he just charged the full amount with this incedental fees on my credit card.Uptill the day of writing this review they didn't refund the sum.It's really annoying and ruined the trip.I made a complaints but all I got is sorry with no action.Just take care when you are in New York.

I stayed at the Marriott east side in May 2015 for 2 nights.I'm used to the neighbourhood since I slept at the W and at the Lexington during my previous visits to NYC.This hotel is currently my favourite in the area, the staff is professional and friendly and the rooms are big and clean (for NYC standards).Excellent position and very gentle reception and concierge staff.I was able to leave my luggage there overnight free of charge (I had to travel to ithaca for two days).Well done Marriott I will definitely come back!

Visited twice this year and both times we have very much enjoyed the hotel, location, staff, club lounge, lobby bar - really we have not found anything that would not make us want to go back next time we head to New York!

Fantastic location, very good quality hotel, very helpful pleasant staff and I would defiantly stay here again. We just used it as a base to get some rest while sight seeing and shopping. It was close to everything so no need to use the subway but far enough away from the lights and noise to get some rest, all in all a great hotel and location. What more do you need when in NYC?.

Typical Marriott property, and professional service. Was in town for a day for a meeting and this was a nice stop. Location is good for business and tourism. It's hard to do much better for the price in New York City. Would definitely stay again if the situation called for.

The hotel is aging and needs some updating in the public spaces but the rooms have been updated with flat screen, smart TVs and iPod docking stations. Staff are friendly and attentive and I was upgraded to a suite. The food at the M Lounge breakfast was nothing special and the room a bit drab but it's a nice perk to have access to this lounge.

Let me start out by saying the staff of this hotel is great. Very friendly and helpful. Also the hotel, while maybe a little older and tired, is quite clean. We arrived yesterday for a three night stay and were booked through Expedia. Apparently 2802 is what you get as a standard room. It may be one of the smallest rooms I've ever seen. There is a storage room down the hall which I think is bigger. I've also attached a picture of the view from the ONLY window in our room. If you are a fan of brick--you'll be pleased. So shame on us for not researching this better and understanding what the Marriott East considers a standard room.

This is a very tired hotel and sad. The rooms are noise even when the air con is off.Want a drink at the main hotel bar and it is closed during the afternoon no coffee nothingMuch nicer places to stay for the money

This hotel is close to 5th avenue a few blocks from saks. It is not hard to get too and not bad price for in the city. As most hotels parking expensive. Service was good but front desk for elite members could have been better. The guys at the door for your car etc were the best and helpful

Best thing about this hotel is its location in midtown behind the waldorf. easy access to many of the best parts of town. good service from the staff. Decor feels a bit dated.a bit noisy at night and small rooms but I guess that is NY.We got a connected room to share with the fsmily which was about the only one we could get in NY for six people.Food at the restaurant was ok nut there are plenty of food options around.

This was a very clean, comfortable place to stay in New York City. The location was great. It was close to the 51st street subway station, and there were always taxi cabs near to the hotel. There is also a convenience store, Duane Reade, close by that comes in handy. Housekeeping was great. We had 3 rooms total, and they were all nice and clean. My only complaint is that the TV stopped working the last 2 days I was there, and there was no mention of it by the management. I feel like they should of acknowledged it and let guests know what the problem was. I would stay at this hotel again...a good experience!!

This was my third stay at this Marriott location. As a reward member I always try and book a Marriott property on my travels & over the past 10 years I've stayed at 9 properties in the Manhattan area. This location never disappoints. Everyone in the lobby area was so wonderful and accommodating, Paulina greeted us upon arrival and was such a bright spirit. Paul, Front End Mgr is another standout, he offered us some great local details on one of our days of exploring another borough. He even spotted us on the street on his off hours and asked how our day was. Truly can't ask for a nicer group of staff. Peter at the concierge desk was a wealth of knowledge. We had a lovely room on a high floor, with a king bed and sitting area. The room size was larger than most, another perk of this hotel. The room was always bright from the three windows with great views of the surrounding skylines. The bedding was like sleeping on a cloud. The bathroom is nicely appointed with a large vanity and includes some lovely bath products. Some reviewers of this location feel the hotel is in need of an upgrade. I found everything to be more than adequate. Some of the wood around the bathroom doorframe appeared weathered but certainly not in disrepair...this building is a classic and that's part of the charm. There is easy access to transportation with a subway just 2 blocks away, two bus stops just steps away and the iconic Grand Central Starion just 6 blocks away. We booked directly from the Marriott website and feel like we got a steal considering the location and level of luxury.

Everyone that I encountered at this Marriott was kind, smiling, accomodating and professional. We stayed 3 1/2 days for an Central Park Running Event held by Achilles in late June. We arrived late, but ate at the bar...they had premium beer and tequila and a very good bar menu...the Reuben sliders were delish! Our room was of a good size with a mini fridge. I don't remember needing to fix one thing! Normally I fix the faucets and bulbs...but this room was ship/shape and CLEAN!!! Normally I find hairs...eagle eye that I am...King bed was comfy too! The health club was small. No room service. But being CLEAN with nice people goes a long way in my book!

Stayed for a Friday and Saturday night last month when the concierge lounge was closed. Expecting a free breakfast in the hotel restaurant in lieu, as the rules have been for many years, we discovered that this is one of the 15 Marriott Hotels World wide that have excluded themselves from the free weekend breakfast for elite MR members. In lieu they award you 1000 MR points (worth $7.00 U.S. Dollars) check the Marriott reward rules closely as they have changed.

The rooms are close to being worn and frumpy. I moved my room twice because of noise- first because of some people the management could not persuade to be quiet, and then once more due to an air conditioning unit that created noise that would drown out a jack hammer. I ended up on the 33rd floor, requiring transfer to another elevator from floor 32 to 33. The elevator did not work. Puzzling that an elevator, the same elevator to the fitness center and the JW Marriott Suite, would be inoperable and the hotel staff would be unaware of this. Many of the staff were pleasant and helpful, some were not.

The hotel is located in a very nice area. It's close to Times Square, Central Park and great restaurants. Very nicely maintained older building with character.The concierge lounge is excellent, Kendra Caniglia works tirelessly to help and assist both business travelers and vacationers with planning, she is very pleasant and always smiling!

I really like the location away from Times Square and close to really excellent local restaurants. The building is older, but the rooms are large and comfortable. Concierge room on 2nd floor is large and has much better than typical Marriott food for breakfast and evening. It is closed on the weekend. Staff is well trained, professional and polite on all levels. (except the bar - see below). Very close location to Grand Central Station and Subways. Taxi's are available right outside very quickly.There is a refrigerator in the room and coffee. The beds were very comfortable. The outside noise is quite loud - honks and sirens could easily be heard at all hours, so I don't know if there is a better spot for a room that might be quieter.WiFi was OK - worked but not terribly fast at all times.The bar would be my only complaint. I expect the overpriced drinks, but the one time I went in there when the place had only a hand full of people, the service was slow and the waiter just plain rude. I would not recommend the bar at all. Stay away and go to one of the better places just a minutes walk away. I'll be back to this location again - thank you.

Good location, clean hotel. Not a lot of street noise from the room (you will still hear sirens and horns but no shouting or car noise). Walking distance to theater district and tourist stuff. Close to a subway station as well. Hotel bar/restaurant is pricey (also adds a "service" charge fyi, I was told by my friend after that it is tip added in automatically) but there are plenty of good spots nearby to pop into for good food at a lower price.

The hotel is certainly in a good location - close to 5th ave, a short walk to 53rd street subway station, Grand Central Terminal, Rockefeller Plaza and Times Square to name a few locations.I had booked a single room for two nights but the nights were split apart by two weeks (start and end of a holiday) and on both occasions, each room was rather small and the noise from people coming and going from their rooms via the corridors was quite audible. Wifi was not included as part of the accommodation so I did not purchase it, therefore don't know how effective it was.Otherwise, the rooms were clean and well-maintained, showers delivered decent hot water with good pressure.Wasn't too impressed with the front desk staff though. I'd missed meeting my tour group and needed to contact the tour guide to make sure he knew that I was still on the trip, but trying to convey that to the staff on duty was like pulling teeth. Another instance involved asking the concierge about the airport shuttle to Newark. Their response was get a town-car instead for $95 flat fee. However, the cheaper option is to go to 41st and Lexington where there is an airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes (depending on the time of day it is) and is $17... and I suspect that anyone in hospitality who has to get people to an airport should have known this.

I only stayed a couple of nights but I really enjoyed this hotel. Definitely get the wonderful Marriott bed but I also got a very large room. Lots of windows, good desk space for business plus a seating area. Bathroom space was sufficient also. The lobby is gorgeous and the elevators are vintage but work well. Best part was the concierge club lounge. They served real food, not just snacks! Service in the lounge was top notch and they handled the business rush very well.

The hotel is bustling and very clean. The beds and linens were terrific. There was more space in the room than I expected from a NYC hotel. The valet parking was very convenient but of course expensive. Overall a great stay.

This is a pleasant hotel, easy to use a base for exploring New York. Rooms are fine, seemed to be a mix of old and newer furnishings. We had a room with a small frig. Did not use concierge or other hotel services. This hotel is a couple of blocks from the subway, and a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square.

Excellent location when in the city to see a show, Safe, clean, great service provided by all. Only down side is the elevators, take FOREVER to get up and down. Plan to leave your room a bit earlier than you normally would.

Hotel was neat, clean, staff friendly and accessible. Rooms are average size for NYC hotels. Hotel is located within a short walk of a subway station. Beds comfortable, AC worked great, refrigerator, safe for valuables, adequate bathroom linens and supplies. A party of 7 checked in at 2:00 a.m. with staff available to assist us. Stayed on the 21st floor with a view of the city, noise was typical of NYC. Would definitely stay again.

I stayed at this hotel from Oct. 2013 - July 2014. I was treated like royalty...same with my wife each time she arrived. The entire staff is beyond wonderful & accommodating from the GM to the Director of Reservations (Mrs. Harriet Goldberg- who by the way is beyond amazing) up to & including front desk management & ALL support staff to the restaurant staff, concierge staff & the Housekeeping Staff and of course all the incredible Hotel Doormen... Jimmy & his other colleagues are the greatest!! They greet you as family & make you feels as though you are visiting royalty!! We keep referring this place to family & friend!! Everyone we've referred it to has had the same great experience!! Live this Hotel... Can't wait to go back!!

Although a few blocks east of Times Square, it is an Excellent location. A few blocks south to Grande Central, over a few blocks to Herald Square, 3 blocks from Rockefeller and St. Patricks, and a lovely walk up 5th avenue museum mile and shopping to Central Park. In short--Great Location.Service was top-notch, as you would expect from Marriott. Front desk, manager, bellhops, concierge were all wonderfully helpful to me and my group. Thanks to all of the staff. I look forward to returning again with my group.
