kitchen: I did not have a breakfast and did not use the hotel restaurantFront desk staff: People at the reception were professionalRooms: from 5 star hotel, however, I expect nicer amenities when comparing Marriott in Prague, this hotel is about 1.5 hviezdicky lower levelthe ratio of price and quality are three points out of five

Booked really reasonable 1 night weekend rate on Marriott.com. I sent email to hotel informing them it was my wife’s birthday, got a response from manager right away that he would take care of us. Asked for an early 1:30pm sat check in, at 10:45am that morning I received another email that my room was ready (5 hours before regular 4pm check in). On arrival the receptionist hugged my wife and wished her a happy birthday. I believe the room I got was 3 or 4 upgrades better than the one I had booked. I had huge 1 room suite with sofa and a view. We spent the rest of afternoon out and returned at 7pm. At 7:05pm a knock on the door and a waiter arrives with complementary bottle of champagne on ice and fresh fruit as well as a birthday card. I can’t figure out how they knew when we would return, I’m also surprised that they went to all this trouble as the hotel was very busy that weekend. There’s a reason I try to book Marriott whenever I can, first I really enjoy Marriott Gold and second, it’s things like my wife’s birthday that they do so well that makes me return.

The hotel, while not one of my favorite Marriott properties, is in a great location close to a variety of things in NYC. The staff was pleasant, but was in need of a step up in housekeeping. The concierge level floor was dirty, and the halls needed vacuuming. The elevators are old and loud.

Good location if you need to be midtown and flying from JFK as no hideous cross town journey. Impressive building from outside, nice lobby. Problem with my reservation but duty manager dealt with it on arrival but only after two calls to customer care who did nothing - I had to physically prove what I was saying was true showing a written confirmation of my reservation. Poor. Upgrade due Platinum Elite Status - corner room with seating area - Nice size but the whole room and floor(s) needs a facelift. Browns and reds, old fashioned shower and concrete bubbly ceiling - quite 70's - Not very contemporary at all - a bit Laura Ashley. M lounge adequate for bfast and drinks (soft) during day...don't expect a European/Asian hotel lounge experience as you will be sadly disappointed. Overall totally adequate for my two night stop on business - if travelling on leisure would not be for me. The Lexington next door also part of Marriott (Autograph Collection) much better.

First time at that Marriott in a while. Although old building, nicely renovated public areas and rooms. Room modern good black out shades. Quiet. Great AC unit. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Lady at front desk actually scanned a letter and emailed it to me. 2 glitches: executive lounge not open for breakfast Saturday or Sunday. Need 7 days. An excellent breakfast buffet but expensive. Lounge nice when open. Took 2 phone calls to get a couple of toiletries delivered to room. The location makes up for minor problems.

We stayed here in Dec 2014 for a work event, and I just loved the place. Funky art deco styling in the lobby, but it was still modern looking and the place ran like a top. Great service at front desk and in the bar. Super convenient location at 49th and Lex, great for walking around midtown. The room was a little dated but still was quite spacious for NYC.

This was our third time to stay in Marriott East Side. The hotel is in an excellent location for visiting Manhatten. It is within walking distance of Fifth Ave, Times Square, Central Park and many more attractions. If you do not feel like walking it is very close to subway stations and Grand Central Station. The staff are courteous if a little distant.On our previous two visits we were given the same room to the front of the building. This time we were in a corner room, which was more spacious but street noise was much louder. There appeared to be deliveries in the early morning on the street below. We were on the fourth floor , not very high, so that may have something to do with the noise also. This time around we booked through booking.com and I wonder if they offer rooms which are not as good as those available on the hotel,s own website. The room was very clean and comfortable.Wifi is not free which is somewhat inconvenient as you would need to be staying around the hotel all day to get value for the rates they charge, and who would sit around all day when NYC beckons!I can definitely recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay here if I am lucky enough to return to New York but it might be worth checking where your room is located in advance of your visit.

Don't expect much. This is a really impersonal hotel. Once in the room, you could picture yourself in any other place. Small and outdated rooms.Service and staff are just OK.Location is fine but, once in Manhattan, it doesn't really matter most. I would pick some other place to stay.
user_name:
Leo D
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: We stayed at the Marriott East Side 6/11/15 to 6/16/15; my husband and I were in town (our first trip to NYC) to celebrate my 40th birthday. We found that the hotel was very easy to get to via subway from JFK; the M, E and 6 trains are nearby. The trip from JFK to the hotel takes about an hour. We checked in a little early and the front desk staff was very pleasant and checked us in very quickly. We were given room 633.The room was very nice, although it had been well-loved and was due for some updates. The king bed was very, very comfortable and the room was clean. The shower head is quite low; I'm 5'10" and had to stoop a little to rinse the shampoo out of my hair. However, the water pressure and temperature were fantastic after a long day in the heat. The A/C worked very well and we were thankful to be in that cool air when we returned to the room at night. Our window faced other Marriott 6th floor rooms across the alleyway, so all we saw was brick -- no remarkable view -- and it stayed pretty dark in our room most of the day. But the silver lining here was that we experienced no street noise at all.We were happy to find a fridge, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer and iron provided in the room. We didn't utilize the wi-fi due to the high cost. We spent very little time in our room, as we had a long list of things to see and do, and limited time in the city.We didn't visit the dining room at all, so I can't comment on that. The gift shop sells 20oz bottled soft drinks for $4 (!), so stop at the Duane Reed to stock up for less (there are DRs near the hotel, located to the left AND right on Lexington as you exit the hotel lobby).The concierge was more than happy to help us with restaurant recommendations, and was very pleasant as well. The cleaning staff we met in the hallway were so very nice -- we looked forward to speaking to them each morning!The hotel is located practically across the street from the Waldorf-Astoria, and is walking distance to Grand Central and the Chrysler Building. Whatever you're unable to walk to, the subway will surely get you there -- we took no cabs during or trip and found that everything is accessible by subway. Get the $30 unlimited subway ticket and you're all set!For a quick bite nearby, try Schnipper's -- their burgers are really good, and the location is convenient to the hotel.We would stay here again should we ever make it back to NYC -- we had a great time!

If you are visiting Manhattan for the first time this is a great choice. Located in Midtown, you are at walking distance of most of the "must see" icons, and less than 100 yards of multiple subway alternatives that take you wherever you need. Even to the airport. Grand Central is also at walking distance.You are close to theaters, shopping areas and of course Central Park.The building enjoys a great architecture and very nice deco.The restaurant and the bar are very comfy too.
user_name:
Denis K
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a layover in NY and stayed for one night. After a long day of traveling the bed was comfortable, room was clean, and we had small but nice views from the room. Had no problems with check-in or check-out. Also, the hotel held our bags for us after check-out time free of charge while we explored NY before the flight.

We went into NYC to see a show at Radio City this past Friday night. I wanted a place in between Radio City and Grand Central Station. I compared many hotels in the vicinity and found the Marriott had the best rate; 1/2 price from the Hyatt next door! The room was clean and big enough for an overnight. The room was very dark, perfect for sleeping. We were not street side so it was also very quiet. I would recommend it to anyone.

Staff at front desk and bell captain was great. I was very surprised at the old fashioned style of the room; gold wallpaper, old and worn carpet, small bathroom and old style furniture. The photos looked amazing so my expectations were high but this property dearly needs some upgrading. I had to move to another hotel when my business plans changed because the 2nd night was going to have a rate of $659. YES, that is crazy. So I packed up and moved next door and saved $200/night.The concierge lounge was big and open all day. Coffee machine is great, lots of water, soda, yogurt available all day and evening.Breakfast was crowded and I needed to remind staff to refill coffee machine, eggs and fruit bowls. Staff was argumentative and rude when I asked for refills and told me to go sit down and wait. Lovely! And one man put his hands all over the tines of the forks when he filled the silverware areas and refused to be interrupted to refill the coffee machine. I did report this to the concierge supervisor who came around to check with the guests.

The day we arrived, streets were closed around the hotel for an outside market and this made it hard to get to. I called the hotel twice asking them how we get to the hotel because all the streets were closed....they were clueless. Finally, their bellhop captain jumped out and told us to cross the street and pull over. He then helped us with our bags and took my car to park. He was the only person who seemed to know anything in the hotel. We go to check in and i asked if i could get free access to the M Club Lounge - how convenient - they are closed on Saturdays. We then get to our room and room had a very strong deoderizer smell. I called and asked to be moved. The girl said they were sold out and could not give us another room. Ten minutes later the manager called our room and apologized and said she does have another room for us and for our inconvenience, she gave me 5K points. We then walked into that room - same strong deoderizer smell. I just said forget it - we will stay and put up with the smell. Room was very large (very hard to find large rooms in NYC). but the room was very outdated. This hotel is a walk to everything. Parking is expensive compared to other Marriott properties in NYC - $65 compared to $45. Breakfast is not complimentary.

My wife and I stayed just one night but the entire staff was courteous and helpful. We were able to go out to brunch and the Bellhop Stand personnel were kind enough to hold our luggage after we checked out. There was a large lounge in the lobby with a huge bar. The room was clean and had a mixture of modern (soft bed, HDTV) and classic (cornices, door handles) features. Check in and check out was fast and efficient.
user_name:
Mark B
New Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel before embarking on a Trafalgar tour of the US and Canada. We added the first night for convenience and the second night was included in our tour. Our room looked out on the face of another building. We were too high to look down on the street. It was barely big enough to open our suitcases. The cost for a hot breakfast was over the top at $34US. Suggest taking a short walk to the Times Square Diner in 8th Avenue for a far better breakfast at one third of the cost. Breakfast was included on the morning of our tour and it was dismal. On our return we booked into the nearby Sanctuary Hotel, far superior to the Marriott and cheaper too, with an included breakfast.

Have stayed multiple times here and always enjoyed it being a bit out of the way and close to midtown.Concierge lounge has good selection of breakfast and hors d'oeuvres, not like the cost cutting at hilton hotels. Try to get a room away from Lexington as street noise is very high even to 20th floor.

We stayed at the Marriott for one night during a private trip to NY. Overall the experience was alright but it had some downers which are worth mentioning, especially the last one. The hotel is a chain, a big one, so expect a big hotel ! From my side thats all i wanted for this trip even though i strongly dislike big hotels. But, we only needed a room for a couple hours since we were out at a bday party and flew back very early the next day. I didnt try the wifi, so no comment on that. The price is high, but we got a deal on orbitz so it was bearable. However, it is New York so i dont think they are more expensive than other places - the opposite is probably true. the good: - the location is very good, and taxis are always available - check in was easy and fast - the bed is comfy, good mattress and clean - overall clean room and bathroom - check out was fast as well, actually we zipped through in 10 seconds (room was prepaid) the bad: - the luggage took very long to get to our room, the guy said he had gone to the wrong floor and had to go back down again (so apparently he didnt listen when i told him my room number) - mini bar was empty (which i think is a new policy but very annoying when you just want a bottle of water) - the shower head was extremely low, so i was standing like a question mark in the shower (my height is 6-2) - when you book through a third party you dont collect points... i booked on orbitz (even though the concierge told me i booked on priceline which wasnt true), so no points for me. BEWARE: When we checked out and took the cab back to LGA the driver tried to rip us off majorly. I am not sure if he had a deal with the concierge though, which got me "slightly upset". They loaded my luggage into the trunk but took quite long. When i turned around to see where the driver was i saw him handing some dollar bills to the concierge saying: i will be back then. The driver got into the car and i told him we needed to go to LGA. He started driving and said: this is a flat fee of 49 usd plus toll. I told him this was nonesense and so he literally said to me: ok, but then give me 39. I again told him this was out of the question and asked him to turn on the meter which he did. He then drove an extra round on the highway so we ended up with 42 dollars incl tip and toll. So, be aware, i dont know who is helping whom there or if the driver just thinks he can rip off tourists. But know that in the big hotels people think they can just take advantage. In my opinion Marriott should take better care of this, but maybe i just had a bad experience. overall, the hotel is alright for a decent price.

I was here for business for 1 night and needed a place near my meeting spot to stay. The rooms are a fair size especially for New York City and quiet. The lobby bar is a great evening spot. They also have the M club lounge which provides free breakfast, drinks, wifi, concierge access and working areas. After I checked-in I inquired about this at the front desk and was given free access. Completely unexpected but great appreciated.

Let me just preface this by saying New York is my home away from home. With that said, I am a hotel snob. I will be the first to raise my hand at this admission, because it is true. I expect clean rooms, good service, no theft of my items, no attitude, decent food and courteousness. I do not expect for anyone to treat me like some Goddess, but I do expect the things I just mentioned to be taken care of. We are Marriott Gold, for anyone interested. (Proof that when we travel we often stay at Marriotts.) They are not all created equal, but this Marriott definitely is how a Marriott should look and feel. Now, let's get into the trip: First of all, my friend and I had an early flight. Thus, we knew we were subject to not being able to check in at the time after our arrival to the hotel. Lo and behold, these people made it happen and not only did they let us check in 4 hours early, they gave me the room I requested. (I will get more into that later.)So, my friend and I were thrilled that we could rest for a bit, take a shower and get a snack before going out and hitting the town. This hotel is located in Manhattan (midtown) so you are literally next to hundreds of things to do - shopping (Times Square), restaurants, the subway, etc. You are a short cab ride away from many other main attractions as well. We got inside the room and were pleased that the room was very clean, neat and looked good for a non- super modern hotel. I knew 'going in' due to research, that this hotel was not '2015 contemporary', however, it is still quite attractive and fairly well maintained. I did not expect for my surroundings to be quiet all day and night. We were in Midtown for Pete's sake - that is a bustling area. That is like being in the middle of the ocean and then being shocked when you get wet. It is what it is. It did not bother me, and we were there for two weekdays and and an entire weekend. The nosiest times were of course at night, but it only lasted a few hours. To help alleviate this if this is an issue for you, ask for a high floor room. I was on the 20th floor in a corner room - and it helped muffle it a bit and I found the room comfortable and peaceful.When I go to NY, I never want to leave. It seems this hotel was sympathetic to my plight, because they allowed us to do a late check out as well, with no issues. Now, let's move on to other details:The concierge lounge was really good. The only thing that would have made it great is if they had non-pork meat options as well. The staff was DYNAMITE. One young lady (a manager I believe) by the name of Kenda, was absolutely wonderful! She kept asking if we had everything we needed then went as far as to slice lemons for us and place them in cups for our tea and water we were wolfing down on a daily basis in our room! I was floored. We had the exact amount needed to last us that entire weekend. Now that is what I call service. I simply asked her if she had a lemon wedge or two, but instead, she went the extra five miles. The front desk staff was also very nice, and the doormen were funny and engaging. I go to New York often, and I will definitely be staying here again. It is close to my friends' apartments in town and it is close to the places I need to go and so centrally located, more times than not, people knew where I was talking about without me having to give directions.If this hotel had room service, I'd jump through the roof, but other that, everything was truly superb. Well done, East Side. Expect to see me again soon!

This hotel was perfectly situated for the business meetings I had scheduled and the room prices were much more reasonable than others in the area.Check-in was very quick and I never suffered from the "slow elevators" that other reviewers mentioned. My room was 1423 and it was great - away from the elevator bank and other common areas on the floor and it was tucked away on the interior of the building so there was no street noise! (no view, but that doesn't bother me).Room was nicely sized and had all of the normal amenities.I'd definitely stay there again.

The Mariott East Side was wonderful! Their customer service was absolutely outstanding. Whenever something was needed they attended to us right away. The operations manager Nicole Jackson was so helpful to us and she was always making sure we were comfortable. She also gave us great suggestions on where to go out near the hotel.The chef is incredible as well. The platters he made for our party were the perfect touch (and tasted fresh and delicious). We would DEFINITELY stay here again and we highly recommend it!!

Let me start off by saying, great experience! The hotel was very accommodating and everyone there was nice. The views of the East Side are great! My father and I arrived around midnight, and were happily greeted. The bellman was very kind, and had many good suggestions. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves NYC just like me!

First trip to NYC for thisworld traveler. Found the Big Apple to be more chaotic than I ever expected. Aside from that the city really has a magical undercurrent. This Marriott property while expensive for the accommodation was centrally located to Fifth Ave, Times Square, a quick subway ride to lower Manhattan and just about all the attractions. Staff including the concierge were very friendly and willing to help us easily navigate the busy streets to find the quickest way to many sites we wanted to see in two short days. The rooms were very tight, but clean with comfortable beds, ample towels and succinct access to wifi, etc. I dont recommend their rollaway bed at all. Thin mattress was so horribly uncomfortable and lumpy metal coils that you'd be better off sleeping on the floor. Other than that a great choice if you can afford the expense of midtown east manhattan.

My trip was both for business and pleasure. The location was very good, the atmosphere is what you expect on a Marriott property; however the hotel looks like needs more love. The only very - very bad factor is the fact that there is no free wi-fi on the guest rooms. This is a must for all hotels and all small business hotels offer it.

Generally clean, well-appointed and welcoming, the Marriott East Side proved to be a good find among the hotel-congested midtown Lexington corridor. This rating would surely be lower if not for the manager's responsiveness to a few quality-control and basic guest-services issues experienced during my 2-week stay, something greatly appreciated in such a large hotel. The elevators are abysmally slow and seem ancient, so be prepared for frustration if you're in a rush. But the fitness center is more than adequate (and has great midtown views), the bar & restaurant downstairs are of good quality, and the rooms are neat, updated and fairly sound-cushioned. I'd stay here again.

This hotel is so warm and cozy. I was here for a total of three weeks, and I was very impressed. The service was fantastic, and the concierge lounge was one of the best I've seen. The front desk staff was very accommodating, and this may be a small point, but thus is the only hotel I've ever seen that allows you to sign in to your Netflix account on the TV so you can watch what you want. I hope I get back here soon.

The hotel is within walking distance to the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Koreatown, Waldorf Astoria (nice to visit for a piece of elegant history), Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Terminal, Madison Square Garden, and an array of exciting eateries ranging from Zagat-rated restaurants to hole-in-the-wall types. We all felt very safe walking back to the hotel even late at night as there were other pedestrians coming from late-night Broadway shows. The rooms are clean and the bathroom is huge. The hallways are tight, though. There were four of us and even though the room was tiny with two queen beds, we were able to fit our four carry-ons in every corner of the room. (Yes, traveling light helps!) Besides, we only stayed in the hotel room to sleep as we were busy sightseeing all day. The front desk is professional and helpful. For trips to downtown or Upper East, it's easy to use the Metro (from the Grand Central Station) or just hail a cab. We did both for trips to the Museum of Natural History and then to downtown to see Wall Street, the 9/11 Memorial, and to Battery Park for the ferry ride to Lady Liberty and Ellis Island. I would definitely stay at the Marriott on Lexington again and again!

The bellmen were absolutely accommodating as well as their concierge service. When we arrived at the hotel yesterday the bellmen to our bags out of the limo brought them to our room without us even asking. When they brought them up to the room I tried to hold the door open to help them & the man said with a big smile, "sit down, relax, have a drink & enjoy NYC! I got the bags & the door you girls all just relax and have a great weekend!" At one o'clock in the morning the mother of the bride called the concierge service about getting food. They delivered food menus up to our bachelorette within seconds of her calling - she was amazed at the service as were we all. This morning I was sick and we went to the bar to grab a drink of ginger ale, the bartender gave it to me in a coffee cup with a lid to take with me on the limo & would not accept a tip from us, simply stating that he was so grateful we had such a fun time and all that he wanted in return was for us to come visit again! Well, I am happy to say that they will DEFINITELY be seeing us again in the near future! If we didn't all have to be in work tomorrow we would've asked to extend our stay. My family & I prefer to stay at Marriott's because of the service we receive there, and I have to say that this was by far one of the nicest hotels and the most accommodating staff I have ever stayed with!
user_name:
Katie M
Atlantic City, New Jersey

review_body: the location of the hotel was perfect for everything we wanted to do. Room was very comfortable-with 4 of us! We went to the bar and got great service and advice on what to do and see! Checked in on line so not much contact with desk employees, however the bell desk staff were always very helpful.

The location of this hotel is convenient to where I need to be in NYC.The lobby is nice,and staff are fairly friendly. Although they can be a bit distracted by other things at times, and completely ignore guests.The rooms are old. They need revamped desperately. I have had to complain on several occasions about smokers in the room adjacent to mine. Not cool. the rooms are noisy, especially if you are anywhere near an elevator. One time they "gave me an upgrade" which really wasn't- it was just a room with two queen beds, but that's about the extent of being treated as a Platinum Rewards member as you get here.The Lounge is decent. Large. Food is not bad. Seen better, seen worse. The staff in The Lounge are about average. The elevators are HORRIBLY slow. You will wait forever, and it will stop at every floor on the way down because everyone else has been waiting forever too. They are also old, and a bit scary at times.The gym is ok. But it's on the 35th floor, which requires multiple elevator switches, and you would be better off walking up. Even if your room is on the 3rd floor.I wish they would upgrade this hotel. I don't care who lived herein the 50s- it's now 2015 and it's time to update the joint.

It is conveniently located and the staff is friendly ( they let us do an early check in one of the rooms). Although breakfast is not included in the rate, the hotel has a lounge with exclusive access for guests. It is open from 6 am until 10 pm , but is closed on Saturdays and repones on Sundays at 6 pm. They gave us a comfortable room with a king bed, but it had a small window and even during the day the room was dark. It is a comfortable and easily accessible hotel , but do not expect any luxury from this Marriott hotel.

We enjoyed our first stay at this hotel we chose it again. The location is very convenient to shopping, restaurants and public transportation. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is very nice and helpful.

We rented a junior suite over Mother's Day weekend and it was perfect. The location of the hotel is fantastic and the rooms were clean and quiet. The staff could not have been nicer and they were extremely helpful. Loved this place, planning to go back soon.

The elevators are a bit slow, the windows are small, the whole place is a bit old, but it is a great location, great staff and we enjoyed our stay here and found it was an affordable alternative to other hotels in Midtown.

I'm a repeat guests of this hotel because of the Lounge for gold/platinum Marriott Rewards members. I travel every week and this is the best one I've found so far. The dinner foods are exceptional and abundant. It's far more than the simple appetizers you so often find at other Marriott's. I'm going to keep staying at this property as long as the Lounge is so highly regarded. The location of the hotel is also very good. It's within walking distance to most midtown attractions and Grand Central Station. There are subway stops within blocks of the front door. The staff that I interacted with was friendly and helpful. I thought the hotel, and my room, were very clean. The rooms are a little quirky (and usually very small) because of the older nature of the building, but nothing too bad....small rooms are to be expected in New York.

The hotel started off on a great note with letting us check in early. The gentleman that helped us was super-friendly, smiling and seemed like he was having fun (Can't remember the name, but his name tag said Operations Manager). Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Public areas were clean, as well. Staff here is superb. Everyone says hello with a genuine smile on their face. This includes the housekeeping to the night time security guys.

Stayed 5/21-5/24 Had 2 rooms,requested connecting and early check-in,both were granted.People at check in and check out were friendly,courteous and helpful.Found the rooms spacious and clean.Even had a corner view of both Lexington Ave and W.49 St.I chose this location due to the proximity to Grand Central,Times Square and Rockefeller Center.Easy walking distance to all 3. Didnt dine at the hotel though ($34 for breakfast buffet steep even for NYC).Not to worry, tons of excellent restaurants within easy walking distance.Definitely recommend the New York Luncheonette on the next block (W.50 St) and the Cafe Metro on W.51 St, and Lex. If you are planning to go to the 9-11 Museum,you should definitely book in advance,kind of a mob scene there,but definitely worth seeing.$24 per adult,some discounts for seniors and students take about 2-3 hours.If you are planning to go to the Statue Of Liberty,that can take the better part of a day.I skipped it but was told 2 hour wait to get on the boat,then 3 hour wait when you get to the island to go up.If you are flying into JFK,best way into Manhatten is take the sky train $5 per person,connect with the E subway,will take you right to East 51 St station 2 blocks from hotel.Definitely recommend buying the unlimited Metro card,for the subways and buses($31 per person). Im told taxi from JFK can run $60 each way for 2 people.Have to say also the rooms are well soundproofed so you barely hear the horns or sirons.Overall I would definitely stay there again and recommend.to others.Only 2 blocks from W.51 St station to get the 6 train which covers most of the East Side all the way down to Battery Park.Took my first trip to Coney Island in Brooklyn,about a 45 min trip on the D train.That was really cool and interesting to see.

When traveling to NYC we generally prefer west side but chose the Marriott East Side primarily for a reasonably priced junior suite that would accommodate the entire family in one room. What a joy. Perfect location for some sightseeing and shopping and absolutely superior guest services met our every need.But the big plus was the new M Club concierge lounge. As an Elite member I am used to a respectable breakfast and acceptable evening hors d'ourves and honor bar at the concierge lounge. But this property outdid itself with a generous buffet both meals and a delightful, spacious and comfortable lounge. Smiling faces as attentive service throughout I may have a new favorite New York hotel
user_name:
jamesml2014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We recently stayed in this hotel for four nights, the rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable.. The staff were very helpful and friendly. It's located close to Grand Central Station, and some great restaurants close by.. Although the noise at night was a bit of a factor..

I recently stayed one night here for a family women's day out in the city. I parked my car with the hotel's valet service, which was incredibly convenient and very professional. Lexington Avenue traffic was CRAZY, but the valet captain was out in the street and waved me right to the curb. We came back to the room after a long day out in the city and were greeted by friendly staff in the lobby and incredibly comfortable beds in our room. Great experience, and well worth the money.
user_name:
Nancy L
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently stayed overnight at this hotel with two friends for a girls' weekend in the city. Located blocks away from Rockefeller Center, so easy to get around. Even though we arrived at noon and check-in is at 4pm, they had a room ready for us right away, which was very convenient. The room was a double, fairly small, but very clean and smelled fresh. The bathroom was large and we had plenty of towels. The air conditioner was noisy, but worked well. We did not have a view, but that was fine because we were out all day. The building is older, so the elevators are very small and slow, but the lobby is bright and clean and the check-in process went smoothly. We got back to the hotel at 11:30pm and decided to have a drink at the bar, which is located right off the lobby. It is an open area with couches, tables and chairs. We ordered 3 drinks, nothing out of the ordinary - a cosmo and two martinis and we asked for shots of "mini Guiness" and described to our waiter how it should be made: kahlua on the bottom with a float of Baileys on top. Well,the bartender mixed the Kahlua and Baileys together in a tumbler and called that a shot. Disappointing. Also, the three drinks and shots cost us $104 (which included an automatic gratuity for the waiter). Note to self: BYOB for the room next time. So when we got back to the room at midnight, my friend went to the bathroom and nearly slipped because it was flooded and water was dripping from the light fixture. We called maintenance and they came pretty quickly. They went up to the room above us to see if the toilet had overflowed, but could not find the problem. Housekeeping came and cleaned up the water and when they pulled out the light fixture, water came pouring out, which could have been quite dangerous. They said they would investigate it after we checked out the next day. At checkout on Sunday, I told the desk what happened and the manager gave us money off our total, which was much appreciated. They were very apologetic for the inconvenience and made good on it. Overall, would stay here again.
user_name:
PattyLongIsland
New York City, New York

review_body: I love the location of this hotel! Walking distance to the Rockefeller, 5th Ave, Grand Central Station, and a couple of good restaurants. Also if you're up for a nice long walk, you can walk to Time Square in about 30 minutes. NYC is definitely a walking city, so bring comfy shoes! The hotel service is really great and helpful. I bothered the front desk so many times for directions and suggestions. They were good about providing popular attractions as well as local eateries. It is a bit pricey, but I think its worth it for the location.

We found the Marriott Eastside to be an affordable option for weekends in the city. It is walking distance to the theatre district, Rock Center, Radio City and Fifth Ave shopping.They sometimes have special weekend rates, and always the kind of quality you would expect from a Marriott. Comfortable beds, in-room coffee, a bar and restaurant, as well as concierge and bell services. The only down side of this hotel is the small elevators, but one can tolerate that for a short ride up or down. Pleasant staff make this our go-to hotel in the city!

I booked q room in this hotel through Booking.com. I needed a place near the Hospital for Special Surgery the night before my surgery. This hotel was about twenty blocks away and the cheapest place on the Upper East Side.. The staff is friendly and the rooms very nicely appointed. It has a lot of amenities such as an indoor pool, sauna, restaurant, gym. Unfortunately, we arrived too late to take advantage of these. We took advantage of the lovely neighborhood with plenty of places to eat right on 2nd Avenue. I will definitely place this on my list of places to stay in New York City. I would not suggest it for anyone who wants to be in the midst of NYC attractions, though. One would need to walk to the subway but cabs are plentiful in this area.
user_name:
Marie R
Ballston Spa, New York

review_body: Booked a Saturday night at the New York Marriott East Side because we were going to the live taping of Saturday Night Live. For the location and quality of hotel, this Marriott could not be beaten. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby; Rockefeller Center and Central Park are easily within walking distance (we did the walk to both locations).We pulled our car up to the very cordial valet. He loaded our luggage onto his cart, gave us our valet claim ticket, and escorted my wife and I to the hotel desk.Ms. Jackson greeted us at the hotel desk. After a long day in the car, Ms. Jackson is the type of person that you want to assist you....very friendly, outgoing, and efficient! Since the car valet was for a 24 hour period we asked if we could have a later checkout time...easily granted.The room (Room #321) was clean and comfortable. Not much of a view as we could only see part of a small rooftop and front facade...but we weren't there to look out the window. Best room darkening shades ever! With the shades pulled down you would not know if it was noon or midnight. Never noticed any hallway or street noise.The staff at the New York Marriott East Side are top notch! Would definitely stay here again!

You can do a whole lot better than this "Renaissance." Dreary hotel with missing furniture in the room (no table or even side tables next to the couch, necessitating you to put food on the floor). TV at a bad angle. Unattractive registration desk. Really, nothing positive to recommend about this hotel. And I know a good Marriott when I see one, since I have more than 100 nights this year at Marriotts and over 700 lifetime.

I stayed here for a business trip, the rooms are small and the lift system is old and slow. The hotel is well located on Lexington Avenue at 50th Street, the facilities are very dated. The gym is on the 35th floor, and from my room I needed to go up three painfully slow elevators to get there. The room prices at $410+ per night seemed high. The breakfast was an uninspiring buffet. The hotel is a little cheeky by adding 15% service charge to the bill and then leaving a space for 'gratuity'. At $42.15 (without gratuity) for basic breakfast buffet, was not good value. There are much better places to stay in New York for the money, I would give this hotel a miss, that would be my advice.

We stayed here for 4 nights in April & I would say a fairly typical Marriott hotel, good service, quick check-in & friendly staff. We requested a high, corner quiet room & thats what we got and was impressed with the size of the bedroom in a city where space is at a premium. Free coffee maker but only paper cups & no slippers!!! Wifi was free for us as we were marriott platinum members & worked well but is usually to pay for - why in this day & age? We walked to most places, times square about 20 minutes, rockefeller 15mins, central park 20 mins. There is a subway station close by but we had trouble following the sub way system (its not as easy as London). Be aware the blocks going north to south are smaller than the blocks going east to west, bear that in mind when walking.

I stayed at the Marriott East Side for 5 nights in May 2015.For good and for bad, the Marriott East Side gives a fairly typical Marriott experience - good service, systems that work quickly and efficiently, an eye-watering price tag and a big, solid fitout that is about 15 years out of date.Location is the main selling point and I would choose this hotel again on that basis - A short walk to Times Square and Central Park, and just far enough away from the tourist madness. My room was facing the rear of the property and was very quiet compared to other Manhattan hotels I've stayed in - it's worth requesting.The room itself was very large and quite comfortable. The free in-room coffee was welcome, the ancient bathroom less so. Service levels were high, at least by New York standards. I've been quite surprised by the very brusque manner I've encountered at other hotels (such as the Westin) previously in Manhattan. The Marriott is far better in this regards and it was welcome.Wifi was quick, but at $16.95 a night you would expect it to be! Marriott, please - it's time to move on and drop this ridiculous extra charge.Don't bother with breakfast at $35, either, as it is very poor value for money for what was a disappointing buffet. There are plenty of better options at half the price within an easy walk of the hotel.The final issue I had was with the elevators. To get to the (very basic) gym from the 8th floor meant taking the ancient, groaning elevator to the 16th, changing to go to the 32nd and then changing again to get to the 35th. Each wait could be up to 5 minutes each way....really, 15 minutes to get to the internal gym is out of this world! Time to upgrade, I think. Great view when you finally get up there, to be fair.So! Not a bad choice in an expensive city. Assuming I could get a reasonable price, I would stay here again.

Great location, lovely, clean room, beautiful lobby, and the gentleman who checked me in was super nice, which is a rarity in NYC. I will definitely stay there again next time. There are some great places to eat nearby, Ess-a-bagel around the corner is great for breakfast.

Girlfriend weekend for just 2 nights in Nov 2014. This location was tops, staff they way it should be in ALL hotels. Doorman always there and pleasant, check in was terrif. Asked for high floor, got it, asked for corner room, got it. Easy walk to Times Square if you are a walker, bit of a hike to Central Park but we did it. Never rode the subway, walked or took a cab. However a subway station is a few steps away. Used the YMCA around the corner and was given a comp day which we took advantage of and took a yoga class, used steam room. Employees there must have had the same Management as the Marriott, tops. Our room was spacious for NY standards as it was a corner, 2 beds and good size bathroom and view. Hotel was clean, comfortable, good elevators and professional-happy staff. Found a great place to dine again not far of a walk, Le Pain Quotidien, it is a chain in NY and you would not know it, organic, veggie, unique upscale menu but not over priced. Our go to bar after our 1st stop to celebrate, was Connolly's Pub on 14th & 47th close by. Good food and great service by Shane & Shamus, they will make you glad you stopped in! East side is close enough to walk to Times Square and far enough away from the enormous crowds that converge there. Oh check out Johns' Pizza in Times Square, another not to miss eatery housed in an old church and the pizza rocks.

We stayed at the hotel for the 5Boro Bike ride and it was a great location for our home base for the 3 days. The staff was very friendly and was very responsive to our needs.When we arrived we were surprised, the GM had sent us a nice thank you note along with a bottle of wine. Nice unexpected treat. Prior to go to the hotel I had read some previous reviews and many noted to stay on upper floors. I had request just that and the hotel delivered. I would 100% stay here again. Thanks for making our stay GREAT!

I went on a girly New York break for 3 nights with my best friend and it was her first visit. As soon as we arrived at the Marriott we were welcomed by the happy smiley door men and then received a warm welcome from the receptionist. We didn't have any tours booked and the receptionist advised us to speak to the concierge people who would be able to help. We managed to get all our tours booked by a friendly lady who gave us the best advice, details etc on where to go and what to see. The bedroom was lovely, clean and spacious and so quiet we had the best nights sleep. We never ate at the hotel we were always up at the crack of dawn and back late at night.The location is fab if you don't want to be in the busy area of Times Square, it's so close to everything 20min walk to Times Square, top of the Rock is even closer. Empire State Building is about a 40 min Walk and also Central Park. The subway is really easy to use we went on it to visit the ground zero memorial and see Statue of Liberty.There's plenty of lovely restaurants and cafes near by there's just endless choice.Overall we had a busy yet a great stay and would defiantly recommend and will be back one day soon.

This hotel is comfortable, clean and has good service, but the best thing of all is the location. On Lexington Ave in Midtown, it is in easy walking distance of the theater district and Central Park. It is also very easy to get everywhere else you might want to go by public transport. Just a few blocks from the hotel you can get the subway E line to Penn Station and the 9/11 Memorial. You can also get the 6 which takes you down to the Greenwich Village area and, in the other direction, to the Upper East Side near the Met, the Guggenheim and the Neue Gallery. We also had a lovely glimpse of the East River from out window.

Smallish rooms that were quite noisy is one thing but on a business trip having to pay for Internet access in 2015 is crazy! Location of hotel is excellent. Breakfast overpriced considering place is surrounded by great cafes! Rude staff in the bar seating area. God help you if you buy a beer at the bar and sit down.

For $500 a night and $34.00 for a very basic buffet breakfast I was very disappointed. There was no bath mat, no complimentary water, no free wifi (and I am a Rewards member), and no view; I looked into another building that was being renovated. The room was small and logistics were poor; but, it's New York. On the positive side -- all the staff I encountered was very nice and the location is great. I travel all the time, around the world. So, I know the difference between a 1000/night and a 500/night or 350/night; between a good hotel and a great hotel. This one is just ok! If I was paying 350 per day my review would have been different. There are many other hotels in close proximity to choose from. I don't plan on staying there again.

I don't know if people usually review the cleaning staff, but Lolita at the Courtyard Marriott on East 92d St, Manhattan, was really special: kind, friendly--the pleasant face of the hotel. Thank you, Lolita.

We've stayed here a few times and never tire of it. Great location,staff who are always ready to help with a warming smile and always making our trips extra special. Thank you Harriet, Miriam and everyone who works at the marriott eastside :)

It's a beautiful venue, centrally located in Manhattan . Very easy walking distance to Grand Central Terminal , Rockefeller Center, Central Park etc. During our event we held meetings & had continental breakfast at the property . The food was delicious.

we had stayed at the east side marriott several years ago and did not recall why we had not been back until last week. arriving into an unappealing lobby with scant seating and looking like grand central at rush hour we joined the check in line. informed of an upgrade from a classic to a superior room we took the slow elevator to our room. upon opening the door we were shocked-crazy small layout/chipped furniture/not updated in perhaps 50 years/dark/dirty windows. we were out so quickly i did not have time to take pictures, having stayed over 2,500 nights at various marriott family hotels i have never experienced a "superior" room like this. after being told by the front desk that this was the best they had we were out the front door walking a few steps to the delightful lexington-an autograph collection hotel. beautiful lobby/lots of seating areas/lovely redone king room/pleasant staff. how anyone would stay at the east side marriott when the lexington is around the corner is mindboggling.

- Small nice room, taking care of details. Good quality sleep- Many floors but fast elevator, typical from NYC. - Adaptable for clients needs (late checkout) - The helping desk in the hall was nice and willing to help. Obviously trying to sell their things. But don't jump into fast purchases, discover all the opportunities they offer you. Don't have any bad review in mind.

Stayed her for two weeks in April 2015 for work. I had a different room for each week and both were comfortable. The member lounge was well stocked and the downstairs bar was reasonably priced.Its only a couple blocks from Rockefeller center and a few more from times square. only downsides you as? I had to take 3 elevators to get to the gym and there is no room service (which really isn't a problem with all the restaurants near by).

Our room was perfect. We were on the 32nd floor with a view to the East river from the bathroom window. The hotel was bright ( 2 windows ), clean and comfortable. Very well situated to see all the major sights. Empire State Building and Top of the Rock within walking distance. Lots of good restaurants in the area. All staff were friendly and very helpful. House keeping staff were excellent. We also booked in advance the Marriott Marquis revolving restaurant in Time Square. Worth every dollar. Fantastic experience.

We were in for a quick business trip. This is a well appointed exceptional hotel. Perfect location. Marriott always delivers a superb hotel and this is no exception. If I had one complaint it would be with Marriott and their reservations page. It is MY reservation but many times my wife arrives before I do. You'd think with the same last name this would not be a problem, but sometimes (and it happened this time too) the hotel calls to make sure she is allowed to stay even though I listed two guests on the reservation form. Really? They should figure out how to fix this.

Hotel has a great location, that is the best that can be said of it. The rooms are outdated with old, dirty carpeting. My room was on the front of the hotel and extremely noisy even though I was on a higher floor. The bathroom was small, but had good water pressure and hot water. What really stunned me is that there is no room service in the hotel. I arrived late at night and could not get anything to eat. I make it a rule to stay at hotels with room service, so this hotel is officially off my list.There are plenty of other hotels in the area with room service, that are even less expensive.

The Marriott East Side is a gem of a hotel centrally located in Manhattan's Midtown district, just one block from Park Avenue, 2 blocks from Madison Avenue and 3 blocks from the sights and shopping of Fifth Avenue. It is across the street from the famed Waldorf Astoria. There are shops and restaurants just steps from the hotel and it is a 5 minute walk from Grand Central Station. The closest subway stop is on 51st Street & Lexington which is only 2 blocks away. Those who are familiar with Manhattan know that it is a very walkable city. Whenever we visit NYC, this is our favorite place to stay given its lush, comfortable interior, perfect location and safe, central location. We walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and Grand Central from the hotel. And if you plan to venture further than the midtown area, then a walk to the subway station will get you where you need to go. Those who prefer taxis will find them right outside the hotel. Buses also pass through Lexington Avenue. While the hotel is in a busy, central area, we did not have any problems with street noise. If you are a light sleeper, then ask for a room in a higher floor or a room towards the back of the hotel. Rooms at the Marriott East Side are comfortable but comparatively small compared to other Marriotts that you may find in other cities. This is true of New York City, however. Hotel rooms are generally smaller since space is a premium. So while the rooms may not be as spacious, you can expect the same high quality service and comfort that you will find in other Marriott hotels. I have stayed in this hotel on a business trip, on a couples trip with my husband and also on a vacation with my family of 4 and enjoyed our stay in all of these occasions. I highly recommend this hotel and it is one of our favorite places to stay in New York City.

Spent one night here to celebrate my mom's 70th birthday. Great, central location. Easily walked to Bloomingdales and dinner. Hotel was in good shape. Not super fancy, but clean and nice. All the employees were really welcoming. The front desk worker upgraded us to a larger room and sent up a bottle of Prosecco for my mom's birthday. Bar in the lobby is cozy.

My boyfriend and I stayed for one night and the stay was good not great. The location is perfect! Central Park and 5th Ave are walking distance! Sam checked me in at the front desk and he was kind to meet my requests when I asked for a high floor, check in was a breeze. My room was spacious and clean. I'd stay at this location again when I return!

Marriott is a worldwide brand one can count on---ideal location. A nice walk to Radio City Music Hall tonight and located near Central Park which is ideal for that perfect morning run! We have a room on the 16th floor with a very comfortable bed, the air conditioner works perfectly and is keeping the room very cool like we prefer. The bathroom is ultra modern with a rain shower head that is ten feet above--unfortunately only half the water jets are working. But it is still nice. One can hear room conversations in the hall--but the rooms are spacious for NYC and this is a very nice hotel! The staff is wonderful and service is first rate.

The Marriott East Side is a nice vintage NYC hotel. The hotel was built in the 1920s but has certainly had numerous renovations over the years and is charming yet still provides contemporary amenities. The rooms are small by not tiny like some NYC hotels, but this is typical of older hotels in the city.The midtown location is great right very convenient and as soon as you walk out on Lexington Ave the best of midtown restaurants are close by. The gym on the very top level provides a great 360 degree view. The Marriott M Club in this hotel's alternative to the Concierge Lounge is more Marriotts and offers a great breakfast and snacks for Marriott Elite members.My only complaint was the check-in process. There two people working the desk and about 15 people online. As Platinum Marriott guest, I've never waited more the a few minutes to check in at Marriott property, while here I waited what felt like a while and that is after I had already completed online check in.

Stayed here for the first time last week. Very quick and easy check-in. I was on the 28th floor, so the room was very quiet. The room was also very clean and everything was provided. The hotel is in easy walking distance to everything you need in NY. Also, the Concierge was very helpful. The only issue I had (and I didn't mention this to anyone) is that the A/C rattles quit a bit. Fortunately, the weather was quit cool, so I didn't have to run it much.

As a very frequent business traveler to NYC, I am constantly searching for the hotel that provides the perfect combination of midtown convenience, a decent size room, one that is well appointed and updated, and has minimal noise...which I understand is hard in the city so I cut all hotels a lot of slack for sirens. Cost needs to be less than $500 a night as well. So after staying at a dozen or so various options I tried the Marriott east side at 49th and Lexington. First the good things, it's convenient to my meetings in midtown and the bellman was a very nice gentleman. The gym was reasonable size. Now my issues....the room and hallways are worn and in need of updating. The towels are thin and appear to have been used for years. The hairdryer in the room was broken as was the ironing board. And the tv's in the gym on the treadmills didn't work. Come on guys...who is managing your attention to detail? For 450 a night before taxes, you were a disappointment. I'm being generous at 3 stars. I'd be willing to bet there are 2 star "days inn" hotels that pay more attention to detail. I would put a reasonable rate for the accommodations at about 179, anything more you pay is quite frankly questionable. I'm sure they have specials so if you get a room for that rate it is fair. My Marriott profile says I like high floors, but I was put on the third floor. I guess I need to either improve my status or stay another place next time. Maybe higher floors have been updated, but the third floor is dated. So this reviewer is still looking for that midtown gem of a hotel. Didn't find it this week.

We were visiting my daughter who attends college in NY and she wanted to get away from the dorm and stay with us. Visit was lovely. The room was very comfortable and we could not hear others in the building which I am grateful for. Great location. We'd definitely stay again! Always be sure though to check your bill before you depart. I found a charge not belonging to us and the desk staff corrected it after I brought it to their attention.

The Marriott East Side is located Lex & 49th/48th. This Marriott is a fine choice for a mid-town visit & business. It is a stone's throw from 2 other Marriott group hotels, so be sure to book into the correct one. The service was friendly and the room was spacious and thoroughly clean. The elevators are slow, as another review mentioned, but not so slow that one would walk. The concierge lounge, "M" Club/lounge, on the second floor, was among the better lounges that I've visited. Their complementary breakfast, evening buffet, and appetizers were second to none. When visiting mid-town I'll be sure to stay here again.

We stayed for four nights and we were exceptionally well satisfied. The lobby is elegant in a classic way. The room was small, as expected in the city. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and evening refreshments in the concierge lounge. For NYC tourist activities it is well located, within walking distance of Rockefeller Center and with easy access to public transit.

The room and hotel staff was very nice. The bellhop JIM was exceptionally nice. Worked there for 19 years. We loved staying in MIDTOWN....(2nd stay in this area) Liked this hotel better than the Marriott Courtyard in Midtown (3rd avenue??). ONLY complaint about this hotel was elevators were extremely slow ~ but it is an older hotel...doubt that it can be fixed. Staff was all very nice and accommodating. Rooms were cleaned quickly and early. Would recommend this place to everyone. WALKING distance to Rockefeller Center and Times Square, Park Avenue, St. Patricks Cathedral, Grand Central Station. Fabulous...ENJOY!

The room was great and ready early - a little disappointed on the charge for an extra day of parking for a few hours after we checked out - otherwise a great stay - great location - courteous staff and on site food

My Sunday night room was on the 35th floor of this Business District hotel - at such a high angle, that I couldn't even see the road from my window - just a building top and a brick wall. You don't hear the traffic from that high up, either! Check-in was fast and friendly, though I wish they provided the wifi code up front, because I NEVER remember to ask on my own, and end up having to ask the front desk later on.The room was clean, with basic "hotel furniture", but there were a few nice black & white photos of NYC sights, like the Brooklyn Bridge and the Rockefeller Center Ice Rink. The bed was comfortable with four comfortable pillows, and the thermostat was very responsive. The TV was internet-enabled, so I was able to log in to my Netflix account and enjoy myself. The bathroom had nice marble in it - nice shower, generously-sized vanity with a big mirror. I would have liked for the bathroom to have had a fan, but it wasn't a huge deal.I had a pleasant and comfortable stay, but one thing stuck out about it. The room doesn't have a hall, bend, or "vestibule" area, so when you walk in, BAM - the bed is right there - not unlike a typical bedroom in a house. This is not entirely atypical, nor is it too surprising, since space is precious in NYC - but it was a matter of perhaps six feet between the bed and the door, and it's audible if ANYONE walks through the hallway, simply through the (normal) space between the door and the floor. If you have noisy neighbors like I did, then you may just be woken up during the night.

We stayed for 1 week this hotel, in three different rooms. The rooms are ok, clean but not above average, but the beds were comfortable. Houskeeping was good. The hotel seems a bit old and run down in places. The Ai-conditioning was old and very noisy, making it impossible to keep on during the night. The machine was also full of dirt and dust. The fitness-senter at 35th floor is spectacular but unfortunatly very full, mostly occupied by men which makes it a bit uncomfortable being a woman. The lobby is always full of straff, unfortunatly they were not very friendly or service-minded. I asked for a cell-phone charger, and got a short reply "no". I then asked in the gift-shop in the lobby, where they sold chargers. This information would have been easy to give at the lobby-desk. Also, when asking about the bill and not understanding the tax-system of USA, the staff got impatient and was not very helpful.The prices at the hotel bar are high, 20 dollars for a small glass of not very good white wine. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel. In short - this hotel does not give good value for money. It is very expencive, and my advice is: if you want to spend this much money on a hotel, choose another!

It's 8:30p on a Tuesday night. I just got settled at the hotel and am sitting at the bar right now - furious that I have to do so. This is the FIRST full-service Marriott that I've stayed at (10+ year platinum MR member) that doesn't have room service. Yes - a midtown NYC full-service Marriott that doesn't offer room service. NOT acceptable...and not the first time this hotel has disappointed. Rude lady at "delighted" to serve told me my only option was to walk down to the bar, order, wait, then carry my food back to my room. So here I sit - wondering what hotel I'll stay at on my next visit. Certainly not this one...

We had the good fortune to stay in a suite in this lovely hotel. First impression was helped by the beautiful inlaid marble in the foyer and the lovely carpets. (Would love to learn the secret of keeping so pristine both of them.) Decor is in keeping with the age of the building and even the lifts are decorated in warm hues. The suite was enormous by Manhattan standards and must be good value, because of its size. It came well equipped, partially marble bathroom, safe, fridge, separate air-conditioning units for the living room and for the bedroom. For me the bed was possibly the most comfortable ever slept on. The only fault I could find was the one set of slippers and one robe provided. I must remark on the pleasantness of the staff. Used the services of two of the concierges and found them to be obliging and efficient. Staff at reception and the cleaners were also excellent. After staying in several of the 4 star hotels in the area, I can wholeheartedly recommend the Marriott East Side.
user_name:
G J F
London, United Kingdom

review_body: This was my third stay at East Side Marriott and all have been very consistent.I find the location to be convenient to much NYC has to offer. But really - most hotels in NY are in a good location. Close to subways and Grand CentralI find the hotel to have charm. not modern or contemporary, but a classic large hotel. I agree with some others who advise those who complain about noise to understand this is a large city and street noise is a given, the ONLY way to minimize this if you are a light sleeper is to be sure you ask for a room on a higher floor NOT facing the street.I was given a room on 33rd floor backside and it was dead quietCheck in, bell desk, club lounge staff were ALL very nice and accommodating. Nice selection of breakfast items in Rewards Club. Fitness Center was doable, still think a hotel this size should offer more equipment, but honestly don't expect much.I was upgraded to a suite on check in and all was very nice, clean and working orderI had no issue with elevators, were quick and no long waits.All in all - a great choice...no worries

My mother and I stayed in room 1432 at the Marriott NY East SIde hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel's location is great and it was easy/fast to catch a taxi outside with the hotel's bellman. Our room #1432 was exceptionally quiet which we both appreciated very much. I've stayed in some very noisy hotels in NYC over the years and this was the quietest. The bathroom was on the small side but our queen beds were very, very comfortable as were the pillows. We had breakfast at the Elite VIP lounge and were happy with the choices of food and beverage.

AN Excellent place to stay, great service and very accommodating. Breakfast was amazing! Beautifully built close to the New York Cruise Port. Also used by NCL. This was by far the best choice of hotel!

This is an older hotel, with a small lobby but has some genuine, old classic features. Slower, smaller elevators but it adds to the hotel's charm. The bar isn't huge but had a good ambiance and friendly staff. The room was well appointed but on the smaller side but had everything needed. A very aggressive shower jet came out almost horizontal from the wall but the water pressure was good. As usual, the Marriott staff was extremely pleasant and accommodating.

I come to the Marriott Eastside every March for the DCAT event. They are always doing an upgrade. The rooms are very nice. The new Marriott M Club is the re-done breakfast and snack area for Marriott Reward members. This is on the second floor. They did a great job on this. The staff in the area are fantastic. The bar in the lobby was redone a few years ago. It is very spread out. The check in area is also new. They did a nice job on this. The front desk staff are excellent and real pros. They took care of a reservation issue for me without hesitation. The bell staff and porters are long time employees at this venue. They are all very pleasant. Spend the night at this gem.

Just returned from a stay here and was surprised by some recent negative reviews. Facilities and staff were first-rate.Beautiful, well-furnished room.Small, but nice bathroom. Very reasonable rate for New York. Great location away from the hordes in Times Square, yet close enough to walk to and from. Complaints about traffic noise were greatly overstated. If you want peace and quiet, you shouldn't stay in one of the largest cities in the world. Our room was close to the elevators, but we never heard one. Also, elevators were quite prompt. We never had an extensive wait. We've stayed in Times Square and at other hotels on the Eastside, but Marriott Eastside is where we'll return.

Our stay here was absolutely fantastic! We came here for a girls weekend in February and checked in early in the morning from a red eye flight, and Josh and Kevin at the check-in desk took the time to search and find us an available room even though it was 6 am. We were so grateful! The concierge lounge was amazing - the food was awesome and the people working there were so incredibly kind and helpful. They learned that one of the girls in my party had a birthday and they arranged a special surprise in our room! I can't say enough good things about our stay here!

The hotel is showing its age. The elevators are small and fairly slow. It is inconvenient to get to the Workout facility if you are on 16th floor or below. However, the exercise area is quite adequate. The furniture in the room is showing its age with nicks and definite signs of wear. There was no note paper in the room The shower was inconsistent as far as water temperature is concerned. The hotel is convenient to subway system, Times Square, and Central Park.

We stayed at the Marriott at the height of the Holiday shopping season our stay was wonderful. Room was larger than most in the city, clean, and quiet (we were on the upper floors). The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Nice stay and will be back!
user_name:
CYND101
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed during conference. the price per night was on the outrageous side, considering the e size and the aged impression it gives. Walking through the corridor you smell murkiness. this hotel needs to freshen up (or lose 1-2 stars and reduce prices). The staff in the breakfast area, and room service was quite nice (but also the breakfast price was way too high (get better quality and taste elsewhere for half the price). Reception area and doormen cannot say the same.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and there were problems at every turn. Check in was poor. Two staff manned the "elite" check in and the check in for ordinary mortals was unattended so I was waved over to "elite ". We had two nights booked under my husbands name and I had added a third night for myself because I was able to come to NYC early. I have been married for over thirty years and never changed my name. Though I booked the room under my name and requested we not change rooms, (all explained to reservation agent along with my credit card number) the agent had booked the three nights under my husbands name. Hence the check in staff said I could not check in unless I called my husband and got his permission!! I showed the staff that my name and my husband name were on my credit card. They were "terribly sorry " in a way that reveals not an iota of concern. I asked to speak to the manager who listened in a professional manner and apparently believed I was not an imposter who wanted to check into a room I myself had reserved but did ask me if I could just have my husband email him his confirmation. I have stayed in lovely, elegant hotels around the world and have never encountered such a strange and inhospitable "reception ". It was bizarre. To continue the poor hospitality, ,there is no room service but you can order food and go downstairs to pick it up. No thank you . There was only one bedside table which is inexcusable ( I put my glass of water on the floor!!) The lounge in the lobby has the ambiance of a bus station. We waited there for our family to arrive and they were greatly delayed. We each had two cocktails that were watery and poor and asked for some nuts or snack. $108 later we got our check. I am happy and willing to pay for hospitality and graciousness and quality. This was not that in any way. The rooms were generic,bedside tables, shower caps, mini bar and room service are too much to ask. Doesn't seem acceptable for a hotel in the midtown of an international city.

This hotel is in an okay area. The customer service sucks. I stayed for 5 days and not one person greeted me. They do not even look up from the desk, no room service. The elevators are old just as the rooms are. my tub was clogged every time I took a shower called maintenance supposedly fixed it but didn't so every time I tooka shower the water would full up, so annoying.. I had left over food and of course couldn't heat it up they do not have one microwave In this FULL service hotel... I should have just stayed at motel 6... Never again... !!!

Absolutely perfect location for our trip, central to my meetings, shopping, central park was all walking distance. The room was very small, the climate control was iffy at best. The bathroom, while nicely remodeled, was extremely small. There was also a great deal of street noise.

We were in the city for a few days with one of our children. We selected this Marriott because of proximity to an event we were attending. The price was very attractive and it was a Marriott so we gave it a shot. Generally, we might stay at the Marriott Marquis in Times Square. There's no comparison. All the staff was wonderful but that's where it ended. Our beds were old and uncomfortable, the shower water volume was extremely low and worst of all, the noise level from the street was unbearable. My wife and I woke up multiple times each night to sirens, horns and people yelling in the street. After my second night of this I was exhausted when it was 5 am and time to get up for the airport. I would have paid any amount of money to get just a little sleep. So unless you can get by with either no sleep or you can sleep with sirens going off around you, I'd suggest a different hotel. It's not a Marriott problem in general. It's a problem at this location though.

Fantastic location. Close walk to everything. 1 block to subway. The staff of this hotel is amazing and well trained. See the concierge for the best advice. Buy the Upgrade to the MClub! Kenda the PM host in the lounge treated us as family, very much appreciated on our first trip to NYC

We just stayed one night at the hotel and I would stay again. The lobby is very nice, quick check in and credit has to be given as they let us check in early. I had a small issue with the tub but other than that no problems. I felt safe at this location and there is plenty of places to eat and of course shop within walking distance. We ate at Davio's which is right down the street and we also had pizza at La Bellezza which is on 49th. Both great places to eat. (I reviewed them as well). Room was fine nothing too exciting, nice size room and clean. Also has a fridge which does come in handy. My other complaint, it was very noisy. I stayed on the street side so I heard all the noise from the street and then all the people coming in late. It could be that we were near the elevator but it was very noisy. I have stayed in other hotels in city without all the noise so not sure why this one was that way. Either way, I would stay again, as the price was great and the location was good as well.
user_name:
Kelly S
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: Hello I stayed during 7 days in the hotel for a business trip. We had a very good rate below 200 Us$ I had a very nice room which was going to an inside area the good was it was very quiet but on the downside it was dark (6 floor) But good bed great shower and Internet was fastBreakfast was not included and for me it was a onetime 42 US$ !!!! And it wasn't really good!!! For this price I expect a great breakfast buffet and not a small and simple one ( shame on the hotel)The gym is great it is on the top floor has good equipment and a nice viewThe service in th buoyed was very good as I would expectDo I would stay again yes but no breakfast

My family and i stayed at the Marriot east side hotel during the NBA All-Star weekend.Our arrival on February 13th was delayed because of traffic, to the point where we were very close to being late for a dinner reservation. When we arrived to the hotel, we were greeted by Fred at the front desk, who provided us with a fast, efficient, and courteous check-in. He even offered us further assistance, which i never experienced from such a busy hotel. We thought we were going to be late for dinner, but thanks to Fred, we were able to make our reservation on time! I will definitely stay at this hotel again, and i will also recommend it to friends and family members! Thanks Fred!

I'm writing this only because I have had now two consecutive experiences here that I can only classify as weirdly rude. The first time I experience a marriot was in Shanghai. The JW Marriot there was very nice and full of amenities. No complaints there. It just so happened that we had an incident in the room and my sister's power outlet shorted out and shocked her when she was trying to use her curling iron. No harm, no foul, we just went to the front desk to let them know what happened and that my sister may need to seek medical attention. Instead of concern or the usual basic human empathic reaction, one of the girls, Cherry was her name, started laughing. Well my sister had a few choice words for Cherry and needless to say we still tell stories about that trip. Either way on to the experience at hand. I travel to New York for a business trip for Saks fifth avenue in July. I arrive to the hotel promptly. Check in is the smoothest I have ever had it. The room is great but I'm not there to be in the room. When I got back to the room on my last night, the room had a strange, smoky odor. Quite frankly it smelled like weed but I had left the window open and maybe there were smokers across or below me. The trip ends and I go to collect my things and check out. I look high and low and realize that I'm missing my ID and an envelope of cash. I gather my things and head down to let the front desk know that I'm missing some items. I go ahead and tell the front desk woman. I told her that I couldn't find the items and that I hope they didn't get picked up by mistake or in the cleaning of my room. She went and grabbed her manager who went and grabbed a cop that I assumed worked at the hotel specifically.So let me break this down. I am a 27 year old, American born Asian dude. The cop started talking to me like I was an infant who did not speak English. He opened the conversation with "Well our staff would never steal anything so..." and "Our housekeepers are UNION. They would NEVER do that." Imagine him saying it in slow motion because he thinks I'm retarded. I blinked a couple times out of incredulity and responded with a fairly tame response of "ok, well I'm not accusing anybody of intentional theft. I simply would like a reference point and to report the incident in case it is the case"I later found the envelope. It had slipped under my suit case's bottom board. A complete accident. No harm at all. However, I don't care if I look like a foreigner or not. Treat me with the respect all humans deserve and maybe extend your customer service training to your security guard too.
user_name:
Everett W
Pebble Beach, California, United States

review_body: We enjoyed our stay on Valentine's Day. The rooms were nice and good size by NY standards. Bathrooms were small but workable We interacted with several staff members and they all were very attentive and accessible. The service for breakfast was fantastic. The only negative was that the breakfast buffet was $45 pp. which is crazy. The concierge's lounge was closed.We went to Kinky Boots Saturday night and walked home from Times Square.Easy 10/15 minute walk and it saved about $150 plus per night per room by not staying on Times Square. Easy access to the tunnel to get to the airport. We liked the hotel and the price well enough that we will consider this hotel as our base for our next trip to NYC and Broadway.
