This is a very good hotel. Location is excellent for leisure and business. It has decent sized rooms for Manhattan, good toilette, good facilities, good TV and channel selection, good lobby, decent all-round. Highly recommended for location and rooms. Service is also helpful and friendly.

Really disappointed. Excellent location and good room size, but condition is quite poor. Maybe I've been in Asia too long, but since when do you pay for a drink in the executive lounge? Couldn't sleep in because window shade wouldn't close all the way. Lounge was worn and dirty. Just generally really disappointed. I'll admit to being a bit harsh with this review, but I live on the road and count on Marriott to be consistently good ... this property falls short. Our office is next door, but I will not be staying here again.

The hotel was clean, staff was courteous. It was an easy walk to all of the places on our "to do list".Lion King play, stroll to battery park, Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building and Tiffanies! Mant choices to eat! Restaurant on site great for a morning breakfast.Would not hesitate to stay there again if the opportunity presents itself again,

Great area, close to everything. Near most subways. Close to Time Square, Grand Central and Fifth Avenue. Easy check in and attention to detail. Rooms are a comfortable size for NYC hotel. They are willing to help you with wonderful sightseeing, shopping and restaurant advice.

The hotel was nice and clean, reasonably price and staff was friendly. Rooms were very nice. Two issues. 1 - brunch on Sunday was about $32 each. Not worth it, frankly. Lovely brunch, but pricey (maybe not for NY but frankly, I never would eat $32 worth of breakfast). Walking a few blocks gives you more food options. we had no idea of cost before we ordered, nor were we given an option. Our fault, I guess. Second issue - easy to get a cab but everyone seemed irritated that cabs would stop. There isn't a place for them to easily line up. No problems getting a cab, just a bit of a mess. I never figured out what the issues were or if people were just being ridiculous each time. Great place to stay.

Stayed there on two occasions in the past week and had a very good experience. Right from check in to check out, I had no complains. Decent sized rooms with all necessary amenities. One of the biggest advantage is it's convenient location - just a block away from the business hubs of Park Avenue. On a Thursday, I strolled in the evening to an opposite direction- towards 1st Avenue. Lots of buzzing pubbing joints. Clearly well located for the city. The underground station is also just a 5 minute walk away. All in all, good within and good outside. Recommended!

This Place this Place. I feel so at home here everyone is so extremely friendly. This review is so overdue. The service here is so amazing. everyone from the doorman to the bartender to the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay a amazing one. THANK YOU. they recommended great things everyday and we tried it all. Rooms were so nice and quite and CLEAN. near 5th ave because I love to shop and was able to walk to times square and the subway.

Well located, impeccable service, attention to all guest needs,good room size, very comfortable beds, all staff is very well trained and courteous.This Marriott from now on will be my place in New York.

This place is way overpriced - there is no value. I'm 5'8" and the shower heads are too low for me. Not much in the way of public spaces. The room layout was awkward including a full length mirror that you could only stand two feet in front of. The hotel generally could use some sprucing up. They offer a "MLounge" room for $50 with snacks and beverages but charge for alcoholic drinks - unless they offer it for free, don't take it. This is just an average hotel and you can do better, particularly for the price.

Not maintained Poor service. When I arrived the reception did not explain nothing about the hotels and area and the energy was just go... A lot of noise from the street because of poorly isolated windows Not marriott standard Will not come back

Overall a very bad experience. I checked in after a very long flight. Although I ordered a king size bed got a double bed room with a brick wall for a view. After complaining got a room with a better view.The concierge services were terrible. It's probably the only hotel in the city that does not provide an umbrella when raining. Will not return.

Had to run up to NYC on the spur of the moment to visit my son who wound up in the hospital for a night. My wife and I stay at Marriotts because they have been consistently good and as Elite members we have been very satisfied with the service. We made reservations for one night so we could check on our son. After our night we decided to use our Marriott points to stay another night. So after a two night stay my feelings about the hotel are somewhat mixed. First, everyone I met working there was very competent, pleasant, and helpful. We were able to stay in the same room for the second night on our points even though it had to be booked as two separate stays. The hotel itself is older and could use some freshening; however, the king room we had was spotless, the bathroom in great shape, the water hot, and the air conditioner kept the place fresh. All this was great and typical Marriott. On the other side of things, no free WiFi is a downer. The valet parker had an issue getting our car returned to us, saying the battery was dead and they had to jump it. Now, apparently when the valet parker parked the car, the left rear door was left ajar and the interior lights drained out the battery. The reason I suspect this is that the door ajar light was on when I got my car and the left rear door was not closed completely and this was the door the bellman opened to retrieve our suitcase when we arrived. Someone should have noticed the interior lights remaining on after the car was parked, not to mention the door ajar idiot light on the dash. I also want to mention the $28 and $32 breakfast buffet. Ok, it's Manhattan and I go there often, but seriously, howabout putting something other than a buffet on the menu. I will pay $15 for two eggs, some bread and a coffee, but thirty bucks is a bit steep for light eaters. Finally, and this is not the fault of Marriott, Lexington is noisy. Get a room off the street if you can and high. I will still give the place 4 stars: however, when I return to NYC I will stay at another Marriott.

This Marriott lacks just about everything, except exorbitant high rates. The elevator made a scary noise for 3 days now, no action by maintenance. The sink stopper does not work, I wonder why room service does not initiate action. Left room at 1030 AM, returned at 3 PM. Room not made. I got a room on the 10th floor, facing Lexington Avenue. Noisy old windows do not keep noise out, and this around the clock. Thank you for being a Marriott Platinum Member.....NEVER AGAIN

We spent one night here in Sept. The location is outstanding, close to everything.Our room was very large for NYC. Our bathroom was sparkling, looked to have been remodeledrecently. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The doormen were the best we have seen anywhere. They were quick to offer directions etc as soon as we walked outside.The elevators are very small and rather slow but not so much as to be a negative for us. We would stay here again.

I stay at Marriott hotels a lot and the service at this property is not as good as the other Marriott's in the area. We requested towels which never materialized and also had problems with the shower drain. I would recommend staying at the Marquis or the Renaissance in Times Square as the service, attention to details and location is better. We also had an unfortunate experience with the car service that a Bellmen recommended named Henry Transportaccion who charged our transaction twice and didn't know how to issue a credit on his Square devise.

We stayed at this hotel for the second time during the US Open. The location is perfect as Grand Central Station is a quick walk away and you can take the 7 straight to Arthur Ashe Stadium. You're also just blocks away from midtown if you're interested. The rooms themselves are generous in size and clean. Great value for a family of four.That said, they could step it up a notch when it comes to service. First, front desk could have at least given me a smile, asked me how my day was, or something when I checked in. Next, the member lounge (the M Lounge) is closed on Saturday nights...what?! Given it was closed, I asked for bottled water before going to bed and was treated by the front desk as if I'd asked for a free room. To top it all off, when we were checking out, it took 45 minutes to get our car from valet. Yikes!In short, I'd stay at the hotel again given the value and location. I'd just probably just bring my own water and make sure I bring enough smiles and pleasantries for everyone since you don't get any from the hotel Staff.

The hotel is just in the center, there is a near by subway station.The room is quite big ,there is a problem with the bath draining the bathroom is big enough .The staff are nice and helpful and I think that considering the hotels nearby the price is very reasonable.

Stayed here for 3 nights for work and fashion week. The hotel is quiet, which was great. We were on the 17floor, and had a nice corner room at the end of the hall. The good: quiet room, clean room, pretty big. I actually had a good night sleep in NYC. The bad: the tub wouldn't drain properly and would fill up with dirty water while showering. We called for maintenance but was never fixed. This is also very convenient if you want to stay in midtown east. Also very pleasant staff.

Good location in the financial area of mid-town that lives up to the Marriott Hotel standards. Very quick service checking in (leveraged mobile check in prior to arriving). Room decent sized for NY. Didn't eat in the hotel, but did enjoy the bar later in the evening - nice noise level for conversations.

The hotel is in an excellent location in Midtown-East. The problem is that for $449 I received a clean, small and ordinary room. The room is well configured for business travelers, in that there were many plugs at the desk and the wifi signal was strong(free for Marriott Elite members-$16-20 for others )

M Lounge (or the concierge room) is well updated. Very modern and clean. Food in the evening was nice and plenty of soda and water to keep everyone happy.Challenging room prices, but I guess it is New York City. Nothing is cheap, right. Service is good. Folks aren't overly friendly, but they get the job done well. Room furnishing are a little outdated, but nothing horrible or worn out.

The outside of the hotel has music playing loudly, as if it is a bar rather than a (hopefully) nicer hotel. This did not fit my image of Marriott. When checking in, there were not enough front-desk staff to handle the guests coming in on a Saturday afternoon. We waited and waited, longer than I've ever waited to check in to a hotel. Our room was nice, on a corner, so we had views on two sides of the building. The bed was very comfortable. The fitness center on the 35th floor looks like it has all new equipment, and you cannot beat the view! We also had a couple of drinks in the bar, but did not try the restaurant. The location is good for walking. I would stay here again.

Nice hotel in general , need some lift me up in rooms. Rooms with 2 double beds very small for family of 2 act and 2 kids. Smelled of smoke even if it was non smoking room!! Very well located few blocks from Central Park , time square and across street from a stop of hop on hop off buses. Concierge very helpful , do not drink wine from bar 50$ a glass :(

Location and rates were great. There was some street noise on the 18th floor, but not too bad. Beds were very comfortable. Meals were a bit pricey but that was expected. Have stayed there several times over the past ten years and will stay again.

Upon arrival, we were graciously greeted. The staff's professional attire set the tone for the hotel. Our room was SO clean, the bed was beyond comfortable, and the location was convenient to restaurants, etc. Each staff member with whom we came in contact seemed happy to be working there. Employees who take ownership of and pride in their jobs are wonderful. This hotel is doing everything right. We will be back.

I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side for two nights last month and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful and I used the online check-in feature on my Marriott app for the first time which was awesome! I got a text while I was en route to NYC letting me know my room was available, well before the standard 3 pm check in time. Our room was on the 16th floor and was somewhat interior, facing a ally, but what we lacked in view was made up for by a complete lack of street noise. The room was pretty spacious for a NYC hotel and very comfortable. My only complaint was the bathroom door - it slide closed like a pocket door, but wasn't actually in the door frame, but in front of it. This meant there was a 6 inch or so gap on both sides of the door allowing for no real privacy when in the bathroom. The M2 Concierge lounge was by far the best stocked and nicest I've experienced in my Marriott travels. Complete with an espresso machine that actually made great lattes and a really nice selection of food at both breakfast and happy hour. The fitness center was OK - it was small, and quite packed, but did have a good number cardio machines and a variety of free weights and machines. Finally, another note about the staff - my friend left an iPod and iPad in the end table drawer and she got a phone call from the staff within an hour of us checking out that they had found the items and were holding them. Luckily we were still in the city and able to get back over and when we did we found that they had them already packaged in a shipping envelope, just in case we couldn't make it back. I'll definitely consider this hotel for future trips to New York.

We stayed here for 3 nights over the Labor Day weekend. Excellent room, very clean and well maintained. Also, very quiet! Loved the breakfast. Very helpful staff. Definitely recommend it...excellent location is a bonus!!!!

We stayed two days over the Labor Day Holiday. Arrived at the property and saw a long check in line in the small reception area. Fortunately we used the on-line check in from the train and our key was ready when we arrived. Hotel is in a great off-the-beaten-path location yet still close to shopping and Broadway shows.

Stayed here for 5 nights and would certainly not make it my first 5 choices when next in NY. The rooms are very dated, i must say. The noise level from the room made us change rooms from the 17th floor to the 24th floor as my daughter couldn't sleep well. The bathrooms made me think i was in one of the best hotels in a remote location, though clean.Customer service was okay, but nothing unusual. It was only at the breakfast room that i will say the staff were very enthusiastic. Breakfast variety was not exciting, but good quality. I paid for bed and breakfast package, but had to get them to remove the charge of breakfast from my bill three times.The receptionists made it seem like you were disturbing them most times. I love the location, but i'm sure one can get better hotels within that same axis.

I stayed here for 3 nights in August for a birthday weekend with friends. The check-in was smooth and the staff was really friendly and helpful. The location is also great. The rooms are clean, but on the older side. The bathroom need to be remodeled some as well. I just felt like the room quality is secondary at this particular hotel. We had a good stay, but don't expect anything to special.

The Hotel is in such a great position, right on Lexington Avenue easy access to Central Park, Times Square, one of my favorite area's of Manhattan to stay. Great service, check in was a stress free experience and the Room was great we had twin double beds which had nice firm mattresses. Bathroom was nice and clean.

We picked this hotel because of its great location. We had a Saturday stay, with 2 rooms. The check-in was very smooth and quick. We asked for 2 adjacent rooms, but since none were available, they upgraded one of the rooms to a very large room to keep both rooms on the same floor and very close to each other. As with many hotels in NYC, the rooms have an old and outdated feel. There was a slight musty smell in the room, but you'd get used to it after a few minutes in the room, no big deal. The lobby is nice and clean, but lacks enough chairs.The bar is nice, bar tenders were very friendly, and prices were as expected. The elevators are somewhat small but fast enough nonetheless. The overnight parking charge is quite steep, about $65/night so we decided not to park at the hotel. In fact, we found free overnight parking on Saturday night very close to the hotel. Overall, we had a great experience and would recommend the hotel.

Spent the weekend there on my first trip to NYC. Had booked a superior room, but as I am platinum elite, they kindly upgraded me to a junior suite (great customer service from Carmen and Allan H. who were friendly, polite and very happy to help) . The hotel itself is an ageing property - last renovated about 7 years ago, and it shows. The suite was a great size, bathroom was tiny (I was surprised how small - not even space to put a washbag on the sink), flush was weirdly noisy but shower was decent. View from the room was the building next door (or as I lovingly called it; my view of a wall) - though you could see the street if you craned your head enough.For a city hotel, the gym was small yet decent - good selection of weights and machines. From a location perspective, great access to subway, walk around grand central and get to most of the tourist spots.

I spent Saturday August 23,2914 at the East Side Marriott. The front lobby staff was gracious and the Room 324 was more the adequate for my daughter and me. The beds were fine and the shower was amazing. The only caviate to the trip occured on Sunday morning. My daughter wanted to sleep in so being an early riser I bought the newspaper and began to read by the lobby bar which was closed. After roughly one-half hour a man in his late twenty's approached me and asked me if I wanted a COMPANION for the day. Never before have I been subjected to such behavior. After informing the front desk they handled the situation quietly but with purpose. Hopefully no other guest will be subjected to this qind of treatment. Arthur B

When I saw the hotel at the web site I was impressed by the lobby, but that is because they show a professional photo, once in there the lobby it not so impressive and rather small and the whole building does not look so modern or cool. After making my reservations I read about what they call a virtual concierge, and I could ask for a couple of things in advance, no guaranty though; I did ask for a higher floor as high as possible with my rate, but they did not have my petition upon arrival, so the best they were able to do was to pass us from the fourth to the fifth floor, in which the view was kind of sad, the front desk personnel are very nice. We found the room with a good size and the two queen beds we asked for, everything in it was ok, clean indeed, good size bathroom and closet, yet again I got the feeling the building is old, maybe with some interior renovations. Free wifi only in the lobby, and the lobby only has a couple of chairs and is always full of guests many of them with the Iphones or Samsungs. In the same lobby area is the restaurant, but food is expensive and does not look tentalizing, so we always ate in the neighbourhood where there are plenty of places to have your three meals or just a snack or a drink. When going out you turn right to the street and then left and you´ll find Park, Madison, Fith Avenues with the Waldorf Astoria, Saks, etc. and going a little bit further in the same direction you'll be at Rockefeller Plaza, and if you want to see a real good view of New York, just go to the Top of the Rock, I like it better than the top of the Empire State Building. The metro is nearby and from there your can go anywhere in New York, we went all the way to Coney Island in a 45 minute ride for $2.50 in a sunny Sunday. The personnel at the concierge desk are really outstanding. The gym is complete and with a good view.
user_name:
Carlos R
San Pedro Sula, Honduras

review_body: My friend and I stayed over the past weekend from Aug 15-18.2014. I had stayed at this location before, maybe 5 or 6 years ago. I've already had a pretty decent vibe about this place. Upon arrival, we were able to check into our room in the morning. Which it was very convenient, since we wanted to settle down, refresh and change into different set of clothes. The room was a standard King bed, which was enough space, since we just wanted a place to sleep in. The room was very clean (no hair spotted) clean white linens, equipped with convenient toiletries, like a good blow-dryer, lots of towels, and coffee machine and mini fridge. The only thing I wish they had was complimentary wifi in the room. They do have it in the lobby, but find it inconvenient when it's 2am in the morning and I have to go downstairs in the lobby to connect.The hotel was only 2-3 blocks away from metro, super convenient, and a couple blocks east to amazing brunch/dinner places on 55th ave and 3rd. A 24 hours Duane Reade (sp) is next to Metro, so if you forgot anything, you can go to that drug store to grab it. When you jump onto the Metro you have access to #6, F, M, D, E which goes uptown, downtown, east, & west. Can't go wrong with this location. I would like to bring attention to an individual. Her name is Kimberly and she works at the concierge desk. If you have a question, she can answer! Kimberly was so helpful throughout our trip. She was detailed, gave great advice for anything that may work easier for us. Kimberly is all about being efficient , ensuring customers understand what their doing and where they are going. It was a pleasure to have Kimberly at the desk to assist us! I wish I can use more of their facilities, but because we wanted to experience the city more, we only had the chance to sleep in the room and interact with a few hotel staff. This place is great if you wish to be in the city, likes to be convenient and surround with everything you need.

Two years ago I run screeming fr the Waldorff Astoria, that became a Hilton factory and everlasting construction site, and this Marriott saved us. Today we are back in NYC and I tested whether this was just luck or standard. It is proven that thos Marriott has outstanding staff. True welcome, very polite, helpful, free upgraded room, free wifi, and all with a big smile. A smile that only is seen on tourists in NYC and not on local people. When in NYC: choose Marriott!!!

This hotel is a well kept secret. It is off the beaten path of times square and yet easy walking distance to get to all the tourist spots. The staff from the bellman, to the front desk and lounge attendants are very helpful and nice. Harriet in reservations is absolutely the best!

One of the best hotel locations in Midtown and convenient and walkable to almost anywhere. Subway via grand central station is just blocks away. Hotel staff are friendly however frequent stayers will start to see issues. There is NO Room service available and the resturant that does serve food will not bring it to you. This is very frustrating when you want to work from your room. Printing a simple document is a hassle as you must first pay for use of their computers to SEE if your email or documents have arrived. To make matters worse you cannot get free wifi in the room where you have to print, and of course you have to pay to print. Be sure and stay off the lower floors on the south side of hotel. They dump the garbage at 4 am and it can get noisy. This is a standard Marriott with some annoying problems.

This was my second visit to this hotel. It is a clean and comfortable hotel but I experienced several problems during my stay, albeit fairly minor.The lifts are possibly the slowest I've ever experienced which becomes a bit tedious after a while. However, when you do get to your room they are spacious, well appointed and looking fairly fresh. However, the Wifi in my room did not work and despite nearly an hour on the phone to technical support never did.The bar area and restaurant do not serve food at the weekend it would seem. This isn't really a problem in New York I guess as you will always be able to find somewhere for that, but just struck me as a little bit odd.The hotel is excellently located to walk to most areas of tourist Manhattan and has a convenient Metro very close by. However, be warned that there seems to be a street market on a Sunday that closes off Lexington meaning you will have to walk somewhere pre-arranged with your luggage to get a taxi/car to the airport if you are travelling on a Sunday.On both stays at this hotel I have left my luggage with the bell boy and on both occasions bags have become separated and lost meaning I've had to go hunting through storage rooms with them to find my bags.

Had a great time staying here in August 2014 when were were in town to see some shows. The staff was great and very friendly. We did check in with the concierge about options for bus tours and places to go to, but did not find their advice to be that good. So ask your friends before you go for ideas rather than count on advice here. The front door staff was great for directions and advice on public traffic. The front desk staff was also great for advice.

The hotel is in fashionable East side,at walking distance with the very center of Manhattan,with a metro station across the corner.area is nice and safe,the hotel is confortable but rooms are basic and lack of amenities.breakfast is good but expensive..The hall lack a few chairs,at least for older guests,but finally this is is a place where i 'do back.

We lucked out by getting this hotel on our first-ever Priceline auction. We arrived around 10:30 and found to our surprise that a room was already available, but it was a handicapped room. Having stayed in one another time, I said we take it. The room was large and on a corner, mostly facing 48th St. Although we were on a low floor, it was fairly quiet given it was Manhattan. The location is excellent, two blocks from the 6 train station at 51st Street, which took us (with various transfers) to Yankee Stadium, the Lower East Side, Williamsburg, the East Village and the High Line.

Great location in the City. I like old hotels and this one is classic. Right in center of everything. Good for business and pleasure. Rooms are newer, clean, bed and bathroom are great. BIG towels.Staff extremely friendly and welcoming.We were here for 2 days as an extension of a business trip. We did not look at workout room or business center.Walked to everything we wanted to do, restaurants, theater and park. We did cab it to the Met though and walked back.

This was my second stay at the East Side Marriott, and I wasn't disappointed. Although I arrived before my room was ready, the hotel staff was most accommodating. I was introduced to the M Club Lounge, an exceptional new feature at this hotel. I appreciated using those facilities which helped make my stay more pleasant and getting around NYC more efficient. Kudos to Kenda C., Margaret G., Scott, Kenny, Candy and the front desk staff! The healthy snacks, beverages, and food were spot-on delicious. I especially liked the Greek hors d'oeuvres served during "happy hour" in the M Club Lounge when I was there. I couldn't resist the dried fruits, cheeses, salad, chicken breasts, and Spanakoptika. I saw two Broadway shows which were one of many highlights of my trip (besides attending my cousin's wedding). My room was on the 27th floor, and I was pleased to have a view of the well-lit Chrysler Building at night. The breakfast near the Lobby was beautiful and plentiful. I was delighted to see John again, who was my server last year. I made a point of voicing my complete satisfaction to the hotel management: Allan Hartwig and Brian. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to families, people traveling on business, and solos like myself. Indeed, it was a positive, marvelous experience to stay at the East Side Marriott.

We recently stayed at the New York Marriot East Side for a family event. The location was great. Marriot has a very "cool" app for Rewards members that allows you to check in before you arrive. There is a dedicated line for you to just walk up and get your key! We were upgraded to a larger room on the 15th floor. For a New York hotel it was extremely spacious, but the bathroom was small. As we were only staying one night for a wedding, we really didn't care. The beds were comfortable which in the end is all that matters. The hotel faces the historic Waldor Astoria nd is in the heart of mid town only a few blocks from Grand Central Station.The front desk , bell captain and concierge were all very polite, friendly and helpfulThe only reason for a lesser rating is the noise factor. Not from the other rooms...but from the street. Even on the 15th floor we could hear constant traffic noise, taxi horns and the whistle of the valet parking attendent.

i came to nyc marriott eastside for my birthday and my 3 cousins we checked in on sat july 19th and checked out on sunday july 20th. i just wanted to point out that your operator eisis i hope i am writting here name correctly she truly gave us a very nice expierence and she was absolutely amazing i just wanted to let your hotel know how wonderful your operator was and your entire staff from bellman to the easy check in i was completely satisfied and most of all it was a great way to celebrate my birthday. I came in from maryland to new york city and it was worth the trip again thank you to you and your staff

My wife and I along with daughter and 2 granddaughters just completed a 6-night stay in this property. It was simply great across the board, including an outstanding "M Club" - probably the best Concierge Lounge (now called M Club) I have ever seen and we travel practically non-stop throughout the year - for leisure, as we are now retired and I am a lifetime elite Marriott member, which clearly is my choice of hotels almost everywhere we travel.The location of this Marriott is great - only a few blocks from Times Square, Theater District, the best shopping, Central Park and restaurants of everyone's preferences.Great reception & staff.Very Highly Recommend!

Went to NYC last night to see America's Got Talent with my wife and kids. Decided to use 40,000 points for a stay at the this Marriott hotel (which is category 8 just in case you didn't know) All was well until this morning. Nothing like a late night walking around the city, crashing in the bed around 12:30AM and then waking up to NO SHOWER! Not kidding, room 1005 does not have a functioning shower. When you pull up on the little knob it will not engage, only sprays water in every different direction from the spigot. You get a little dribble from the shower head. I hope a Marriott manager reads this review and addresses this asap. My next email is going to the corporate office to request my 40,000 points refunded. There is no calling room maintenance at 7AM with 4 people just waking up and wanting nothing more than a shower. Absolutely unacceptable.

Having stayed several times in Times Square when visiting NYC...because I always thought it was more convenient, I opted to stay elsewhere this time. All I will say about the change is this:If you don't want to feel like a salmon while getting into your hotel, then don't stay in Times Square. The convenience is marginal (you still have to get to the Subway and all attractions) and the mass of humanity makes you favor side doors anyway. For less money and more sidewalk space, avoid Times Square.The New York Marriott East Side is very comfortable. We were in a corner room with two doubles (though, sharing one bed, they were comfortable for two average-sized people). The room was large. The bathroom was very clean. The beds were very comfortable. The coffee in the room is, as always, horrible, but there are two coffee shops less than a block away. The staff was courteous and funny.This is an old building. There are bubbles in the paint on the ceiling. The access panels rattle. The windows aren't sound-proof, nor are the doors. But...if you remember ear plugs, or are a deep sleeper, then you will likely sleep well.The location is great. There is Subway access a few short blocks away. Rockefeller Plaza and Fifth Ave are very close. We easily walked to Grand Central, the Empire State Building, and then back to St. Patrick's.

Let me start with a few members of the staff, Paulina (front desk) and Hassan (Bartender), they were nothing short of spectacular. Paulina went out of her way to attend to some of our needs while staying at this Marriott. Our stay was not planned and basically a last minute emergency stay in the city for 5 nights, Hassan who works the bar during the day was a wonderful person who cares about his patrons, he is a world of knowledge when it comes to everything NYC...both Paulina and Hassan should be recognized as outstanding employees at Marriott/East Side. The property itself could not be located in a better location, right on the Lexington Subway line as well as near all the cool places on 3rd and 2nd avenue and of course a few blocks from Rockefeller Square/Times Square. Our next visit in NYC will definitely include a stay at the Marriott East Side.

Bellman Kenny is outstanding! Overall, staff is excellent. Rooms were clean, comfortable, and well appointed. A small "step" (~1") from bedroom to bathroom was a little annoying. Elevator doors were narrow. Easy walk to Grand Central Terminal. Overall a very nice hotel.

I booked this hotel through expedia and turned a good deal. The hotel is in a great location with walking distance from time square that I did multiple times a day. There's a few hot dog stands in the area that is very continent. The restaurant was a plus. Even thou there are plenty of restaurant on the area we didn't feel like walking in the cold. The food was deliciouse and the price was reasonable$$$ for the service and location. There's is constantly taxis outside waiting we found helpful when in a hurry. The view wasn't special at all we had the roof of the building that one can at least see if it's raining/snowing.

We were unsure prior to arrival, but really enjoyed the experience of this hotel. Great location, good service, great public spaces, rooms renovated but a little small. Every part of the hotel was well cleaned and the staff was terrific. The downstairs bar area is pleasant and a great place for a small group meeting or get together. Within walking distance of many of mid-towns best attractions. We would stay here again one day.

In town for a funeral and the Marriott East Side couldn't have been more convenient to our family in Queens while still being in the middle of it all in Manhattan. We were unbelievably grateful for everything that the Marriott team did for us during this pretty stressful time. The staff (reservations, housekeeping, bartenders, doorman and receptionists) was all very attentive and we felt like family by the time our week had come to an end.

I got this room thrown in with my Vacations to Go package so they paid for it but 375. USD for 1 night in a hotel with NO POOL just a small workout room on the roof which can only be accessed using a secret elevator which you have to put your room card into. OMG no way. then the room was furnished in an old fashioned way. For that money ? it should have looked like a palace.
user_name:
Julia S
Staten Island, New York

review_body: sitting on 49th and Lexington this is a perfect location from which be "play at worldly NYer. close to all that you could want from local eateries from bagels and swarmer to acclaimed watering holes and wonderful Italian, Chinese, French food. you are a short 5-10 minute walk to Time Square, the Theatre district, Empire State Building, the United Nations (Just around the corner)the Original Palm Restaurant (837 Second Ave) with all the famous wall cartoons, and 5th avenue shopping.The cozy lobby can be hectic, but the new bar and restaurant-the Lex is a good place to people watch. If you ask for a high floor hope to get the club level rooms or the renovated corners which require a special elevator.at the top. Join the Marriott Reward Program. I have found the front desk accommodating if you are a member, and they will work at upgrades and good locations when politeness is used.I would suggest eating out for all your meals as you have all of first and second avenue to pick from. Seek out the green groceries found on many of the corners as well as the local bakeries. for a great and inexpensive morning starter.

My wife and I got what was I swear a queen-sized bed even though Marriott said it was a king, in a very tiny room. More frustratingly, as others have mentioned, every car honk and bus stop from Lexington Ave below was audible from the room. I called the front desk and asked if a quieter room would be available on a higher floor. The employee said that a bellhop would be right up with keys for another room. 30 minutes later still no bellhop. So I went down to the front desk myself and the new keys were on the counter next to the front desk employee. She apologized that no one had been flagged to bring them up to me. I then noticed that the new room was actually on a lower floor, so I asked why they would move me down closer to the noise. She said that it was a different employee with whom I'd spoken and wasn't aware of the details, but she moved me up to the top floor. The room I was finally given was much better - very quiet and actually a lot larger too - on a corner. But why did I have to go through all of that hassle to be taken care of? And if bigger, better corner rooms are available at check-in, isn't that supposed to be given to me in the first place with my gold status? With all of the options around NYC at or below this price point, I recommend looking elsewhere.

My partner and I stayed at this marriot lexington and 49th st. The location was exactly where we wanted to be ( main reason besides the brand we chose it). After a couple minor issues w lamp and the tub, we asked to be moved the next morning. Rosario at the front desk was really friendly and helpful, got us sorted very quickly and easily. She went out of the way to recommend good places close to eat and was a pleasure to talk to. The stay was uneventful as it should be, bed was comfortable and check out was flawless. I would stay here again, and would love to see Rosario again. Great job guys
user_name:
Allen M
North Miami Beach, Florida

review_body: I just stayed here this past weekend in NYC and really enjoyed this hotel. They just refinished the lobby and it's very nice inside, the rooms are standard rooms for a Marriott and actually quite big for NYC standards. My room didn't have much of a view at all, just of another building but that's the only complaint that I have with it. The location is great as its walk able to all the main areas of the city but it's away from the craziness that is time square.

Stayed for business and weekend family visit. Very clean rooms. Would like to see them fit 2 queen beds in the current 2 double room configurations. Mattresses were a little soft for me as well. Maid service was excellent. Like the concierge lounge during the week, but wish it was open weekend mornings. Staff was super friendly, especially Carol who helped me with some last minute reservation changes. NYC is a great walking town, and this hotel offers a very good location to explore the city (seems like the park, compared to the zoo of Times Sq!). Cannot wait to go back again.

We have stayed at this Marriott several times. Concierge lounge staff is always friendly and helpful with suggestions for every traveler. Welcoming/friendly/attentive customer service has us coming back!Plenty of room for a family of 4.

The location is excellent--close to subway green line and a lot of attractions in Manhattan. The room was clean and quiet. I booked one room through Priceline's Name Your Own Price and got a good deal. It was supposed to be a 1 king room but they upgraded it to a 2 double room without extra charge when I asked it at check-in. The space of the room is relatively large compared to other neighbor hotels on Lexington Ave.

we arrived after travelling 24+ hours and the desk clerk treated us as if we were an inconvenience rather than a guest. nothing short of abrupt. Hotel room, 501 needed a brighter decor as it faces brick walls and looked dismal. Apart from ths the remainder of staff we dealt with had excellent customer service, housekeepng was faultless, beds were so comfortable and the fridge in room was a godsend. Cocktails were amazing and bar staff friendly.

My five friends and I had the most fantastic time at the Marriot Eastside. Brilliantly located, staff fantastic (most of them), rooms fully and well equipped and no problem with early entry and late departure. Sadly on the day we left the Marriot guy at the door who got us a cab - clearly and very indiscreetly gave the cab driver some money. When we questioned the cabbie he was embarrassed and insisted that on a sunday as soon as you sit in a cab to the airport the surcharge is already $20! Our cab to the airport cost $110 and our friends cab cost $78!!!! Although we argued he insisted nothing untoward had gone on!! Do be careful when getting a cab. Apart from this Marriot would have earned 5 stars!

This was my first time at the Marriott East Side and I would return again. The location is great for midtown shopping, site seeing and going to a Broadway show. The subway is just 2 blocks away so a trip downtown is quick and easy too. The rooms do vary in size and shape and we had a really nice corner room on a high floor with a very pretty view. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast and the buffet was tasty and had lots of choices. One negative I want to mention is the lobby bar area is small and not very inviting. In general, I would expect a hotel of this caliber to have a nicer lobby area.

The Eastside has been a tradition in my family for 30 years! I checked in June 20 for five nights. STUNNED they cancelled their "room service" program. I had a nice room...BUT...missed the room service option! I will probably find another hotel in The City...SAD Platinum Member...JRB

I have stayed at The Marriott East Side three times since February and the location is perfect. My daughter is in a show so we were able to walk to the theatre district easily. My niece and an uncle live on the upper westside and I have friends in the village. We were right in the middle so it is convenient and an accessible place for all parts of the city. They were very accommodating when I checked in early and changed me from a king to 2 queen sized beds. It was very clean but I didn't have a view but I usually don't when I stay in the city.

We just returned from a 4 night stay at the East Side Marriott in NYC. What makes our stay unusual is that we stayed in 2 different suites. The first suite was on the 4th floor. Clean, 2 double beds and not as noisy as you would think being close to the street. The room is small, but overall, it was enough for our group of three. I did not feel that the hotel was tired looking. Obvious updates were made in the rooms...newer bathroom fixtures...has more of a contemporary feel. It was nice to be able to control the thermostat. It was sweltering in NYC during this period so it was a nice feature to walk into a cool room and adjust it once we were comfortable. The location is perfect for those who want to walk. Close enough to get to Times Square....Macy's...Grand Central within minutes. Only minor issue we encountered was a burnt out light bulb in our suite entrance way which was fixed by the time we returned from seeing a show. Can't speak about the lounge as we ate out for all of our meals. We also stayed an unexpected 1 night on the 14th floor due to our flight being cancelled. This suite was in the exact location of our earlier one...just 10 floors higher. There were subtle differences...taps were different in the bathroom, a small alcove which was convenient for toiletries was not in the 14th floor bathroom and the suite just seemed slightly smaller. We also waited longer for the elevator to arrive so I prefer a lower floor for that reason alone. I would recommend this hotel for its comfort and proximity to all the points of interest in this amazing city. As a tourist who has stayed in several different hotels in NYC, the East Side Marriott falls into the will stay here again category.

I rated this as "very good" because in general it is a very good hotel. I would absolutely stay there again without hesitation for a business trip. I would likely not stay there for leisure - which this trip was. I took my six year old granddaughter to NYC, American Girl and all that. The room was great - even had a bit of a view of the river which was really cool. The Marriott club was closed on the weekend which was a huge bummer for as I was counting on them for breakfast. They also did not have room service which was a double bummer and while I didn't actually use the restaurant, it seemed less than traditional. The hotel location was great and there was plenty around there. I just had planned on breakfast and/or room service.

I have updated this review regarding an additional post-stay problem. I originally rated it two stars, now down-graded to one star. (You can't give less.) While I'll stay at other Marriott properties (and, indeed, have two upcoming Marriott reservations), I'm done with the East Side Marriott.I've stayed here before and I chose it again because it was convenient for my meetings.My first room was 2121. A small king, though adequate in size. I switched the next day because the internet did not work. Wired did not work (and wire was broken and had to be replaced.) Wireless did not work. While the hotel made an adjustment, I'd rather pay the bill and not have a problem. And not spend an hour in a failed attempt to get wired or wireless to work. For $325 a night, internet needs to work on the first try. (That included 34 minutes on the phone with the 3rd party tech, multiple calls with the manager on duty at the hotel, and a visit from the staffer who brought the new wire and observed failed connection attempt after failed connection attempt.)I moved to room 2311 for 2 nights. A large, corner room. The internet worked seamlessly on the first day. Second day, hard-wired kept trying to connect me to the Marriott conference internet some 24 floors away. Wireless would not connect at all. (Manager visited, saw the problem, and posted some bonus points.) Wireless worked after a while. Then crashed. I gave up. (I checked out a day early.) Large rooftop air conditioner outside ran continuously at a low hum.There is a large exercise room, but it is 2-3 elevators away. The executive lounge is not open after Friday at about 1:30 p.m. until Monday morning. The hotel provides 1,000 Marriott points in its place. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive, but there are plenty of nearby options.Hotel is convenient to transportation (subway is two blocks) and there are always taxis.UPDATE: As stated above, the hotel promises 1,000 points per weekend day instead of the Executive Lounge. Totally inadequate and totally undisclosed. (Signs were not visible when I went for Friday breakfast, probably due to crowd from adjacent function.) After I checked out, other points from my stay (including applicable bonus points) were promptly posted. The 2,000 points for the closed lounge? Not posted. Called Marriott Rewards. They only post what the hotel tells them to post. Called hotel. First call not returned. Second call both accounting and the manager on duty insisted this was a Marriott Rewards issue. (Over 11 minutes on the phone.) Called Marriott Rewards again. At least they took ownership of the problem and solved it. Over 28 minutes on the phone, most of which on hold so I could do other things. My sense was that Marriott Rewards called the hotel. Whether that worked, or they just decided to post an additional 2,000 points, I do not know.There are plenty of choices in New York, including other Marriott choices. This was my 5th Marriott in about 3 weeks. It was clearly inferior to each of the other 4.

Stayed here for three nights while working with a client. Nice older Manhattan hotel and they have put in a considerable amount of money into the Executive Lounge. This is probably the nicest lounge I have been in within any Marriott in the world. It seems they just reopened it after updating and is very nice. Almost feels like you are going into an upscale restaurant. I got a plus one pass with my stay so I could have taken someone else with me. Overheard the lady saying to another guest that the first additional person is free and then it is 25.00 for each person after that. You are on the mid to lower East side so it all depends on where you need to be, but I was able to walk to my clients site each morning. Starbucks was about two blocks away.

An annual trip to New York during Memorial Day weekend for us is as sure a way to begin summer as for some people to go to the beach. So, without fail, each year we pack our bags,board a plane, and arrive at Laguardia for a fun filled long weekend.There is no doubt....we may stay at different hotels throughout the city, but it will ALWAYS be in Manhattan, and it will ALWAYS be a Marriott property.This year, we chose the Marriott East Side, and there were no regrets.The property is centrally located and easily reached from the airport (well...as easily as can be in a city that size with the traffic flows experienced each day!). The lobby is impressive as you enter, and the checkin experience was great. The staff was efficient beyond belief, and even though we arrived long before check in was scheduled, a room rapidly became available and within a few minutes we were in our rooms. And a few minutes is all you want to be in the room on your first day when there is so much to see and do.We had a corner room with 2 double beds. It was spacious, exceptionally fresh & clean, and had a great view of the adjacent Waldorf Astoria. The room was quiet, and we couldn't have asked for better.We stayed five nights, and housekeeping kept things as they should be. I think they are unsung heroes of the hospitality industry, and I for one appreciate what they do. I make it a point to tip daily, and I wish more customers did so.Check out was a breeze, and though we were sad to end our visit to New York, this property made the stay wonderful. I certainly hope to be able to find a room when we return for our next visit.

Our hotel of choice is the Marriott chain, but this hotel did not live up to expectations. It is in a great location, but it is a little worn. The lounge area has the ambience of a cafeteria. It is noisy, not cozy in any way, and way too lighted. We actually had drinks there for a couple nights. When we asked for a bowl of the bar mix snacks that are usually available at the Marriott bars, we received a big bowl of nuts for which we were unexpectedly charged $8. The room was very clean and adequate. We may stay there again, but there are so many other good choices in that area.

I stayed here three times. Nice location, room standard is just ok - there are better choices closeby. The lounge is closed on weekends, my experiences with the staff are mixed: Some are nice, some others are not as friendly or helpful as I would expect it.Overall a slightly below-average experience, compared with other Marriott properties in the same category.

Stayed here for a recent business meeting at the hotel and extended a few days. I found the property to have a great location with a friendly staff. By New York standards, I found the size of the room to be generous and the on site amenities to be great including the lobby lounge/cafe. We would definitely consider staying here again!

Stayed here 10 years ago and remember it as being nice. Well, I don't think the carpets have been cleaned since then. The whole place has a worn, dingy feel--you know, dust and fluff along the baseboards, stained carpet, fingerprints and smudges everywhere, worn linen. What a disappointment. Marriott's quality is becoming more uneven. Would not stay here again.

It has been a long time since we were in NYC. Since it was where our wedding hosts were staying. The location is wonderful. It was an easy cab ride or walking to the places we needed to be. Our room was pretty good. We like to have 2 double beds and we had plenty of room. Nice closet for wedding dress up clothing. Room had a nice NYC view. We are Gold and enjoyed breakfast only once. It was a pretty good selection of food. Went to one of the restaurants listed on the hotel website and really enjoyed.One issue...there was construction that started at 7am in the room below us. It totally ruined our morning of sleeping in. They had to have known that when we checked in and they also knew we were there for a wedding rather that a business person that would be up at 7 anyway. We were compensated with additional Marriott points and the staff was most apologetic but we did not get our sleep back. Don't know if prices were good or bad for NYC. Did get a special rate for weekend nights. Would likely stay there again as we did enjoy the location.
user_name:
Pat W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This place is the worst from check in to check out. The restaurant was so bad the manager did not charge us for four meals and drinks. The rooms are the size of a postage stamp and over priced.I am a Marriott Elite Member, and will find a different place to stay on my next trip to New York.

Recently stayed at the Marriott East in New York City. This hotel really needs a makeover. Very small lobby and quite noisy. The restaurant is open to the lobby and bar area, not very romantic.The food is below par. Had to send ours back and ask for refund. The room itself was somewhatseedy and could also stand to be redone.Overall was quite disappointed with the Marriott East. Would not recommend staying there until some changes are made.

Very attentive staff will see to your every need. Concierge is excellent and won't steer you wrong. The rooms, like most in NY were a bit small and could use some updating, although you had most everything you needed. Small things like cleaning the glass on picture frames or wiping off the lid on the Q-tip holder seemed to be overlooked but overall was very clean. Bathroom was small and my wife had no place to sit to put on makeup. Shower had great water pressure and temperature worked pretty good, but it drained a bit slow. A/C never seemed to be as cool as the control stated, but was very sufficient. The best part was the bed. Very nice mattress and makings. Plush pillows. Very nice overall. Nice sized desk with lots of plugs and internet connections. Wi-Fi was extra. We did not dine at the hotel but they had a nice dining room. Gift shop was very small. Top notch service everywhere. Location wasn't bad. East Central Manhattan and close to the subway. Many restaurants within walking distance and Broadway shows were only about a 20 minute walk.

Stayed here in May for a sightseeing trip with our 12 year lad. The Hotel was great. I am afraid we didn't see much of it as we were out from morning till night. We were on the 15th floor. We had a great room at the back of the Hotel. The room was very clean and very spacious. The staff were really helpful and friendly. We did have a drink in the Hotel bar one evening just while we caught up on emails etc..but after coming to $40 for 2 glasses of wine and a soft drink we decided not to do that again. I can't comment on the food as we didn't eat here either.There was a fridge in our room so that was good to keep water, soft drinks and beer cold!! Also had tea and coffee making facilities. We found this Hotel was a great central location to everything we wanted to see. It looks like a long walk on the map's but it really isn't that far. We were close to it all. Central Park, 5th Avenue, Chrysler, Empire and Times Square. On the morning we were leaving, our flight wasn't until 6.30 that evening so the Hotel stored our bags for us so we could go out and enjoy the time we had left. When we collected our bags I noticed they had a computer and printer available to print off our boarding passes. If we ever go to New York again I will definitely book here and I would also definitely recommend to anyone else.

The New York Marriott East Side offers a serviceable place to stay in an incredible city. I have not slept in many NYC properties because I usually stay at family or friends' apartments. In this case, I was in the city for one night, needed clothing for a family member's wedding and wanted to be close to large department stores. From that perspective, the hotel's location is unbeatable. Saks Fifth Avenue, Barney's and Bloomingdales are all within 20 minutes' walking distance, along with many shops along Fifth Avenue.In terms of service, the front desk was pleasant and the doorman helpful. Overall, however, I found the hotel's outside curb environment and lobby to be frenetic and impersonal. I was not greeted till getting to the front of the registration line to check in. The feng shui of the lobby is off, with people and luggage clumped all over the place. The space needs definition, furniture, and a warmer sense of welcoming. There is also an overly chemical, saccharine smell to the lobby which I found disconcerting and unpleasant.I found the hotel room just passable. It was dark in terms of both light and feeling. There was just one tiny window in the corner. The bathroom was rough around the edges with tired paint cracks in the door and door frame. The room lacked a hair dryer: a staple in 21st century hotel bathrooms.Summary: Location is great for shopping and not far from 42nd street theatre. Room clean. Service available, nice but lacking in personal attention. The hotel does not offer a sense of character or feeling for this wondrous American city of New York. If you want a feel for this city, stay elsewhere. In addition, I'd say my room and the overall experience were sub-par for Marriott properties. This would be a place I'd choose for 1 or 2 nights only, with functionality of location being my priority.

My wife and I stayed here for the beginning of out tour. The rooms were really nice and the water was filtered. Which was rare in the States. It had a nice old school upper class feel to the place as well. Would stay here again for sure.

We had a Board of Directors Meeting in Manhattan, and Marriott East Side was one of the few hotels that has a meeting room big enough for 35 people. Overall, the meeting part of our stay was good not great. The meeting space worked. The breakfast and lunch food was good. The rooms, however, are small with no view, and need refurbishing badly. The catering staff was pleasant and tried to accommodate. The rest of the staff was not even average. Seemed the objective was to just move as many people as possible in and out of the hotel. Public food that we had was sent back as non-edible. This is not one of Marriott's nicest hotels.

Stayed at this hotel for four nights and have to say we were treated very well! From the doormen to the front desk to the women cleaning the room, everyone was very friendly, helpful, and polite. We had issues with very loud noises in our room and the front desk staff was attentive and offered to move us. Not sure if it was the elevator but the room was so large and nice we decided to stay (any room with 17 at the end is large!). Very clean, updated, nice-sized bathroom. Would definitely stay here again! Yes, internet is high priced here ($16/day) so plan accordingly (free wifi in lobby).

Very good hotel! Everything great.Comfi and clean rooms.Location Is Very good . Subway stop Very near. Walking distance to the tourist atraction.The only thing i thought it was something that can not be accepted in a marriot is being charged for using wifi 14 usd dollars p day . Terrible . OutOf this Century !

We had a fantastic stay. Lovely breakfast, friendly staff in the dinning room.Small rooms but very clean, housekeeping does a very good job. Would stay here again without a doubt. Worth every penny!!!

Great location, close to a station for the hop on hop off bus. Rooms are small however most are in NYC. Customer service was great and the breakfast was tasty. We only stayed 1 night as part of a tour - I'm not sure I would spend more than 3 nights here. Great for a short stopover though.

I always stay in this Marriott when I travel to ny. It is located in a great area which is walking distance to many restaurants and shop. It also has a decent size gym and the staff provides excellent customer service.

We stayed here with a small group that was going on the Queen Mary2 the next day. Baggage was handled well. Breakfast was included in our rate (probably not the usual case) and was excellent. The group also had dinner in the hotel and it was also good. It is located in a nice area of NYC that allows for walking around in the limited time that we had. The room was well equipped and a reasonable size, though that may be because we had gold status within Marriott Rewards and got an upgrade. There was also a great "concierge level" bar with complementary appetizers and an honor bar for drinks.

We recently stayed at the East Side Marriott again in New York and like other reviewers, there was smell evident throughout the hotel. The smell was strongest in the lobby, but also in the hallways. Lucky for us, we could not smell it in our room. The location of this property is very central and cheap off-site parking is available a few blocks away. The problem with this hotel is the amenities, they are just not as detailed as other Marriott properties in New York, especially with the opening of the Lexington not far away, but again the location is excellent, but some investment needs to be made to get this property up to par, or maybe they should drop there Marriott affiliation.

I got 2 rooms here for a bachelorette party for the weekend. I called 2 weeks in advance to request early check in and adjoining rooms if possible. When we got there, only 1 of the rooms was ready for us, which worked out since the other room was attached. It worked out perfectly for us to have the rooms together. Both rooms were a really good size! For NYC, I was expecting to be tight with space, but there was plenty of space for all our stuff. Since we had to wait over 3 hours for the second room to be ready, we asked if there was anything Customer Service could do for us to make up for it.. When we got back from dinner, there was champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in both rooms with a personalized note from Neeraj, the man that was helping us. It was that small extra step that they took which made a huge impact on our stay! I would definitely recommend this hotel, and plan on staying here again next time i'm in NY!

We recently stayed at the East Side Marriott New York and like other reviewers, were there when they had a most revolting smell evident throughout the hotel. The smell was strongest in the lobby, but also in the hallways. Lucky for us, it wasn't evident in our room, which we were grateful for. For such an expensive hotel, we were expecting more. We had four garments laundered and the bill came to US$70 which we found just ridiculous - especially as this was not even dry cleaning. There were just little things missing in our room like a shower cap in the bathroom and a pen with the notepad. We also found the payment of our bills confusing. They had our credit card on file and had up to $250 pending for our stay there. We left over a week ago, and they still haven't returned some of our money. So over all, we were not happy with the hotel. Not for the price we paid. The location is excellent though, however we were there during the visit of the President of the United States and as he stayed over the road at the Waldorf, we were often blocked off from the hotel having to walk an extra two blocks to get to the hotel. I am sure that there are more value for money hotels around the area.

Let me start off by saying that we know NY hotels (and almost everything) is completely overpriced! But for the price that we paid for this Marriott we expected much much more. Marriott hotels are usually nice and clean with friendly staff. Well, not this one. As soon as we walked into the lobby of the hotel it smelled terrible, disgusting and overpowering! It was one of the most repulsive and revolting smells ever! The bellman informed us that it was the sewage smell because it had been raining so much it was overflowing. That should be enough of a reason for me to never recommend this hotel right? Nope…there is more. Imagine smelling that your whole stay in this overpriced “luxury” hotel. When we went to the front desk the two clerks all had attitude problems. They saw me standing there, stared at and looked at me like I was crazy. They we so rude and ill-mannered and knew nothing of customer service. Finally another woman asked if we needed help and checked us in. Our room was not ready (and it was 4:00 which is check-in time) so we had to wait another 3 hours when they said it would be ready in 30 mins. When we got to our room the smell was in the hallway and a little in the room (on the 8th floor). I was so irritated but too tired to try to switch hotels or make a fuss. The carpet was dingy and definitely needed something on my feet to walk on it. Did I mention noisy rooms? Yes it felt like the people in the hallway talking at 6am were sleeping in the bed with you! The only plus to this hotel was the location. This hotel was definitely not worth the money. Stay somewhere else!Recap-1) Ghastly smell2) Terrible customer service3) Dirty carpet4) Loud rooms5) No room service 6) No mini bar

I stayed at the New York Marriott East Side with a group of ladies for my friend's bachelorette party. We had a wonderful suite at the hotel and the room was large, clean and beautiful. The hotel was also in an amazing location and the staff were very friendly & helpful. I had an issue with my bill for parking, but called the hotel and was immediately transferred to the manager. He understood my concern and was very helpful in rectifying the issue. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone traveling in NYC.

The New York Marriott East Side is part of a major lodging group but has a wonderful boutique hotel feel. Service is outstanding, especially the front desk staff. I wanted to make some changes to my on line reservation at check-in which were a bit complicated but the desk person was very accommodating and helpful. The lobby restaurant and bar are comfortable and the staff are friendly and make you feel welcome. The rooms are a bit small and dated but very clean. We "apparently" stayed in the same room as Errol Flynn which was fun to consider. The location is central to Mid-town, in walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Overall, the hotel is a winner.

Spent two nights here. The location is great, located right in NYC midtown and has several subway stations nearby. Room is decent, well kept, and relatively spacious for NYC standard. Charging $16 for wifi per day is overpriced for me, since I usually get free wifi at most hotel. And you even have to pay $19 for "premium" wifi which they claimed to be faster.

I stayed here in December 2013. Check-in was a bit of a nightmare - the lobby is small and it was packed. In all fairness, it was the weekend prior to Christmas, but I don't think that excuses poor service. The front desk staff wasn't overly accommodating (even though I am an elite member) and when they said that my room wasn't ready, I gave them my cell number to let me know when it was. They said it would be about 2 hours, but it turned out to be 4.5 before they called me -- also after the official check-in time. When I left the hotel, I wanted to store my bags, but that took me 30 minutes because the bell staff was not attentive what-so-ever. The same thing happened when I checked out and wanted to store bags. I stayed in the executive double that has a separate sitting area from the bedroom. It was one of the more spacious hotel rooms I've stayed in in the city, but it's well worn and nothing special. Views were awful. Overall, I would not suggest staying in this hotel when there are so many other properties to chose from in NYC.

We recently spent a few nights at the Marriott East side. It is a very nice building, well located on Lex & 49th. Close to the 5th Avenue and a nice walk to Times Square. The rooms were a little small (understandable for an old hotel building), but who comes to NYC to stay indoors anyway? Overall it was quite a nice place to stay. The Concierge was very helpful.

We had a wonderful time in New York the team at this hotel were friendly and warm. Location was not ideal for where we wanted to be but thats not their fault. Gym was well equipped and at least close to the underground I do recommend for a simple stay

We arrived in the City shortly before 11:30 AM and were delighted that our room was available. Check in was smooth and efficient. The room was 1536. It had three windows and was very quiet and comfortable! Location is great for sight-seeing! Staff was always friendly. Valets were prompt and kind. Highly recommend this property and will absolutely stay again!!

We were surprised and delighted with this hotel! The staff was so friendly and helpful; the room was very large with 2 queen size beds, two large windows, coffee maker and a large, updated bathroom with rain shower. The beds were very comfortable, too! Great location: 5 blocks from Grand Central and 4 from American Girl and 30 Rock. Highly recommend!

Extremely poor value for money at over $500 per night; no room service, not even a bottle of water in room, you can "buy from the vending machine". The 16th floor had open wiring hanging from the roof on the way to the gym; btw getting to the gym means 3 different lifts to a cramped room if you are unlucky enough to stay below the 16th floor. How could I possibly pay the same as the Marriott in Washington DC the night before? Completely ridiculous and I'll make sure no-one at our company stays there again.

Nice rooms. Comfy beds. Nice coffee machine in the room. Well located for business and restaurants. Friendly staff. Plenty of Hobbits and no Orcs. No elves sneaking into the room in the middle of the night looking for trouble. No dwarves. No wizards. No Bassilisk. Three point to Gryffendor. Free sorting hat. Nice lobby bar. Not too much traffic noise. A bit pricey but it was Frodo's shout so why should I care? ................................................................................................................................................................................. .............."...............................

This hotel was good in many ways, but it just doesn't live up to the price or the ranking of a five-star hotel. The pro's were the M-Lounge that I was allowed to use for being an Elite member. The location is excellent and it is clean inside. I found my room to be plenty large enough, with some nice updates done to the bathroom. The reviews are correct, it is very noisy, but I suspect that's hard to change without some very costly updates. It seems to be a trend for older buildings in NY. However, for over $500 a night, there just was nothing special about the service or amenities. I will say that when spoken to and asked questions, the staff was very friendly and responsive. But no one offered to take my bags, open a door, or acknowledged me with even a hello if the M-Lounge. It just doesn't have the feel of a 5-star hotel. I have been trying to decide whether to stay in the Marriott program or to start venturing out and trying hotels. I think for the prices Marriott charges, it's time for me to try other hotel brands. The perks for Marriott Rewards members are not that great, especially being a member who has their credit card too.

My mom and I stayed here this past weekend. The room was supposed to be handicap access Assessable however it was not. Beds were soft and pillows were comforable. There was a lot of excess traffic noises that we heard. The bathroom was average. It was an older hotel and the age shows. they offer breakfast here but beware...it's crappy food and for two of us it was $87! There was nothing more on the buffet than what you would get free at a holiday Inn express or Hampton. No made to order eggs or anything. It was a rip off. Food was cold and not turned often enough. There are better and cheaper places to eat! Don't waste your money here.

We really enjoyed the stay in this hotel.The view of the room was great, the executive lounge was very good and the staff was fantastic.We loved the city and the hotel was also a very positive contributor.Everything was fantastic.

This is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. My room is very small even by NYC standards is $500 per night and has no room service or mini bar. When I dialled room service they said they cancelled it 3 months agoIn a five star MarriottShame on you My time staying in Marriott hotels is coming to an end I think. If I wanted a small room with zero amenities in a good location I could have stayed at Hudson for 160 dollars.

This is our go to spot in NYC. It is near a few places that we like to visit before we go upstate. We usually have a basic room overlooking the street, but this time we were upgraded to a bigger room. The room did have more space, which is a luxury in NYC, and since we were not facing the street I thought it might be quieter than usual. NOT SO we were overlooking the craziness of ducts and mess in the ares below. There was some type of machine that came on periodically and made a screeching noise. I called at your service to see about changing rooms, AND SHE NEVER CALLED ME BACK; and we are platinum. I thought she would call back and say, sorry we're full your're stuck, but not even that. The concierge lounge is now called the M lounge & is on the 2nd floor. It is much larger than the old lounge. There is the main area with many tables and chairs and several tv's like the 16th floor, but there are also several smaller places, with counter seating and a back room with more tables and chairs, much bigger. The food selections have increased, and Margaret and Kenda are still taking good care of all the people; they sure have a wealth of info in their heads or can get it quickly, amazing ladies. We are still so grateful for their calm demeanor during hurricane Sandy, which we rode out in the lounge on the 16th floor. The staff are always cheerful and helpful, just would have been nice to hear back from them. The bottom line is the bed is the best, and that is always a great thing.Will def. stay again next time, but will forgo the "upgrade"

I stayed there twice. The first time was three years ago. The review would be the same then. It is a big hotel in a very good location. The rooms are big with plenty of space, but you can hear the noise from the street unless you are on a high floor or in the back. The bed is EXCELLENT as in any Marriott I ever visited. The furniture look old and they actually are old but they are of good quality. The room was equipped with big flat screen tv, an iPod/iPhone docking station, a fridge (empty) and big writing desk. The bathroom is very big and they provide tons of towels every day plus amenities. There is plenty of storage space in the closet and drawers if you plan to stay for long. Big minus is the noisy air condition, but I did not use it and I suppose if I asked they would have fixed it. Another big minus is wifi, but this is general minus in NYC. It is very expensive even though the internet is cheap in the US. I am not saying that Internet is not provided, I am just saying it should either be free or at least cheaper (somewhere around 20$ a day). However they do provide free wifi access in the lobby. Breakfast is not good value for money but there are countless places nearby where breakfast is served. Just one block away there is also a 24/7 supermarket if you need something in the middle of the night (they also sell plug adapters). In terms of location the hotel is close to a lot of things. Underground station is on 51st (less than a minute walk), Grand Central is 5 minutes walk, 5th Avenue is 6 minutes walk, as is Rockefeller Center and Times Square is 15-20 minutes walk. Central Park is about 20 minutes and the Museums about 30. But I would suggest a taxi. Taxis are relatively cheap. In general I would recommend the hotel to a friend and I would go there again if the price was ok.

It's a very pretty hotel and the bell service was great when I arrived. Went a little downhill from there. The person who checked me in was too busy talking on the phone to even make eye contact or say have a nice stay. The rooms are standard small New York size. The room was very clean which was good. Taking a shower was quite an adventure though. One second I was trying to jump out because the water was scalding hot then it was suddenly freezing. I slept very little. I was on the back side facing an alley and other wing of hotel. I think it was the heating or cooling fan that kept making terrible screeching noises off and on all night down below my window. There was no sleep to be had having that jolt me awake periodically. And breakfast...well the eggs were good but I think the waffles may have been made from plaster they were so hard. And if you are going to charge $28 for a buffet, at least make it edible. Literally couldn't chew them. I won't be making a return visit if it's not necessary.

Had stayed at the Marriott East Side before and was disappointed with the room (dark, small, ripped bedding). This time the room (2103) was quite large, nice and bright and the bathroom and products were nice as was the coffee/tea storage. The only downside was upon our arrival I noticed a desk that indicated Elite members here - I approached and was rebuffed by the desk clerk - she wasn't ready and there was a line (no line - one man awaiting a desk clerk in front). Felt quite foolish by the rebuke. Also, restaurant needs an update, food is limited and need a late night menu (croissants, scones, some lite fare). Was approached by a manager/assistant manager one night while awaiting some coffee and tea. Very nice! Our check in/check out was 4/23/2014 and 4/24/2014.

Nice hotel, but the room was tiny. The room was nice, but for the location and price I just expected it to me nicer. Room was ready early, which was a blessing. Staff was nice. Walking distance to many things.
