The towels were so ragged I would not use them as cleaning rags.The tub did not drain at all and it took them 3 requests and 2 days to fix it.As for housekeeping they knocked on the door and did not wait for a response before they walked in.We were generously afforded a late checkout the last day. That did not stop housekeeping from knocking on the door 3 times.Stay somewhere else

Great location, Hotel Staff very Helpful. I was in NYC for 2 days to Welcome my Nephew Ryan Chalmers a paralympic athete in from his unprecedented feat of pushing his wheelchair over3,321 miles accross America in 71 days. He arrived in Central Park on Saturday June 15. Mylocation with in walking distance of the Park was very helpful. The Hotel went out of their wayto accomidate the family and Ryan. Many reasonable priced locations to eat within close walking distance. Walking distance to most Midtown New York attractions.

Hotel is in a great location. The staff was great. Room size for New York is fabulous. Bathroom is large. We had absolutely no view but it kept the room dark in the morning and no one stays in midtown for the view. If you want a view, go to Times Sq or Central Park or downtown. Door staff and bell staff are great.

We stayed for three days and really liked the location. Close enough to walk to most attractions but a little away from all the chaos. Hotel is old but in a charming way. Rooms are small but the bed is very comfortable and the service is good. I don't think you can find a hotel in NYC that is quiet, so we did hear traffic noise, but it did not keep us up.

While on vacation with my niece and sister, we stayed here for 4 nights and were pleased for the most part.We found everyone to be helpful from the time we checked in, concierge downstairs, valet, concierge on the executive level, security, etc. Maybe because my sister has elite status or whatever it is you get with Marriott??The rooms were acceptable, but for $1500, they weren’t all that great. The room was tiny, drawers were broke in the dresser and when housekeeping finished cleaning/vacuuming smelled like a wet dog.For $1500, could they could at least throw in internet instead of charging $16.95 a day.The best advice we received on dining locations was from the valet. The concierge kept recommending $$$$$ restaurants and we were never really happy. Valet sent us to 2nd Avenue and we hit the jackpot of restaurants!Like I said, we were pleased, but I’m not sure this would be my first choice next time.

I have arrived at 23pm, pretty hungry. The hotel menu is very limited. I ordered a steak (medium) and it came really with a outer part burnt and raw inner very raw and cold mash potatoes.My room was very noisy (#722) and I could hear every car passing by. Not a very resting night.When I arrived, Sunday late night and dressing casually, the door man did not offer any support with my luggage. Later, dressed up with my suit, support was offered.Because I frequently stay at the Waldorf Astoria that was full, I have chosen this neighboring hotel.If you have other options, please consider.

We've been at New York Marriott East Side for new year's eve, and it has been a good choice, but there are better ones in the Big Apple. Located at 3rd Av with 50th, it is nicely located, if you like to walk (16 blocks till Times Square or Central Park). Common areas are good, and service efficacious. Staff is not friendly and this is a reason to think twice before coming back. I expecteded a better room quality overall (bed, bathroom were good, but some works at walls and ceiling were needed). Overall, at the same price, Affinia, Hilton or Paramount are better options due to location and staff.

I have stayed here twice, most recently in November 2012.We arrived in the evening time, on Thanksgiving Day. We were immediately greeted by one of the friendly bellhops and check-in was seamless. Our bags were brought to our room for us and we were told that they had a Thanksgiving Buffet in the dining room if we'd like to avail of it, unfortunately we were exhausted so we went straight to bed!The rooms were lovely, very comfortable beds, nice and bright during the day and it had blackout blinds which were great for getting to sleep.We didn't have breakfast in the hotel any morning, preferring to go to Pershing Square by Grand Central (try it, it's amazing!) but we did dine there two evenings during our stay and the food and service were great.I would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to New York!

As a frequent traveller (in wheelchair) to New York City I have been staying at quite a few hotels in Midtown, all with "ok" (partial) accessibility. The most common thing is heavy entrance doors that is difficult to open when you are in the wheelchair and in the rooms you will find tiny, tiny bathrooms with a bathtub that is hard to climb in to.I stayed at Marriott East Side in early March 2013 and was very happy and surprised when I noticed how wheelchair friendly the hotel really is!There is a smart placed wheelchair ramp outside to the right side of the entrance and automatic door openers are placed at the top of the ramp/by the doors inside the lobby.The room I stayed in (1431) is a nice room with a spacious bathroom where you will find a lowered WC, sink and shower head. Handrails are mounted on the walls both by the WC and in the shower.It will be my pleasure to recommend Marriott East Side to people who will need a wheelchair friendly accommodation in Manhattan.Marriott East Side will be my obvious choice when I travel to New York City in the future!

Arrived for a weeks stay which was booked through Virgin Holidays - did we receive a warm welcome no we did not!!! When front of house staff were given the necessary paper work to check in we were informed that there was no booking for us as a confirmation number was missing from our paper work - no confirmation number no booking no room! Now did they seriously think we would travel thousands of miles to book into their hotel with forged paper work - well they obviously did - they were unhelpful beyond belief. We have been visiting the USA for the last 16 years and have NEVER been treated the way we were at this hotel - we had to pay again for a hotel room which we had already paid for or would have been out on the street - no room for us at the inn! - to us it didn't matter at that time who was at fault Virgin or Marriott but where was their customer care sadly nowhere to be seen. It took us that afternoon and until 6 pm the next evening before WE sorted it out without assistance from Marriott staff - our holiday was ruined as we were put through so much stress - in fact we couldn't wait to come home. As for the rooms - dark (needed the lights on during the day) dated - but clean. The Reservations Manager did call our room to say sorry for the mix up and sent up wine and cheese ........... sorry too little too late ........ will never stay at a Marriott again!

Beautiful and clean hotel in a great location. Our room was pretty spacious in comparison to other NYC hotels I have stayed in. Beds were comfortable but definitely need to upgrade the pillows! Room service was always quick and make sure to take advantage of the computers in the lobby to print your boarding passes ahead of time. Hotel is accessible to many attractions with a Duane Reade 2 blocks away to buy necessities and not get over charged at the downstairs gift shop. My only complaint was the the unwelcome we received at check in. No smile or hello just "name? We need a credit card, here's your key, the elevators are over there." Very disappointing for a hotel of a high status in Manhattan! The lady who helped us the night before leaving was very pleasant and helpful. I would stay here again.

We love Marriott and have stayed at east side last thanksgiving when we had a perfect stay. The hotel is superbly located and we had a great basic room. The problem with this stay is that on our first night after checking in from the UK we were called in our room because our card had been declined. We asked if we could sort it in the morning as we had gone to bed and were advised if we could not come down to reception security would be sent to the room - we think this is not the way guests should be treated, especially those who are members of Marriott Rewards. We were booked in for 3 days. When we spoke with the front desk they said card decline happened all the time with UK cards - our experience too - so why may I ask do we get a threat of a visit by security. Once call to the UK sorted the card issue immediately. A second issue was that on checkout we were overcharged - the error was rectified as soon as I bought it to the front desk reception but I was very unimpressed and again a first for us staying with Marriott - it was around 100 dollars so not an insignificant amount. So this time we had a poor experience of the hotel. We would still return as its convenient and we will stay loyal to Marriott these were obviously glitches but do check you bill.

Once you get past the brusque, not to say rude, check-in and the smell of disinfectant in the lobby, this is really not a bad hotel. Spacious rooms, at least on the upper floors, nicely furnished in the Marriott palette, comfortable and clean. Good location for getting around and seeing the sights, either on foot or using the subway and buses. Wifi is a ridiculous $16.95 a day; shirts cost $12 to launder. If you get a deal, you will warm to the place.

This was my first time at this Marriott, and it was a very pleasant experience. The room was comfortable, clean, very appropriate for a restful night after a busy day in the city. Service was great. The concierge was very helpful when I was looking for places to go.

Smaller, boutique hotel in midst of busling city. Very friendly, helpful staff, clean. Great location. Across street from Waldorf Astoria, just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue, 2 blocks to subway, and within walking distance of Times Square and theatre district.

The hotel is nice but as other reviews have stated the rooms are smaller and platnum members dont get much of an upgrade which is disapponting. The best part is the close proximity to the 51st train station which connects you to everywhere you need to go.

We have stayed here with our kids and it was a fantastic experience. The Hotel staff were mostly pleasant and helpful. The building has some great views. It is very central and we ended up walking everwhere. I used Marriott points for my stay and they were very attentive to our needs. The Elite breakfast room was very comfortable and and was great for the kids.The only negative was the person working the bar when we ate there one night. He was unhelpful and did not point out that some dishes were unsuitable for children. As a result we were served food that was too hot (spicy) that burned my kids mouths.

Stayed here many times while visiting Manhattan. It has always been consistently good. We are Elite members and are always upgraded to a larger room. Beds are very comfy. The location is central and many things are in walking distance.

Recently stayed at the east side Marriott while traveling on business in midtown. I have stayed at a number of properties in ny and given my preference is for Marriott and this property is conveniently located in midtown for business, it made sense to visit it again. Overall, it's been relatively consistent over the years. I would say the best thing going for it is the location. The lobby is relatively small without much seating and bar sort of off to the side. The rooms are small, but typical for New York. I stayed in the "superior" room, which was almost the size of a regular hotel room in most other cities. The room was clean although for some reason both nights they either came very early or didn't do turndown service. Not a big deal but strange that it would happen two nights in a row. Only real complaints were the street noise (even on the 31 st floor) and the fact that most rooms are either near elevator or ice machine (small building on upper floors). The concierge room is large although selection lacking vs other full service marriotts.Bottom line is for a midtown NY hotel it's conveniently located and not in as congested an area as time square.

I stayed at the Marriot for one night and the room was very clean and quite spacious. But it had no view and I guess the view is not a priority in that specifique place of Manhattan (Lex Avenue does not have a nice view). The facilities are ok but the lobby was very crowdy. They have a stupid Internet Policy which allows the hotel to charge you 18 USD to acces Internet from your room or get it for free at the lobby (another reason why it is difficult to find a seat at the lobby).The location is good, subway is 100 meters and taxi are easy to find.My room was 2020 in the 20th floor and I would suggest to ask for a lower floor too in order to make an easier in and out from the elevator (there are 36 floors in this hotel).

Marriott’s have a reputation for cleanliness and excellence and the East Side location certainly fit the bill! We arrived on the later side (around 9:30pm), but the front desk was fully staffed and we were checked in and up in our room within 5 minutes of walking through the door. As with many New York City hotels, it was on the smaller side, but we didn’t mind as we didn’t plan to spend much time in the room. More importantly, it was clean. There was a nice view of city buildings from our small window, which was lit up beautifully at night. The bathroom was a little bit hard to maneuver in if the door was open. Our only two complaints would be the bathroom did not have a fan, so you had to keep the door open to avoid it getting all steamy. And our tub had a little bit of a drainage problem, so there was a puddle of water at the bottom of the tub. Hotel staff was kind, always smiling, and very helpful. The hotel is also located in a fantastic neighborhood in Midtown, with lots of nice restaurants and walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building, and Central Park. We would definitely consider staying here next time we go to the city.

Very rude and cold reception. Requested a spacious room and on high floor but was given a room at the 4th over looking Lexington Avenue. When I asked the receptionist whether the room is noisy or not she rudely answered " it is for you to judge not me" and never tried to help claiming this is the way they talk in NY! H manager was kinder but didn't make a difference. Being a Marriott reward member didn't help me much.

The New York Marriott east Side is in an excellent location very near Central Park, Times Square and Grand Central Station. The hotel itself is beautiful with very clean rooms. The only downside is that you have to pay for internet in the room and it is very pricey at $16.99 per day. The hotel staff are amazing especially Carmen who checked us in-so friendly with a beautiful smile! We very very comfortable in the room and had a beautiful view of the Chrysler building, albeit we 32 floors up. All in all a great experience and we would stay there again in a "New York" minute.

I was a tour leader for a group I booked at this hotel; the group services leader was wonderful and took care of our needs without issue. Despite there being limited parking out front, the staff managed to get our two buses parked, unloaded, and moved out of the way easily for both our arrival and departure. Service was great. Hotel was super clean. Location is fantastic! Rooms were very comfortable. We ate breakfast at the hotel, but were on our own the rest of the time; their restaurant was under renovation, but they did a good job providing a temporary space for food service. Lobby was a bit small with large groups checking in (lots of luggage), but we managed well. We stayed here in June of 2011, but that date wasn't available for selection.

The hotel staff at the counter acted like it was a bother to even look at you much less answer a question for you. I am from VA and maybe that is the attitude for NYC, but I have met some great people in NYC and this was not the place. The maid service was fantastic, always say hello and anything you needed they would go out of their way to get it for you.

My husband and I stayed at the Marriott East Side for 5 nights in April. The lobby is really nice, but the rooms are showing some wear and tear. Snags in the carpet, worn window coverings, sort of tired looking bathroom. The bed was very comfy. We chose this hotel for it's location, as we'd stayed there before. The location is excellent. Just 2 blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The front desk staff were ok. Not hugely friendly, and the doormen weren't overly friendly either. We aren't sure if we'll stay at the East Side again. Not because of the hotel, but we want to stay in a different neighborhood

I have stayed at the Marriott East Side a few times now, and each time I am impressed with the staff. From the doormen to the concierge floor, the staff are friendly and helpful. You can't do much better for location - Lexington and 49th make walking to Times Square, the Park, shops, etc. a breeze. The gym requires a weird elevator change on the 32nd floor, but it is well kept and has good machines and free weights. It is certainly adequate for a few days. The lovely lady who cleans the gym is terrific and has a smile that will start your day off right. If you forget headphones, no worries as they provide them in the gym so you can watch TV on the cardio machines. The rooms are fairly typical Marriott rooms. No frills, but the beds are great and the rooms are clean and well kept. No complaints for this consistently excellent property.

This is an excellent hotel, in the heart of the very vibrant East Side. The room was surprisingly comfortable and roomy, for a New York hotel. (I had two double beds to myself.) And the hotel building, which dates back to the 1920s, but is very modern inside, is totally charming. Unfortunately, I have to give them a one-star decrement, for two reasons. First, a maintenance request (drainage problems, sink and tub) I made on the first morning of a three-night stay apparently went unheeded. And, please, $16.95 for in-room Wi-Fi? At these prices, they should be paying you.But I'd definitely consider staying here again.

I was in NYC for business and they selected this hotel for us. Looking for convenient, updated, clean and friendly. Got all of that. About 7 blocks off Times Square, 3 from the UN and 4 from Grand Central. No hassles whatsoever. The room was VERY well appointed and clean. I didn't try their bar or restaurant but for an accomodation, it was excellent. When i go back to NYC, I will try them first.

My parents and I stayed at the East Side Marriott for four nights in late April 2013. It's within the price range you'd expect for a hotel of that type in Manhattan, but it still felt expensive. I usually stay at Sofitel when I visit NYC but they could not accomodate 3 people in the same room, so I had to look eslewhere.The room was clean and comfortable but the screen thing on the radiator was busted. The room was quiet, we could not hear the other guests on our floor, but we could hear everything that was going on outside and I think our room was close to a loading area because we could hear trucks coming in very early in the morning.The location is great, close to MoMA, Bryant Park, the Empire State Building and two blocks from a subways station if you want to get off the beaten path.WiFi is $16.95 a day...I don't know if I'd recommend the hotel but I would not discourage anyone to stay there either. We were fairly satisfied with our stay.

We came to the Marriott to celebrate my mothers bday for a girls weekend in NYC. The staff was excellent everyone was very attentive and we had an amazing time. It is definitely worth paying a little extra for the quality of what we got!

Depending on the time of year, hotels can be quite expensive in Midtown. Managed to get a better rate than other comparable offerings in the area.Beds were comfortable and managed to survive a short stay (3 nights) considering an eight hour differential in time zones.They also did not charge for me to receive a couple of items from the mail room. This is a service that I would expect from a hotel at this level. I was charged at the Grand Hyatt New York which I will never stay at again because of the charge.
user_name:
gambit76
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Perfect for a work trip to NYC! Close to all of my meetings yet not totally in the thick of things. Walk to Grand Central is easy, as well as business meetings nearby. Staff was helpful, Wi Fi works, and there is a 24 hour 'mart right next door, so you'll be fine for any extras. Staff was helpful especially the outside staff who help with taxicabs. Keep up the great work, and I'll be back again soon!

Great hotel central to everything you need in the city. Rooms are nice and the staff is helpful. I wish there was more room in the lobby for sitting and lounging that was not necessarily in the bar. There is room for improvement there but all in all it is a nice location and I would certainly stay again.

We have stayed at least at least twice yearly for the last 15 years. We always loved the Old World Charm of the Lobby Bar. It has recently been remodelled to a very modern, sleek bar w/astonomical prices for a drink. The rooms are hit or miss and are quite expensive. We are Marriot Rewards members so usually get a room for free, but if you have to pay it is over $300. for a queen. Unfortunately, because of the bar, I think we have stayed our last time...looking for a new place to stay in Manhattan, even though it is very convenient to Grand Central and midtown shopping.
user_name:
Sally R
Wilton, Connecticut, United States

review_body: Nice room, good location, typical nice Marriott. We own Marriott, my wife is Platinum for Life, I am Gold so we are Marriott customers. However, when I spend that much money in NYC I expect the Conceirge Club to be open - this location closes the Club 130PM on Friday and doesn't open till Sunday! What is that?? Members earn the privilege and at a NYC hotel of this caliber the service should be exceptional...very disappointing! However...room and other services were OK.

The room (small) was over $500 for the night. Went to Business room to print out dinner reservatiions and had to pay $5 per 15 minutes internet access charge.really?no reason to go here again.on a positive note the bed was comfortable.

My bottom line expectation for business travel:1. Six hours sleep.2. No bugs.This hotel delivered on this expectation.Some color however:1. Everyone was fairly friendly, as contrasted to the reports I have read on this site. Kind of surprising since I have no real expectations in this regard, particularly in NYC.2. Breakfast was good. Fresh, well done. Wait staff by friendly and attentive.3. Three members of our team arrived after nine pm and were told they had no rooms despite confirmations. Although I didn't have this problem, this is pretty much unacceptable for business travel.4. As far as value, it is NYC so it is gonna be expensive. However, at these rates you can go to a much nicer hotel.5. The lobby is darkish, but plenty of seats and tables for coffee and impromptu meetings.6. Concierge level on 16 is nice. Really nice patio out the back of the room if the weather is nice. A little weird to pay $8.50 for a glass of wine in the concierge level, so I didn't. 7. Cell phone and Internet connection is okay, not great, calls cut out forcing me to take calls on hotel phone.So overall, if forced, I would stay he again but only after looking at all other options.

The room itself was very small in a European kind of way. Small but nice, with a nice TV and refrigerator. Very friendly nice service from the front desk, the bellmen and the concierge. When we first discovered that our room was directly across from the elevator, we were a bit worried that it would be very noisy. But it turned out that we didn't even hear a peep - from inside the room you never would have know how close we were. The bed was very comfortable. Couldn't quite figure out the air system. It would at times get a bit chilly, but the bed was cozy and warm so it was just a minor irritation.Overall it was a very nice stay. Great location, close to the subway and walking distance to many sites.

This hotel was recommended for business by people that my client and I were going to meet. While it was convenient to their offices, so was the Waldorf across the street, where I have stayed previously [on someone elses tab]. The lobby was nice, but the room was nothing special, and it was a corner room. I might have thought more about their use of the term "cozy," read small, to describe the king room.The bed was comfortable, but there was no water in the room, except for the tap, and the heater made a creaking and groaning sound every time it went on and off, which was frequently. They could also use a lot better soundproofing on the windows, as the streets far below, sounded like they were in the hallway.As my business companion noted, there are prices, and then there are prices, but $19.00 for two eggs, toast and coffee? Really? But, then again, they want to charge you virtually by the minute for internet access, unless you pay almost $17/day for "unlimited access." Why is it that Best Western and lower budget chains throw this in without charge, but when you are paying hundreds of dollars a night, they try to nickel and dime you for the same service? Let me know when you have an answer for that one, as it is a regular annoyance at the supposedly better chains of hotels.

No services at all. My husband is a platinum for Marriott and we get the worse service.....by experience we know new Yorker are not the most friendly people but when we ask for something, they just do not care.So location is great service is not the one expected for the price

The Marriott East Side is an Older Hotel at the corner of Lexington and 48th. The room that I had was very small on the 24th floor. The room was Ok but not the usual well design interior or the Marriott WOW factor. I have nothing to say about the Marriott personnel. Very accommodating and polite. However, for unknown reason they did not want to upgrade me even thought that I am a Platinum member with Marriott. The Gym is well equipped but very small. It ended up being very busy in the morning and even at the end of the afternoon. The concierge lounge is OK located on the 16th floor but again close in the week-end. I personally do not understand why Marriott close the lounge over the wee-end. I am not sure that I would go back. You are located about 15 to 20 min either from Central Park or Time Square and about 10 minutes from UN building. I ended up changingHotel to go to the Marriott Residence around the corner on 48th.

I frequently visit NYC for business and pleasure. This Marriott property is close to some of the city's main attractions (Radio City, Grand Central Station, and a few blocks away from Times Square). The staff was friendly and our room was always clean and comfortable while the noise level from the street was typical for NYC. If you have platinum status, you may certainly enjoy the food/snacks provided at the relaxing lounge upstairs. Overall, I recommend this hotel since I believe it provides a good value for the price.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
George M
New York, New York, United States

review_body: The location is great, a block from Grand Central Station. Starbucks, a restaurant, and bar on the main floor. 24 hour deli across the street. Surrounded by a lot of fancier hotels also, so there's fun people watching. This is a pretty standard hotel. I've stayed here a few times and I don't have any strong feelings about the place. One time I was stuck in a sad, cold, little room next to the elevator, so that was noisy and made me feel like an indentured servant, but my other stays were much more normal.
user_name:
annemarie626
New York City, New York

review_body: We are very satisfied with everything. The room was clean and comfortable, with blackout curtains and no noise! The staff was friendly and the location was close to Grand Central station and Radio City. There are lots of breakfast places all around, as well as good restaurants. We had come for a concert and the hotel was perfect for a late ending.

We were in NY for five nights with our grandson. We found the Marriott East Side to be a great location to be able to walk almost everywhere. Also close to subway access. A corner room provided nice light and space for three people. The bathroom was very small, but adequate. We particularly liked having access to the Concierge Lounge for breakfast and cocktail hour. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially Wade, who was a font of information about New York.

This is the hotel I have always stayed in when travelling to NY, and in accordance with Marriott tradition, the location is top-notch. The rooms are very comfortable, and the famed Marriott beds are hard to get up from, they are so cozy!!!I definately chastise this hotel (and any other) for not offering free WiFi for guests. I find it hard to believe that in this day and age they still charge ridiculous rates for internet connections, especially considering how much you pay for a night's stay!!Still, I will always enjoy staying here.

Stayed there for one night on a business trip. Very nice property, choose it based on location and price for NY. Room was clean and convenient, but interior and behind the eleveators so it was noisy in the rush hours. Nevertheless I slept well. Staff was attentive and very helpful.

Marriott East Side gave me the worst Marriott (across all brands) rooms I have ever had. I am Platinum Elite in their rewards program so 1) I get to see a lot of their hotels and 2) usually get the better rooms. My room was on the 5th floor and was small, dark and dingy. I was there for two nights for a business trip so the room was OK. It would not have been acceptable if I had been on vacation. The Concierge Lounge is big but the food and amenities there was average. It takes at least two different elevators to get to the gym. It is on the small side but the machines were of good quality. The best aspect of the hotel is its location. If I ever go back to this hotel, I would not accept a room below the 16th floor.

I stayed at this Hotel 5 nights in March 2013. I first stayed on the 13th floor I believe and I switched to 2803 for the last two nights. It was a corner room with a great view (picture provided). The location is great, I walked everywhere other than long distances (took a cab for those). It is an old building, but the looby and the rooms are nicely done. You have to pay for wifi in the room, but it is really fast. The elevator setup is a little odd, but no problems there. The fitness center is a little small, but adequate for most needs. The equipment is nice. I had dinner at the restaurant in the lobby, and it was delicious. The restaurant and bar at the lobby has a nice atmosphere, seems busy most of the time. Service was good, not great, but was enough for my needs. Would stay there again.

We stayed here over the Easter weekend in 2013. The location is great! It's a couple blocks from Grand Central Station, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and the famous shops on 5th Avenue. We were able to walk from the north end of Central Park, down 5th Avenue, and then back to our hotel which was pretty reasonable. The rooms were decent size for New York. The maid service left a little to be desired (didn't restock shampoos, left dishes in our room from previous days, rip in the sheets) but it was clean, quiet, and convenient. The fitness room was really cool (great view) and the breakfast buffet was nice (not included). Overall, we were very happy despite some of the missteps by the maids.

Stayed only one night, wanted a suite but they are located on interior light shaft - very dark and depressing. We changed to a corner room on a higher floor - very small, no room to open a suitcase.Bathroom was O.K.Dining room wasa good for dinner but beware breakfast - we had the buffet for 2, did not notice that they apply a 15% gratuity to the bill, ended up paying $66.00 for a very average breakfast. Later found a big inexpensive breakfast restaurant right across the street.This is an old hotel, similar to many in New York. They charge high rates but offer poor accomodation, but better value can be found elswhere.We moved to the Doubletree Times Square - great hotel in a very inconvenient location.

After staying several times at the Marquis and Renaissance Times Square, I was ready to do away with the overbearing crowds and overpriced area restaurants. This time I checked into the East Side Marriott and wasn't disappointed. At check-in I received a large king room on the 31st floor, overlooking Lexington Avenue. The bathroom was smallish but was fine. The condition of the room was excellent as was the linen and bed itself.The subway was a very convenient block and a half away, at 51st Street. Grand Central is a short walk to the south, at 43rd Street.The staff were great and accommodating. On the 16th floor was one of the largest Concierge Lounges I have seen at a Marriott and actually has an outside deck with tables. The lounge was well stocked and included hot breakfast selections, including scrambled eggs. There was a plentiful supply of bottled water and sodas in the fridge for us to take back to the room.As for location, it may not be for everyone. I actually liked it a lot because there's an ample supply of restaurants on Lexington Avenue, as well as one block down on 3rd Avenue. It's a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza and all things 5th Avenue. Getting to the theater district could be a strain so a taxi may be required, although we found no issue walking it.The bell staff was very good, especially Nelson, who suggested a limo service for the trip to JFK instead of a cab because the cost would be the same. I had him make the reservation and the car showed up exactly on time and had me to the terminal in 40 minutes.I hadn't visited the restaurant and therefore can't comment on it.I wouldn't hesitate to check into this property again, and most probably will in the near future.

We stayed at this hotel for a meeting. Rooms were quiet, clean and adequate, beds comfortable, sheets were nice. Not much of a view, but didn't spend much time in the room. Good location, walking distance to metro. Easy to hail a taxi. Longer walk to theaters. Efficient check-in. Staff friendly and helpful. Didn't dine here except for breakfast provided at the meeting which was fine. Drinks were expensive in the bar, but it's NYC. Fairly reasonable rate. Several restaurants nearby. Would stay again for meeting.

This a a good Marriott. Although, as far as Marriott hotels go, this one is average. If you are staying on points, choose another Marriott. There are plenty in the city. The courtyard hotels in the city are just as good. I wasn't too impressed with the executive lounge either.

This hotel rates high for location because it is across the street from the Waldorf Astoria, which puts it five blocks from the Rockefeller Center, 11 blocks from Times Square and Broadway, one block off Park Avenue, three blocks off Fifth Avenue and all of the shops and ten blocks from Central Park. The nearest subway is six blocks away at Grand Central Station. The rooms are average and the restaurant is very overpriced with a very limited selection. The exercise are on the roof (enclosed) is nice with a view of 49th and Lexington Ave. There is no pool or spa, a very, very small gift shop and little else. Fortunately there are plenty of restaurants very close by in all price ranges. The rooms are okay. Ours had a king bed, a refrigerator and coffee maker. Smaller than most rooms you find in less expensive hotels. The service was acceptable but not exceptional. Don't eat here unless you like to spend $70 for very little food. I recommend you book the room as part of a package if you are flying to NYC. Marriott and most of the airlines have packages available that save you over booking just the room. I booked through American Airlines and got the room, air and a private car from and to LaGuardia airport for far less than the room alone would have cost. We were able to walk everywhere except the 9/11 memorial. we used the subway to go there.

Stayed for two of the longest weeks of my life in this hotel courtesy of work. Had to move rooms due to groaning and clanging pipes all night long, then had the lovely pleasure of ordering room service and being provided with a salad full of rotten lettuce. Rooms were also very poorly insulated so you get to appreciate all the habitats of your neighbors. To top it off Internet costs you an extortionate 16.95 per day. Points for effort of the staff who provided a couple free drinks and some cheese to say sorry for the hassles but at the price they charge these shouldn't happen in the first place... Poor showing for a Marriott...

We have stayed here several times a year for many yrs , and have always been very pleased. Don't know what happened last week, but the room smelled musty and i could not sleep allnight due to the very LOUD air cond/ heat unit. So I do recommend the hotel from past experience but NOT room 926! PS parking went up to 60.00 fyi

We went here for my daughter's 16th birthday. We booked the room for a Saturday night and the price was decent, considering it was a weekend in NYC. We were within walking distance of times square, the Chrysler Building, and St. Paul's Chapel. The room was small, but you probably won't be spending all that much time in your room, except to sleep. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The offer bath and body works amenities!
user_name:
lilgoyl67
Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey

review_body: Bad location, watered down liquor drinks, corner small rooms, bad service and bad atmosphere. We havw stayed in new york city three times and this is the worst hotek. Could stay at a nicer place any other place. Nicer hotels for same price.

I stay at the Marriott East Side every March for the DCAT event at the Waldorf~Astoria. The price is better and it has less hustle and bustle.It was just renovated. The rooms, the lobby, bar and restaurant were all redone. They did a great job. I have been coming here for almost 25 years, and I can highly recommend this hotel on Lexington Ave.

Stayed here for 5 nights in March 2013. We had a large room on the 33 floor, which was spacious and very quiet. The concierge lounge was large pretty typical for Marriott properties. I love the position of the hotel in the city. Quiet yet one street off of Park, 10 minutes to Rockefeller Center, 15 to Times Square and Broadway and a wonderful 20 minute walk down Park to Central Park. This hotel is an excellent choice to enjoy the city...and quiet upon return.

A good place in the right area for NYC stays. Only thing to be careful of is the fact that rooms in the hotel can be very small (it is NYC). Did not get the Marriott amenity that we requested nor extra pillows that we requested but that seems to be Marriott standard now so that should not keep you from staying here. New lobby and bar area is a big improvement over what was there so an improvement in the follow through and service are the only thing to be really improved.

This was a very clean, updated hotel in the heart of it all. Walking distance to Grand Central Station, 5th Ave. shopping, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and more. We were booked for a standard king room but asked for an upgrade and got bumped up to a superior room (larger room) because of our Marriott status. The bed was really comfortable, bathrooms were a nice size and there was a fridge in the room (not a mini bar though). Would stay here again for sure.

Stayed for four nights, March 8-12. Had a king room on the 27th floor with a partial view of the Chrysler Bldg. it was very quiet for a NYC hotel, as we did not face Lexington Ave. Bed was comfy and room very clean. Bathroom smallish and old, but adequate. New, fluffy towels would have been nice, but seem to be hard to come by these days, probably where costs are being cut in the industry. A small mini fridge in the room ,plus coffee maker much appreciated. We enjoyed Room Service a few times, and the Elite Members Lounge. We would return to this property again. Thank you, Marriott.

I would happily stay here again but let me start saving the money first. We arrived by car which was $60per day for parking (city prices). I wish the floor was clean when I arrived. There wasn't much of it but what there is wouldn't have taken 2 minutes to run a vacuum over. You would think for $399 per night that internet would be included but no such luch $16.95 for 24 hours. Breakfast and entree room service expensive. Starbucks is only a hop over the road not even a whole block away. Shame it was raining, people everywhere grabbing taxis and crowding the roads and blocking the walkways with umbrellas. 14th floor was far enough away from the street to reduce the traffic noise a bit, higher better.

Mother daughter weekend with 4 young teens. This was perfect location for us to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Times Square, park ave, Rockafeller center, Central Park and FAO Schwartz. They accommodated our request for two connecting rooms. Lucked out that one was a corner room which is larger. Starbucks 1 block away and Duane Reade 2 blocks. I would stay here again!!

Upon arrival, the staff had all of our room keys readily available for almost 200 people. The staff was courteous and considerate. Room was clean and of the standard quality for a Marriott. There was a bar area with a minifridge that wasn't exactly cold and was quickly replaced when requested. The only complaint from many in the group was the water ran hot and cold in the shower. A lot of tourist sites are within walking distance or a short subway ride. The closest station being 2 blocks north. There is a pharmacy within 2 blocks to stock your fridge. Around the corner we enjoyed the Italian pizza at Apertivo.

We stayed at this Marriott for a night our recent night out... dinner, show, etc. Loved the location as it wasn't as crowded and touristy as staying in the Theater district or Times Square, but still close enough to walk to the theaters on a nice evening (which we did!) Standard king room was nice and clean, on the small side, but sufficient for what we needed. It even included a small fridge which was convenient for bringing along some cocktails and storing our delicious restaurant leftovers! Bed was extra comfy! Would definitely stay here again!

Spent one night at the hotel for a business trip. I would consider this an average hotel for the business traveler. The room was ok, nothing to write home about. Bathroom was a comfortable size and bed was very comfortable with a good size closet. The window coverings were not adequate for privacy. The elevators are very small which leads me to believe this was an old hotel that was renovated and they didn't bother to re-size the elevators. At least there were express elevators to the top floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful and check-in was smooth. Checkout was easy given I could do it via the TV. The only complaint I have is that they charge extra for using wifi. This is not at all convenient for the business traveler as it makes it that much more difficult to expense the extra charge. Although I found that northeastern hotels tend to nickel and dime travelers on charges whereas down south they're not as bad. Overall, my stay was pleasant and comfortable but doesn't rise to the level of 5 stars. This is certainly not a luxury property. Pretty much your standard NYC above average hotel in a convenient location.

Husband and I stayed here a couple of nights in March as my husband was having meetings a few blocks away. This hotel is located just a couple blocks from the subway which made it convenient to go explore the city as well as to make the trip back to JFKWe arrived early around 10am and are room was already ready so we were able to check in early before heading off of some sightseeing.Our room with a King Size bed was a corner unit with windows on two walls. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows which I prefer. Room was the perfect size for a couple. I would definitely stay here again.

Spent a weekend with friends at the New York Marriott East Side. The hotel met our needs and was in a good location. The rooms were a decent size for a NYC hotel and the bathrooms were larger than other hotels in NYC I've stayed in. The hotel elevators are small and older but added to the charm. Rooms were nicely appointed and clean. Check-in ran smoothly and staff were friendly. Rather than using valet parking, we found a coupon online at a parking garage a few blocks away and only paid $36 compared to $60 for overnight parking. It was an Icon garage on 54th street...Hotel is close to Subway and taxi cabs were accessible. As far as food, we had breakfast in the lobby restaurant and we all enjoyed our meal. Overall a great stay.

This hotel has a great location. It is not a luxury property but it is comfortable. I got a nice size room with two full size beds. The bathroom was small. It had good amenities and was relatively clean. The heating system is noisy but works well as does the lighting and the television. They give plenty of coffee. Breakfast is on the expensive side but hey... you are in New York. The staff does not volunteer to help but when asked to is quite helpful. A good hotel for business or leisure. I would stay here again if the price is right. The gym is small and you need to take three elevators to reach it although there is no extra charge. Interneti n the lobby is complimentary too. It is a bit noisy in the room.

We travelled to NYC over the March 1st weekend. All the staff were very friendly throughout our stay. We arrived early and had no issue with early check in. The room was very clean and linens refreshed daily. I found the hotel to be above average in these details. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the pillows - it was like sleeping at home!However, I did have a couple of issues. My first issue was I had to ask for the coffee to be replaced. The room had been cleaned, and for what ever reason, the coffee was not replenished. This request took about an hour. Second, we had brought wine glasses up to our room for the bar, in other hotels I have stayed I have done this, and when the room was cleaned, the glasses were cleaned also. This was not the case - not a big deal, but I was a bit surprised. Lastly, at about 4pm I called room service, because I was in need of champagne glasses, as we wanted to have a glass of Prosecco. Room service was not in operation until 5pm. So I called the front desk and asked if we could have the glasses brought to our room, as we were in the process of getting ready for an evening out. The answer was no. We had to wait for room service to open. It made me wonder what would have happened if I needed an extra towel or blanket?? Regardless, we thought we would have the prosecco when we returned. Upon returning to the hotel (about 10pm) I walked to the front desk prior to going to the room, and asked to have the champagne glasses. Again the response was great, not a problem it would be sent up right away. We waited for over 40 minutes - no glasses ever arrived. We gave up and went to bed. While these are "minor" issues - they were still very annoying. Were there things I could have done like called back down to the desk or gone to the bar myself? Sure...but as a guest I shouldn't have to.So to recap - Very Clean, very polite, very comfortable. But, the service end could be improved upon. One last observation: Just a tip - I paid less for my martini at Delmonico's Restaurant. They were identical Martini’s – Hendrick’s Gin, Dry, two olives. $22 for a Martini is outrageous.

We stayed here with my family to celebrate my mom's birthday, and it really was a perfect place for our purposes. (I should note that when I checked the box for a "family" trip, while we are a family, none of us are children so I don't have info on kids' activities.)Our group had two rooms: my parents had a double bed room and the other four of us in our party shared a room with two double beds. The first and possibly most impressive thing was the size of the rooms for a NY hotel. The four of us were able to stay comfortably in our room, and there was even enough room for my parents to come up and hang out in our room for a bit. My parents' room wasn't bad at all, either. The hallways were wide enough to make it easy to drive your suitcase around, and the elevators were remarkably quick and big enough that several of us could fit inside with luggage. This reduced the crunch you usually see around checkout time, or the need to let several elevators pass before you can go anywhere.The room and bathroom were both very clean. The shower was good - a little hard to regulate the water temperature at times, but good water pressure. The amenities generally were very nice and completely functional. Good hairdryer. No frills, if that's important to you, but it was not to us. There was also a mini fridge and safe in the room. We heard the road noise at night a little bit at night and the fridge kind of made noise, but it wasn't a huge deal, just possibly not the quietest room ever.The gym also was really big for any hotel, especially a city one. There were about three or four ellipitcals, two or three bikes and three or four treadmills, along with some weight machines and free weights. The only weird thing is that you have to switch elevators a few times to get there since it's on the 35th floor. But the view is great and the facility is worth the trip.All of the staff was incredibly nice. Our rooms were under one reservation and my parents had checked in the day before us. When we checked in, the staff remembered who we were and had everything ready for us right away. There's a little Starbucks/breakfast place in the lobby that turns into a bar later on in the day. Great place for people to chill out in the morning and wait for others in the group. They may have had wifi, but I'm not sure - saw lots of people on their computers in the lobby. The location of the hotel is also ideal because it's fairly close to walk to (or easy to take the subway or a cab to) pretty much all the things you might wish to do as a tourist (or in our case, a group of tourists). We sometimes needed more than one cab to get somewhere due to the size of our party, but never had to wait outside the hotel more than about 30 seconds to get as many cabs as we needed.I would definitely stay here again, with or without a group.

Incredibly spacious room with 2 double beds and a couch -- ideal for family of four in New York overnight for a weekend getaway. We arrived well before noon, and the Front Desk accommodated our early check-in so we could grab lunch and catch our Broadway matinee. Great location for midtown Manhattan activities. Would definitely consider staying here again.

I stayed three nights on a business trip. As a Marriott Platinum Exec member, they supposedly upgraded me to a deluxe (larger) room. It was small, but comfortable enough. However the bathroom was too small to be comfortable. I don't have that many toiletries, but there was no room to put any toiletries. The bathroom consisted of a tub/shower combination, toilet and sink with almost no counter space. I know this is New York, but smaller than other hotels I have stayed at in mid-town. I liked the location. Most other hotels are near Times Square and too busy and touristy. This is a quieter and nicer area, with a number of good restaurants nearby. During the time I was there, the Concierge Lounge got slammed in the morning and they had a very hard time keeping things picked up and stocked - not the best experience. I enjoyed a glass of wine in the lobby bar and found the service to be good and friendly.

Stayed at East side Marriott w/some of my girlfriends. Check in was smooth. My husband is platinum and talked w/Calvin about upgrade suite. We received a suite w/king bed and pull out couch on the 5th floor. Great big mirror in closet, frig,.comfy sheets & pillows. Toilet overly loud & Marriott robe has seen better days..looks more pink than white but overall great time, great room & staff. We also had breakfast downstairs very good and huge fan of the Starbucks coffee!!! Thanks for the upgrade Calvin. This is how platinum members should be treated! We will be back :)

I've stayed at this property for years and it continues to be a solid Marriott. Rooms are due for an upgrade however. They are fine but a bit dated. Concierge lounge staff is very nice and helpful. In fact, randomly the GM greets guests in the lounge which is a nice touch.

yes teh lobby is dated and dark but you dont sleep there. Rooms are large and decent, yes could do with some rennovating but still far from being tired.Staff friendly and good at whatthey do. Restaurant staff wre a little preoccupied with the Superbowl but that is to be expected.Good loctaion and great rates so would use it again.

Great business hotel, very efficient, clean, friendly greeting by doorman, helpful staff. I have stayed here several times and found it to be a good hotel as long as you get the club access. Without the club access it is sorely missing the experience. The lobby has nothing to it and so without club it is not the same vibe at all. Club is on the 16th floor and is fantastic. I find that I don't have to eat out much at all if I have club as the meals are filling. I've had macaroni and cheese, cheese and meat plates, chicken Caesar salad, made-to-order eggs, pasta, on various different days. Fabulous. Sad that the patio is closed on a day when it is 60 degrees out. Hope it reopens later. The patio is also a plus. You can sit on a sweet little table and enjoy some air, which is a rare privilege. There is also an exercise club on the higher floors. This week they welcomed guests with a treat for Black History Month - a nice touch!Sounds like a minor thing but it feels like a message that Bravo TV is not available... this is probably the most popular TV station for women these days and there are a zillion sports and news channels. Keep in mind that your business women and travelers both would enjoy a few hours of Bravo during their stay....

I stayed at this location last weekend; the property is very clean and rooms are comfortable. The staff was very helpful; however they did not have enough staff on duty to assist during check-in. The hotel is in need of upgrades and is very dark compared to newer properties. I would stay here again for a short stay 1-2 nights; however I would try the Marriott Marquis for a longer stay.

We stayed there for a total of 8 nights during our recent trip to NYC. The rooms are clean and the house keeping is very consistent unlike other hotels. Nice location with the train station just a block away. Staff in general were very helpful.

Located very conveniently near the major transportation spots, yet in very quiet area, Marriott on Lexington Ave is a great choice to stay. The rooms are spotless clean, staff extremely courteous and professional. Nice gym on the roof with nice view and decent number of cardio machines, recently renovated lobby area with great bar and cafe serving Starbucks coffee. I stayed here several times and definitely coming back!
user_name:
EURESES
Manhattan, New York, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott East Side for 2 nights on a recent weekend away without the kids. We have stayed in the Times Square area in the past and, this time, wanted to try to get away from the insane crowds and noise. The Marriott is good 15-20 minute walk from Times Square, so if you are planning on staying in the Times Square area your entire trip, the East Side may not be your best bet. For us, though, we went to museums and restaurants and did some shopping in lower and upper Manhattan, so the proximity of the Marriott to a bunch of subway lines was a big plus (you can pick up the 6 train 2 blocks north or the E train 3 blocks north). Our room was typical Manhattan size (i.e., small) and did not have much of a view, but it was clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was all marble. The exercise room, which is on the roof, is well-equipped and has great views. There is a nice bar/lounge area in the lobby where we had a few drinks (note: they charge typical inflated Manhattan prices). It took less than 2 minutes for the front desk to check us in, and we were able to leave our bags when we checked out and pick them up at the end of the day.

Rooms are typical in size for older buildings in cities like NYC and Chicago. Room was very clean and well appointed despite the size and lack of view (room 1222). It's noisy, but its NYC. Room service was prompt and complete. Rockefeller Center just down the street and you can walk there. Many folks who travel to NYC do so for work or to sight see vs stay in their hotel. This Marriott serves those purposes nicely.

My stay at the Marriott East Side was awesome! The staff was beyond accommodating to any needs my family and I had. The lobby was spotless along with our room, and the location was perfect! The bell hops were seriously the best, I don't remember their names but the one that helped me on New Years Eve find a cab on obviously the busiest night ever, you are fabulous!The only issue that I had was that the lobby bar closed at 10 on New Years Eve, somewhat inconvenient for some of my family that wanted to stay in and just grab drinks at the hotel.

I booked this hotel on Priceline as it was last minute for work and many places were sold out. I have had the terrible experience of staff treating you poorly and giving you the worst room in the building when they see you have "pre-paid". The staff hear treated us like we paid for the penthouse, not matter where we went. The room was clean and a decent standard for NYC standards. The lobby was beautiful and the bar and restaurant modern with good selections. Starbucks coffee onsite was a nice touch as well. Did not have to wait long for our car as we called 15 minutes ahead of time. The only real shock was the $60 for overnight parking. I travel to the city a lot for business and this is the highest rate I have paid. Besides that for $175 all of the staff was very gracious, hospitable an helpful and the rooms great.

We were impressed from the start by the great location and high quality of the hotel. Its an older building but our room at the front of the hotel, that had recently been refurbished was like new and spotlessly clean. It was a little small for 4 , but this is NYC. The staff were friendly and very professional, check in, check out and valet parking were all trouble free. We opted for the buffet breakfast option when we made the reservation. Choose this option if you can! The breakfast was an experience in itself, well prepared fresh food! Great selection, something for everyone, yes even the vegetarians came away satisfied. Recommended!

This Marriott East Side is in a great location for touring and shopping. The front desk was friendly and efficient, and the room was well-equipped. My only complaint is that Marriott continues to charge for Internet and does not provide WiFi in the rooms. All in all a great experience!

Stayed one night at the Marriott East Side and was impressed with the staff and the service. We were greeted each time we came and went by the friendly staff. The housekeeper on our floor even stopped us to ask if we had everything we needed! The Hotel is in an older building which gives it character. We had a Cozy King Room on the 27th floor. Although the room was smaller than some are accustomed to, it was immaculately clean with a large closet. Ample room for two people with a desk, coffee stand with refrigerator below, and comfortable chair with ottoman. The bathroom was spotless and appeared to be brand new. Afternoon bar service in the lounge was prompt and friendly. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good and service was very high standard. Check-in and out was a breeze for us.

Stayed here as an alternative to the Renaissance a few blocks north. While the location isn't bad, the hotel didn't blow me away. While the room is a decent size, the bathroom was small. Overall, the room isn't terrible, but it was a little depressing having a window with no view that lets little to no light in. Convenient if you have plans to sleep in every day. The concierge lounge is fairly spacious serving your average fare, but the omelet service at breakfast on the last Wednesday of every month is nice. Too bad it isn't more frequent.

I have stayed at over 50 Marriott hotels across the world and this seemed to be the smalled room of any. Great hospitality, although 20 minutes to check in, excellent location, usual high Marriott standards.

Good location for midtown business. About four blocks to Grand Central Station if you want to take a train somewhere. I like to take the bus from the Airport to Grand Central; more comfortable than a taxi and cheaper ($13 from Laguardia). Nice bar in the lobby. Rooms are small but that's typical in NYC. Old fashion steam heat is a little noisey but works fine. Very clean. Bed comfortable. I paid $259 / night pre tax as part of a group.

We stayed here for our son's 21st bday. What a great surprise. Our room with two double beds was spacious and lovely. Comfy beds and very clean. Definitely would stay again. Excellent staff. So friendly!!

We had the pleasure of an exemplary front-desk staff, in particular Lucy and Denise, from the minute we arrived at this comfortable, clean, and friendly hotel. They might say they are only doing their job, but I stay in a lot of hotels, and I never receive such a warm welcome as we experienced on this weekend getaway.Of course it was a Holiday. We were offered a wine and cheese intro to settle in with, came down to the Lobby to join a gathering of returning shoppers being welcomed with a chocolate fountain of dip-your-own-fruit. Adults and children alike were indulging...It was festive; it was friendly.The Concierge desk was knowledgeable and helpful about the goings-on the town. He really seemed to care. However, the lounge was very pricey; next time, we'll probably find another place to have some cheer.I definitely look forward to another stay at the East Side Marriott. The comfort zone was huge. Special thanks to Lucy and Denise. Regards, Nancy and Frank D.
user_name:
Nancy D
Long Island City, New York

review_body: I like the East side Marriott, it is my hotel of choice for business travel when I am in NYC. The hotel is located near a lot of offices so its perfect for the business traveler, yet it is still within walking distance to all the sites. The hotel itself is nice, the rooms can be a little small, but overall it is usually clean and comfy. The staff is hit or miss, I find if you ask, they are accommodating. They rarely anticipate your needs or go above and beyond (although there are two or three staff members that do).

I stayed there for the second time after 2012 for a trade show I attended in NYC.The staff is friendly and helpful, my rooms were small but clean and well maintained. I used the bathtub for a bath which is my indicator for a clean bathroom :-)The gym is small as well but well equipped offering free water and headsets for the machines.I received a free 2 pm late check out.If in NYC I would go back.

I have stayed here four times over the past five years. The rooms, lobby and overall appearance is very clean and the location is great. The big negative and I mean really big is the restaurant which is awful. After three great stays there with nice experiences in the restaurant for breakfast and once or twice for dinner, the restaurant changed names and apparently personality. The manager was arrogant and oblivious to the simple idea of making sure a party of four could be seated in a near empty restaurant. Once seated, we were ignored for fifteen minutes.....no water, no service, nothing!! We had to get up fom the table and ask who our waiter was. Once we ordered dinner, the food took fifty minutes to arrive and was barely passable in terms of preparation. By any standards, this was bad. I decided to complain to the hotel manager since the restaurant manager was someone who does not belong in a marriott. I was compensated by being given 10,000 additional Marriott Rewards Points. Despite this nice gesture, the experience was so bad it makes this hotel a no-go on my next trip to New York. Marriotts are great hotels but a hotel in a major city MUST have a decent restaurant that makes you feel welcome.

Enjoyed our stay here recently. Had a room on the 21st floor that was VERY quiet, clean and comfortable. Check in was easy. Few issues except we werent aware that Marriotts in NYC do not open their exec lounges on weekends and do not comp breakfast for Gold members. We thought this was strange given the numbers of tourists coming in on weekends. In any case, the manager was respectful, helpful and rectified the situation. We found the breakfast excellent and the wait staff terrific. All in all a great stay. Thank you.

Stayed at this hotel for one night while traveling on business. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was small (typical size for the city) very clean, and look like it had been recently remodeled. Bed was comfortable, room heat was easily controlled. I had breakfast from the menu in the hotel restaurant. The food was very good and the staff was exceptional. If this hotel location is convenient for you I highly recommend it.

Nice rooms concierge floor very goodWas there during hurricane sandyVery accommodating Used points to cover stayWould recommend to allRooms could have been largerNeeds upgrading for amenities carpeting elevators towels and linens

Out of all the Marriotts in the city, I think this one is the most charming. I enjoyed our stay here Christmas week, though a few things were bummers. 1. we had concierge floor access, but it was so crowded whenever we went there, that we were never able to find a place to sit and enjoy. We would take our snacks and go back to the room. 2. the water never got hot enough. That may be because the hotel was clearly booked solid, but still, don't the manage hot water for full capacity? I enjoyed the location, since I know the East Side very well. And the service was nice. Rooms were good, beds comfy, everything was in typical consistent Marriott form. If the hotel wasn't as crowded, I probably would not have complained about the hot water and lack of seats in the concierge floor.

Used some of my Marriott points to stay at the Marriott East Side earlier this month for one night. Pros: the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, location ideal for Times Square and Upper East Side. Cons: ended up with teeny tiny "snug king" room (or whatever they call their small king-bed room) which faced a brick wall out of an even smaller prison-sized window. Room was so small, they should be ashamed for asking someone to pay several hundred dollars for that! We ended up switching rooms to an equally small yet somehow more spacious "snug king" room, which at least faced outward to the street. Honestly, for the price you pay at this hotel, there are far better options in New York.

I tend to avoid this Marriott when we go to NYC b/c it feels so old and dated, and the rooms are small (which comes with the territory of staying in Manhattan -- but this Marriott seems to have the smallest rooms of all the full service Marriotts in NYC). However, we got a stellar rate, so we opted to stay there. I convinced myself the good location would make up for the dated and small rooms.I expected bad service based on TA reviews here, but the bellmen and front desk were always pleasant and helpful. So that wasn't an issue. If you don't care about ambience, decor and room size, then you may find the good location of this hotel to fit your needs. It's right in midtown and close to subways. We were upgraded to a corner room which had more space. I don't mean to sound ungrateful, but I couldn't feel completely relaxed in this hotel because of the dated rooms, the creaky old elevators, and the overall congested feeling of this hotel. Pro's: - in midtown Manhattan -- which would be ideal for first time tourists who want to be near the sites. - close to subways- concierge lounge is spacious and modern, which makes for a great escape to relax in since your own room will feel cramped and old. Con's: - old, dated, small rooms. - old, cramped elevators (our elevator wouldn't move after more people got on. luckily, the doors opened and we were able to get out!).
user_name:
travlnfoodie
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for business recently. I found that the rooms were very dated, and only moderately clean ( there was a hair on my duvet and hair on the bathroom floor). The views are suboptimal and the street noise is significant. No free wifi in the rooms either. You can do better for the price in NY.
user_name:
j c
New York City, New York

review_body: Went for a 4 night trip to NYC with friends and stayed in the Marriot Hotel East side. It there was 5 in our party with 2 rooms, rooms were a workable size especially for New York standards. What was best was the location of the hotel it is very central, but outside the hustle of times square. The hotel was clean and had an average size bathroom. However we had to request to move rooms as we were in the left hand side back of the hotel and it was very very noisy. We were moved to quieter rooms at the right handside of the hotel. VERY BIG THANKS to the hotel for this. breakfast was included in the price of our room, it buffet style had wide selection of foods with pancakes and waffles cooked to order, fresh fruit and cereals. Overall it was a very good base for what was a girls shopping trip.

I've stayed here on multiple occasions and have generally had a positive experience. The hotel has a good location, outside of the hustle bustle of Times Square, but still central. The lobby renovations look terrific. However, on this visit I upgraded to a "Larger" Guest Room. This was a mistake. Apparently, all of the "Larger" rooms are in the same vertical line of rooms. Although I had asked for a room on a higher floor in my profile, I was first given a room on the 8th floor. The room was large and newly renovated, but not surprisingly, it was easy to hear significant street noise. In addition, on my first flush, the toilet did not work and a loud whirring noise resulted without an actual flush. I went to the lobby to request a room with a functioning toilet and on a higher floor. I was then sent to the 15th floor. Although it was somewhat higher, this room was significantly worse. This was obviously an older renovation, but aside from that, had several major defects. First, the wi-fi did not work (it kept kicking me off the site). When I called the operator, the hotel transfered me to some third party company that kept me on hold for about five minutes, and then told me it would take 30-45 minutes to test, and asked that I keep trying to use the wi-fi so that they could see what the problem was. Ultimately, they could not solve the problem. Second, the pipes banging behind the bathroom would periodically but regularly bang every few seconds. I went back to the lobby and spoke to Chris at the front desk. Chris advised that I should call back from my room when the banging was occurring and he'd send maintenance. He also denied that he was aware of a wi-fi problem. When I asked for a room with functioning wi-fi and no pipes banging, he told me that all of the rooms that are the size I booked were on the same vertical line and that it wouldn't change anything to move. He made no effort to move me and was seemingly unconcerned about these issues.I resigned myself to no wi-fi and a loud night. In addition to constant banging of pipes (audible even with the bathroom door closed), the 3 am garbage pickup which seemed to last about 30 minutes was the topper. Bottom line is that I was very disappointed with the room and very disappointed with the hotel's attitude when I ran into problems. I will not be returning anytime soon...

This hotel is in a great location, with very nice, large rooms (for NYC). The staff is very professional, friendly, and attentive. A better value than other hotels in the neighborhood, and you get the elegance without the attitude. I stay here a couple of weeks per year and always enjoy my stay. That's what makes this hotel an excellent option.

Great location, with a few cons. 1) Staff not so friendly they were always in a bad mood and always asking for extra tip even duo in all services the 15% tip is included. 2) no free Internet access in the rooms. 3) really expensive breakfast ($50 per person) and for a terrible buffet.

Spent 2 nights at this hotel. It was on points so don't know what usual rates are. My room on the 22nd floor had 2 windows and views: one of the heating unit on the roof(ugh) and the other of the Chrysler Building(fantastic!) Room was modern and clean. Bathroom was modern and up to the standard of a Marriott property. Room was very quiet, the air conditioning/heating unit both in room and on roof was not loud. Big comfortable bed. Nice atttractive lobby. Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on restaurant/bar.Good location; a short walk to Grand Central Station and subway lines. Easy to get to major tourist areas if that's what you want. Taxis always available and doormen always asked if I needed one when I was leaving the property. My one complaint would be the $16.95 charge for wi-fi (which I did not pay). I just think we've reached a point where we all need wi-fi and it should be a basic amenity.

Just came back from a 4 night break and stayed here.Lovely clean hotel. Very busy in the foyer at times but nothing that was a problem, but once up in the room you wouldnt realise it. So quiet.Room so clean and well appointed. Only grip i would of liked a mini bar not just a fridge. I think this kind of hotel you expect it. A little drink before going out is sometimes nice. :)Certainly would book again.

This 5 night stay was my first visit to this hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly. My initial reaction to the room was disappointing as the window was open (and it was 37 degrees outside) so the room was very cold when I arrived and looked a bit outdated. I was going to ask for another room but instead just turned on the heat and put on a jacket for about 20 minutes until it warmed up....probably just a goof up, but not a great start to the stay.The staff were very pleasant at the hotel. Rooms were clean and housekeeping was very good. Bed was comfortable. Wireless internet was not good in the room (would only work in certain parts of the room), which was inconvenient. Had dinner one night and breakfast a few days in the hotel and food was fine. Nice hotel workout/gym room. All in all, an okay choice.

This hotel as a convenient location and I would stay here again if the price was right, however the rooms and hallways are a little outdated....somewhat like a pre-war NYC apartment with small bathrooms, old plumbing, old windows and fixtures.

We were lucky to have the opportunity to spend the night in one of the suites on 12/31/12 (concierge floor) thanks to a very good friend. It was absolutely beautiful and large enough to accommodate 4 adults easily. We enjoyed the heated terrace as well.Service was excellent and it was very nice to be able to dine on breakfast the next morning form the breakfast buffet too. Location was perfect to access Grand Central Station and to visit the tree at Rockefeller Center without any hassles. Thank you!

Stayed 3 nights for business. Room was a bit small but fine for business travel. Hotel is very clean and service is good. The bar/restaurant has a great work table with plugs and connections to work which we used a lot. Location is great though.

This was our 2nd NYE in NYC staying at the Marriott East Side. It is a very short easy walk from Grand Central, blocks from 42nd Street, Times Sq. etc. T stops easily accessible. It is a little out of the "crazy" tourist area so you don't have to be shoulder to shoulder with people as you try and enjoy the city. The rooms are small but do the trick and who wants to stay in their room when you are in NYC? I was surprised that on the 31st floor we could hear the street traffic but it was really just subtle background noise. Highly recommended!

The staff is stone faced and uncaring. The hotel is very out dated and the concierge offers bare bones - you even pay for your drinks while Margaret keeps guard. The pastries are cold and hard. Room service is very slow. Avoid this hotel at all costsPierre Montiege Dec 29 2012

Stayed here one night after a flight schedule issue following Sandy. Great hotel. Staff really friendly and Check in and out was easy.Great room - very comfortable with some thoughtful touches and great beds. Bathroom great and cleanliness great.Very safe and comfortable hotel. Great experience had here. Recommend.

Positives1. heated lamps at entrance2. clean lobby area3. clean room and plenty of towels4. location to midtown restaurants and events5. Collette at Front Desk - sympatheticOkay1. check-in efficiencyNegatives1. expensive based on the room quality2. plumbing issues (leaking sink, SLOW shower drain, shower diverter needed repair)3. called maintenance; claimed that they fixed it; plumbing issues were worse after he was there

A bit on the expensive side but we were in Manhattan! A very comfortable stay, the hotel is clean good and very agreeable the hotel staff were grenerally friendly but the bar staff were super friendly, and very helpful. The positioning is great near almost all important shopping and restaurant places, easy walking distance to UN and some great restaurants.

MAGNIFICANT Hotel!!!I communicated with the General Manager, Chris Hosmer and the Concierge, Harriett Goldberg by email before my arrival. They each were very responsive with the Marriott excellence I have come to expect over the last 29 years. When my fiancée and I arrived, we were greeted by none other than the GM himself, who was out on the street, welcoming guests. I don’t often see this and right away I knew this guy was the best. He warmly greeted us, remembered us and made sure we were taken care of at the front desk. Jimmy (I think) was the bellman and he took our many many (too many) suitcases and also made us feel at home.Later on, we met Calvin in the Concierge Lounge, who had remembered us (I guess from an email from the GM). Chris told me about you and your fiancée. Calvin was awesome and treated all the guests like royalty, going the extra mile to make sure they had the very best he could offer.
