Later that day I caught the GM helping rearrange the chairs in the Concierge Lounge and said to myself, “A hands-on manager –THEY are the best of the best. NOW I know why these employees are even above the normal Marriott Excellence”. He gets out of his office to mingle and be a part of the team. Last night we came into the lobby and were greeted by Moet Chandon Champagne and small French Macaroons. FIRST CLASS!!! This really made us take even deeper notice of the class of this hotel. We will be here for a week and are very glad we chose this hotel. Previous trips to NYC have included the Marquis, Financial Center (now called Downtown), Word Trade Center, Fairfield Inn 5th Avenue, Residence Inn Times Square, Courtyard Jersey City. I think this will now be our first choice for all of our next visits to the city we love New York!
user_name:
Byron C
Nassau, New Providence Island

review_body: Nice hotel with very good service. The hotel was full and the lobby had a chocolate fountain with fruit dipped for guests. They also had Christmas characters in dress in the lobby for pictures with guests children. Ate breakfast at 525 Lex several times which was very good all three times. Location is good, easy access to midtown, Central Park and other attractions. I do receommend this hotel. If you get a room with a window on Lexington Ave, expect noise from the street. You can hear it in your room. If you need a very quiet room, get one with no street view.

A second visit this year was just as good. What I like about this hotel is that it has a warm intimate feel and the service is very good. It is a pre-war building that has been well-maintained. great location for trains. Christmas is crazy busy in NYC and this place makes for a nice retreat!

Hotel was very nice and in a great convenient neighborhood. The rooms were clean and comfortable just like any Marriott. Only problem was the elevators. Half the time only one or two were functional. This left my family of 4 deciding to climb 12 flights if stairs up and down rather than wait the 5-10 minutes for an elevator with enough room for us. We didn't mind the exercise but my kids complained a bit. Would definitely stay here again. Got a fantastic rate for the days dec 20-24.

we have traveled to NYC many times and understand that it always chaotic at Christmas.Hotel was full to overflowing.But the service was fine and attentive.Had a quiet room (ask for courtyard side not Lexington ave) Elevatorsare small and only go up so far. Three different elevators are needed to get to the gym on the 36th floor.The gym does have views. overall nice hotel in a really GREAT location.

Love this hotel. It is not fancy smancy, but it is just good quality and impecable service. Gym was clean and cool. Treadmills all worked and each had its own TV. If I recall correctly, they even had BRAVO (yes I watch the housewives, they are my "twinkies") to contrast with the WSJ. I will definitely stay there again!!

When we checked in, our room requirements, although noted on the reservation were not available. My husband was not coming in for several hours and they refused to check me and my children in when we arrived because my last name was different from his although I presented a credit card with the same account as my husbands. Since he travels and we have been married for 20+ years, I have checked in many times without him present but not at this hotel. I understand security however I presented ID which should have satisfied the requirement. We had three children with us and wanted connecting rooms. Instead, we got two rooms on the same floor located on opposite ends of the building. One of the rooms was located next to the elevator which we specifically requested a quiet room away from the elevator which was also noted on the reservation. The room was extremely noisy with the noise from the elevator shaft and guests getting off and on the elevator. The heater also did not function properly. The room would be extremely hot and then get extremely cold. The toilet also would fill intermittently due to a leaky valve in the tank. Eventually, I had to close the bathroom door to eliminate the noise.When we went to get our car from the valet, they told us it would be 15 minutes instead we waited an hour and were told ever ten minutes that they lost our car. When the car arrived, it was warm inside and a different radio station other than what was programmed was playing indicating that someone had been using the car for awhile.

Overall we had a good stay. I booked my room through the marriott website and was able to get a pretty good rate. We had three rooms for our family: two "cozy king" rooms and one room with double beds. The cozy kings were pretty small. The rooms were relatively nice; no major complaints. The elevators were slow. Some parts of the hotel seem "tired" and "worn". Hotel employees were friendly. The lobby itself really does only have two chairs. Their is a bar that has more seating. Location of the hotel is good. I would consider staying here in the future, but I would definitely also check out the rates of nearby hotels.

The room was very small. If you did not shower by 7 am you would have a cold shower. Mgt says they know about the problem but are doing nothing to resolve the issue. We paid $450 per night for the concierge room not worth the money The concierge is closed on sat and sun. All they offer is eggs and oatmeal for breakfast. It is nice to get coffee and soft drinks free if they are open. It is an old hotel in need of renovation not worth the money. I am a Marriott time share owner and have stayed in many Marriott hotel including Marriott court yard. I am very disappointed with the room and would stay elsewhere. They put this hotel as a category 7 I am sure it's because it's in new York it more like a category 4. I do not recommend this hotel you can stay in other hotels and save your money I am very disappointed.

We booked on Kayak/expedia for a room with two double beds. When we arrived, the available room had a king size bed only. The hotel was full. We were under the impression that the room with two beds was guaranteed. Read the small print on Expedia contracts. it is NOT. The only way to make sure that you have the room you want is to book it directly with the hotel. The manager (after we were pretty insistent about getting two beds) gave us a room with two beds for two of the three nights. Therefore I would say that the hotel was flexible. The room we had was a corner room with a view of the east river. Nice. The location is superb. The room was clean and beds comfortable. It is particularly close to the bus stop for EWR, making it very convenient and cheap if you are flying into EWR.

Location is Wonderful! walking distance to many must see sights of New York. Staff was great and very friendly. Rooms were small but we didnt spend much time in them. The bar down stairs was convenient. Lots of choices for food conveniently located within a few block radius. About a 30min / $65 cab ride to JFK (we hit very little traffic on our ride)

A perfectly located hotel for walking a good deal of Manhattan and convenient to the subway. Shopping venues, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall and great restaurants are all within a few blocks. The big positives are the location and the front door staff. After that, it's a mid-tier experience Marriott hotel. We had stayed at the Carlton on the lower east side the night before (the room there was about $200 less for a Staurday night) and the experience there was a bit better. The concierge lounge is nice and roomy and breakfast choices are good. A downside on our visit was the absence of an umbrella in the closet or complimentary ones available at the front desk. It was funny to note that guests at surrounding hotels came out with hotel umbrellas.

Marriott has upgraded this older hotel. Because of its age the rooms are generally on the small side along with closets and bathrooms unless you upgrade to a junior suite which is nice size but expensive. The elevators are small making waiting a frequent occurrence especally at check out. Start early if you have a time to be somewhere. They are frequently full when they get to the lower floors. Hotels is within walking distance to Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave Stores. The lobby is small and usually crowded. If the location is where you need to be it is OK.

Hotels ramp up their prices at this time of year, but I got a good room rate for my overnight stay. Room was cosy, with a view of other rooms. Amenities, including the iPod player were much appreciated. The power shower was excellent. My only tiny gripe?Internet at $17 was (I felt), expensive as was the burger in the lounge ($29 with a soda and fries). That said, I will happily return if rates are good when I am looking for value.
user_name:
Pi31415
South East England, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed in #934 and it was one of the quietest rooms I've stayed in anywhere, until the baby moved in next door. Friends staying on the 22nd floor noticed street noise. Room was comfy and clean. We stayed in the "cozy" room and found it reasonably spacious by NYC standards. The bathroom was tiny, but manageable. Location was very convenient.

We had the tastes check in ever in our travelling life! Super efficient. It was good to be back in a Marriott they never excite but they are home form home and thats just what was required form this trip. Rooms comfortable and spacious for new york. It is great that there is free wifi for guests in the lobby but tiresome someone like Marriott doesn't break the mould and stop charging outrageous connection charges for wifi in the room - I would be happy to pay a reasonable amount per day say $5 but no more. This is why I have only awarded 4 rather than 5.Cleaning service excellent. Doormen friendly, concierge helpful front of desk staff efficient and courteous. There was a banging noise throughout the night that we did not report until the end of our stay so our fault for not addressing it sooner. Perfect location for a tourist - central to everything nearby Grand Central for connections and a great connection 2 blocks away via subway and airtrain to JFK in less than an hour for $7.75

My husband, daughter and I visited NY over the thanksgiving holiday to celebrate a birthday. We attempted to book the Mariottnin Time Square as we stayed there previously but wee unable to get a room for the dates we needed. I booked the East Side hoping for the same serive and type of rooms. WE Were extremely happy with both at this hotelCheck in was extremely quick suprisingly considering it was a holiday weekend. We even arrived about 4 hours before our designated check in time and our room was ready. The lady behind the desk was extremely sweet and courteous to my daughter wishing her a wonderful birthday. Our room was a king size bed room. It was a bit Small of a room...however it was extremely comfortable and Clean. I knew prior to booking that the rooms were a bit small because the building is historic thus the rooms are different than the newer sections of the hotel or newer hotels. The rooms. Comfortably fit all three of us and to be honest we usually spend very little time in the room when I. NYC We had ONE PROBLEM when in this room which worked out to our benefit because of the wonderful customer service at the hotel. At about 3:00 AM there was a noise of banging pipes possibly the heater or water. The next morning we politely complained and the manager immediately told us that he was sorry and moved us the another room....he even UPGRADED the room to a Suite at no extra charge! The man who moved our luggage told us that our room was in the older portion of the building. In any event the situation was handled wonderfully checkout was quick. However,we waited a while for our car to be brought in from the garage (about 25 minutes). The hotel in response deducted a day from our parking fee without our even asking for a deduction. I highly recommend this hotel!!!
user_name:
Alexa I
North Conway, New Hampshire

review_body: We've have stayed in the New York Marriott East Side the second week-end of December for the past 8 or 9 years. One would hope the hotel would make an effort to reach the minimum services Marriott offers its best customers. Not this hotel. Front desk is very patronizing and, inspite of the "Oh we're so glad you're here and thanks for being so loyal to Marriott' assigns run of the house room on a lower floor where there's lots of street noise. Housekeep is non-repsopnsive to requests - heck, even in New York they should be able to deliver a towel in less than 3 hours. The music is unbearably loud in the gym and the lower floor elevators stop once every 3 days. It goes on and on. Breaking up is always hard to do but next year when we return we'll stay around the corner at the Hyatt where the rooms and service have to be better than this.

My best friend from NC was visiting me in NJ and we took an overnight trip to NYC and we always stay at the Marriott. This one in particular is in a great location, few blocks from Central Park and Broadway and Time Square. Great location and great price. Doormen and front desk help were very polite and happy. Room was clean and updated, our room was on the small side, but we were just there to sleep and the beds are super comfy ! It was a perfect night stay in NYC
user_name:
Kristin F
Cherry Hill, New Jersey

review_body: Really nice staff, clean, and great location. Right in the middle of it all- can walk or catch a subway to most anywhere in NYC here. Typical New York hotel, rooms are not real large but they are comfortable and clean. Recommend this property without reservation

Marriotts are consistent. Clean and with good service. This one is no different except for 2 issues upon leaving. The first issue was that we were missing one of our bags from the bell hop when he retrieved them. I guess these types of issues happen, and it was resolved. My bigger concern is seeing the system for holding these bags. They were in a conference type room, all over the floor. It appeared disorganized, and proved to be so when we were missing a bag upon leaving. Then the valet. Yikes. waited an hour for our car. I realize they park it offsite, but come on man. Found out shortly after that they never called in for the car until we reminded them 45 mins into it. I wont stay at this marriott again, but I'm especially bothered because I stay at marriotts all the time for work and leisure. I want to be loyal to the brand, but they have to be better than this.

We stayed in July (see previous review) and returned in December. We were paying for the first night and using Marriott Reward Points for the 2nd and 3rd. For the first night we had a Junior Suite, which was a courtesy upgrade by Marriott. That was a very nice perk for being a rewards member. It was an awesome room with French doors between the living room and bedroom. The living room had a comfortable pull out sofa, television, chest of drawers, and desk. The bedroom had two doubles and television. The best part of this room was that the vanity was outside of the bathroom, so that we could be more efficient with our time.Unfortunately, we had to move rooms for the two nights using points, which meant we had to check out in the morning and check back in at 4 PM. We were gone all day, so that part wasn't a problem, but it was just a little annoyance. We had to wait on our luggage to be brought back up and ask a couple of times for a rollaway. This was a standard room with two doubles. The rollaway was a tight fit between the wall and one bed. It was too short for a grown person. The bathroom in this standard room was very small and had the vanity inside.The front desk, bell hops, and doorman are all friendly (for NYC). The doorman, called a car service for us for the airport, which only took 20 minutes. The price was $50 higher, however, than in July!!! This time it was $110 (cash) + tips to driver & doorman. Taxis are also readily available.We like this location because we can walk to Central Park, Times Square, the theater, and Grand Central.We walked to Patsy's Pizzaria for a good meal and also to Comfort Diner for breakfast. There are Starbucks in each direction. And my teens like Red Stone pizza as a late night snack.Beds were comfortable with down comforters and pillows. The showers were hot with rain shower fixtures. BIGGEST CON: $16.95 for 24 hour internet.

This is a great hotel in New York City and only a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal. The staff was very friendly and the rooms are great. The banquet staff is very energetic and makes sure a meeting room is set up right.

excellent location... big rooms nice staff... walk everywhere...we had a great time and the reservations desk was very helpfulthat's all i've got why do you want more. bar has the tvs and the games too

I've been to this hotel twice, once for business and once for leisure. The location itself is relatively convenient. There are no subway station in the immediate proximity of the hotel, so you need to walk about 5 minutes to Grand Central to take the 7 to Times Square or the 6 to Union Square. Walking to Times Square takes about 15-20 minutes.The rooms are bland, standard, and reliable. Just what you would expect in a Marriott of this category. The rooms are impecable and a pretty decent size for New York.Breakfast was good (but VERY expensive), bundle breakfast with your room if you're going to have it, much better value usually. The lunch I had there was catered, but was surprisingly good, especially considering the amount of people that were there. Nothing fancy, but it was obvious they used good quality ingredients.It might be a matter of taste, but I find both the interior and exterior of the building beautiful and well integrated with the neighborhood. It's definitely a plus for me, especially since it was recently renovated. The neighborhood itself is great. Grand Central is definitely worth seeing. Very close to the Rockefeller Center too.This hotel often offers deals that are really good value especially if you pre-pay. It's obviously never going to be the same as being in Times Square, but if you can score one of these deals, it might tip the balance because there can be a huge price differential.I can't say much about the service other than both my stays were trouble free. I had no reason to interact with the staff, but the few interactions that I had were pleasant.All in all, I think this is a fantastic option if you are going to New York. If this is your first time in New York and you are a little apprehensive about taking the subway or missing out on the action, then it might make sense to pay extra to be in Times Square, but I think it's hard to go wrong with this hotel, especially if you can score a decent deal. It's a Marriott, so don't expect that boutique feel, but I think the beauty of the building somewhat makes up for that. Definitely high on my list for my next trip.

Had to strain to give four stars but a very solid three plus. I rate hotels based on their 1) infrastructure, 2) services offered, 3) interaction with staff, 4) price.1) The building is an old one, not unusual in NY, has been updated in many ways; bathrooms, outlets in rooms for many devices, but the rooms are relatively small and not exciting.2) As an elite member of their chain I get free internet, pain to connect in this hotel. Their concierge level offered a breakfast without a meat but nice eggs and buns. In the evening they had more than adequate appetizers if you had too much to eat at lunch (as we did at Momofuku) you could leave here satisfied.3) Their breakfast corned beef hash was wonderful, pricey, but very good. Staff at the hotel was very pleasant, the reason to stay at Marriott.4)New York hotels are all overpriced.

Well located and rooms functional but a little small, well equipped. I would echo other comments about wifi being expensive. It really is about time wifi was included in the price, for me it is a choice maker. When I have a choice I will go to a hotel with free wifi, not one that you pay $16+. Breakfast and bar also very pricey but this is NY.

We arrived in NYC from Seattle on 11/01 for a 4 night stay centered around my wife running in the NYC marathon. Given the circumstances of everything that was happening due to the storm, I cannot say enough good things about our experience. The staff at check-in were friendly and efficient. I asked about my room options and was given several diferent choices. Jimmy, from the bell staff recommended a room that was away from the street noise. We were very happy with his recommendation. Throughout the stay, Jimmy knew us by name and was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and he arranged for a very reasonably priced private car to take us to JFK for our return home. We took the time to talk with most of the staff that we came in contact with and nearly every person was either directly or indirectly seriously impacted by the storm yet they had smiles on their faces and were genuinely interested in making sure that we were taken care of. The hotel location is perfect for a family vacation. We ate at several small diners and restaurants in walking distance (good food at a reasonable price). We did not have any meals in the hotel simply because we like to get out and see the city. Times Square, shopping, MOMA, Rockefeller Center are all within easy walking distance. The Concierge lounge was perfect for a quick snack and drink. Our room had a small refridg in it which was used for drinks and leftovers. Even though the marathon was cancelled (good decision but should have been canceled much earlier), this trip reinforced our belief that New York City and it's people are the greatest in the world. We'll be back.

I got a very good AAA rate for this hotel. I stayed overnight. It was the last night of a weekend trip in Connecticut and I wanted to stay in the city for a night. Hotel is in a very good location-close to Grand Central and also 5th Ave shopping. Check-in was pretty smooth especially since it was very crowded. The room was well appointed and bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was very small. The door banged into the toilet if you tried to open it all the way, However the shower had very good water pressure and lots of hot water!! No complimentary Wi-Fi in the room which is ridiculous. My biggest complaint was that the front desk was supposed to have a town car to take me to the airport at 6:30 pm Monday. I went out to look for my car and there was no bellman around and my towncar wasn't there! Luckily another car was in the taxi cue and did not have a fare so he took me to airport. I had to handle all of this because the bellman was MIA.The staff was not very happy, helpful or eager to please. They had that New York-you're lucky to be here attitude which didn't especially please me. I would stay again if the rate was right but there are certainly other places in NYC that I have stayed and received better service!

We recently found ourselves at this hotel for one night during Hurricane Sandy. We had two connecting standard size rooms. These are very small rooms, with very small bathrooms. However, everything did work and the beds were perfectly comfortable. The breakfast buffet at $35/head was a total rip-off -- the scrambled eggs, for example, were cold. The concierge was useless. I also hate that neighborhood. On a more positive note, I do have to say that the staff (other than that concierge) is very friendly and nice.

I stayed here overnight while on business. Checkin was smooth and easy. My room was on the backside of the hotel and away from the elevators. It was well appointed with a desk, casual chair, large sized flat screen TV and a king bed. The bed had very nice comfortable linens. Bathroom was very clean with a Kohler showerhead and an ample supply of towels. Room was quiet at night and early morning which can be a challenge in NY. Doormen are quick to get cabs and helpful with bags. This hotel lobby was a zoo when I returned from dinner as it looked like a bus tour had booked the hotel. Hopefully not the norm.
user_name:
Timetorun
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for two nights while we were evacuated from our downtown NYC apartment. We could not have had a smaller, darker, noisier and frankly dirtier room. Maybe all of that is typical of the very old, big Manhattan hotels. But I don't know why a hotel that charges $500+ for a tiny (they call it 'cozy') room does not ever dust the furniture, or vacuum that very old carpet. On the more positive side, very decent bedding and once you pay for the wifi you can connect 6 different machines. Most employees are very efficient and friendly. Just like a good business hotel there are electrical outlets everywhere. And if you ask for something you get a response.

I have stayed at this property at least three times in the past year. It is clean, dependable, has an excellent staff and a great location. Marriott is one of my brands of choice and I have never been disappointed at this location. I have stayed here while kicking off a cruise with my wife and for business. I once got a room that I didn't like...too small and no easy chair and the bell hop and the front desk fixed it immediately for me and moved me to another room - just like a quality class act is supposed to. I'm a former diplomat and travel agent and am a bit more demanding as a client. I plan on staying here again.

Stayed here recently for a business trip. Quick check in. Easy to get cabs in front of the hotel. Nice concerige lounge with a rooftop patio. Rooms are typical NYC hotel size but clean. Elevators are a bit slow, especially in the morning. Turn down service at night is nice. Would definately stay here in the future.

Just came back from riding out Sandy in midtown; which was a lucky place to be. every bit of Manhattan south of 39th had no power, it's just coming back on now 4 days later. It is a dire situation at all the coastal regions and yet walking around midtown 2 days later there is very little evidence of problems except the horrendously slow traffic due to the major subways lines still being under water and also tree limbs being cleared up; on the streets, the parks are closed. Our hearts go out those in all the states affected and we wish for a speedy recovery.We had a flood of our own in the room the 1st night as we were settling into bed; we love to travel but it is physically grueling. The toilet sounded funny and when I went in to see what the noise was it started overflowing. I know how to fix a toilet, so I took off the cover and the trap would not stay shut; then the unit broke and the Gusher came. I called for help and they were there very quickly. he did tell me that we could not stay there because it was too wet-really flooded; so we had to pack everything up and move upstairs. We are gold elite members and they never bothered to even apologize for the inconvenience let alone do anything for us that was disappointing. What really appalled us was when we went down the next day and asked the concierge if he has a bus map . 1st he acted like we were bothering him and then he said no. I asked him what streets the buses travel crosstown and unbelievably he said, I don't know I don't take the bus. Clearly he either does not like people or has objections to working on Sunday I am not sure but he should not be in that job.He looked it up for me on the web and told me 42nd and 57th. After I was on the street and walking toward 57th, I realized that 1/2 block away @ 49t st was the cross town bus we were inquiring about. So he looked it up and then me incorrect information-great concierge-NOT.Afterward when I was looking through the book I rcvd from him I realized that there was both a subway and bus map in back of the book. I did get a bus map from the lady working there on wed-who greeted us before we even got to her counter. She opened the door and took it off the shelf where there were dozens of others and said that her colleague only worked Sunday and didn't know they were there-then it is a case lack of training; but to me it looks like a lack of ambition on his part. Open the door and see what tools you have to do your job when you sre sitting thee doing nothing. Interesting indeed. With the exception of the Sunday concierge I felt that all other staff we ran into we cheerful, caring, and helpful. As Gold members we are allowed to use the lounge and have fruit, beverages, yogurt and other goodies during the day and enough food to make dinner at night {membership has it's priviledges} it was lovely not to be stuck in our rooms for the duration of Monday when we could not go out on the street after 11am. Margaret during the day and Kenda at night were cheerful and helpful to everyone I saw ask them for assistance. I love Marriott because they have the best beds and in most cases the best staff. Although we had a tiny room, it's New York and all rooms are small and expensive.This one did not disappoint overall-we really can't complain as we used points for the entire stay however we did spend a lot to get those points. Either way we would def come back here. Found Keats karaoke bar on 2nd between 44th and 45th which was a fun and welcoming spot. There are a lot of good restaurants near the hotel. Just 3 avenues from shopping on 5th and and 2 avenues from 2nd where there are a lot of Irish bars. We'd stay here again.

I went to NYC for a business conference but went a few days earlier and stayed at another hotel prior to checking in to this one. With that being said, it was great that I had a recent means of comparison for hotels and I would definitely say you get what you paid for. The Marriott was cleaner, friendlier and definitely more efficient in their check-in process compared to our other hotel. Their check-in wasn't till 4:00 pm but I checked in at noon and they already had my room ready! The front desk staff was super friendly and she made the deposit process so easy for me. The bartenders at their bar was also incredibly friendly and I never had to wait really long for my drinks. The staff at the gift shop were also very polite. The location of the hotel is terrific! It was actually great the it was a little further from the heart of Time Square and closer to the working crowd vs the tourist crowd. Overall - if I went back to NYC, I would stay here again!

Great value for a midtown stay. Room was as advertised, clean, comfy and the location is great. Close to restaurants, shopping, etc. we stayed three nights and enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this hotel for the short weekend stay, rooms are small but are cozy. If you want a view, you need to be specific when you book, we ended up with an internal view of some brick walls which wasn't great but you get what you pay for and we got a great rate for our stay, and we spent nights in the room so it didn't matter. Some have told me that the street noise is bothersome at some NYC hotels, so we had no complaints there.

Stayed here whilst on an MBA exchange programme in October. The rooms are nice and spacious, the staff are very friendly and the location is great on Lexington Avenue. The internet is really fast but also a bit costly. Overall this hotel was great and i would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here as part of a wedding package so the rate of $189 was less than usual ($349). The hotel is in a great location - close to many tourist and not-so-tourist attractions. Very busy hotel with a great conscierge and porter service. Went beyond the call of duty to get us a taxi back to the airport.

Stayed for single night as part of a package so not sure of price.Extremely busy and crowded in reception (and outside on Lexington). Queues!Standard room was okay but soundproofing didn't work and very noisy all night.Breakfast was standard fayre and okay. Generally hotel looked over-worked and tired.Having said that it is a very convenient location for this part of town.

Stayed at this hotel for a business trip and it was perfect for the trip. The rooms are not the largest, but by New York standards they would be considered spacious.Service was great, and the concierge services were a great help. The hotel location is probably the best reason to stay here, close to Times Square/broadway and shopping on Madison/5th Avenue... Waldorf Astoria across the road. Tube stops are also conveniently located and a number of options for meals close by.Gladly stay here again, although the cost of staying here does make it a slightly tougher decision....

We arrived at 7am on a Saturday and by 11am we got a call that we could check in early. Our room was perfectly sized for two adults and our 10 year old. The room was on the 19th floor with 3 windows. Staff we are all attentive, hotel was clean and tidy. Lobby area could use more than 2 chairs but that is neither here nor there. Hotel is in a fantastic location away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square which after this trip I have come to learn is just not necessary after you've done it once!Subway station is close as is Grand Central. Ess-a Bagel is just around the corner and the American Girl store was just close enough to keep our daughter happy. Located right next to the Waldorf Astoria, you really can't go wrong at this hotel if you can get it at a decent price. We left with zero complaints and I would stay here again, no question.

OK, I know this is Manhattan so all the normal rules about room sizes, value for money etc simply don't apply but I was really expecting a bit more from this place. The price paid (well in excess of $400 a night inclusive of taxes) was actually quite low for this hotel as it was booked well in advance. The room was average rather than spacious. Everything worked and was clean but there was little to make you feel you were in a luxury hotel. I'm a Marriott Rewards Platinum member so am supposed to get a room upgrade - I can't tell if I actually did on this occasion but if the room I was given was anything other than the most basic, I'd hate to see what the basic rooms were like!As a top tier frequent guest I also gain access to the executive lounge for breakfast, This, however, only seemed to operate during the week and was closed for most of saturday and sunday. Again, this is not as good as most Marriotts I've stayed in where the lounge is open 7-days a week and seems a little mean given the premium paid for staying here!On the positive side, you can't really fault the location - walking distance to Central Park, Central Station, Moma, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza etc and only a block from the subway.

Most New York hotels are small and expensive, so what are you going to do? I thought the room was above average and the staff was friendly and attentive, so what more can you ask for.My room was not ready when we arrived, which by most standards was pretty late 5:30pm, but they gave us complimentary drinks and made our wait comfortable.

We were looking for a good hotel for a 1 night stay in NYC, before moving to an appartment we rented for the rest of our holiday in New York. We chose Marriott mainly because of the location, and the brand's name- thinking that you can not go wrong with Marriott. Well, apparntley, you can: I will start with the positive- the hotel location is fantastic, a short walk to the MoMA, Rockerfeller center/plaza, top of the rock, Empire State etc.. The hotel is indeed nice and overall clean. Having said that, we had some issues that prevented us from truely enjoying staying in the hotel. I will start by saying my spouse and I are easily stasiftied, and that almost every B&B or hotel we stayed at was good to excelllent for our needs. 1. Upon our arrival (~11am), the lobby was packed, and we were told that our room is not ready yet. This was, of course, understandable. I was asked to leave my phone number, and was told that once the room is available, I will be contacted. This sounded very reasonable, and so, we left our luggage and went on with our holiday plans to experience the city. It was around 2, when we wondered what's going on. When we arrived back at the hotel, we got our room. No one bothered calling me to tell me it's ready- despite stating this when I first arrived2. The room: a standard room, which was big and clean. In the middle of room there was a huge metal door - it appears to me that this door was used to connect two rooms together. The second room which was next to ours, was acoomodated by guests, and so, I really have to wonder why using rooms that are conencted by a door, when the guests are not related? Moreover, we found a breakfast menu that was used by the guest who stayed there the day before us (it had the date and his requests for breakfast) - which certainly gives you the feeling the place wans't cleaned as much as you'd like before your arrival. Please bear in mind that the room didn't have any sort of refreshments- not even a simple bottle of water (simple B&B's in Maine/NH/Vermont offer that- and the famous Marriott don't..). There are no water machines as well, if you'd like to fill in your bottels. Also, don't expect a real 'free wifi' - it's time limited.Noise: We were staying in the 19th floor, but you could still hear the traffic noise pretty loudly. This is also the place to say that the A/C the room had was snoring and making loud noises almost constantly while being on. We had to turn it off to go to sleep.I'm rating the clean level as 3, only because of the menu issue. I know it might sound silly, but it simply gave both of us the feeling the place wasn't really cleaned prior to our arrival.3. Breakfast: I didn't like the fact there are no vegtebales, and that you don't have free access to juice/water/specific foods (i.e. waffels) - you are being served, and need to request everything. I guess some people would like being served, but I would enjoy serving myself better, without having to call (or tip) a waiter for bringing me a simple glass of water4. Tipping: this one correaltes with (3) actually, and comes back to the fact that you are being served, no matter what. You will have to tip the staff for everything- and when I say 'have' I do mean so: When a staff member brought a bag of mine (while I said I can handle it myself, and thanked him), he didn't move away until I tipped him. I do like giving tips for good service, and am certainly not trying to be rude or save money here, but having to tip the staff for everything they do, even if you don't ask them (or specifically tell them you got that covered), was tiring and annoying.The bottom line:This place has great location, and the price we got was good as well. If you like being served, and don't mind not getting anything 'more' (water? decent buffet breakfast with free access? free wifi access?) - you should consider staying in here. Personally, we won't be staying at the Marriott hotels anymore.

I wonder just how much you have to spend a night in NYC to get a tiny view? As a Marriott Rewards member paying $499 per night, I didn't expect to be looking at an interior brick wall. I admit I'm a bit of a wimp and didn't complain (and my husband will only if the place is a complete ruin.) Other than that the room was really nice and comfortable, it seemed newly refurbished, with nice decor & furnishings. The coffee/tea maker was also a welcome convenience. The bathroom was also very nice, but with a single sink only. The shower head was so powerful I was standing in water to my ankles. The towels were cheap -- think gym towel quality & smelled a bit strange, not fresh. No exhaust fan, I prefer a bath with one because the room was on the small side. The midtown location was great, easy walk to everything I wanted to see, and a good variety of excellent restaurants and delis nearby. The in house restaurant was nice but very pricy for breakfast, as it was not included in my room rate. Oh and wireless Wi-Fi - ah no - but plug-in Internet access was $16.95 a night, really? I went to Starbucks. My compliments to the staff, all were very friendly and accommodating.

Wonderful location staff always goes out of their way to take care of us. This is our fifth visit this year and we are already booked for the holidays. My mother lives just a few blocks from this location and that is a big plus. The bellman are always friendly and some even remember my name. See you soon

The hotel is centrally located. We had two heavy suitcases but there was no porter on duty to help get these into the hotel. We were dealt with very efficiently at reception, and advised how to get to our room. We were in a regular room with two double beds and therefore there was little spare room to open suitcases. The air conditioning in the bedroom has to be the noisiest I have ever come across. It was so intolerable we had to switch it off completely to be able to get to sleep. Breakfast was good though nothing out of the ordinary. Service was good.

We recently went for a long weekend. Having checked TA before I left I knew checkout before 4 pm was not going to be easy. We called and were able to check in at about 3:30 however the place was a zoo at that time. The hotels standard checkout is noon so check in is 4 pm.Having requested a room away from the elevators months ago I was surprised to get a room directly across from the elevator. A call down stairs and our room was changed to a higher floor and away from the elevators. The rooms are not very large and bathroom is small. The rooms are clean and well done with furniture etc. No issues here.One killer is NO WIFI, internet is available with a hard connection for 16.95 a day (RIPOFF). Dunkin donuts is free, and in general I found WIFI not as wide spread as one would think.We did not use room service or the restaurant as the cost was on the high side and we enjoyed walking the area to discover local places for the same cost. I can eat in a hotel restaurant anytime I want. We made it to the bar one night and they had a good selection of beer wine etc. very nice spot. The prices are a little more than some of the nearby spots, but certainly within reason.TIP get a room away from elevators since the rooms are not large your bed will be near the door right next to the people getting on and off the elevator.Also get a room on the highest floor, the lower you are the louder the street noise.Parking for your car is $60 per night. You can find for $10 cheaper, but the valet makes this pretty much worth it. Hotel is very close to Times Square and central park.

We liked this hotel a lot very convenient to Grand Central. Great lobby. Great staff. Big room by NYC standards! Food in 525LEX Restaurant was good but pricey like most hotels. Convenient on a rainy night with baby. No complaints. Would love to stay again!

Just got back to the UK after having stayed here over the last 2 nights with my wife. All I can say is that this hotel is fantastic! It was situated perfectly for our needs (Midtown East - Lexington & 49th); as we were only there for 1 1/2 days, and was only a short walk to most of the places we wanted to visit.The hotel and all its staff were very accommodating from the moment we arrived, which just added to the pleasure. Our 'King Cozy' room was on the 29th floor and was perfect in size for our stay - most importantly it was very clean.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in NYC.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights this past August with my two teenage boys. We were booked in a regular room with 2 double beds. The view was of the street below. When we checked in I requested to be upgraded to the Concierge floor. Because I am only a silver member the up charge was $40/day for the three of us. And there were no rooms available on this floor but we did get access. It was the BEST money I spent on this trip. The lounge is spacious and updated with a beautiful outdoor eating area that overlooks NYC on three sides. It was beautiful to go up there at night time. They offered a pretty plentiful dinner appetizer spread, which as the mom of two growing teens, I really appreciated. Not to mention all if the water and soda that is available to take to your room whenever the lounge is open. Nice tea and coffee service as well as an honor bar. The evening desserts were predictable... Cookies and brownies. Also the breakfast that they served was good and filled us up until lunch. Now I realize that everything in NYC is expensive. Food especially. But I wasn't prepared for our last morning when the lounge wasn't open and we went to get breakfast in the hotel restaurant. When I have been to the Boston Marriott Copley, the buffet there is either 19.99 or 24.99 per person and that is an extensive buffet with a waffle bar, an omelet station, oatmeal and homemade granola. The buffet at this restaurant was $33.00 per person with no waffles, no omelet station, and limited fresh fruits. I couldn't believe how lack-luster it was. And on top of that they added on the city taxes and whatnot and the mandatory gratuity (even though the service was non existant) and it cost the three of us $120 for breakfast. My advice would be to skip eating at the restaurant and go get a more reasonable breakfast. The shining star at this hotel was the woman at the concierge desk up in the concierge lounge. She was awesome. She had great ideas for what to do with the teens, got us free tickets into the freedom tower and the 9/11 memorial even though I tried myself and was told there were no tickets left. And she reserved us tickets to the Empire State Building. Finally, she armed us with maps so that I felt pretty confident heading out. I would stay here again. It was a nice location. We were able to walk to the NHL store, Niketown, Louis Vuitton, Burberry, Chanel, etc. very pretty walk.

I love it when people book a hotel, and then complain about the location!! There are plenty of hotel choices in New York, and if your business or pleasure takes you to Midtown East, this place is great.i requested a higher floor to get away from street noise, and was accomodated with a very nice size room on the 22nd floor...2207 to be exact. Room was clean, quiet, and roomy. Had a frigde, coffee maker, nice shower. The only funky thing about hotel is that you have to take an elevator to the 32nd floor to switch to another elevator to get to the 35th floor gym. I ended up just using the stairwell. The gym itself was a little smaller that i might have expected for a hotel this size - but had everything you needed to at least have a decent workout.Ate at the hotel restaurant - was pretty good, a little pricey. and unusual for me, even though I was a party of one - they added 15% gratuity to the bill, thought that was oddAnyway - no reason to not pick this place - very good choice

This hotel was about a 5 or 6 block walk to Times Square. Not too bad but by the end of our 4 days there the walk was getting a bit annoying. The hotel was great though! Clean, no signs of any bugs (and I really checked), and a great staff at the front desk and the bell service. Big problem with it though: the concierge was completely useless. They couldn't tell us anything or help us with any questions we had about where something was or the best way to get somewhere was. Not to mention they were almost always closed. They weren't open early in the morning when we left and they were closed by the time we got back most days. The worst part was them refusing to book us a SuperShuttle to the airport because they thought we should just take a cab. It was the bell service staff that explained all our options and was willing to help us with it. We ended up using the hotels' car service to get back to the hotel. I would ABSOLUTELY recommend using the car service! It was a flat rate of US$45. The Super Shuttle that we got from the airport (LGA) was US$15 per person and it was a crowded van that made multiple stops. We travelled in 3 so the car service worked out to US$15 each anyway and was a much better and relaxing drive to the airport. Just don't bother asking the concierge for help with that!We stayed in room 720 and it was pretty small but not uncomfortably small for 3 girls with giant suitcases and shoes everywhere :) The bathroom was a good size. Our windows looked out to a wall about 2 meters away so definitely no view there. Overall, the hotel was great. I would've given it a 5 star rating had the concierge done something of use at one point or another. Honestly, the Marriott should be embarrassed. Their concierge service is holding them down.

1. Rooms are far too compact2. Avoid the road facing rooms. The traffic noise can disturb you through the night.3. Hotel was good enough to change my room the next day4. Dont expect any staff to help you with your luggage5. Dont expect something as simple as a toothpaste in your bathroom 6. Good Restaurant7. Staff service is neutral. Neither warm nor indifferent.

My wife and I stayed here for one night while in town for a party. Definitely more of a business/tourist location than true neighborhood, but certainly a solid option, and at a decent price. Old building with small elevators and rooms but lobby, hallways, and rooms are fairly updated. As is usually the case, Marriott comes through with a reliable and clean property.

Nice Marriott. Very helpful staff and quiet rooms. While not huge, they are comfortable. Subway three blocks away. Easy walk to Times Square. Concierge is extremely helpful and knowledgable on what and where to go.Had a super weekend.

Had a semi-bad experience about a year ago and the general manager phoned me about that and PROMISED me the next time I booked to contact him and he would get me the best suite available at the time of booking. Therefore, this review will mainly consist of my EXPERIENCE this time around rather than describing the hotel amenities, etc.I went ahead and booked it (two rooms in fact with the referral I gave my Aussie friends) and contacted the GM IMMEDIATELY after booking the room- Christopher Hosmer. He was out of town and I booked a non refundable rate. I was told a suite would be unavailable but I would receive a junior suite (with french doors), which I was happy with as this would suffice for my purposes. Upon check in I was told I had a "junior suite" but when I entered it was indeed the large room, no divider walls after countless calls and a written confirmation (on Marriott's site). I went downstairs and spoke with Richard (the evening manager) who insisted the room assigned was a junior suite (which did not meet the specifications if you look at the room details of the junior suite - two televisions, french doors, etc on their site under room details). My battery was dead on my phone and I was unable to pull up the confirmation and stumbled through luggage to look for the printed version for my two night stay. Finally, Richard emerged with a confirmation stating it was a "larger room." I was beside myself and ready to move to another property. As I was calling other properties in desperation and considering leaving the city, Richard finally came back out and stated he would be able to give me the junior suite for the two nights booked under my name and apologized, shook my hand, etc. I happily went to the new room, which was absolutely fine.We ended up having a great time but after such a delayed flight from LAX and then meeting my friends, we ended up sleeping in until pretty late to get a late start on the only full day that I had there. After check out, my friends advised me the Marriott would be charging me an additional night in fees and said I did not fully prepay this, which I did (even have the confirmation and charge made in July) when I was already back in LA. I contacted them and will be disputing this with my credit card company. Never again will I trust this hotel and there is no way this can be made up. I was completely lied to and mislead and this is not the way to treat customers - ever! This is my own opinion and I truly dislike writing reviews that reflect a negative opinion, but the truth should be out there and people should not have to deal with crooks who run a hotel. I think Tony Soprano would do a better job then the persons managing this property.

Girlfriend and I stayed here in September of 2012. We really liked it here.Got there super early because we took the redeye in from the west coast. Showed up around 10 in the morning, fully expecting just dropping off our bags and wandering the city in a stupor until check in time. Much to our surprise the hotel had our room ready! It wasn't a high floor, which is the only reason they lose a point in this review. The East Side Marriott was super convenient to everything. Easy cab ride to Broadway shows, walking distance to everything, a quick and very entertaining cab ride to little Italy/SOHO. Room was clean every day when we got back. The shower was clean, the room stayed cool with the AC on, and we never had a problem getting a cab to go anywhere we wanted to go.On check out they let us stash our bags so we could go explore the city for the last few hours we had left. They also hooked us up with a car service to the airport, which if you're going to JFK this is the only way to go. $65, including tolls, tips, and the car. Well worth the extra $8 it would cost over the shuttle service.Over all very happy. Would absolutely stay there again, but next time on a higher floor!

The Marriott East Side is a great property for business travelers or people coming in to see the city. The location is right in Midtown Manhattan and convenient to many of the most popular destinations. There is an endless list of great restaurants, bars, and nightspots that are walkable from this property. Cabs are always plentiful right on Lexington Avenue at the hotel entrance.My particular stay was for three nights while on business travel. The room was renovated within the last two years and felt very up to date. The only real downfall of the room was the bathroom. While it has updated shower curtains and counters, the bathroom itself is still very old (though very clean). The next renovation should bring it more up to date with the rooms. The bedrooms are the standard Marriott beds and always very comfortable. Also, the club floor is large, and while busy in the mornings, always had an open seat.If you're looking for a solid Marriott property in the heart of Manhattan, skip the Marriott Marquis in Times Square and head here. You'll be glad you picked this smaller property and missed the crowds.
user_name:
BlakeTraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have to admit, midtown is not my favorite area of NYC so I wasn't so sure about this but my experience was really great. First, major points for having a room available for a very early check in. I took a red-eye in so I figured I'd have to drop my bags off and wait several hours before I got a room, but nope, the Marriott had one ready for me. That made my whole day. The front desk staff was super polite and helpful every time I needed them. Same goes for the bellman, concierge etc. Customer service here was top notch the entire time, not one complaint. Also, no surprise fees or charges, everything here was above board. The room itself was nice, I know some others have said small - but for NYC I thought it was actually pretty good sized. Cleaning staff did a great job and room was always in good shape when we returned to it. My only complaints are that the bed was not very comfortable and our room was NOISY. I think it was because we were right next to the maid closet but we could hear door slamming, a hammering noise etc. Also, I recommend requesting a higher floor if you are bothered by traffic noise. I'm a city mouse so it actually helps me sleep, but it was definitely audible from our 6th Fl room. If you want to stay in Midtown - this is a great option. They take good care of you.

I really want to like this hotel because it is wonderfully centrally located midtown, contains great history (its exterior having been a subject in paintings by Georgia O'Keefe) and is part of the Marriott brand. The rooms and elevators are typical NYC size/style - Not big. Most rooms do not have a view except for looking into the room of the building across the way. The concierage desk is incompetent (They could not answer any of my questions accurately). The first floor bar is generic. My second recent trip was as a Marriott reward member and specifically chosen for those perks but guess what - The lounge here is closed weekends! The front desk staff were pleasant, but always very busy/understaffed with long lines for checking in/out. Rooms were clean, but public areas not as much. Both visits were for special occasions (birthday and anniversary), neither which were acknowledged. The hotel is so average and underwhelming would only return if could obtain a special rate.

With friends in NYC, we frequently visit them. Deciding we could no longer spend sleepless nights on their pull-out sofa, we splurged for a hotel this time. I love the Marriott brand for their service and consistency. The hotel room was cozy (read: small), but it's NYC. Lexington was a great spot with Central Park blocks north and Grand Central Station just down Lexington. We walked down to 30th for brunch at Penelope too. I would stay here again if the price was reasonable.

Positive experience. The room was very spacious, clean, great beds, comfy pillows, wonderful shower head. Some important things to mention, NO free Internet in the rooms. $16.99 for 12 hours is the rate. The lobby is very spacious and glamorous, but no computers for guests use. However, there is wifi public access in the lobby. The bathroom is small, clean, nice counter space. The soda machines are located on floors 5, 9 & 16. The hotel is very quiet in terms of people. However, the a/c & toilet is very loud, but not a big deal. Our overall experience was wonderful. It's a nice hotel, but they do not offer much for amenities considering how pricey it is and it's a marriottt. I would recommend this hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times for pleasure & business in the past few years. In fact, I stayed there a year ago this month and have never written a review...so I thought it was time. The superb location, friendly bellman, front desk attendants, concierge and housekeeping staff all do their job with perfection. I have stayed at several hotels in NYC before, but this one just has it all. It's really that simple. On my last visit, my stay was made extra special by the professional and kind service given to me by Mariam. She is a total sweetheart. The hotel is safe and secure. So, if you're a woman traveling alone, you're covered. The hotel's location provides easy walking to many destinations that everyone wants to visit while savoring the amenities in beautiful NYC.

We stayed here for one night while in town for a concert; it is our second stay at the Marriott East Side. It is a convenient location. The rooms are comfortable and clean. But the best thing was that my husband happened to mention when checking in that it was our anniversary, and when we got to our room after the concert we were surprised to find a bottle of wine chilling on ice and a small cheese and fruit plate. It was touching!

This is a superb hotel; great people; nice club level room; and fantastic location. I was bowled over by the experience and will be back! Every aspect of this hotel works. i enjoyed banter with the porters and the bar/restaurant staff could not do enough.

Weather extended my visit for a few days out of NYC and I was fortunate enough to get a room, last minute at a reasonable rate, after two days of flight cancellations. Myself and many others (similarly affected) were treated very professionally and patiently upon arrival to the hotel.This last hour fill to the occupancy levels had to be very unexpected by the staff, who - without hesitiation - rolled their sleeves up and made everyrone feel like a VIP.Allan, spefically assisted me with my room and rewards # information, after his normal work hours, which I guess was a very long day.I received great value, service and peace of mind, that comes with the Marriott brand, after what could have easily been a difficult expereince. Kudos to Allan and the rest of the staff for their seamless efforts to assure a great end to many guests. I look forward to another great visit.

This is the first time I've ever been to NYC and gotten a good night's sleep. The staff was friendly upon check in and let us get into our room 2 hours early. Our lovely room was on the 29th floor with a lovely view of the Chrysler building. Being on the 29th floor was great because it meant we were above most of the street traffic and we were able to sleep at night. We could still hear sirens from time to time, but overall it was pretty quiet. The bed was comfortable and the linens were fantastic. (The wallpaper in the bathroom needs to be replaced and the elevators could be slow, but overall we had no complaints.)
user_name:
Betsy E
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at the hotel on July 8th & 9th and thoroughly enjoyed the experience, Double room spotless and large;comfortable beds, unbelievable pillows. Concierge lounge wonderful.Beautiful weekday breakfast, well attended by an older gentleman who never stopped moving. Hot offerings and even cappuccino and espresso! Weekdays also offer early evening Hors D'Oeuvres and desserts from 7:30 til 10. Computer access, large flat-screen and nice terrace where you can catch a glimpse of a few historic buildings and a tidbit of the East River. Nice on a sunny morning... I do want to add that the concierge staff was extremely helpful to my son and me when a medical emergency arose involving my daughter on Monday night . Many thanks!  The hotel is a fully renovated old building that formerly housed such famous folks as Georgia O'Keeffe and Alfred Steiglitz . among others. Our party had two rooms, the double being considerably larger, yet the king equally comfortable. Wonderful bellman and doorman to get you a cab or your own car. Word to the wise-parking can be pricey, here and everywhere in NYC. You really don't need a car unless you plan on leaving the city. Save your bucks for more fun stuff and use MTA.  Hotel doesn't have a pool,but you'll be so wiped from all there is to see and do in NY, you won't care. Nice fitness center on the top floor with floor to ceiling windows-killer views-go up and look even if you don't work out. A sauna would be nice... Anyhoo, I'd definitely recommend a stay here for it's location, generous staff and amenities. But do take a walk down the block and check out the Waldorf-Astoria-if just for the history.

I am really late in writing this review, why? To be honest i thought i had :(. Anyway 1st trip to NY city and this hotel was cenrtal to everything, It has the most comfortable pillows ever and the beds are great. There was some building work going on but it didn`t bother us. We were in a group of four and they made sure our rooms were together without us requesting it. It was a bit expensive and we could have got cheaper but i would stay in a marriot again just for the beds. We stayed 5 nights and never really got speaking to any staff. they were nice but we were out all the time. Great rooms and a 5 minute walk from times square. It was Sept 2010 when we went , sorry it took so long but i thought i`d written a review ;(. NY is a must.

I have stayed in this hotel many times and it only gets better and better. Everybody is so friendly and helpful.This past visit, Carmen welcomed me at the front desk and was so pleasant.The hotel is a welcome retreat after a long trip or a busy day in the city.

We booked this hotel because it was about $50 cheaper than the hotels closer to Times Square. It was clean and the rooms were very comfortable. Not much, if any, view. Everything from internet to the fridge had prices attached, so we didn't touch anything. I would probably stay there again, but liked the NYC Hilton better.

First trip to New York was great. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. Hotel is within walking distance to grand central station, 5th ave shopping, time square and central park. Beds very comfortable. Stayed in a king room and was a good size for two of us. Will be staying again.

I spent the weekend of my 40th Birthday at the Marriott East Side and had a great time, Not only is it a little bit away from the hustle and bustle of times square ( only about a 4 avenue walk) but it is a great location if you want to go to Grand Central station or shopping on 5th , and only about 10 blocks from Central Park, We had what was referred to as a cozy room and it was perfect for New York ( as you want to be out enjoying the city), extremely clean, cofortable room that looked newly renovated, and right across from the East side of the Waldorf. The restaurant was amazing ( 525 Lex) and had great service. Will make sure this is one of the places I stay next time I am in the city.

Overall, I can say my stay at the Marriott East Side was an absolute pleasant one. The staff at this hotel was accommodating, and whatever requests I had came almost immediately. I slept very well in the comfortable bed, and the in-room coffee was just right. My room was a corner room, so I had almost no noise at night. The location of this Marriott is perfect, and was near my workplace. I can definitely say that I know hospitality, as I am a manager of a hospitality consulting firm; I can definitely say that this Marriott knows hospitality. I will be back.

Stayed here for the 3rd time and still like it. Went downstairs to have brunch w a friend and there was a street fair right outside the door... For tourists it was well appreciated. This time around though I do have to say the bell man at the front was very unprofessional speaking loudly on his cell phone while I was trying to catch a cab on my own...when I came back he didn't open the door acted like he didn't even see me. Everyone should be treated equally a guest is a guest no matter what. Clearly I can do this myself but why is he standing there and Working for the hotel if he's not going to do anything? My only complaint though. I will be staying here again!

This hotel, while an older one, maintains the level of cleanliness that I have come to expect from Marriott. Service is very good and price is consistent with comparable level hotels in Midtown. If there is a negative it is the concierge lounge which is pooly layed out and not comparable in breakfast offerings to other Marroitt hotels.

We're Platinum members and were greeted and upgraded to a spacious room. The staff was obliging and terrace in the concierge lounge was a bonus we enjoyed for outdoor cocktails and breakfast too. We frequently stay at Marriotts in NYC and we will be coming back to this property.

Lovely Hotel, fantastic location, would stay again. Room was great, we upgraded to Superior and Gym was Ace. Location was next to Chrysler and a five min walk to Rock. Empire State 10 minute walk. Local Delis are Ok for breakfast and Grand Central dining concourse MUST be seen and is 5 minutes away

Stayed 1 night for business. Nice rooms, nothing fancy. They were clean, updated, and did the job. Enjoyed the fitness center - enough space to work out at your leisure, and complimentary towels and ear buds :) Front desk staff was ok, but not as attentive as I would expect. There was construction going on my side of the hotel, can't recall where, but that did not help me to sleep in.

I stay at Marriott's often and this is another, dependable choice in a high class neighborhood!I chose a "Cozy King" room. I now appreciate the on-line description of the room because my expectations were set for a tiny, tiny room. I was pleasantly surprised to find an efficiently laid out guest room with a love seat couch, work desk, large LCD TV and even a refrigerator! The bathroom, though small too, had a sink with vanity with room to put toilietries. I've been in NY hotel rooms where that is not the case.The high point of this hotel is it's great location. A fantastic starting point, especially if you are visiting NY as a tourist. The hotel is in "hotel row" on the back side of the Waldorf Astoria next to the W and across from the Intercontinental. St. Patrick's Cathdral is a couple of blocks and Rock Center/NBC Today Show is a straight shot 3-4 blocks away. The hotel is a block from the subway as well.On a personal note, although other reviewers have critized the staff at this hotel, I instead found everyone helpful, kind and professional. We had a unusual family emergency during our stay and management went above and beyond to assist us.There are also lots and lots of restaurants nearby in all price ranges. You will enjoy this hotel and if smaller rooms bother you, just get a larger one here!

Even though I have stayed there before and am a platinum elite status I was barely greeted, and acknowledged, on arrival: “no upgrade, lucky we have room for you 30 minutes before checking time of 3pm on a Saturday night in August.”  So my cubicle next to the elevators and storage room with one jail like window was sleep able but barely breathable and certainly not enjoyable. Think college dorm size/rate. And I do visit NYC often, btw so I know NYC rooms. I did call mgr. to ask for a re-do, but he essentially said we are busy, go away. So I did. I had my son arrive the next day, and my son checked in under my name next day and they charged me $50 more than the room rate I was registered for, so when I came home I had to fix all that.No one gave us a second thought, so I will not give them one either. There is not an open lounge ( which is stunning with balcony and gr8 view) all weekend until Sunday night and unlike most Marriott full service there is no compl. breakfast in the restaurant offered not even a bottle of water for elite Marriott members. I did ask for both and was told again go away. The luggage crew were lovely and bellman, so perhaps they should give the inside staff a few tips.

Good marriott, great location, clean room, near subway, Park Ave shops, Central Park, lots of places of various prices to eat nearby. Friendly reception staff, friendly cleaners. We were able to check in early at midday.On the rate I was on, entry to a lounge was included so I got a breakfast buffet included. Great, apart from the tea and coffee being served in cardboard cups, which was odd because the rest was on proper plates with proper knives and forks. While the hotel is nice, clean and all of the above, there is not much special about it, no funk.

One night stay with my daughter as we had tickets to see Jersey Boys. Room was very nice, clean, roomy (for NY) and we found the staff to be friendly and even allowed an early check in (11 am). Checkout was 12 noon so we enjoyed that later than usual check out time. Great mom and pop diner around the corner on Lexington and 3rd for breakfast. Location was perfect for theatre, shopping and yet away from the bright lights of Times Sq. I left my blackberry behind by accident and didn't realize it until we got home. Called late on Sunday night and received an email and call back the next day - they shipped it out overnight to me, no charge - with a smile. That scored high in my book!

The room smelled.... The bell boy was rude.....though Paulina at front desk went out of way to help me. They do not keep an adapter...so if you are an international traveller get your own...quite an average MARIOTT. The location is though fabulous ....buy you can choose W next door. Much classy and nicer personalized service

Just back from the USA where my wife and I stayed in New York for nine days broken up by side trips to various location. Each stay was three days and at a different hotel each time. The last was at the Hilton Time Square, which was horrible. Like staying at Grand Central Station. The second was the Millenium Time Square. Which was quite expensive, but lacked everything you should get in a high end hotel. The first, which spoilt us for the rest, was the Marriott East Side. This is by far one of the best hotels in New York. A fantastic location, being an easy walk to all mid-town attractions. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, and the rooms are as good as you get in a hotel these days. Clean and comfortable.I would highly recommend the Marriott East Side, and if I ever return to NY, that's where Ill be staying.

My husband and I stayed here on a recent extended weekend in NYC. The location was perfect! A short walk to Grand Central Station, Times Square, or Central Park. The room was relatively spacious for NYC, the staff was friendly, and the price was right. Our friend got us a pretty good deal for $170 a night. I'd stay here again for sure.
user_name:
ShellyM248
New York City, New York

review_body: The Marriott East Side is located an easy walk from Times Square , and the Theater District. My wife and I travelled to NYC on 8/10 and enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. Check-in was easy and seamless. We were able to check into our room early even though we did not request this ahead of time. After reading many reviews on this site I expected to get tom yroom and find your typical NYC small hotel room. When we entered I was surprised to find that the room was plenty big enough. There was ample room to navigate around, and even a nice chair with a small table for reading. I guess many reviewers do not know what to expect when visiting NYC in regards to room size. The bell staff and vallet were efficent, and pleasant. We enjoyed a drink in the bar that evening before our dinner reservations elsewhere. We had no problems with our stay.

Hotel was in a great location, 5 blocks from Times Square so you are far enough away from the hustle and bustle if you don't want that but not too far that you can't walk. The rooms were great, very clean and spacious with very nice bathrooms. I travelled with a group of friends and the hotel had made sure all our rooms were next to each other. All the staff at the hotel were kind, friendly and helpful, especially the waiters working in the dining room every morning for breakfast. Food available was of a high standard, room service was always quick and not too expensive and bar prices were reasonable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning on staying in New York.

My stay in Marriott for four days was perfect as it could be. The breakfast was nice and staff was very friendly.I liked the rooms and the proximity of the hotel to my office in NY.Recommended for business as well as personal stay.

They charge $17 per day for wifi, from noon till noon. If you're thinking, "that's weak, but I guess I can still use the business center..." you'd be wrong because they *still* charge you in the business center. Other than that, the rooms are small-ish and a little outdated, but decent enough.

I just returned from a stay at the Marriott East Side in Manhattan. I am a frequent traveler to New York, and have stayed at many of the most highly reputed and expensive hotels in the City, but if you ask me where I really like to stay it is at the East Side Marriott. Why? because the staff there treat you as if you were a guest in their home, not as if you are just someone paying money to receive a service. My advice, get to know the doormen, who have a wealth of information and are extremely friendly. Talk to the front desk staff, like the extraordinary Paulina, who I saw in action greeting guests, remembering their names, welcoming them to the property, and establishing a bond with the guests. The housekeepers and the room service waiters are also very friendly and accommodating. In spite of the reputation that some service businesses in New York City have of brusque interaction with clients, this hotel is a place where you can feel at home in your enclave very quickly if you take the time to talk with and get to know the excellent staff, most of whom have worked there for years.

The best thing about this hotel is the helpful, friendly staff. The hotel is nice, location is great, but from the doormen to the front desk staff, you always feel cared for. The hotel room was adequate but not very spacious for the price paid. The bathroom was small but clean and the water pressure was awesome. All in all this is a very good choice for a New York City hotel.

I stayed at the Marriott East Side for a business trip from 7/23-27. Compared to some of the other hotels in the area, I thought this was just average. The location is very convenient. The elevators and room were tiny. In addition, the elevators were very slow. The front desk was attentive. However, when I called the front desk from my room, I had to dial several times before someone picked up. Room service was slow. It took over 45 minutes to receive my room service order even though it was past 9pm. The king size bed was comfortable. The room decorations were bland. The TV was tiny, but there were some HD channels available. As others have said, I think this hotel can definitely use some modernization and a facelift. I wouldn't choose to stay here if I had a choice.

We booked this hotel through Expedia.ca as part of a fly/stay package. Never having stayed in NYC before, I really had no expectations. I had read that the hotel was older and maybe needed a face lift. That's maybe true, but the rooms were clean, the beds comfortable and as I always travel with earplugs, I wasn't bothered by traffic noise or other guests. True, the room wasn't overly large, but I'm not in NYC to spend time in my room! The hotel is definitely within walking distance of some great sightseeing spots (Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park and Grand Central were all an easy walk, even for my 76 year old mother-in-law). And it was a pleasant surprise to wake up Sunday morning and find Lexington Avenue closed to traffic in front of the hotel for a vendor's market that stretched for blocks. I'd give a special shout out to Craig, the concierge, who was able to obtain fantastic tickets for us to see Zarkana at Radio City Music Hall (I would have gone 10 more times!) and to Jimmy the doorman for recommending a wonderful pizza restaurant within walking distance of the hotel which didn't break the budget! It might not be the biggest, brightest, newest hotel in NYC, but I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again.

Last minute we decided to stay overnight in the city and chose this Marriott. It's got a convenient midtown location, the front desk staff was helpful and attentive. We were given a king bed room on a high floor. The room was actually really large but the decor was kind of meh, could use a bit of a facelift. The room smelled like the carpet had been febreezed to death but it was overall clean. We didn't hear any noise from outside or other rooms even though we were across from the elevator. The AC is loud but I think thats just how it goes with older buildings in NYC. We have stayed at the Renaissance on 57th which was a MUCH tinier room but seemed a lot nicer. All in all this was fine for a one night stay.

The hotel is lodged right on Lexington so inevitably you're going to hear some truck hit a pothole and wake you up early in the morning. If you happen to be at the hotel in some wicked NY heat wave, make sure to bring ear plugs as the old fashioned air conditioner keeps you up all night.
