Service was terrific from the front desk to the doormen. We would stay there again in a heartbeat and the price was terrific with a AAA discount! Highly recommend.

Got a great weekend deal with rewards membership $169 plus tax. We arrived at 1 pm and were able to check in. Room with king was small but very comfortable. Everything was brand new, bed was great, bathroom was huge, room had mini fridge which is nice touch especially for NYC. Plenty of security in lobby of hotel so you always felt safe. Hotel restaurant looked like it was closed for renovations. Hotel was convenient to 5th Ave shopping, restaurants, bars, was a great home base for the weekend.

Stayed here for five nights on business. Overall, a good hotel in a very good location offering all that I need.Room quality was good - fittings were good quality and the bed comfortable. It was clean and a good size (both the room and bathroom). Clearly the room sizes vary (judging by other reviews) but mine was fine. I should add that I did switch rooms when I first saw it - not because of the size but because I wanted a room at the back. I mention this because it was no problem at all to switch so if one particular room is a problem then ask to switch - they were very helpful.The other things in the room were good. Aircon worked well; little coffee maker was great; and I appreciated the good quality steam iron in the room - these little things make a difference!I didn't use any amenities other than room service, which was fine. Took too long on one occasion (just over 50 mins) but no big deal.My only gripe is WiFi. $16.95 per day! Rip-off. However, I didn't use it and connected to another WiFi.I switched to this hotel after a disaster at Club Quarters on a previous business trip. I will be staying here again when next in town on business. If you're looking for funky/stylish then this place won't be for you, but for me, it got all the basics right.

The New York Marriott East Side is well situated for visiting Midtown Manhattan. It is an older building, as you would expect due to the location, but the recent renovation has it looking clean and crisp for the most part. The usual Midtown tourist attractions (e.g., Times Square, Theater District, United Nations), as well as the stores and businesses of Park and Madison avenues are within easy walking distance.The rooms are nothing to write home about, but they meet expectations. Space is tight, which has been my experience for a standard room in Midtown Manhattan hotels. The quality meets the standard I've come to expect from Marriott. The concierge lounge, on the other hand, is spacious. It can get packed during the peak dining periods, but there's a lot of space and the quality of the food and beverage service meets expectations. Also, there's a patio for outside dining in the warmer months. It is the nicest Marriott concierge lounge that I have experienced in the US (newer Marriott properties in Asia have an even better lounges). The fitness center is small, but adequate. Room rates are variable, depending on time of year, but prices generally are competitive for this part of Manhattan.Summary: you get Marriott quality at a reasonable price. There may be a better value proposition in Midtown, but I've yet to experience it.

I travel to NYC every few months and I've stayed at this hotel many times. Why? I love the location - it's midtown without the craziness of times square. However, I got sick of staying here. Why? The rooms stink. For $400 a night, you shouldn't have to smell mold (it's got to be in every room - I've stayed here at least 10 times). Marriott really needs to give this hotel a facelift.

My wife and I stayed with our 11-year-old son the week before Christmas (missing the big blizzard, thankfully!). The hotel is, like many buildings in NYC, an older one, but has been thoroughly renovated, with upscale appointments typical of Marriott properties in its class. The hotel's location is great for visitors bent on seeing the sites. When we booked the hotel, we were originally a little concerned that it was a little further from Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Central Park than we would like, as these were some of the primary sites we planned on visiting. We found that these were no more than a brisk 10-to-15 minute walk away, which turned out to be ideal. Further, subway stations are also nearby to go just about anywhere in the city, and we took advantage of these to travel up to the museum district and down to Battery Park, WTC, Chinatown, Little Italy, Chelsea and Herald Square.We stayed in a deluxe king room with a roll-away bed for our child on the 21st floor (thanks to Lucy, the front-desk clerk). There are only a few double bed rooms available, so you might want to be very specific regarding your needs. Also, a standard king room may not be big enough for a roll-away bed (which was the only thing that was of lesser quality and comfort, though adequate). There was a nice view of the Raddison hotel next door and the top of the Chrysler building from out windows. The room was very nice, with a comfortable king bed and other typical ammenities. The room had a very nice, clean bathroom, with plenty of hot water. It was also nice and quiet -- enabling us to get a good nights' sleep every night.Service from staff members was exemplary and helpful throughout our stay, with excellent recommendations for where to eat nearby (Longwood Gourmet for breakfast is across the street at the corner) and other requests.We look forward to returning!
Great hotel, NYC at Christmas, Great Location, What's not to like?

Overall a good hotel. Comfortable bed, good size room for NYC and a nice bathroom. Rooms are oddly shaped but functional.Internet is $17.00 for 24 hours which is ridiculous but sadly becoming the norm.Breakfast is not included but you are so close to everything you can grab something at one of the 3 Starbucks around the block.Rooms are quiet, staff decent. Awesome location.

My room did not have bedbugs, the temperature regulation was OK, it was reasonably quiet (although my room was in front of the elevator and there was some noise due to that), and nothing terrible happened. But the rooms are very small and tired, the view was of some other hotel rooms, and the bar in the lobby was loud, small and weird. The hotel insists on charging $16.95 per day for internet which is outrageous since it costs them almost nothing. The hotel is convenient to everything but I stepped into the lobby of the Hotel Intercontinental across the street and jealosy overwhelmed me. It was classy but cool at the same time, everything was spotless and there was classical music in the lobby.

I had a strangely-shaped corner room at the Marriott for my last visit to NYC and I really enjoyed it overall. Like the room, the bathroom was also oddly shaped. You can tell the hotel's been "cut up" a lot over the years. Still, it was a typical Marriott room with all of the business travel amenities one would expect. Internet was expensive but bundled with free phone calls so I made the most of that service. Also, it can be noisy if facing the street but it's New York City after all!My first Marriott visit in New York since I usually stay at a Hilton property but it won't be the last.

This is an excellent busy hotel with great client facing management. Arriving after a long transatlantic flight we were not happy with the size of room we had asked for. Perfectly adequate, but just not big enough. I asked to be upgraded, which after much effort by the front desk not justnot possible and they promised to move us for the rest of our stay to a much bigger room. A bottle of wine was sent to the room as a gift. Which I thought was a very nice touch and true to their word we moved the next day and spent 3 nights in a beautiful room on the 27th floor.Moral :never be reluctant to ask for what you want. You are the client and Marriott have got this absolutely right!Highly recommneded-location great-staff very helpful

My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 4 days. The hotel is nice, the staff is helpful. We were able to use the concierge lounge on Thursday, and that had a nice outdoor patio with great views. My husband used the gym and he said it was crowded, but an average gym. I used the hotel internet, which is $16.95 from noon to noon. As an FYI, there is no food available between 11 and 5 during the week there. Although the book in the hotel room says the Shelton Grill is open for lunch, it is not. Room service doesn't operate and the bar offers no food. It's not a huge deal as you can walk outside and find several places to eat, but when you are working and you want to grab a quick bite, you need to exit the hotel. The cleaning staff was very nice and prompt. I would stay there again, but I preferred the Sofitel.
great location , nice rates compared to some of the other hotels near by. The rooms were a little small but clean . Would stay again !
We have stayed here several times. The location is great and the staff is very helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

Relatively recent refurb, and scaffolding still around the block. Reasonable size standard room with the usual facilities. One good point was the computer in the lobby connected to all the airlines allowing you to confirm and print off flight bookings. Very nice fitted gym on the roof!

Stayed at the Marriott East Side for two nights over a weekend in early October. We were able to check in early (at 1:30 p.m.) and we felt that our room was large for NYC standards. The room was nicely furnished--no complaints. We checked for signs of bed bugs and didn't see any! We never experienced any issues with the elevators--yes, they are small but there are two separate banks; one for floors 2-15 and the other for 16-32 so that helps alleviate really long waits. I would agree with earlier posts that the lobby was loud and crowded. It's not very big, so I think it feels crowded easily. Our room rate was $329/night for a king bed and I did not feel ripped off. This hotel is in a great location. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Stayed there for 3 days end of September, having to pay $ 610 for an ordinary room with lounge access. The rooms are smallish and not special. No Minibar, little amenities, no information material about hotel, no stationery, not even a note pad. Even had to pay extra for Internet Access. The reception area is always crowded and noisy. The lounge offers mediocre breakfast. Elevator is slow and rather antique. Actually everything in the hotel feels quite old, and not in a good way. The service wasn't really bad, but can't really call the employees friendly or motivated.Bottom-line is: considering hotel prices in NYC, $ 300 would have been appropriate. But charging $ 600 is just a rip-off. It was booked by the company and some colleagues were staying there too. Thus no choice. Otherwise I would never have paid that much for it.

I've never stayed here before and I knew nothing about it before my stay; in a nutshell I thought it was a very nice hotel. All hotel staff were pleasant and courteous, from the front desk, to bar staff to room service. The room itself was very clean and the bathroom stocked with the most towels I've ever seen in a hotel room. While there was a mini-fridge in the room, it was not stocked. I wasn't in the room for anything but showers and sleep, so I did not use the internet connection but it was $16.95 for noon to noon service. Breakfast from room service was excellent, but very pricey. I stayed in this hotel for business, but I would stay here for a personal visit in the future. I can't think of one complaint; fellow colleagues expressed that they were happy with the hotel as well.

Our check-in was booked for 3:00pm and finally got our rooms at 9:30pm. No apology, in fact front desk staff were rude - said go ahead and try to find another hotel on a Friday. Beds were ok, rooms small but good bathrooms. Good restaurant for breakfast. Again the front desk staff were rude given we waited HOURS for our rooms. Concierge very helpful for booking restaurants.

Won this hotel on priceline and was happy because of the location. Our room was quite big for NY standards. Other positives include the very nice fitness room located on the top floor. Lots of modern equipment and a view of Manhattan over the rooftops! Beautiful and what motivation to work out! Lots of restaurants and cafes in the area, central park just a few blocks away. Only negatives: Unlike other reviewers who couldn’t sleep because of the noise on the street, we didn’t have problem with that at all because our room didn’t face Lexington. Instead, we found the walls to be very thin and woke up several times in the night from other room flushing the toilet, running the water, returning to their room (and having conversations in the hall, slamming doors, etc.) I was disappointed that the wireless internet wasn’t free, even in the lobby. We would definitely stay here again as all in all it was a very good hotel and great location.

With my wife we spend three nights at the hotel on Labour Day weekend. When we made our reservation we asked for an early check in as we had an overnight flight. When we arrived to the hotel we were told that our room was not available and that we come back at 4 pm, even as we explained the situation and I am a Marriott silver status member. This situation ilustrates the kind of personal touches or friendliness you mayexpect at the hotel. We anyhow liked the concierge service.Location is very good, close to Grand Central station, making it very easy to get round the city. Room was small but had very confortable bed, small windws. In general, the hotel is an old one refurbished to some extent but still seems to be an old one.Definetevely, we will look for another hotel next time we go to NYC.

Just got back from a long weekend in NYC. The Marriott East side was booked on-line as a package with Delta Airlines. We'd read all the reviews, both good & bad, and were very impressed with the cleanliness of our room (no 1111). The bed was very comfortable although being on the 11th floor you could hear the constant traffic and honking of horns all night. Front desk staff Carmen and Bell captain Ken very friendly and helpful. Great location for all the sites.
Seems more like a Courtyard than a Marriott. Very close to the American Girl store. Was on the 16th floor and I found it to be very noisy. No concierge lounge on weekends.

My family and I recently came to NYC and stayed at the Marriott East Side in midtown Manhattan. Overall, I found the hotel and the majority of it's staff to be quite charming and professional.The location is brilliant with easy access to trains and other public transportation. This hotel also offers a free concierge service that I found to be incredibly knowledgable and friendly. One of the best I have found in my travels. We did have a slight issue with our room as we booked a room with double beds however were given a room with only a single bed. My husband called the front desk and asked to speak with a manager. He was asked to hold which took almost 5 minutes and then was transferred to a manager named Veronica. He explained our situation and what our room should have been and was met with denials, lack of sympathy, and down right rudeness. The situation was eventually resolved however my husband said that in 25 plus years of traveling, he has never encountered such a dismissive and rude manager. Aside from this one issue, our room and stay in nyc was very enjoyable. Oh and if you are looking for quick bite to eat after a long day of sight seeing, you can go wrong with pj clarkes. Great burgers,staff and close to the hotel.

We're surprised by the number of positive reviews for this hotel. It's by no means an awful hotel, but it's not great either!Things we liked:- Stayed here on business, and from a work perspective it has everything you need - close proximity to the midtown district, high speed internet (at a cost), desk.- Fitness center had a wide range of machines, and a fab view over NYC- Room had everything you need - comfy beds, working a/c, tv with wide range of channels, fridge- Close to Grand Central station, making it very easy to get round the city.Things we didn't like:- The rooms have obviously been refurbished recently, but the windows are small, making the rooms feel very gloomy. - The rest of the hotel needs a makeover!- The staff are efficient - my check in was literally 30 seconds! But there's none of the personal touches or friendliness which is so common elsewhere in NYC, and makes you feel welcome.

I have stayed at this hotel on two occassions and have found it perfect for the sights and attrations of Mid Town Manhatton. Central Park, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square are all within easy walking distance. There is a subway station two blocks away at 51st St and Great Central Terminal is a short walk. The hotel is very smart and the rooms quite luxurious. We had great views from our corner room and not too much street noise on the 24th floor. However, the air con system is quite noisy and we found it necessary to turn it off to get a good nights sleep. Our most recent visit was marred by a mix up in the booking as they only had us reserved for two nights - we had booked and pre-paid for four nights through an agent in London. The desk man made no attempt to be helpful and merely said that the sytem had us for two nights even though I presented him with the pre-paid voucher. Fortunately the London agent had provided us with a 24 hour contact in New York and one phone call by me sorted it out. After a long transatlantic trip it would have been nice if the hotel had taken the initiative to make the call, but it was left to me - Yes they had charged me for the call when I came to check out. Despite this experience I would stay again as the remainder of the staff were helpful. A tip for informal eating - Connolly's on East 47th Street, two blocks from the hotel - good food at affordable prices.

We stayed for 2 nights at the end of August. The location of the hotel is great. The only problem is that the noise level at night was very high. I think part of the problem is that there is a thru street right next to t he hotel, so there are lots of sirens and horns from vehicles going cross town. We were on the 9th floor in a corner room. The room, itself was fine, but I wouldn't stay there again due to the noise!

I was in NYC for a little over a month on business and stayed at a could different hotels before finally finding the Marriot East Side. Wow!! What a great hotel! I am a tried & true Marriott fan, and had stayed at the Marriott Marquis my first week in and was horrified with the sheer number of people in/out of the hotel, as well as on the street (to be expected I guess when you're right on Broadway in Time Square!). By the time I found the Marriott East side I just needed a break from the people and the commotion, and this hotel was a dream come true! The hotel itself is beautiful!! It's an older hotel, but has been recently renovated to match the true Marriott style and comfort. From the moment you walk into the lobby until you get to your room, the hotel is luxurious, and beautiful. The staff is WONDERFUL!!! As a frequent business traveler, finding a hotel like this, is worth it's weight in gold! Just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Madison Ave. 5th Ave shopping, and a short walk to Time Square. The location is quiet, well, for NYC!The rooms aren't as large as the Marriott Marquis, but the atmosphere is a far cry from the "vegas" style atmosphere you get at the Marquis. If you're looking for a really NICE room, in a clean/quiet location, with a great hotel staff, stay here!! You won't be disappointed. And if you are.... you haven't stayed in enough bad hotels to know the difference! :)

this hotel is indeed in a good area but the hotel is so tired it's sad. our room had crappy litle half-windows at the floor level (my wife said it was like being in prison), it had water-damage and rotting in the bathroom, the ac didn't work even after we called to complain so the room was unbearably hot (we didn't sleep well at all at this hotel), and so on. the hotel and overall experience there was crap.i actually took the time to write an email to the hotel to complain and the only response i got was to call the hotel. last thing a busy traveler/worker wants after they complain via email is to have to talk on the phone more about a bad experience.i suggest you steer clear of this VERY tired hotel. it's overpriced and just not worth it.
surprisingly quiet and great location. the bed was so comfortable, very nice expereince. Lobby leaves alot to be desired, but service and concierge was fine. would stay again

This was our first trip to New York. We took the train into Penn Station then took the subway to Grand Central Staton and then walked from 42nd to 49th to the hotel(The blocks are very short). Great location on Lexington ave. When we checked in, the front desk woman was very polite and helpful. We were checked into the room in less than 5 minutes we were given room 924 which faces Lexington ave. The room wasn't too high up but I barley noticed the noise exept for a few horns at around 11:00pm one night. The room was a decent size and much bigger than I expected.Pros:1. The Location! Walking distance to almost everything.2. Decent sized rooms that were updated with new beds, furniture, fridge that wasn't a mini bar, and bathrooms. 3. Over all great staff. All very polite and willing to help exept the concierge. Cons: 1. The double beds were TINY for a family of 4 although they were not completely uncomfortable. I think the beds were just shorter than normal double beds.2. The $16.95 per day internet charge is outrageous considering its been free in nearly every hotel i've ever stayed in but I guess thats New York for you.3. The concierge was terrible. He acted as if he would rather be anywhere but where he was and gave me very little eye contact. He gave us mediocre to downright horrible restaurant recomendations. After the second restaurant, we just found our own places and they were great. One place worth mentioning was a place a block east off 3rd called Ashtons. The food was horrible and over priced. I should have gotton a clue when the restaurant was dead. Not many people in there and now I know why... Over all, this was a great hotel with just a few minor issues but there is no such thing as a perfect hotel and I would problably stay again if I could get another great rate.

Got there at 9:00 a.m. and we were able to get our room immediately. All the Hotel Staff were friendly and wonderful. There was a small glitch with our American Girl Package and they made it right and even added the concierage room. The manager called and then came to the room and gave me his card. I couldn't have asked for a better stay with my Granddaughter. I will be back again and again.

This hotel is in a great location - 49th & Lexington. The hotel is really nice - rooms are nice, beds are so comfortable. The shower is great. The rooms are nice and quiet - hard to believe you're in the middle of the city! The only bad thing was that the bar in the hotel closed at midnight - on a Saturday night!

This is by far one of my favorite hotels. Its not special beds or amenities that make it so awesome but the people. The staff is very friendly and dedicated to making everyone feel special in the sea of anonmyous faces in NYC. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. The TV is a flat screen with the plug-ins for computers. For gold and platinum members, the conscierge room is one of the best I have ever seen; the conscierge staff are the best people to visit with upon getting up and after a stressful day. Kenda always goes out of her way to be helpful and friendly!!

For my second trip to NY I stayed for 7 nights at this hotel that was September '09We were checked in in 5 minutes!! Great after a long time in traffic from the airport to the hotel!Our room was big enough en we had a very nice bathroom and a great view on the Waldorf!!We had breakfast in the hotel the first morning, it was very tastefull but too much food, so after that we took our breakfast at Café Metro!Connelly's is another place were you can eat very good!! 2 blocks down the hotel! The concierge was so helpfull! Thx to him we finally found the HBO shop! True Blood fans support each other! :)Wat was also good? Fith avenue was close by, Bloomingdale's ... Times Square!The only thing that I really didn't like was the noise at night! But that is NY I guess, that was the only bad thing!I really recommend this hotel!!

Sorry I did not really like this hotel (or the city). I did arrive late on a very hot night from a long flight and jet lagged only to find my room was not ready! The Front Desk did not handle this very well, but was resolved with Concierge Lounge access (am a Platinum member) and then they found a room shortly afterwards. The Lounge is excellent here. The room we had was an average size with an ancient and very noisy air con unit - it was 88 degrees outside. The area is convenient for shopping. The downstairs Concierge was not very helpful for tour suggestions and only promotes one idea. But we were only here for 2 nights. I choose this hotel as my husband does not like heights so the fact it was a not a high rise hotel was excellent.

This is our third time staying at the Marroitt East Side, traveling with a six year old! The hotel always had our room ready, rooms were very clean, room service wonderful!!!!! Very helpful with anything you needed. For nyc the rooms are quite big. Always feel very comfortable staying there. Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center,etc. Would highly recommend to anyone.

I confirmed my reservation 10 days in advance for my 7-night stay, and when I arrived at the front desk, I was told there was no room available for my first night, and that I would have to make my own way to another hotel 2 blocks away. It was late, and I had already traveled 10 hours. They had already printed the letter for me to give to the 'back-up' hotel. In 12 years of business travel, this has never happened to me before, so I can't rely on this hotel from now on. That said, my room was ok, clean and comfortable. The front bar is a bit cold and lonely - the other hotels around would have been better options for a drink/bite to eat, especially the W hotel, which is probably where I'll book next time.

I booked this hotel as a Virgin Holidays package for my partner's birthday. On arrival we didn't have to queue to check in and although our allocated room was nice and clean, it was very dark as we were directly facing a brick wall. I rang reception to ask if it was possible to move to a different room as it was a special holiday for us and we really wanted a room with a view. This was no problem and we were allocated a corner room on the 8th floor, it was so much bigger and brighter than the first room, so if you don't like your room for whatever reason it may be worth asking to move.The location of the hotel is good, about 15 minutes walk to Times Square. However, we did find the resturants were more expensive as we were staying in more of a business area than a tourist area but this was fine as I felt the service at the hotel was better because of this and we soon found some good places to eat within a short walking distance. There was also a shop nearby called Duane & Reade which sells snacks, drinks etc and there is also a Starbucks within just a couple of minutes walk. I wouldn't recommend buying anything from the hotel shop as this was very expensive.We found an Irish bar called O'Neills (about a ten minute walk from the hotel) which was really nice, the staff made us feel very welcome. One night they had live Irish music so if you like this kind of thing then it's well worth a visit. We also ate there one day for lunch and the portions were so big I didn't need anything to eat for the rest of the day! Good prices too.We ate in Ruth Chris' Steak House one night which is just off Times Square - highly recommended. You also decide on the tip you want to leave as this isn't added onto the bill like many places do. The staff at the hotel were more than happy to book this for us and arranged a cab for us too.We did all the usual tourist things and found it very easy and safe to travel around on the Subway but as the weather was so nice while we were there, it was nice to walk as often as possible as the hotel was in such a good location to Grand Central Station, Public Library, Central Park, Fifth Ave etc.When we left the hotel arranged a taxi for us to take us to JFK Airport, this was a huge private 4X4 type vehicle and was much more comfortable and cleaner then the yellow cabs. The price quoted was $55 including tolls and tip which was really good value and we would definately use this service again. We were also able to use the internet service free of charge in the Business Centre to check-in for our flights.Overall this was a great hotel in a fantastic location with top class service and we would definately consider staying here again.

My partner and I stayed for four nights and our stay was fine but could have been better. We arrived around 1:00 p.m. and our room was ready. Once we arrived in our room, the TV was not working properly. The room was clean except for the chair next to the bed which had not been cleaned around the seat borders for some time. The room and bathroom were a little too small for our liking. Some channels on the TV did not work at various times which was frustrating. One of the concierges was not helpful to recommend a restaurant near the hotel. He seemed a little cold and bored. Lobby area is too small and as a result is too crowded. Overall the hotel is nice but could improve on services. Need more smiles from staff at hotel restaurant!!

I was very impressed with the Marriott East Side. Let me start by saying that I got an e-mail from the hotel about 3 days before our trip indicating that because they had a full house the night before we arrived, they weren't sure if they could meet our request of an early check in, and if they did they wouldn't guarantee the room type we wanted. So we had a plan to spend some time touring the city in the late morning/early afternoon in the expectation that we would not have access to the room, only to find they had upgraded us, provided a nicer room in the same type we had requested, and given us the early checkin we had wanted. So the staff was dealing aces from the very beginning and the rest of our stay was also great. Aside from the location which is close to everything in midtown and easy access to the subway, the next best thing about the hotel was a reasonable rate, particularly the deal we got for a 3 night weekend stay. In fact the only complaint of any kind that we had concerned a unexpected smell of cigarette smoke that seeped into our room around 10pm on the last night of our stay. It seemed to be coming in through the vent in the bathroom, which led me to believe that another guest was smoking in their bathroom even though the entire hotel is supposed to be non-smoking. We smelled it again in the morning so I reported it to the front desk upon checkout. Other than that random occurance, we had no complaints and would stay here again on a future trip to NYC.

Just returned from our 4 night stay at the Marriott. Thought the hotel was really nice. We only used the room so cannot comment on the restaurant or any other facility on offer.The room was nice, not massive but adequate. The beds although were comfortable were very small. The hotel was directly opposite the Wardoff Astoria, the hop on hop off bus stopped directly outside. Bloomingdales was situated further up the street.We ate breakfast at the Au bon Pain most mornings which was situated a few blocks up. Great choice and excellent value. Would definately recommend the hotel and hope to stay again in the future.

We stayed at the Marriott NY East Side for 2 nights in Apr'10. We've stayed at the other two Marriott hotels (Marquis, Renaissance) but decided to go for the East Side Marriott this time. It proved to be a right choice. Things like at this hotel:-quiet location (compared to the hussle and bussle of Times Square)-walking distance to everywhere (15 min to Times Square, TKS booth, 20 min to Broadway theatres, 35 min to Lincoln center and theatres, 10 min walk to numerous restaurants and cafes/deli, 10 min to 5th Ave shopping and American Girl store)-clean hotel room, marble bathroom-large guest room (we had a king, plus roll away bed, still have room to walk )-quick check out (check in took longer with some guests jumping the line)Things disliked:-very small lobby, it can get noisy when the lobby bar is openMy two cents on getting around/things to do:-there's a garage parking right on 48th st, the same block where the hotel is, $54/24 hrs. We parked there and just walked around the corner into the hotel lobby.-Liberty Deli Cafe on 49th St. (2 blocks west from hotel) offers good varieties of food/drinks with good prices. The meals are sold by portions not by weight. For our family of 2 adults 2 kids it cost $18 for dinner, including drinks. -Shin Wong Chinese restaurant on 48th about 4 blocks to the West has the most authentic Chinese food around Times Square. We had 3 dishes for dinner for $23. Their soup noodle with wonton is very very good. We had 3 meals there and saw local people eat there too.-Variety Deli and Cafe almost next to Shing Wong is not so good. Food is not so fresh. They sell food by weight so a box of lunch can be more expensive than you thought.We walked to all the theatres of the shows we saw on this trip.---the good: Phantom of the Opera (good as always), The 39 Steps (very good comedy), South Pacific (good musical)---the bad: THe Gazillion Bubble Show (totally not worth the money in my opinion, even my 5 yr old was not thrilled, and we were sitting in 2nd row)Overall, we like the Marriott NY East and would love to stay here again.

And the rooms are tiny too. And no microwave in room, or anywhere else.The reason they said for wait was the hotel was sold out that day. Hello? If a hotel is sold out, people with confirmed reservations still wait for 2+ hours after arriving at scheduled check-in times?Also, in their rush to get the room ready, the linens were not clean, but had stains on them.

Stayed here recently for a weekend in the city with two family members. Great location and staff. Wonderful decor and very clean. Only complaints are the water pressure wasn't so good (18th fl) and the towels kind of smelled funny. Everything else was as expected from a Marriott. Breakfast buffett was decent, coffee at the buffett not so great. We'll go back there and will recommend it to our friends.

Just back from the NY Marriott East Side. The location couldn't be beat. It was close to all we planned to do in Midtown. The price was also reasonable. We asked for early check in and it was not a problem. We also asked for two beds, and again, no problem. The entire place was very well kept and clean. Only a couple of issues, two minor and one major. First the minor - the elevators are small and slow. It was nearly impossilbe to take the elevator down, as they were always packed. My husband and son walked down and I took the elevator with my other children. Some people were getting very angry as they had reservations to eat, and we waited for more than four elevators before we could get down. There was also a problem with the bathroom because they don't have fans. In the morning when I took a shower the fire alarm went off and scared the heck out of me. The hot water was also limited. We were on the sixth floor and it was too close to the street so we heard noise the entire night. I would recommend requesting a high floor. The biggest problem we had with this hotel was the comfort of the beds - they were terrible (very hard.) The linens were soft, but the bed itself was extremely uncomfortable. Overall this is a good hotel, but if you do not desire an extra firm matress I would stay elsewhere.

My wife has stayed at the Marriott East Side on 3-4 occassions. I'm a frequent traveler to New York, but this was my first time. The thing I liked best about the Hotel is that it's close to so much without being in the middle of anything. Never had to deal with the irritating tourists, yet I could be in those heavily touristy areas rather quickly.The doormen did a great job, and our check-in was effortless. All of the hotel staff we talked to, includig the hotel General Manager, were super friendly and helpful. Nothing but good things to say. Will def stay there again.

Large hotel, even by NY standards, with a heavy gearing towards business but the location, quality and size of room more than make up for that.We were surprised how reasonable the rates were booking a good way in advance, and it was nice to be upgraded to a better room simply because one was available - why don't more places do that?Very helpful front desk when we needed them, though getting coffee replenished in the room was a bit of a battle.Excellent bed, slept very well. Well equipped bathroom.

Came here on the recommendation of a friend. Used Marriott Rewards points and it was the cheapest (pointwise) of the full service Marriotts. Was convenient to the subway and buses. The gym was excellent (with excellent views) and the concierge room was above average. However, the rooms were small, cramped, and the hotel itself is very old. I have found other Marriott properties in Manhattan better, so I won't return.
Our room with two beds was very big. The beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable and clean. They gave us bath robes that were great.

I stayed at the Marriott Eastside as I do every year in March for a Pharmaceutical Conference. I am always amazed with the "welcome back" as I valet my car at the entrance. This Marriott like most of them have a way of making you feel like you are home. As others have said the location is very convenient. I had to meet my fiancee at Penn Station. Both doormen made sure I knew the way with great directions. it was an easy walk down Lexington to the E train right into the stattion. If you decide to walk outside Penn you are very close to the Empire State Building. This train seems like it will also take you to the site of Ground Zero and Canal Street for some shopping Chinatown or Little Italy. At the recomendation of the Marriott web site my customer and I dined at Dos Caminos on Third Ave...it was very good. We shared the vegetable Quesidilla and both of us had the Ribeye steak which comes on a skwerer and a great side rice dish. Very nice atmosphere we made reservations and it did seem like the place was full when we left. Breakfast one morning was at a place called Essa Bagels also on Third. Very good but long lines and a bit expensive for bagels. All in all another nice stay on the Eastside. One thing be careful the internet at $15.95 is by the day NOT 24 hours...ouch

I recently stayed at the Marriot East Side. I have stayed at a number of NYC hotels and although this one is by no means luxurious, for the budget traveller this hotel is a great value. At check-in, the staff was very friendly. I had secured a low rate when I reserved and I was awarded a $25 gas card upon my arrival. I checked the bags early in the day but when the room was ready and they were returned to me no one offered to bring them to the room or escort us. Upstairs, the room was very small and felt like a dormitory. I could hear other guests in their rooms and the hallways. I looked at different rooms for a future visit and the hotel offers a variety of options to meet your travel needs. Enjoyed a lite breakfast on the premises, but the hotel food is unremarkable. As a former New Yorker, I know my way around but I inquired with the concierge for neighborhood suggestions because it was snowing. He had a useful menu book but was not well informed himself. The location is great, it's convenient to Grand Central, the UN. You can walk over to the Cathedral on 5th or Times Square easily. It's surrounded by other hotels and a choice of restaurants, mostly very expensive and meant for Midtown business expense accounts. I return to New York regularly and would stay again at the Marriot East Side, but I am in no rush to.

We stayed at the Marriott East Side for an anniversary weekend. The Marriott wasn't necessarily our first choice but we had a gift certtificate and saving money definitely made our decision for us.However, I am so pleased we chose this hotel. We mentioned it was our anniversary and got an upgrade at check in. King Bed, upper level floor with a seating area - very spacious and comfortable for NYC.The location is great. We were able to walk to Rockefeller Ctr, Central Park, Theater Disctrict, Times Square, etc. No problem getting a cab as the doormen were very helpful in hailing one outside the hotel. This hotel is a great value for a posh neighborhood in NYC. It was a great choice for a weekend we wish wcould have lasted longer in the Big Apple.

Everything about our stay at the Marriott East Side was great. The location is perfect, convenient to the subway, plus easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Central Park, St Patricks Cathedral, etc. The hotel staff - from the frontdesk to housekeeping was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was impecable and the bed was so comfortable. We have stayed at a number of hotels in NYC and this facility is definitely our number 1 choice.

You want a small, clean, hotel in NYC with a solid nights sleep, this hotel is for you. This property has the feeling you are staying a lift type property. Small rooms, but able space. It seemed to me that many of the other guests were eurporeans. When I return to NYC, this will be the hotel of choice

Living only 40 minutes outside of Manhattan, I rarely stay in Manhattan, but I have stayed at 2 W's, the Waldorf, the Hilton on 6th, the Giraffe and a few others in the Times Sq area. This is one of my favorite NY hotels. It is a very nicely located business hotel. The rooms are not glamorous. The windows are small. However, the beds are comfortable, the rooms meticulously clean and well maintained and a decent size for Manhattan. What I like best is the very accommodating attitude and service levels. The Club Lounge is one of the best I have enjoyed in any city. In the morning you can enjoy scrambled eggs, muffins, hot cereal, cold cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, teas, coffee while watching tv or reading newspapers in a large lounge. Everyone is courteous and helpful and I find the service to be superior to other hotels I mentioned above in NY. Internet is expensive at $16 per day. Rates at the hotel are not bad. You can get them for under $250. Bed very comfortable. Room comfortable temperature. Good lighting. Internet worked well. Noisy because the city is noisy. Not sound proof windows. No restaurant.

This is my second time staying at this Marriott. It is a typical convention style hotel and it is a very solid and predictable property. Check-in was easy and there was never a long wait for the elevator. The room was a good size and even pretty big for NYC.I had no problems with noise in the room and if you are looking for a bar go to Connollys on 47th.

Loved this hotel; room was nice size! Location was great for walking to all areas of interest: Grand Central Station, The Rock, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue. Would definitely stay here again!

I liked this hotel, you could certainly tell the maintenance staff did well with the upkeep. The rooms are small; smaller than the courtyard on the east side. Overall it was a nicer hotel tho, and for the location the room size was expected. We had 2 rooms, it would have been nice if they had put both of them near one another, rather than separate floors. Otherwise, a great stay.

Booked this hotel as part of a Virgin Holidays package and got a great deal. I couldn't fault the hotel, we were allocated a room on 3rd floor with 2 double beds, just as I had requested. We had a large room with LCD tv, a fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer and iron and ironing board! Beds were very comfy, bathroom spotless, room was cleaned and new towels every day of our stay. All staff were very helpful and the hotel is within walking distance of most attractions and subway. I would definately recommend and would stay here again.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter as part of a British Airways deal. We were amazed at the deal we got on this hotel ! It is well situated within walking distance of many attractions and a subway station, yet the hotel itself has a calm and efficient atmosphere. We did not eat in the hotel, choosing to sample many of the local restaurants. The room, on the 27th floor, was large , spotless and with 2 huge comfortable beds; with 2 windows we had views down to the East River and up Lexington.All the staff were charming and extremely helpful. Tea and coffee making facilities are provided in the room and there was a small fridge.Internet access is available at a charge.

I understand this is an "antique" hotel built in the early 1900's..but you would think something could be done to soundproof the rooms! You can hear a pin drop next door...nose blowing...toilet flushing...you get the point. If I wouldn't have secured earplugs after the first sleepless night I wouldn't have slept a wink the entire week! The rooms overlook the Waldorf Astoria rooms and you can see people lounging in their beds...if you are loking for a view you wil not find it here.The rooms are extremely smal...even for 2 people and even for NYC. We've stayed nearly everywhere and these were by far the smallest rooms.Marriott Marquis has a better atmosphere and rooms are much nicer...there is just no "wow" factor here at all. Very sleepy place.

My husband and I were here recently for an overnight getaway in the city. We shopped, went to the Exhale spa on Madison and dined at The Four Seasons. Typically, we do not stay at Marriotts for our leisure trips. However, my husband used his accumulated points from business trips and it was perfect. This hotel is in an excellent location, close to all of the upscale shopping you could ever wish for. The room (a deluxe corner king) was clean, modern and rather sizeable--especially for New York standards. What really stood out, though, was the friendly and accomodating service from the valet parkers and doormen, to the front desk and lobby bar staff. I will definitely stay at this hotel again--even if I don't use points next time.
Very nice updated room, but small. Since we were only there overnight, the size was fine. I would definitely stay there in the future.
Excellent service, on a few blocks from Times Square, Central Park. Would stay there again.

We booked this hotel through Octopus and got an amazing deal of only £69 a night for a 4 night stay, what looks like an incredible saving for a hotel of this standard in New York! We arrived late in the evening and were checked in with speed. Although our room was on the 3rd floor with no view to speak of, we were in New York to sight see, and time in the room was for sleeping only, so it wasn't a problem. After hearing about the small size of rooms in NY, were were very pleasantly surprised by the room size. There was plenty of floor space. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean, and the bed comfy.We chose not to eat in the hotel, as it was expensive, but there's quite a few places nearby. The location is fab, only 5 mins walk to Grand Central Station, and less than half an hour to the Empire State Building and Times Square.The hotel provide a computer in the lobby to do internet check in for your flight home, and as the computer was in use, we were quickly escorted up to the business suite to save us time.One negative is that on the morning of our check out, we had an invoice under the door for charges to our room that we hadn't spent. Although not a lot, when we queried what this was on check out, without even looking at the invoice, reception told us it was a mistake and we wouldn't be charged - a bit strange.But overall, for the price we paid, this was an excellent hotel!

It's a venerable seeming property with a great lobby and perfectly adqeuate, largish (for New York) rooms. I didn't have a chance to try the food but there doesn't seem to be anything resembling an actual separate bar. In the corner of the lobby, you can sit at the stick and order drinks but it feels like....well.....the lobby. Front desk staff were okay but overworked and not very helpful in that midtown tourist hotel way. Again, the weak dollar and strong Euro is filling the city with people who don't really speak enough English to travel in North America. But they do have the money!! Good proximity to most major midtown attractions and you're on the Lexington Ave. Subway line which is great for tourism.

Just back from a 4 night stay in the Marriott Eastside. I was a bit hesitant staying on Lexington Ave as on previous trips to NYC I have always stayed close to Times Square, but it was the best location ever. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes walk from 5th Ave and less than 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The staff were very friendly and efficient especially the Irish Porter from Donegal. He was so pleasant and helpful. We had room service one night as we could not walk any more after our day shopping. The food and service was great and only cost $70 for dinner for two with beer and tea included. Never again will I stay in hotels close to Times Square, I'll be staying in the Marriott. The concierge was great and organised a 'town car' for us to go the airport in and it only cost $75 including tolls and tips - again this is the cheapest fare we have ever paid to the airport from a hotel in NYC. This is my seventh trip to NYC and would have to say the best trip ever by far and this was all down to the fantastic hotel that I stayed in. I'll be back!
